Description: This is a beautifully structured wine, perfumed from wood aging and ripe in a black plum flavor. It is powered by concentrated tannins and dynamic, juicy fruit. This bottling is one of a trilogy of wines sourced from the different terraces in the vineyards, with this coming from the third terrace above the river. Drink from 2021.
Designation: Clos Triguedina Les Selections Parcellaires Les Galets
Name: Jean-Luc Baldès 2014 Clos Triguedina Les Selections Parcellaires Les Galets Malbec (Cahors)

Description: This wine is a reminder of the history of Cahors. Once the area produced so-called Black Wines because the must was cooked and because the color was dark. This strongly wood-aged bottling recreates that in a gloriously dense wine with powerful tannins as well as opulent black fruits. Drink this compelling wine from 2021.
Designation: Clos Triguedina The New Black Wine
Name: Jean-Luc Baldès 2014 Clos Triguedina The New Black Wine Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Produced from the best parcels of this biodynamically run estate, this wine is powerful and very rich. Even after five years, it is packed with firm tannins and layers of spice and new wood. But it also has immense fruitiness and will come together impressively. Drink from 2022.
Name: Château de Chambert 2014 Grand Vin Malbec (Cahors)

Description: One of a trilogy of wines from the different terraces that mark the Cahors vineyards, this bottling comes from the second terrace above the river. It is well balanced, rich in tannins and in black fruits, full while also elegant. This is a particularly fine vintage, complex and ageworthy even after five years. Drink from 2020.
Name: Jean-Luc Baldès 2014 Au Coin du Bois Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Named after the statue of the Virgin Mary that dominates this part of the vineyard, this wine is powerful, perfumed with new wood and packed with structured black-plum and berry fruits. The wine is rich with both fruit and potential. Drink from 2021.
Name: Domaine de Cause 2015 Notre Dame des Champs Malbec (Cahors)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This wine is subtly layered, rich and appealing from the complex aromas of spiced cherry and vanilla to the ripe and concentrated fruit flavors and on to a lingering finish. While full bodied, it is warmly wrapped in soft tannins for a velvety mouthfeel.
Name: Concannon 2016 Reserve Malbec (Livermore Valley)

Description: The third wine in the Baldès trilogy of bottlings from the different terraces above the rive Lot that mark the Cahors vineyards, this comes from the plateau at the top. The wine is tight, characterized by big tannins and intense structure. Very firm still, it is likely to keep a strong sense of structure as it ages further. Drink this wine from 2021.
Name: Jean-Luc Baldès 2014 Les Petites Cailles Malbec (Cahors)

Description: From the oldest vines on the estate, this is a structured, concentrated wine. Ripe black-plum-skin flavors and dark tannins reveal a wine that will age for several more years. Drink from 2022.
Name: Domaine de Cause 2016 La Lande Cavagnac Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Situated at a high point of the Cahors vineyards above the river Lot, this estate has produced a rich, tannic and structured wine. Its bold fruits and tannins, smoothed by the 12 months in wood, are very ageworthy. Drink from 2020.
Name: Les Vignobles Saint-Didier Parnac 2017 Prieuré de Cénac Malbec (Cahors)

Appellation: Red Hills, Lake County, California, US
Description: This concentrated and exuberant wine has a reduced aroma on first whiff, but quickly turns rich and generous, showing black-fig, blackberry and turned earth aromas followed by ripe black fruits, plenty of spicy complexity, full body and firm tannins.
Name: Boatique 2016 Malbec (Red Hills)

Description: Now ready to drink, this rich black-fruit-flavored wine with touches of mint is dense with tannins to contrast with the dark fruitiness. It is ripe, smoky and complex.
Name: Domaine du Prince 2013 Lou Prince Malbec (Cahors)

Description: This richly mature wine is a fine expression of rich Malbec. Dense and still with some tannins in place, the wine has weight smoothed by toastiness and spice. The blackberry fruits are still up front, fragrant and fresh. Drink this wine from late 2019.
Name: Domaine du Prince 2015 Le Chêne du Prince Malbec (Cahors)

Description: This well-balanced wine shows both the tannins of Cahors and the fruit. It has structure, with a dry core that contrasts with the rich black fruits, laced with acidity and full of potential. Drink from 2020.
Name: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2016 Malbec Malbec (Cahors)

Description: This old vineyard in the heart of the Cahors landscape has produced a rich, smoothly textured wine. The juicy black Malbec certainly has tannins, but the ripe fruitiness shines. The wine is dense, full of flavor and will be ready to drink from 2021
Name: Château Labastide Haute 2016 Malbec (Cahors)

Description: This stylish wine is full of complex black fruits, spice and fragrant tannins. It is still ready to age with its dry core and ripe while fresh fruitiness. Drink from 2020.
Name: Les Vignobles Saint-Didier Parnac 2016 Calos Grande Réserve Malbec (Cahors)

Appellation: Yolo County, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Well balanced, firm in texture and complex in flavor, this wine shows light wood-smoke and black-pepper aromas, meaty, plummy flavors and a lightly tannic mouthfeel. While slightly on the lean side in terms of fruit, it's appetizing and complex.
Name: Berryessa Gap 2016 Malbec (Yolo County)

Description: A firm and tannic wine with ripe blackberry fruits and touches of spice from wood aging, this is solid and worth aging further. It is densely textured, with a dry core that needs to soften. Drink from 2020.
Name: Les Vignobles Saint-Didier Parnac 2016 Calos Réserve Malbec (Cahors)

Description: This entry-level wine from the Saint-Didier Parnac vineyards is designed for early drinking. Gentle tannins are bolstered by fresh black fruits and acidity as well as a warm, rich texture. Drink the wine from late 2019.
Name: Les Vignobles Saint-Didier Parnac 2017 Mission de Picpus Malbec (Cahors)

Description: This is a style of Malbec that is ready to drink young and fruity. With berry and black-currant flavors, ripe tannins and a good balance between acidity and maturity, it is densely textured and can be drunk now.
Name: Domaine du Prince 2015 L'Envoi du Prince Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Part of Osmin's series called Le Conservatoire highlighting grapes from southwest France, this wine shows some of the tannins of the Malbec while really emphasizing the black fruits. It is young but will develop quickly. Drink from late 2019.
Name: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2017 Malbec (Comté Tolosan)

Description: This chateau, well placed among the best vineyards in Cahors, has produced a solidly tannic wine that also has great black fruits. It is young, not quite balanced between fruit and structure. But it has potential and will be all ready to go from 2022.
Name: Château du Caillou 2017 Malbec Malbec (Cahors)

Description: This wine is pure Malbec, but it shows the grape in its fruity rather than structured guise. It is full of juicy berry flavors, laced with acidity and with tannins that comes from the perfumed fruits. Drink the wine now.
Name: Jean-Luc Baldès 2016 Malbec du Clos Malbec (Cahors)

Description: This dense wine is about fruit and tannins rather than any obvious wood aging. Bold blackberry flavors are full, structured with tannins and with the potential to mature into a rich wine. Drink from 2020.
Name: Domaine de Cause 2016 Margaux & Company Malbec (Cahors)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas intrigue, with notes of matchstick, dark fruit and tar. The flavors coat the palate from end to end, with a soft, pillowy feel. Lightly grainy tannins back it all up, finishing warm.
Name: Dusted Valley 2015 Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Malbec has always been planted in this appellation, and to judge by this wine, it thrives. Big and bold, this is packed with black fruits and tannins and moving firmly to richness. Drink this wine from 2020.
Name: Château Martinat 2016 Malbec 100%  (Côtes de Bourg)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: This is an easygoing, ripe wine, the softest view of Malbec. It emphasizes black fruits, perfumed acidity and a lightly tannic, juicy aftertaste. Drink the wine now.
Name: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2017 Villa la Réserve Malbec (Vin de France)

Description: A fresh, fruity wine with juicy black-currant flavors and a smoky, spicy edge, this is bright and succulent. Black fruits are shot through with still-young acidity and the wine needs to age. Drink from 2020.
Name: Domaine de Cause 2016 Tradition Malbec Malbec (Cahors)

Description: This light take on Malbec is fresh with red fruits and soft tannins. With plenty of bright acidity, the wine is crisp and ready to drink.
Name: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2017 Pyrène L'Irrésistible Magie Noire Malbec (Comté Tolosan)

Description: Mature and perfumed, this wine has tannins that are still dry and likely to remain so. Its structure is firm while the black fruits are beginning to fade. Drink the wine now.
Name: Domaine du Prince 2013 Rossignol Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Heavy oak on the nose results in creamy aromas of chocolate and lactic vanilla. A thick palate is grabby and a bit flabby and cloying. Oaky flavors of campfire snuff out this Malbec's fruit, while the finish feels sticky and tastes woody.
Designation: Maxima Expresión Del Terroir Alta Reserva Las Brujas
Name: Gimenez Mendez 2017 Maxima Expresión Del Terroir Alta Reserva Las Brujas Malbec (Canelones)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine comes from Northridge Vineyard, one of the state's premier vineyards. Blended with 23% Cabernet Sauvignon, vibrant aromas of ripe plum, licorice, dried herb and baking spice lead to full-bodied, well-balanced fruit flavors that carry on the finish. There's great enjoyment overall, and the tannic structure helps give a sense of gravitas.
Name: Charles & Charles 2015 C2 Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: It has taken Alta Vista a few years to get this Maule Valley Malbec right, but this rendition is on the mark. A saturated black color and jammy aromas of blackberry, minerals, licorice root and raisin lead to a fleshy palate that's a touch loose in structure, with tannic backing. Toasty oak, herbal blackberry and gamy flavors are complex, while ripe berry and oak flavors offset a minty green note on the finish. Drink through 2023.
Name: Altamana 2015 Single Vineyard Constanza Malbec (Maule Valley)

Description: Ripe, slightly desiccated aromas of prune, raisin and blackberry include a horsey note. A full-bodied palate weighs in as mildly flabby and heavy, while dark, charred berry and toast flavors are blackened. On the finish, chalky dryness lends focus to an otherwise ripe finish. Drink through 2023.
Name: Altamana 2015 Grande Reserve Malbec (Maule Valley)

Description: This wine is sourced from Parma Extension, Sawtooth and Williamson's vineyards. Fruit tones are at the fore, with aromas of blueberry pie and plum, along with spice and herb accents. Medium-bodied blue-fruit flavors follow on the palate. It shows a lot of finesse and detail, with an appealing sense of purity and balance.
Name: Huston 2016 Malbec

Description: This mature Malbec from a cool vintage offers concentrated, meaty aromas of black fruits, iodine, black olive, herbs and minerals. In the mouth, this is a bit scratchy and tartaric. Flavors of blackberry and stewed plum are short and a touch salty, while this feels chewy, full and a bit sticky on the finish. Drink through 2022.
Name: Galan 2013 1492 Malbec (Central Valley)

Description: A blend of 90% Malbec and Cabernet Franc, this wine has plenty of red fruits that have acidity and brightness. Its texture is soft and balanced with fruit and gentle tannins in harmony. Drink from late 2019.
Name: Domaine Gibault 2017 Emotion Malbec (Touraine)

Description: Jammy blackberry and blueberry aromas come with funky Elqui notes of cardamom and Middle Eastern spices. On the palate, this is acidic and choppy at first, then smoother. Herb-infused black fruit flavors are grassy and atypical for Malbec, while this feels wide and grapy on the finish.
Name: Elqui Wines 2015 Limited Release Malbec (Elqui Valley)

Description: An herbaceous nose includes aromas of green tobacco, eucalyptus, olive and road tar. The palate on this Malbec is tight, pulling and tannic, while the flavor profile sticks to peppery and green, with just a hint of berry fruit.
Name: Montes 2015 La Finca Clos d'Angel Malbec (Colchagua Valley)

Description: This wine has a nose of blackberry and green pepper. It has flavors of black cherry, strawberry, pomegranate, smoked meat and clove. Tannins can feel a bit stiff at first, but strong acidity overcomes that sensation, leading to a long, smooth finish.
Name: Hacormim 2017 Adi 13 Malbec (Israel)

Description: A black plum aroma carries the nose, coddled by notes of sarsaparilla and white pepper. The polished palate leans on bright acidity to keep the red plum, raspberry and cherry flavors tasting fresh, while tannins tickle the tip of the tongue. Ripe blackberry makes an appearance on the finish, lingering pleasantly with tart acidity.
Name: The Infinite Monkey Theorem 2017 Malbec (Grand Valley)

Description: Aromas of cassis and black plum are backed by frankincense and creosote on a nose. On the palate, blackberry, baking spice and tobacco blend seamlessly together on a bed of fine, sandy tannins. The acidity keeps things light and food friendly, making this perfect for weeknight dinners.
Name: BookCliff 2016 Reserve Malbec (Colorado)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Fruit for this wine comes from one of the state's top Malbec vineyards. The aromas are brooding, with notes of blackberry, baking spice and herb, with the fruit seeming dried out. Full-bodied fruit flavors follow.
Name: Plumb Cellars 2015 Gamache Vineyard Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Vanilla, sweet baking spice and cream soda lead the nose, joined by aromas of raw rhubarb and bell pepper. A cozy combination of flavors bring together ripe raspberry, red plum, vanilla and allspice. The tannins are powdery in feel, mingling with mouthwatering acidity that adds tang. Cherry and tobacco flavors smother a little heat on the  finish.
Name: Continental Divide 2017 Malbec (Grand Valley)

Description: From an estate site in Pope Valley that rises to an elevation of 1,000-feet, this impresses in high-toned raspberry and cassis fruitiness, accompanied by an aromatic note of violet. Well structured and full bodied, it has secondary characteristics of cedar and dried herb, the oak supportive and not in the way. This will do well in the cellar; enjoy best from 2025–2030.
Name: Gratus 2015 Estate Grown Malbec (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Freshly smashed red-currant and blackberry aromas provide a bright and accessible nose. The palate is layered with tobacco, mint and plum flavors, and there is good acidic zip to the lively feel.
Name: Rancho Sisquoc 2016 Flood Family Vineyards Malbec (Santa Barbara County)

Description: Thick red- and black-cherry fruit punctures more savory earthy elements of dried herb and currant in this tart tangy wine. A strong core of tannin supports the ripeness with violet aromatics leading the way.
Name: Toybox Wine Cellars 2015 Cadden Family Vineyard Malbec (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Côt is an alternate name for Malbec—a southern Oregon strength. This tasty wine mixes plum and wild-berry fruit with smoky toast from 18 months in barrel. It's drinking well and should go another three or four years.
Name: Troon 2016 Estate Cuvée Côt (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Raspberry jam carries the fruit, with better balance than the winery's other 2015 reds, which seem bitter and tannic in comparison. Here there's enough fruit to compensate for some initial roughness. The wine will reward aggressive aeration.
Name: Schmidt 2015 Malbec (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas offer notes of dried cherry and licorice, with the fruit seeming a bit desiccated. Ripe, full-bodied flavors follow. The fruit seems dried out, but it still provides enjoyment.
Name: Seven Hills 2016 McClellan Estate Vineyard Malbec (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Estate-grown, firm and compact, this leans toward barely ripened flavors of cherry tomato and thin black cherry. There's a touch of buttery barrel, along with a gentle earthy character.
Name: Del Rio 2015 Malbec (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Coffee grinds, wet soils and dark fruits show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is slightly sour with berry and forest-floor moss flavors.
Name: Martellotto 2017 My Way Malbec (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are quite green, with notes of green pepper, dried tobacco and fresh green herb along with orange peel. Light, tangy fruit flavors follow, with plentiful orange peel notes throughout.
Name: Mercer 2016 Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Reduced to the point of inscrutable, other than scents of rubber tire, this wine stayed stubbornly closed even after many hours. What flavors were there appeared dull and sour, with weedy fruit.
Name: Maragas 2015 Terrebonne Malbec (Oregon)

Description: A 100% varietal wine, this impresses mightily in its offering of blueberry-cobbler flavor and graham cracker. Dark chocolate and white pepper contrast easily within bright polished tannins and a lingering finish of leather and graphite.
Name: Stags' Leap Winery 2015 Malbec (Napa Valley)

Description: Hailing from a hot vintage, this mature Malbec smells ripe, baked and much like raisin and chocolate. A huge palate is creamy and lush; balsamic berry, chocolate and stewed fig flavors finish slow and steady, with chocolaty richness. Drink through 2020.
Name: Antigal 2009 One La Dolores Vineyard Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Ripe, slightly raisiny aromas stop short of cooked. That said, there's a sense of overripeness to the palate. If that theme is getting boring, then sorry, because this tastes of desiccated black grapes and prune. Cobos is good enough to make excellent wine in less than optimal years; this is a prime example of that.
Name: Viña Cobos 2015 Cobos Marchiori Estate Vineyard Malbec (Perdriel)

Description: Aromas of blackberry, cassis, hot pavement and herb are solid but not effusive. This is a full and balanced Malbec with adequate freshness to the palate. Dark plum, blackberry and chocolate check off what's normal for a wine of this level, while fair tannins lend grip to a lengthy finish. Drink through 2025.
Name: Melipal 2015 Estate Bottled Malbec (Agrelo)

Description: Chocolaty blackberry aromas are at the center of a deep nose that's also creamy from lactic oak. Juicy acidity bolsters the palate, which is full and balanced. Black plum and blackberry flavors include a smear of chocolate and mild herbal notes, while this Malbec is chewy and chocolaty on the finish. Drink through 2024.
Name: Durigutti 2015 HD Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Woodsy aromas of black fruit and gingerbread create a friendly nose that lacks exactness. This is bulky on the palate, with dense berry flavors that are foresty, minty and oaky. Spice and chocolate mint flavors blend with lightly herbal berry notes on the finish.
Name: Bodega Catena Zapata 2015 Alta Historic Rows Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Earth and black fruit aromas are prominent on the nose. The palate is dense in a black fruit flavor, with chocolate and coffee chiming in. This is fully ripe and hefty in feel. Drink through 2022.
Name: Loscano 2015 Grand Reserve Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: Slightly reduced black fruit aromas are baked and come with accents of tobacco and asphalt. A heavily concentrated palate is a touch flat and sticky, but not overly so. Dense blackberry, cassis and burnt toast flavors show toasty oak on a thick finish that some might call syrupy.
Name: Terrazas de Los Andes 2012 Parcel N2W Los Castaños Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Toasty black-cherry jam meets smoky oak in this robust, rich varietal wine, blended with a small amount of Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Abundantly ripe, it finishes soft and round.
Name: Stephanie 2014 Malbec (Napa Valley)

Description: A full blast of cassis and blackberry aromas conveys ripeness, while a side of murky earth is a barrier to greater excellence. On the palate, this is chewy, tannic and rich. Plum and blackberry flavors are familiar for quality Mendoza Malbec, while this feels a bit rubbery and tannic on the finish. For a marginal vintage like 2015, this deserves praise. Drink through 2023.
Name: Chakana 2015 Estate Selection Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Concentrated aromas of dark plum and blackberry are what serious Mendoza Malbecs are made of, and this has them. Although this is wiry on the palate, there's enough depth, pulp and weight to handle punchy acidity. Wild berry and black plum flavors hit the road on a finish that's crisp, fresh and showing slightly scratchy tannins. Drink through 2024.
Name: Pampas del Sur 2015 Gran Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rounded aromas of dark strawberry, black pepper, smoke and vanilla show on the nose of this bottling by the Riboli family. It's smooth and very drinkable on the palate, with flavors of French toast, red plum and dark strawberry jelly.
Name: Opaque 2013 Malbec (Paso Robles)

Description: An opaque black color and grapy, blatantly ripe berry aromas open this chunky Malbec from a difficult vintage. A scratchy palate displays scraping tannins, while this tastes blackened, charred and low on vivid fruit. Peppercorn spice and other dark flavors take this overripe but manageable Malbec home.
Name: Luca 2015 Nico Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Earthy blackberry aromas are slightly murky and thus lack precision. This Malbec from a sketchy vintage feels chewy and a bit heavy across the palate. Berry and cassis flavors are a touch gummy and stewed, while this feels tannic and tastes of blueberry and green herb on the finish.
Name: Pascual Toso 2015 Reserva Barrancas VIneyards Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Baked berry, root beer, cassis and licorice root aromas set up a firm and solid palate that's in good health. Slightly salty and roasted flavors of cassis, tobacco, root beer and braised beef finish with heady warmth.
Name: Wild Iris 2010 Reserve Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Somewhat shy on the nose, this bottling offers berry, dried herb and wet slate aromas. The palate is very dry and tightly woven with chalky tannins that only allow berry, roast beef and charcoal flavors to barely arise. It will likely become more expressive with time.
Name: Donati Family Vineyard 2015 Family Reserve Malbec (Paicines)

Description: Spicy clove and black pepper adorn a burly build of subdued black fruit in this reserve-level wine. The finish is soft and moderate.
Name: Rutherford Ranch 2016 Reserve Malbec (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Sweet and dark aromas of blackberry, dark chocolate, mint and charcoal show on the nose of this bottling. It's quite thick on the palate with strong tannins that cut the extracted black-currant and cigar-box flavors.
Name: Clos La Chance 2014 Reserve Malbec (Central Coast)

Description: Reduced and meaty, this is a richly built, robust and earthy wine, with grabby tannins that grip the palate with force.
Name: Hendry 2016 Hendry Vineyard Malbec (Napa Valley)

Description: A heavy, raisiny nose may be ripe, but it's also blocky and flat. That same sense of weight comes across on a palate showing tartaric boost. Prune, cassis and other ripe black-fruit flavors don't show much complexity or character on the finish.
Name: Familia Cassone 2014 Obra Prima Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: This is a mature throwback Malbec with a rusty color and aromas of balsamic vinegar, raisin and warm earth. The palate is a bit broken down and tannic, while soupy flavors of stewed berry and raisin finish with depth and weight but not much freshness. This is more interesting than exciting at this point.
Name: Weinert 2006 Carrascal Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Starting out slightly reduced, aromas of plum, cedar, spice box, tobacco and orange peel are followed by medium-bodied plum flavors. There are some interesting things going on, but they don't all come together.
Name: Brook & Bull 2016 Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Barrel aromas are out front, with notes of baking spice and vanilla extract followed by cumin, dried parsley and medicine cabinet. Dried black cherry flavors follow with grainy tannins for support.
Name: Henry Earl 2015 Quintessence Vineyard Malbec (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Oak Knoll District, Napa, California, US
Description: Vanilla oak and cola flavors are given additional richness by way of jammy blueberry fruit and toast. The structure is muddled and fleshy.
Name: Materra Cunat Family Vineyards 2015 After Midnight Malbec (Oak Knoll District)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aged in neutral oak, this is mostly Olsen (82%) fruit with the balance Upland. The aromas pop, with notes of freshly peeled tangerine, citrus, black pepper and plum. Light fruit flavors follow. It's interesting, but the concentration isn't all there. Put it on the dinner table to see it at its best.
Name: Structure 2016 Foundation Malbec (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are perfumed, with notes of dried orange peel, violet, plum and raspberry. The raspberry and orange flavors are light, with a chalky feel. It piques the interest, though not fully delivering.
Name: Vino La Monarcha 2016 Malbec (Wahluke Slope)

Description: Saucy berry and plum aromas are lightly infused with herb and tomato notes. This feels jammy and easy but low on structure. Generic berry and plum flavors are slightly pasty, while this tastes sort of burnt and fruitless on the finish.
Name: Malacara 2017 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Gamy blackberry aromas have nothing in hiding. While this is plump and full, it's cutting and tartaric in feel, with roughness a big part of the mouthfeel. Baked black fruit flavors bumble toward a grabby finish without much flow.
Name: Fabre Montmayou 2014 Gran Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Beefy berry and iodine aromas never reach much of a high point, while this Malbec feels big, bulky and sort of flabby. Savory spice and generic berry flavors finish with notes of oak and salt.
Name: Kaiken 2017 Estate Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: High-toned aromas of dark cherry and black licorice lead to black fruit flavors that are centered around the middle, seeming to be missing on the edges. The variety seems hard to find, and the volatiles a bit amped up.
Name: Liberty Lake 2016 Scooteney Flats Vineyard Malbec (Red Mountain)

Description: Not every vintage is a winner, proven by this dark Malbec with closed pruny aromas. A seemingly worked palate feels fat but still blazing with acidity, so go figure. Lactic berry and awkward oak flavors finish short and hollow. Other vintages of this wine have been better.
Name: Bodega Rolland 2014 Mariflor Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Foxy berry aromas lack clarity, density and ripeness. A flat and heavy palate deals flavors of soy sauce, baked beans and stewed berry fruits, while this offers little fruit on a finish that tastes slightly weedy.
Name: Gubinelli 2011 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Aromas of ripe berry fruit and asphalt lead to a brisk palate with bright acidity. Flavors of grilled meat and red berry fruits end crisp and clean.
Name: Kirkland Signature 2017 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Cheesy berry aromas are in the lead, while there's also a hint of clove to the nose. A superficial palate offers almost no depth or structure, while this tastes of lightly spiced plum and berry fruits. A mild finish is inoffensive.
Name: Black Cabra 2017 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Raw red fruit aromas are herbaceous and ever so slightly weedy. Following suit, this Malbec from a cold year feels thin and on the hollow side. Minty currant flavors include green herb notes and ample oak, while this is dry, peppery and a touch bitter on a miserly finish.
Designation: Siesta En El Tahuantinsuyu Single Vineyard
Name: Ernesto Catena 2014 Siesta En El Tahuantinsuyu Single Vineyard Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Murky berry aromas drive a nose that's mostly dull and stewy. Raw acidity creates tart, ornery red plum and currant flavors, while this is tomatoey and a bit weedy on the finish.
Name: Nieto Senetiner 2017 Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

Description: Pickled berry aromas are less than fresh. This Malbec is raw, choppy and hard. Prune flavors and mild oxidation on a grabby finish fail to push this ahead.
Name: Argenses 2014 Reserve Block #15 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Raisiny berry aromas announce a Malbec based on sketchy raw materials. In the mouth, this is flat and jammy but juiced by tartaric acidity. Soupy berry flavors are green and tomatoey on the finish.
Name: Bodega Toro Centenario 2017 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Raw, clipped berry aromas smell like a hot road. Rawness is a persistent theme; this tastes underripe, tomatoey, herbal and gamy.
Name: Graffigna 2014 Grand Reserve Malbec (San Juan)

Appellation: Red Hills, Lake County, California, US
Description: This is a sophisticated, complex and smooth-textured wine that has a mellow, spicy, moderately oaky character and lots of ripe berry and black cherry to fill the middle. The body is full, the tannins are abundant but soft and the mouthfeel is rich and plush.
Name: Cinnabar 2015 Malbec (Red Hills)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Rich aromas of blackberry jam and equally concentrated fruit flavors give a lot of enjoyment to this deeply colored, full-bodied wine. It has lots of fine-grained tannins that enrich the texture while nuances of black pepper and boysenberry flood the tongue and linger on the finish.
Name: Charles B. Mitchell 2014 Reserve Delfino Malbec (El Dorado)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: An alluring spicy aroma and generous, opulent fruit flavors pack this full-bodied wine with pleasure. It has a velvety, almost-thick texture, blackberry, blueberry and oak spice flavors that are concentrated and deep, plus a good structure of fine-grained tannins.
Name: Shannon 2015 Home Ranch Reserve Malbec (Lake County)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Ripe grape and plum aromas fill the nose in this exuberant and fruity wine. The palate brings a rich blackberry-jam flavor that seems to coat the tongue in a velvety texture, ending on a delicious dark-grape tone on the finish.
Name: Saracina 2016 Skid Row Vineyard Malbec (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Fair Play, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Ripe and saturated fruit flavors and moderate tannins come together nicely in this full-bodied, lightly spicy wine. It has a good sense of concentration, lots of ripe blackberry and blueberry flavors and a lingering finish.
Name: Winery by the Creek 2015 Miller Vineyard Malbec (Fair Play)

Description: Aromas of black pepper and grilled beef lead to rich black-cherry and blackberry-jam flavors in this full-bodied and densely flavored wine. It has firm tannins and good acidity for a rather stiff texture that needs a bit of time to soften. Best after 2021.
Name: Viaggio 2014 Outlaw Malbec (Lodi)

Description: This wine comes from a small parcel of Malbec, a grape once common in Bordeaux but now rare. The powerful tannins show that Malbec can now ripen easily in selected terroirs, thanks to climate change. The wine is full, spiced with wood and firm with a solid structure. It will age further, so drink this rich wine from 2021.
Name: Château Fleur Haut Gaussens 2016 La Viminière Malbec  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This medium-bodied wine is rich in blackberry and blueberry flavors and mellow in texture. It starts with aromas of cinnamon and black pepper, has good fruit concentration, light tannins and low acidity.
Name: Langman Estate 2015 Bud's Block Malbec (Sierra Foothills)

Description: A perfumed 100% Malbec wine, this has rounded tannins, rich flavors and plenty of potential. Bold, full of black fruitiness and firmly structured, the wine will take time to develop. Drink from 2022.
Name: Château Tire Pé 2016 Les Malbecs  (Bordeaux)

Appellation: Fair Play, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Slightly earthy aromas lead to good fruit, black-pepper and smoke flavors, solid structure and a firm moderately tannic texture.
Name: Charles B. Mitchell 2013 Chui Vineyard Reserve Malbec (Fair Play)

Description: The stout, concentrated nose is packed with berry fruit but also shows a slightly wild side that's rustic and suggestive of animal hide. The acidity is a bit bracing, carrying flavors of dark plum, currant and blackberry. Jam and chocolate finish with mellow tannins. Drink through 2022.
Designation: Terroir Series Finca Coletto Single Vineyard El Parel
Name: Trapiche 2014 Terroir Series Finca Coletto Single Vineyard El Parel Malbec (Uco Valley)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Blocky, jammy berry aromas are forward and include lactic oak. This is a big boy with commendable structure. Blackberry, cassis, tobacco and vanilla flavors finish bold and spicy, with latent tobacco and barrel notes. Drink this classic full-bodied Malbec through 2023.
Name: Trivento 2015 Eolo Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

Description: A massive nose with huge blackberry and cassis aromas is ripe to the max. This Malbec is flush but still fairly fresh, so it succeeds in blending power with structure and balance. Flavors of blackberry and cassis show a chocolaty touch on the finish. Drink through 2023.
Name: Infinito 2014 Winemaker's Selection Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Salentein's new San Juan project is one to watch. This sunbaked Malbec is a touch desiccated on the nose, with ultraripe aromas of blackberry, prune, raisin and marzipan. A pure and layered palate is structured and not baked out. Toasty, blackened cassis and berry flavors reign, while this is chocolaty and tastes of wild berry fruits on the finish. Drink through 2020.
Name: Pyros 2014 Single Vineyard Block No. 4 Malbec (Pedernal Valley)

Description: Smoky, savory aromas of grilled beef, graphite, clove and baked fruit are the opening on this saturated Malbec. Baked black cherry, blackberry and cassis flavors are compact prior to finish, with strong acidity and tannins. Drink through 2022.
Name: Tomero 2015 Gran Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Abacela's reds are dark, bold and tannic, but the estate-grown fruit is up to the challenge of the extended barrel aging. Bourbon tea aromas introduce this pure Malbec, which does a vertical dive into deep black cherry and cassis fruit. A spine of iron and finishing touches of licorice and espresso contribute to a powerful, tannic finish.
Name: Abacela 2015 Malbec (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dark berry and cherry fruits meet with turned earth, oak smoke and wet rocks on the intriguing nose of this bottling from the Santa Maria community college winery. Boysenberry and black-raspberry flavors show on the sip alongside shaved cocoa and soil flavors, the overall richness cut smartly by acid.
Name: Allan Hancock 2016 Malbec (Paso Robles)

Description: Jammy black fruit aromas are reedy and a touch herbal, with a note of fennel bulb. A raw, choppy palate is loaded and full, while this San Juan Malbec from Bodegas Salentein tastes herbal, minty, spicy and a touch green across the finish. Drink through 2021.
Name: Pyros 2015 Barrel Selected 160 Malbec (Pedernal Valley)

Description: While some might find this over the top and overdone, it has its strong points, namely mossy aromas of cassis and mocha. Don't expect much tension from this Malbec; the flavors are ultraripe and jammy. While the label says 14%, this seems riper and heavier than that.
Name: Mas 2014 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: A concentrated nose includes aromas of blackberry, black plum, coconut and charred wood. A thick, almost syrupy palate is on the heavy and round side, while this tastes of ripe blackberry and cassis. A rich finish with peppery spice and fudge-like flavors is warming.
Name: Rutini 2015 Encuentro Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: South Coast, South Coast, California, US
Description: Deep, dark and lush aromas of blackberry, black plums, lilac and smoked meat show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is well rounded and cohesive, showing berry, plum and espresso-bean flavors.
Name: Hawk Watch Winery 2015 Solo Barrique Malbec (South Coast)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rich aromas of blackberry jam, roasted meats and gravel are very well integrated on the nose of this bottling. The palate deftly balances pepper and charred meats with a strong black-currant core, adding touches of gravel and tobacco leaf toward the finish.
Name: Midnight 2015 Solstice Malbec (Paso Robles)

Description: Inky, concentrated aromas of black fruits are mildly spicy and granular. High acidity along with a grape-skins texture defines the palate, which tastes of grapy blackberry. A compact, narrow finish is flush but lacks expansiveness.
Name: Colomé 2014 Estate Malbec (Salta)

Description: Blackberry, black licorice and campfire aromas lead to a fleshy palate that's full but with gaps. Blackberry, dark plum and cassis flavors are standard for quality Malbec from Mendoza, while this is chocolaty on a finish that doesn't evolve.
Name: Trapiche 2015 Medalla Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Cola and slightly overripe aromas of raisin and fig are blanketed with oaky mocha and cocoa. This is syrupy in feel, with not much structural or acidic support. Thus you get a rich, creamy set of chocolaty berry flavors all the way through the finish.
Name: Fäsi 2013 Reserva Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: Blackberry, cassis and licorice aromas are ripe on the nose. Bright acidity creates tension on the palate, while this tastes of berry and cherry flavors offset by lactic oak. On the finish, an oaky vanilla tone wrestles with brisk red-berry acidity.
Name: Doña Paula 2015 Selección de Bodega Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Minty, cheesy oak notes dampen blackberry aromas and render the nose foresty. A full mouthfeel has its share of pulp, while this Malbec tastes spicy, chocolaty and herbal. Oak takes the reins on a finish that tastes toasty and a lot like chocolate.
Name: Piattelli 2014 Grand Reserve Limited Production Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

Description: Baked berry and earthy plum aromas are dense and meaty. A raw, choppy palate shows aggression and tannic bite. Snappy black plum and wild berry flavors finish with inward pull along with lasting notes of mint and oak.
Name: Rubus 2015 Icono Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Pulpy aromas of blackberry, cassis, fig and pastry show a mineral streak. This feels solid and chewy, with spongy tannins. Standard black fruit flavors are normal for Mendoza Malbec, while this is weighty in feel and tastes of blackberry on the finish.
Name: Trivento 2016 Golden Reserve Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dark boysenberry aromas meet with peppery spice and herbs on the tangy nose of this bottling. The palate shows a bit of balsamic sourness, with hints of boysenberry and blackberry fruit.
Name: Allegretto 2014 Ayres Family Reserve Malbec (Paso Robles)

Description: Ripe, raisiny aromas include barrel-based notes of vanilla, cocoa and graphite. Hailing from a cool, rainy year like 2016, this is surprisingly full, extracted and traditional is style. Raisin and cassis notes carry the flavor profile to a slightly syrupy finish.
Name: Lamadrid 2016 Single Vineyard Reserva Malbec (Agrelo)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of fresh plum, orange peel, tar and herb lead to quite light, tart fruit flavors backed by lightly grainy tannins. It's an intriguing interpretation of this variety, but the concentration doesn't seem all there.
Name: Three of Cups 2016 La Monde Cameron Ridge Vineyard Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Herbal berry and plum aromas are savory and a touch green. An edgy palate pulls back and is drawing, while this tastes of herbal berry fruits and cured meat. Mouthcoating tannins take elegance away from the finish.
Name: Viejo Isaias 2015 Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Gaseous aromas of iodine and latex cloud black plum and berry scents. This feels stocky but grabby and obtuse. Limited black fruit flavors are generic and finish hollow despite this Malbec's bold color and weight.
Name: Nieto Senetiner 2016 Don Nicanor Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Hot tar and peanut brittle aromas are earthy at best. This Malbec is tight and unyielding on the palate, with plum and currant flavors. The finish tastes saucy, with tomatoey acidity.
Name: Antis 2014 Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Gamy berry and plum aromas are matched if not outdone by heavy herbal scents. While this is round and full in feel, it tastes roasted and herbal, with minty berry flavors that suggest green. A gamy, herbal, peppery finish is par for this course.
Name: Terrazas de Los Andes 2015 Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Grapy aromas of cassis and purple flower are jumbled. This is high in acidity but short on depth and richness. Tart black fruit flavors are smacking and taste of saline on an acidic finish.
Name: Chakana 2016 Nuna Estate Bottled Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: A cloudy red color and earthy aromas of wet cement, raisin and berry fruits set up a fleshy palate without much intensity or depth. Charred, minty berry and plum flavors finish hollow.
Name: Bodega Cuarto Dominio 2016 Tolentino Winemaker's Selection Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Berry and plum aromas are woolly and far from fresh. In the mouth, this passable Malbec is wiry and sharp, with tangy acidity. Savory, saucy plum flavors finish salty and leafy.
Name: Luigi Bosca 2016 La Linda Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

Description: Heavy oak aromas are chemical at first, then more civil and familiar after airing. A jammy, pulpy palate holds plum and saucy berry flavors. On the finish, this Malbec is savory tasting and lacking in fruit.
Name: Septima 2016 Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Wiry black fruit aromas are woody and tough. On the palate, this is chunky, plump and rubbing. Dark berry and minty green flavors are on the herbal side, while this tastes burnt and oaky on the finish.
Name: Piattelli 2016 Premium Reserve Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

Description: Foxy herbal aromas of rhubarb lead to a heavy, rubbery palate with no lift or vitality. This Malbec tastes of green herbs, leaves and plums. An herbal finish with a minty oak flavor is slightly bitter.
Name: Cruz Alta 2016 Reserve Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Extremely extracted aromas of blackberry juice veer toward vinegar on the nose of this bottling. That balsamic aspect dominates the palate.
Name: Millésimé 2014 Malbec (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: Foxy berry aromas mixed with forced-oak scents of clove create a jumpy sum of disparate parts. A tight, drawing palate is basic at best, while this tastes tart, woody and limited, with herbal plum and berry flavors on the finish.
Name: Rutini 2016 Trumpeter Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Flat, soapy aromas are green, woody and don't stir interest. A full, grabby palate tastes of weedy, oaky berry fruits that are green and leafy on the finish. The list of faults on this Malbec is long.
Name: Canciller 2016 Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Reedy, high-toned aromas of underripe berry fruits and oak signal a sappy palate without much structure. Saucy berry flavors are more savory than fruity, while this barely registers on the finish.
Designation: Inkarri Made With Organic Grapes Estate Bottled
Name: Chakana 2016 Inkarri Made With Organic Grapes Estate Bottled Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Valle de Uco, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Gamy, funky aromas of herbal blueberry and currant announce a narrow, tubular palate. Burnt plum and berry flavors are green and weedy, while hard spice is the prominent flavor on a condensed finish.
Name: Luminis 2014 Allamand Malbec (Valle de Uco)

Description: Aromas of boxed raisins are flat and dull. The palate is fleshy in feel, with forward flavors of raisins and plums.
Name: Laberinto 2016 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Weedy, green aromas of plum and berry are less than ripe and less than convincing. A raw, choppy palate and flavors of reedy berry fruits finish leafy, green and a bit rotten tasting.
Name: Cigar Box 2016 Old Vine Hand Harvested Malbec (Argentina)

Description: Chemical aromas of paint and wood grain seem unnatural. This feels rubbery and obtuse, while herbal, minty berry and plum flavors are green to the point of herbaceous.
Name: Mountain Door 2016 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Pure berry aromas give the impression of nothing but clarity and purity. This is saturated and pushing the ripeness meter to the edge of syrupy, but not quite. Blackberry, root beer and chocolate flavors are lush and dense, while this closes in a kind, smooth sort of way. All the Cobos Bramare Malbecs from 2015 are exemplary; drink this through 2028.
Name: Viña Cobos 2015 Bramare Rebon Estate Malbec (La Consulta)

Appellation: Valle de Uco, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: A pure berry nose of black and blue fruits is rich, a touch jammy and oh so inviting. On the palate, this is tight and firm, and far less thick than Cobos wines of the past. Blackberry and lightly toasted oak flavors are direct and generous, and this Malbec from the Uco Valley is laser focused on the finish. Drink through 2030.
Name: Viña Cobos 2015 Bramare Zingaretti Estate Malbec (Valle de Uco)

Description: Pure aromas of Malbec grapes, cassis and violet petals is what this cement-raised wine delivers for starters. In the mouth, this is spring-loaded with rubbery tannins and mild acid-based astringency. Naturally blackened flavors of blackberry and dark plum are full, round and consistent across a long intense finish. Drink through 2024.
Name: Zuccardi 2016 Poligonos del Valle de Uco Malbec (Paraje Altamira)

Description: Clean, pure berry aromas come with earth and smoked meat notes. This is a full, bold Malbec from old vines. Spicy, lightly herbal plum and blackberry flavors finish pumped up, juicy and fresh. This is ready to drink or can be held for years to come; enjoy through 2028.
Name: TintoNegro 2015 1955 Vineyard Estate Grown Malbec (La Consulta)

Description: Ripe berry and graham cracker aromas are bold. A fleshy, fruity palate benefits from bright acidity as flavors of blackberry, wild herbs and pepper roll out. A racy finish with blasting acidity means this Altamira-grown Malbec will hold steady and could improve over the next three to five years. Drink through 2023.
Designation: Terroir Series Edición Limitada Finca El Milagro Single Vineyard
Name: Trapiche 2013 Terroir Series Edición Limitada Finca El Milagro Single Vineyard Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: A saturated dark-purple color and aromas of pure grape juice and stout berry fruits amount to an impressive opening. Blackberry, cassis and natural peppery flavors fill out this cement-fermented-and-aged Malbec from the highest part of Tupungato. A steady, focused finish is clean and powerful, and overall this is a racy muscular wine to drink through 2024.
Name: Zuccardi 2016 Poligonos del Valle de Uco Malbec (Tupungato)

Description: Pure Malbec has tannins. But when, like here, they are well integrated into the dark fruits and the wood-aging flavors, they almost melt. This wine has ripe berry flavors and great concentration. The rich structure and power indicate that it will age. Drink from 2023.
Name: Château Eugénie 2015 Haute Collection Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Lush blackberry and cassis aromas offer a deep dive into the land of ripe fruit, all touched up by notes of coffee and mocha. This Uco Valley Malbec is flush, with volume and precision to the palate. Earthy berry, mocha and chocolate cake flavors finish full and ripe. Drink through 2028.
Name: Luigi Bosca 2015 Terroir Los Miradores Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: Cola and racy red-fruit aromas are classic Uco Valley. A fresh, zesty palate is a touch choppy, but this Malbec's deep and impressive licorice, spice, espresso and berry flavors carry the show. A fresh finish is full of blasting energy, so no need to rush this. Drink through 2028.
Name: Salentein 2014 Pr1mum Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: This powerful, rich wine is produced from a vineyard and cellar selection. It's full of impressive tannins and black fruits, with strong flavors of wood aging. Ripe berries are enhanced by spice and a big structure cut with acidity. Drink from 2023.
Name: Vignobles Pelvillain 2016 Château du Port Grand Réserve Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Lightly herbal and floral aromas of wild flowers, thyme and sage lend complexity and interest to an otherwise berry fruit nose. This is fresh but a bit edgy in feel, seemingly a combination of its Altamira origins and a cool 2016 vintage. Berry fruit flavors are bright and touched up with chocolaty oak, while this is sturdy, spicy and complete on a juicy finish. Drink through 2025.
Name: ZaHa 2016 Toko Vineyard Estate Grown Malbec (Paraje Altamira)

Appellation: Valle de Uco, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Concentrated black-fruit aromas are dark and meaty. A tight, pure, sinewy body is home to lightly salty flavors of plum, blackberry and natural spices. A direct focused finish is what Zuccardi is seeking from Poligonos, a line of cement-made wines with zero oak. This one hails from San Pablo, one of the highest vineyard areas in the Uco Valley. Drink through 2026.
Designation: Poligonos del Valle de Uco San Pablo
Name: Zuccardi 2016 Poligonos del Valle de Uco San Pablo Malbec (Valle de Uco)

Description: Berry and cassis aromas are uncompromised and offer a sprinkle of cinnamon and spice. A warm, slightly heavy palate is balanced by tartaric acidity, while flavors of plum and raisin are fully ripe but finish short. Overall, this is a very nice Malbec that comes up a bit short on structure and complexity. Drink through 2021.
Name: Viña Andrico 2012 Gran Reserva Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: This domaine, owned by the Pelvillain family, is a vineyard in the heart of the Lot Valley. The rich tannins that come from this powerful wine provide the structure that supports great swathes of black plum and jammy berry flavors. Drink this dense wine from 2022.
Name: Vignobles Pelvillain 2016 Domaine du Théron Grande Réserve Malbec (Cahors)

Description: This mature Malbec is a throwback to the days when Mendoza was all about big is better. This smells ripe and raisiny, with a cooked-fruit element that some might dismiss as unfresh. In the mouth, this is typically bulky and saturated almost to the point of syrupy. Flavors of raisin, coffee, black licorice, root beer and jerky are sweet and savory prior to a flat finish. Drink now.
Name: Monteviejo 2010 Lindaflor La Violeta Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: A selection in the vineyard is the basis of this powerful wine. Rich in tannins as well as fruit, it has a dense texture, the weight and concentration showing the wine needs aging. It has a rich future; drink from 2023.
Name: Vignobles Pelvillain 2016 Château de Cénac Grande Réserve Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Rooty berry aromas include notes of raisin, licorice and herbs. A thick chunky palate is chewy and dense. Flavors of stewed berry fruits, mocha and chocolate finish with a blast of oak and coffee along with herbal hints and firm residual tannins. Drink through 2022.
Name: Alpasión 2014 Grand Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: A chalky, stony nose screams of the alluvial rocks that inundate the vineyard from which this comes. Of course, there's also a lot of berry fruit in the picture. Ripe but energetic on the palate, this tastes of black fruit, coffee and pepper. A firm, classy finish is full and juicy. Drink through 2025.
Name: Doña Paula 2014 Alluvia Parcel Bush Vines Malbec (Tupungato)

Description: Wild berry and fresh herb aromas are classic for Tupungato, and especially Gualtallary, where this comes from. A racy acid-driven palate is a bit jagged in feel, while reedy spicy berry flavors are juicy and fresh. Acidity is the fuel behind a hard-driving finish with espresso-like bitterness. Drink through 2028.
Name: Zuccardi 2014 Aluvional Gualta Malbec (Tupungato)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Dense compact aromas of blackberry and other dark fruits are what Luján Malbec is all about. This is full and integrated on the palate, while blackberry and oak-based spice flavors finish savory, with a note of graphite. Smooth, grainy tannins help this along.
Name: Zolo 2015 Reserve Estate Grown Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

Description: The 12 months in wood have contributed to the richness and density of this complex wine. With firm tannins, sweet blackberry fruits and good acidity, the wine is already appealing, but it needs time. Drink from 2021.
Name: Les Vignobles Saint-Didier Parnac 2016 Latis Grande Réserve Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Savory dark-berry aromas suggest cumin and curry along with dry earth. On the palate, this Paraje Altamira Malbec is quite racy and acidic, such that it's puckery. Lemony acidity sharpens the wine's plum and berry flavors in front of an intense finish that simmers. With so much acidity on display, this will last another 15–20 years.
Name: Chakana 2015 Ayni Malbec (Paraje Altamira)

Description: Mildly green, herbal and stalky aromas are a touch on the hot and raw side. In the mouth, this is round and firm, with exemplary structure. Herbal spicy dark-fruit flavors finish fresh, tight and a bit rugged. Drink this excellent Uco Valley Malbec through 2024.
Name: Finca la Celia 2014 Heritage Single Vineyard Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: From a 15-acre vineyard located on the third terrace above the river Lot, this wine is dense and structured. It is packed with juicy black fruits, solid tannins and layers of toastiness from the wood aging. Ripe and balanced, the wine should be ready to drink from 2021.
Name: Vignobles Pelvillain 2016 Château du Port Prestige Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Clear-cut black cherry and cassis aromas are tight and not overtly oaky. A tight, drawing palate is dry as a bone for Malbec, and nicely focused. Savory berry and plum flavors are lightly peppery prior to an intense finish, with gripping tannins and minerality.
Name: Altocedro 2017 Año Cero Malbec (La Consulta)

Description: A massive nose of licorice, green herbs and raisin suggests warmth and weight. That assumption is accurate but slightly belied by high acidity. Raisin and prune flavors are chocolaty, while pulsing acidity makes for a long finish. Drink now.
Name: Doña Paula 2013 Alluvia Parcel Bush Vines Malbec (Tupungato)

Description: The vineyard surrounding the medieval castle of Cénac has produced a dense wine that is still young. Concentrated, rich from the ripe black fruits and cut with acidity and minerality, the wine is impressive. It will be ready to drink from 2020.
Name: Vignobles Pelvillain 2015 Château de Cénac Cuvée Prestige Malbec (Cahors)

Appellation: Valle de Uco, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Inky aromas of black fruits and balsamic vinegar are narrow. In the mouth, this Malbec is edgy and bouncy, with elastic tannins and high acidity. Plum and wild-berry flavors finish hard, tough and walled in, all of which reflects the cool 2014 vintage.
Name: Zuccardi 2014 José Zuccardi Malbec (Valle de Uco)

Description: Pure black plum along with natural dust and spice notes make for an alluring nose. This blend of Malbec fruit from Paraje Altamira and Vista Flores, both subzones of the Valle de Uco, is direct and abrupt on the palate, with grit. Meaty gamy slightly salty berry flavors are intense on a juicy finish with rubbery tannins.
Name: Zuccardi 2017 Q Malbec (Valle de Uco)

Description: The medieval castle of Cénac is at the center of this 17-acre vineyard. With its firm tannins and black-currant flavors, the wine is structured while also having great fruitiness. It needs to age, and should not be drunk before 2022.
Name: Vignobles Pelvillain 2016 Château de Cénac Cuvée Prestige Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Black-fruit aromas are solid and smooth, with a good but not overwhelming complement of oak. This ripe Malbec is dense and concentrated, but not overly thick or jammy. Baked black-fruit and prune flavors benefit from integrated oak prior to a steady medium-length finish.
Name: SignoSeis 2014 The Angel Oak Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: Dry berry-fruit aromas come with wild but controlled notes of leather and animal. A fresh palate is medium in weight and concentration, with crisp black-plum and cherry flavors supported by smooth tannins. A similarly fresh finish is consistent with the rest of this Malbec.
Name: La Posta 2017 Fazzio Malbec (Tupungato)

Description: This wine comes from a 15-acre vineyard on gravel soil. It is strongly mineral, packed with tannins and richly dense. The black fruits balance the structure of this ripe wine, while acidity keeps it fresh and shows that the wine could age further. Drink from 2019.
Name: Vignobles Pelvillain 2015 Château du Port Cuvée Prestige Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Unbridled berry aromas display notes of iodine and rubber as this unwinds. The direct palate offers a fresh mouthfeel, while this tastes of mixed black fruits and toast. A lightly blackened finish wraps up this bold Malbec, which contains 5% each Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Syrah.
Name: Domaine Bousquet 2017 Reserve Made with Organic Grapes Malbec (Tupungato)

Description: This is 100% varietal, from grapes grown atop Stagecoach Vineyard. Both stainless-steel and French oak-aged, it offers strawberry, blueberry and watermelon flavors, strong, well-defined characteristics complemented by supple texture and a twist of lemon peel at the finish.
Name: Ladera 2017 Rosé of Malbec (Napa Valley)

Description: Natural berry aromas are tight, lean and snappy. This foot-trod and cement-aged Malbec is grabby and solid in feel. Tangy red-plum and currant flavors are a touch salty, while this is as firm, dry, fresh and juicy as Malbec gets across the finish.
Name: Matias Riccitelli 2017 The Party Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: Intense aromas of iodine and dried blood mix with pointy berry aromas. This is tight, drawing and highly acidic, and arguably in need of a bit more body. Savory saucy red-plum and red-currant flavors are tart and tangy, while this Altamira Malbec feels firm and fresh, some might say angular and too fresh. Drink through 2028.
Name: Zuccardi 2014 Aluvional Malbec (Paraje Altamira)

Description: Blackberry and blueberry aromas are a bit mushy. This feels deep but rather heavy. Dark, almost burnt black-fruit flavors reflect a fair amount of chocolaty oak, while in the midpalate this is slightly green. A toasty blackened finish is oaky and shows a pinch of heat. Drink through 2024.
Name: Maal 2015 Imposible Malbec (Vista Flores)

Description: Blueberry and cassis aromas are a bit gamy but interesting. A fresh snappy palate with tightness holds flavors of plum, raspberry and black pepper. This is a touch woody on a finish that's crisp and drawing.
Name: Tamari 2017 Special Selection Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: Blueberry and dark-plum aromas are gamy and wild. This has a full chewy palate with size and heft. Toasty berry flavors are accented by baking-spice notes, while this is lasting and dark on a solid and satisfying finish.
Name: Tapiz 2017 T Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Black fruits and density are hallmarks of this wine. Ripe and perfumed, it has plenty of firm tannins as well as juiciness. The wine's structure and solid base of tannins offer a rich future. Drink from 2020.
Name: Clos de Gamot 2014 Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Twelve months of wood aging have added a smooth, rich character to the bold black fruits of this full-bodied wine. It has dusty tannins along with acidity and vanilla flavors. Drink this ripe wine from 2019.
Name: Les Vignobles Saint-Didier Parnac 2016 Mission de Picpus Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Peppy, upright aromas of dark-berry fruits, oak and related spice lead to a dense, round and mostly complete palate. This Malbec deals familiar black-fruit flavors along with peppery spice. A settled finish indicates that this is ready to drink.
Name: Maal 2014 Bestial Malbec (Vista Flores)

Description: Sweet berry aromas of blueberry and blackberry are a touch oaky and suggestive of graphite. A plump but pulling palate is quite dry and tannic, but not mean or raw. Savory plum and berry flavors include a hint of soy sauce, while this is flush on the finish.
Name: Susana Balbo 2016 Signature Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: Savory aromas of baked, slightly soupy black fruits emphasize ripeness over freshness. This feels full, jammy and a bit soft. Dark-berry flavors come with a touch of spice, while this is warm and a bit lazy on the finish. Drink this ripe Malbec now.
Name: Conquista 2014 Reserve Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: Ripe and juicy with a smoky bacon character, this wine is fully structured and concentrated. It has bold tannins and rich black fruits, with good acidity to balance everything. This is a wine with a good future and should not be drunk before 2021.
Name: Vignobles Pelvillain 2016 Domaine du Théron Prestige Malbec (Cahors)

Description: One of several wines from this producer highlighting single parcels, this wine has power. Concentrated tannins and black fruit come together, filling the wine with perfumed blackberry and blueberry flavors. This firm wine needs to age, so don't drink before 2021.
Name: Vignobles Pelvillain 2016 Inspiration Plot 7.9 Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Floral berry aromas include a hint of orange blossom, making for a competent and pleasant nose. This Malbec from the cool rainy 2016 vintage is tight, lean and fairly high in acidity. Berry-fruit flavors are subdued but fresh, while this is bouncy and springy on the finish.
Name: Kauzo 2016 Terroir Expressions Altamira Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: Rich, young and fruity, this wine is currently all about bold tannins and ripe black fruits. It needs to age to integrate the fine components. The structure and the core of dryness suggest the wine will improve and should be ready to drink from 2020.
Name: Les Vignobles Saint-Didier Parnac 2016 Latis Réserve Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Reedy stalky aromas of leathery berry fruits are not surprising given how cool 2016 was. This Malbec feels solid but low on fruit, resulting in lean woody red-plum and red-currant flavors. A flush but tannic finish ranks as dry.
Name: Domaine Bousquet 2016 Grande Reserve Malbec (Tupungato)

Description: A structured wine that has plenty of firm tannins as well as black fruit, this is ripe without being too rich. The concentration and dry texture show that the wine needs to age. Drink from 2020.
Name: Vignobles Pelvillain 2016 Inspiration Plot 7.5.3 Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Oak and clove aromas out muscle the fruit on this grabby, bumpy Malbec. A core blackberry flavor is matched and probably even outweighed by oak and related clove. On the finish, this is chunky and short on acidity.
Name: Gaucho 2014 Reserva Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: The mystic properties of the number seven inspire the name for this wine that's juicy with red-berry fruits. It has a mineral edge, along with a layer of firm tannins and final acidity, Drink the wine now.
Name: Vignobles Pelvillain 2015 Plot 7.9 Inspiration Malbec (Cahors)

Appellation: Valle de Uco, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: A dark shiny luster and extracted aromas of iodine, Band-Aid, blackberry and vanilla lead to a rugged palate with sucking tannins. Pushy flavors of berry fruits, black plum and oak are more or less standard but good. On the finish, this is a bit raw and tannic, and thus hard.
Name: Viñalba 2015 Reserva Malbec (Valle de Uco)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of dark roasted coffee beans, herb and spice are followed by somewhat lighter-styled cherry flavors with a slightly tacky feel. Cherry notes persist on the finish. The variety seems hard to find.
Name: Ambassador Vineyard 2015 Estate Grown Malbec (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Fruit for this wine comes from the winery's recently planted estate vineyard in the SeVein project. Aromas of cherry and spice lead to a highly structured palate, with slightly gritty tannins. The middle seems a bit missing. Tasted twice with consistent notes.
Name: Cadaretta 2015 Southwind Malbec (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: Crisp peppery red-fruit aromas are raw but fresh. Those words describe the palate as well, which is tight, fresh and raw in feel. Spicy, peppery plum and red-currant flavors show a touch of oak on an acidic finish.
Name: Finca la Celia 2016 Elite Malbec (Paraje Altamira)

Description: This wood-aged wine is ripe and soft, full of black fruits and warm tannins. It is made to drink young, with great fruitiness and a rich, generous texture. Drink from 2019.
Name: L'Escarpe 2016 Malbec Malbec (Cahors)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Olive, mint and herbal berry aromas amount to a gritty whole. High acidity and saucy fruit flavors of plum, berry and oak spice simmer but don't change much on a racy finish.
Name: Luigi Bosca 2015 Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

Description: Partially aged in wood, this is a dusty, black-fruit-flavored wine. Open tannins support the limpid blackberry fruits. The structure and fruitiness suggest that the wine will develop quickly. Drink from 2019.
Name: Vignobles Pelvillain 2016 Domaine du Théron Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Soupy aromas are undeniable on this murky Malbec that holds its own despite some flaws. A full rugged palate is tannic but not lively. Earthy stewy berry flavors lack freshness, while mild bitterness is noted on a chewy, thick finish. Tasted twice with similar findings.
Name: Antucura 2015 Yepun Single Vineyard Malbec (Vista Flores)

Description: Lightly herbal plum and raspberry aromas include a tomatoey note and spice hints. Like many 2016 Malbecs from Mendoza, this is fresh, racy and pulled tight and to the middle. Peppery plum and currant flavors finish spicy and fiery, with bold acidity.
Name: Kauzo 2016 Cofermented La Consulta-Vistaflores Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: Rooty, earthy berry aromas are covered in a veneer of oak. This Malbec from a problematic vintage is bulky, with high acidity. Chemical oak and berry flavors turn more spicy with airing, but also suggestive of clove. The longer this sits, the better it shows.
Name: Kaiken 2015 Ultra Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Aromas that lean towards savory include exotic notes of cumin and curry along with a fair amount of raw wood. This Malbec from a challenging cool year is round and resiny in feel, with some stickiness. Dry oak and sawdust flavors smother basic fruit, while this ends with mostly wood grain for flavor.
Name: Loscano 2016 Grand Reserve Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: One of a pair of wines that take this estate outside its Fronton home, this softly structured wine is described as Malbec to drink now. Its berry flavors are only lightly textured and there is no sign of wood aging. Enjoy from 2019.
Name: Château Coutinel 2017 Domaine de Coutinel Malbec (Comté Tolosan)

Description: Despite a dark color and aromas of blackberry and mixed baking spices, this has some issues, namely a blocky overextracted palate and baked black-fruit flavors that are less than fresh. A grabby, sticky, clawing finish is thick and beefy, much like the rest of this solid but challenged Malbec from a subpar vintage.
Designation: Gran Reserva Vista Flores Single Vineyard
Name: Finca El Origen 2015 Gran Reserva Vista Flores Single Vineyard Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: Savory baked plum aromas come with spice and floral add-ons. A juicy palate is short on depth, so this Malbec feels a bit flimsy. Berry fruit and cool herbal flavors finish snappy and with unrefined energy and length.
Designation: Inkarri Made With Organic Grapes Winemaker's Reserve
Name: Chakana 2016 Inkarri Made With Organic Grapes Winemaker's Reserve Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: This ripe, fruity wine shows the softer side of Malbec. That makes it an easy, red-fruit-flavored wine for early drinking. Its soft texture, generous fruit and balanced acidity are just right now.
Name: Clos de Gamot 2015 Le Gamotin Malbec (Cahors)

Appellation: Valle de Uco, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Fresh plum and raspberry aromas are miserly. A sharp shearing palate is low on body and high on acidity, while this tastes of peppery red plum and finishes lean, dry and with little weight.
Name: 1853 Old Vine Estate 2016 Reserve Malbec (Valle de Uco)

Appellation: Valle de Uco, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Dry scratchy red-fruit aromas translate to the mouthfeel, which is raw and drawing. Spice flavors and some oak-based toast sit on top of racy red-plum notes, while this is dry, lightly oaked and scouring on the finish.
Name: Malacara 2016 Oak Cask Malbec (Valle de Uco)

Description: Woody aromas of sawdust blend into berry, graphite and wet shale scents. With that much outsize upfront oak, it's no shock that this feels resiny and grabby. Woody savory black-fruit flavors are dry on a rubbing tannic finish.
Name: Tomero 2016 Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Herb, coffee, green tea and wood spice aromas lead to light coffee and chocolate flavors. The wood seems to get in the way of the plum flavors.
Name: Kontos 2015 Malbec (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Raspberry jam and dried cranberry aromas are at the fore, with peppery accents in the background. The flavors are plump and ripe, but don't have the structure to hold them together.
Name: Maryhill 2015 Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Grapey aromas are reduced and meaty, with gaps. This feels hard, tannic and blocky, while dense flavors of blackberry and mint don't rise above the “good” level. A thick heavy finish is saturated in feel but tastes a touch herbal and green.
Name: Andeluna 2015 Altitud Malbec (Tupungato)

Description: Black-plum and black-currant aromas are a bit shocked. In the mouth, this is tight and tannic. Jammy black-fruit flavors are the definition of generic, while this settles in bumpy fashion.
Name: Argento 2017 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Forced oak aromas are gritty and strongly suggest clove. A tannic palate is resiny in feel. Oak-based clove is the key flavor on this oaky one-dimensional Malbec that comes across as being more worked than natural.
Name: Casir Dos Santos 2017 Avatar Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Maraschino cherry, anise and vanilla aromas lead to lightly sweet-seeming fruit flavors. It doesn't all work.
Name: Kontos 2015 Seven Hills Vineyard Malbec (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Valle de Uco, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Soupy saucy berry aromas lack commitment and purity. This feels soupy as well, with jammy weight. Herb-infused black-fruit flavors are kind of green, while this is lugubrious on a finish without much flow.
Name: 1853 Old Vine Estate 2015 Selected Parcel Malbec (Valle de Uco)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: Medium-intense aromas of ripe raspberry and sweet spice show in the bouquet, coming off a bit warm. The medium-weight palate shows more of the same, yielding a straightforward yet solid and clean experience overall.
Name: Kiwi Cuvée 2017 Bin 18 Malbec (Vin de France)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of Jolly Rancher and licorice are followed by lighter-styled flavors that show a lot of wood influence. Green notes linger on the finish.
Name: Maryhill 2015 Proprietor's Reserve Tudor Hills Vineyard Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Woody aromas of berry fruit, scented soap and herbs come in front of a soupy palate. Berry and plum flavors are earthy and a bit green, while this is spicy, saucy, herbal and not real deep or interesting as a whole.
Name: Alamos 2015 Selección Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Furry berry, cotton candy and herbal aromas are less than fresh. This Malbec is clampy, narrow and highly acidic. Minty flavors of plum skins are raw and a bit green, as is an edgy finish.
Name: Bressia 2015 Monteagrello Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Grassy, minty red-fruit aromas are weedy and include more than a hint of oaky clove. An acidic and raw palate holds sour red-fruit flavors along with blatant green notes, while this is minty and clove-like on the finish.
Name: Ernesto Catena 2016 Padrillos Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: Minty clover and raw red-berry and plum aromas announce a wine that's less than ripe. That impression is confirmed on a rough and scratchy palate. Sour plum and currant flavors finish crisp and grating.
Name: Alta Vista 2016 Estate Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Underripe aromas of a burning field mixed with stale sweat socks are not the stuff of legend. A thick soupy palate deals dense berry flavors that are tainted with rot. Call it herbal or call it murky, but overall this isn't cutting it.
Name: Fäsi 2015 Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: Herbal, smoky berry aromas taken as a whole smell much like a burning field. On the palate, this is clamping and short. Tart plum and red-currant flavors are also salty, while this is pinned closed on an acidic finish.
Name: Graffigna 2016 Reserve Malbec (Argentina)

Description: Light cherry and raspberry aromas are earthy and don't amount to much. Scattershot plum and berry flavors lack focus, while this is strangely chemical on the finish.
Name: Bodega Cuarto Dominio 2015 Tolentino Winemaker's Selection Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Coming from a vineyard best known for its Syrah, the aromas show complexity, with heaping notes of black pepper, flower meadow, freshly chopped herb, mint, fresh tobacco and wet gravel. The red and blue-fruit flavors bring a sense of purity, richness and texture, while remaining extremely deft with a long finish. It's a completely unique offering of the variety in the state.
Name: Savage Grace 2016 Boushey Vineyard Côt (Yakima Valley)

Description: Gamy black-fruit aromas benefit from notes of pencil lead and olive. A full, plush mouthfeel is grapy and a bit rough, but loaded with power and depth. Flavors of black fruits and chocolate are a touch rubbing on the finish but complex. Overall, this is high in quality and shows the many upsides of Chilean Malbec. Drink through 2022.
Name: Viña Chocalan 2015 Vitrum Malbec (Maipo Valley)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is the winery's third vintage of this wine. Aged in a combination of French and American oak (50% new), the aromas are generous, with notes of coconut, vanilla, cherry, graphite and spice. The full-bodied fruit flavors are plump and rich, with fruit and barrel intertwining on the finish. It brings a big yum factor.
Name: Fielding Hills 2015 Estate Riverbend Vineyard Malbec (Wahluke Slope)

Description: One of Polkura's many gems is this Malbec. A deep nose with spicy and bold black-fruit aromas sets up a concentrated palate that's chewy and ripe. Plum, blackberry and cassis flavors are aided by notes of herbs and chocolate prior to a chocolaty, spicy finish that shows a dash of salt. Drink through 2022.
Name: Polkura 2015 Malbec (Colchagua Valley)

Description: Although this wine smells a bit pointy up front, enough ripe blackberry and cassis on the nose offsets olive and leather notes. A jammy, plump palate is more widespread than compact, while flavors of oak, tobacco, spice and berry fruits are integrated and finish long and fairly complex. Drink through 2022.
Name: Montes 2015 Alpha Malbec (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: There's no mistaking the variety, with its aromas of dark plum, fresh herb, clove and toasty barrel spices. Fruit flavors coat the palate, bringing a lovely sense of depth and texture. Best by 2022.
Name: Januik 2015 Champoux Vineyard Malbec (Horse Heaven Hills)

Description: Fruit for this wine comes from the Royal Slope. The aromas pop, with notes of freshly peeled orange and tangerine along with fresh herb and piercingly pure plum. The palate is all about lightness and delicacy, with plentiful orange-peel flavors. It's a fascinating, lighter-styled offering on the variety, though it might be a bit too elegant for some tastes.
Name: K Vintners 2015 Broncho Stoneridge Vineyard Malbec (Washington)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are subdued, with notes of wood-spice, herb, dark chocolate, tar and black and blue fruit. Pillowy soft fruit flavors follow, with the tannins giving a light squeeze. A warm finish follows.
Name: Col Solare 2015 Component Collection Malbec (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Blended with 10% Cabernet Sauvignon, the black-pepper, clove, flower, herb and spice aromas are followed by light plump fruit flavors, with a tart finish. The concentration seems light for the variety but what's there is interesting.
Name: Damsel 2015 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))
