Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas draw you into the glass, with notes of plum, blackberry, spice and herb. The flavors bring a sense of purity with a tart finish.
Name: Seven Hills 2015 McClellan Estate Vineyard Malbec (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: Spicy black-fruit aromas are concentrated and lightly herbal. A choppy palate with tight, rubbery tannins yields just enough, offering tastes of savory berry fruits with salty herbal notes. Oak becomes more noticeable on the finish.
Name: Casa Donoso 2016 Gran Reserva Bicentenario Malbec (Maule Valley)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: On this 100% varietal wine, plentiful aromas of plum, tar and spice are followed by elegantly styled fruit flavors. It's a very pretty expression of the variety from this blazing hot appellation and vintage.
Name: Col Solare 2015 Collector's Society Malbec (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is a blend of fruit from the Dineen (70%) and Sheridan vineyards. Beguiling aromas of black plum, tar, clove, cigar box, dried orange peel, spice and whiffs of game are followed by elegant, slightly tangy fruit flavors backed by lightly grainy tannins.
Name: Stevens 2015 StevensTimley Malbec (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of red plum, clove, barrel spice and dried herb lead to soft lighter-styled fruit flavors, with the tannins bringing a lightly chalky feel. There's a pleasing snap on the finish.
Name: Three Rivers 2015 Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Barrel aromas are at the fore, with notes of char, coffee and wood spice in front of dark plum. The palate shows a pleasing sense of weight, texture and length. There are good things going on but the oak seems primary.
Name: Novelty Hill 2015 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Tight, pointy berry and plum aromas come with a hint of oak-based graphite. This Malbec has a medium-bodied, somewhat narrow palate. Flavors of dark plum and wild berry fruits finish compact, with a touch of fiery heat.
Designation: Serie Riberas Gran Reserva Ribera del Tinguiririca
Name: Concha y Toro 2016 Serie Riberas Gran Reserva Ribera del Tinguiririca Malbec (Marchigue)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are fruit forward, with notes of plum and spice, along with what appears to be a light oxidative note. The palate is lush and fruit-filled finishing warm.
Name: Newsprint 2016 Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Flush cherry and berry aromas are impressive given this Malbec's value pricing, with additional tones of animal and saddle leather. A chunky, obtuse palate is anything but lean, while slightly gummy flavors of blackberry and cassis finish steady.
Name: La Moneda 2016 Reserva Malbec (Central Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas aren't quite ready to reveal their charms. The plum flavors are more giving but can't make up the difference. It seems to be in a strange spot.
Name: Baer 2015 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Gritty, rubbery berry aromas come with an oaky covering. This Malbec feels good and lively, but also resiny. Flavors of forced oak rest on top of generic berry underpinnings, while oaky flavors of clove and mint take over on the finish.
Name: Montes 2016 Malbec (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas show notes of bruised apple and pear. Lighter-styled plum flavors follow. It doesn't all work.
Name: Columbia Crest 2015 Reserve Andrews & Rowell Vineyard Malbec (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas show notes of fresh herb, plum, spice and orange peel. The flavors are light and sleek, not showing the variety's more generous side but still providing interest.
Name: Waterbrook 2015 Reserve Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Ribald cassis and prune aromas ride alongside oak and licorice tones. The full palate is dense in flavors of blackberry, molasses, chocolate and coffee, followed by a mocha explosion on the finish. Amid the many leaner and fresher wines coming from Argentina, this is a throwback to balanced ripeness, weight and well-applied oak. Drink through 2027.
Name: Altocedro 2015 Reserva Malbec (Uco Valley)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Left on skins for 35 days and aged in 40% new French oak, this wine is perfumed, with plum, mulberry, green herb, clove, orange peel, scorched earth and exotic spice notes. The flavors are deep and layered, with spice notes speckled throughout. The balance is exquisite and the finish long. A stunning example of the variety.
Name: Latta 2014 Northridge Vineyard Malbec (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Valle de Uco, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Even in a difficult vintage like 2015, this Malbec is typically toasty and full up front, with mocha and coffee aromas. A saturated palate benefits from a blast of lemony acidity, while flavors of raisin, mocha and coffee match the nose. Baked berry flavors find a cushioned landing on full, intense finish. Drink through 2026.
Name: Viña Cobos 2015 Bramare Malbec (Valle de Uco)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: A smooth aroma of fully ripe blackberry comes with notes of cola and smoke. This is giant, but mostly in balance. Baked, spicy flavors of blackberry come with a lot of oak, while coffee and lightly herbal berry tones carry the finish. Drink through 2020.
Designation: Don Nicanor Single Vineyard Villa Blanca
Name: Nieto Senetiner 2013 Don Nicanor Single Vineyard Villa Blanca Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

Description: Blackened aromas of road tar and cherry are softened by oaky notes of popcorn, butter and leather. This is a tight wine, with a palate feel akin to a door slamming shut. Savory, saucy berry and plum flavors stay that way on the finish. Drink through 2024.
Name: TintoNegro 2015 Finca La Escuela El Limo Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Ripe aromas of blackberry drift towards raisin and animal fur. This is immensely full in body, with ripping tartaric acidity. Flavors of coconut and vanilla are oak based, while blackberry fruit finishes bold, but with a reverb of choppy tartaric acidity. Drink through 2022.
Name: Clos d'Argentine 2014 Winemaker's Selection Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Aromas of jammy blueberry and graphite are reduced but solid. This Malbec has a wide palate that's wall to wall with fruit and tannins. Familiar flavors of plum and berry fruits finish with oak spice, cocoa and leftover red-plum notes. Drink through 2020.
Name: Casa Natal 2013 Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Aromas of desiccated black fruits start with blackberry and air out in the direction of raisin. A huge palate is massively tannic, while this tastes of dried plum, cassis and tobacco. Severe tannins make for a rubbing finish. Drink through 2021.
Name: Ruca Malen 2013 Kinien Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Dark, inky aromas of blackberry, graphite and mocha get things going. This Malbec is full, thick and resiny in feel, with overt oak. Flavors of chocolaty oak, mocha and berry fruits finish round and beefy.
Name: Sur de los Andes 2014 Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Toasty blackberry aromas are linear and secure, but fairly basic for quality Malbec. A plump grabby palate is restrained by rubbery tannins, while this tastes of roasted blackberry with a caramel note.
Name: Finca Decero 2015 Malbec (Agrelo)

Description: Earthy, slightly damp black-plum and black-currant aromas include notes of tobacco and graphite. A round plump cushioned palate is toughened by slightly rough tannins. Blackberry, dark plum, coffee and toasted flavors finish with spicy notes of black pepper.
Name: Calamaco 2014 Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Ripe cassis aromas push up against prune and raisin. A full palate is bold and generous, but also displaying tartaric acid. Fully oaked blackberry fruit smells a touch cheesy and of vanilla, while this is pudgy and oozing ripeness on the finish.
Name: SoloContigo 2015 Affaire Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: A bullish nose is charred, minty and delivers heavy blackberry aromas. This is a massive Malbec with weight issues: It's rather flabby, but with biting tannins. Stewed blackberry and chocolate flavors finish with notes of fig and raisin.
Name: Terrazas de Los Andes 2013 Single Vineyard Las Compuertas Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: This Malbec from a difficult vintage is a success. Plum and dark berry aromas are ripe and dry. The palate is flush, while ripe berry and black-plum flavors dry out on the finish.
Name: Zuccardi 2016 Serie A Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: A concentrated and powerful brew of earthy, roasted berry and plum aromas includes a hint of burnt rubber. This feels thick and blocky, with only modest acidity. Stewy berry flavors come with herbal underpinnings, while this tastes baked on the finish.
Name: El Esteco 2014 Malbec (Calchaquí Valley)

Description: Initial graham cracker aromas transition to smoked meat, black olive and leather while never suggesting much fruit. This is smooth but thick on the palate. Savory flavors of herbal tea and black fruits are plodding on a meaty dense finish.
Name: Estancia Los Cardones 2015 Tigerstone Malbec (Salta)

Description: Unconventional aromas of beef jerky, ham, rubber, mint and reedy plum lead to a palate with tannins like nails. Minty berry flavors are slightly green and suggestive of grape skins, while an unyielding finish just won't give.
Name: Manos Negras 2015 Artesano Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Red Hills, Lake County, California, US
Description: A rich pink color, plenty of plum and raspberry flavors and a smooth mouthfeel make this full-bodied wine satisfying to sip. It is very well polished in texture, has good fruit concentration and fine balance.
Name: Boatique 2017 Rosé of Malbec (Red Hills)

Appellation: Valle de Uco, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Broad berry and plum aromas are oaky and spicy, but also a touch grassy. A crisp palate is high in acidity, like biting into a red apple. Racy plum and berry flavors are stern on a finish with bright but forceful acidity.
Name: François Lurton 2016 Piedra Negra Reserve Malbec (Valle de Uco)

Description: Black plum and berry aromas include hints of clove and nutmeg. This Malbec is jammy in feel, while the flavors are of dark but generic berry fruits. A solid finish is plump and medium long, but not tannic or intense.
Name: La Posta 2016 Pizzella Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Fruit-forward aromas of plums, blueberries, clove and dried herbs lead to soft, plump fruit flavors in this wine. Coffee and raspberry notes linger on the finish, providing a lot of appeal.
Name: Columbia Winery 2015 Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Crisp toasty blackberry aromas suggest good things to come. A vibrant palate is bouncy and jumpy with acidity. Roasted berry flavors break down a bit before finishing meaty and gamy.
Name: Bodega Catena Zapata 2015 High Mountain Vines Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Ripe grapy aromas are full and slightly raisiny. This lusty Malbec is a touch stewed on the palate, but holds it together. Savory saucy plum and berry flavors finish mellow, bulky and with an herbal leafy note.
Name: Casir Dos Santos 2014 Reserve Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Blackberry and spice-cake aromas announce a largely ripe Malbec. Mild astringency from rubbery tannins is tolerable, while this tastes of toasty berry fruits with herbal hints. Dry tannins anchor this Malbec that's honest and doesn't overreach.
Name: Bodega Norton 2015 Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Woody berry and cassis aromas come with a hint of graphite. This Malbec feels full and solid, with rubbery tannins. Savory, gamy red-plum and wood-spice flavors finish dry and with a hint of oaky clove.
Name: Terrazas de Los Andes 2016 Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Ripe aromas of prune and raisin are almost overripe. This is jammy with a soft structure. Berry fruit, baking spices and herbal notes make up the flavors on this thick-bodied Malbec that's best when taken as a whole.
Name: Antis 2015 Antis Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Despite what seems like a touch of volatility, this Malbec locks in on black-fruit aromas with a pinch of rubber. A pulpy palate is healthy, while this tastes of berry fruits and dark plum prior to a finish with modest intensity and drive.
Name: Chakana 2016 Maipe Reserve Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Ripe berry aromas suggest raisin and marzipan. Following those aromas, this feels jammy and soft, with barely any edge. Cassis and berry flavors finish with notes of cola, spice and raisin.
Name: Mendel 2016 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: A bold purple color and black-fruit aromas form the opening of this saturated Malbec. A high-energy palate is driven by acidity, while this is full of ripe blackberry flavors. Mild heat accompanies a grip of tannins on the finish.
Name: Zuccardi 2017 Serie A Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Smoky, savory aromas of oak, root beer and plum are encouraging. This Malbec is full but soft and jammy in feel. Savory black-fruit flavors are herbal and spicy, while this is chunky on a finish with gaps.
Name: Argento 2014 Reserva Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: Woody berry and cassis aromas are appealing yet the palate feels wiry and tannic. Stewy, lightly baked berry and raisin flavors finish with chocolaty oak notes along with lasting hints of prune.
Name: Bodega Catena Zapata 2016 High Mountain Vines Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Made from Malbec grapes, this wine has a light peachy amber color, aromas like apricot skin and very dry, bracing and tart flavors. It's quite lean, restrained and tangy and needs an audience that values those qualities.
Name: Atrea 2017 Skid Rosé of Malbec (Mendocino County)

Description: Leafy berry and plum notes suffer slightly from a vinegar-like side note. This is soupy and chunky in feel. Flavors of gamy, rubbery plum and blackberry finish with overt oak and some heat.
Name: Solo Contigo 2014 Primera Amante Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Incongruous aromas of tomato sauce, pepperoni and jammy raspberry are challenging while leading to a tight palate with drying tannins and loud acidity. Spicy peppery red-plum flavors pull inward on a high-acid finish.
Name: Monteviejo 2016 Festivo Malbec (Uco Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine's aromas are locked up on first pour, revealing high-toned plum, blackberry, herb, licorice and spice notes as it opens. Its blue and purple fruit flavors are light and framed by gritty tannins.
Name: Swiftwater Cellars 2015 Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Floral plum and currant aromas fall somewhere between fruity and raw. This Malbec from a cold and rainy vintage feels lean and edgy. Red berry and currant flavors are light on a finish driven by acidity.
Name: TintoNegro 2016 Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: Rubbery black-plum and black-currant aromas lead to a plump palate that's light on structure and grip. Jammy plum and blackberry flavors are good in a generic sort of way. A round finish fades away without intensity.
Name: Finca la Celia 2016 Pioneer Malbec (Uco Valley)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Roasted sweet plums, campfire smoke and balsamic reduction aromas show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is a tad disjointed, with dried fruit flavors and a zesty acidity.
Name: Buttonwood 2015 Malbec (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: Spicy blackberry aromas are dry and not overly effusive. A firm palate with drying tannins delivers flavors of oak spice and smoked meat along with solid berry fruit. Overall, this is competent and a touch gamy.
Name: Gaucho 2016 Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: Stalky berry aromas smell like hot pavement more than ripe fruit. This feels full but soft, with minimal structure. Foxy, oaky, herbaceous berry flavors dictate the terms of this Malbec from a cold and rainy year.
Name: Tomero 2016 Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: Gritty berry aromas show hints of animal and latex. In the mouth, this is solid and firm, with a medium-plus body. Peppery berry flavors are a tad herbal, while burnt and roasted notes come up on the finish.
Name: Bodega Calle 2015 Alberti 154 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Smoky, rubbery blackberry aromas yield to oaky clove. This is tight and wiry in feel, without much padding. Quick-striking red-berry flavors are herbal and peppery, while this is tannic like rubber bands on the finish.
Name: Ernesto Catena 2015 Tahuan Siesta en el Tahuantinsuyu Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Berry and plum aromas are rubbery and hint at wood smoke. On the palate, this is hefty but short on stuffing and structure. Gritty flavors of stalky berry fruits are low on ripeness, while this is spicy in flavor but also dry and tannic on the finish.
Name: Fincas Don Martino 2016 Old Vine Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Dark cherry aromas come with a note of grassy clover. A full palate is saucy and sticky, while plum and berry flavors are spicy but heavy. This is a ripe thick wine that's more good than problematic.
Name: Antigal 2015 Uno Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Reedy berry aromas show mild clove and spice notes. This is drawn down and pinchy on the palate. Salty plum and tomato flavors are backed by a finish that's rubbery in texture. As a whole, this is basic Malbec.
Name: Bodega Cuarto Dominio 2016 Lote 44 Vineyard Selection Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: San Diego County, South Coast, California, US
Description: Concord grape jelly, wisteria, candied violets and a hint of dank herbs show on the extremely powerful nose of this bottling, which is impressive simply for aromatic explosiveness. The palate shows roasted herbs and tangy fruit flavors.
Name: Hungry Hawk 2016 Hill Springs Malbec (San Diego County)

Description: Raspberry and plum aromas are kind of furry and gamy. A chunky palate has rubbery tannins, while this tastes of herbal cherry and plum fruit. A touch of chocolate is found on a medicinal finish.
Name: Tapiz 2016 Made With Organic Grapes Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Earthy, gritty berry and plum aromas are reedy and just ripe enough. This Malbec is plump but inexact on the palate. Herbal berry and plum flavors lack purity and intensity.
Name: Tercos 2016 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Roasted plum and berry aromas are rubbery. There's heft and body to this Malbec, which tastes of savory plum that's just ripe enough. On that same theme, the finish is slightly herbal, with a hint of rubber.
Designation: Gaucho Select Sustainably Farmed Estate Grown and Bottled
Name: Zolo 2016 Gaucho Select Sustainably Farmed Estate Grown and Bottled Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Norton's Britto Series art label wine is regular stuff. Aromas of olive and rubber mean it's not exactly clean and fruity to start. A rubbery chunky body lacks a focal point, while this tastes of briny olive and barely ripe berry fruits prior to a savory finish.
Name: Bodega Norton 2015 Barrel Select Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Spicy red-berry aromas are minty and lead to a choppy palate with hard tannins. Saucy plum, tomato and herbal flavors land on a dry finish with a tomatoey reprise. Ripeness and bold fruit are not this Malbec's calling card.
Name: Notro 2016 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Light berry aromas are plain and simple. This feels crisp and acidic, with angularity. Salty plum and red-berry flavors are bright and lively on a lean finish.
Name: Ruca Malen 2016 Yauquen Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Reedy, grassy berry aromas are darn near weedy. This feels tough and raw. Minty flavors of plum and red currant are dry on a finish that's not showing much charm.
Name: Payana 2016 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Soupy plum aromas are overrun with a heavy scent of clove. In the mouth, this is resiny and sticky. A singular flavor of clove renders this more fake and forced than natural.
Name: Region 1 2016 Reserve Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Flat gummy aromas of candied berry fruits and clove don't impress. Nor does a raisiny palate with no acidity. Lifeless berry flavors finish with notes of prune and raisin.
Name: Manos Andinas 2015 Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: A cloudy color and stale aromas of earthy and gritty berry fruits is not a good opening. Nor is a palate that feels like gravy and tastes weedy, soupy and green. While not totally disastrous, there's a lot of wrong with this Malbec.
Name: Luminis 2013 Pedriel Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: From the oldest block of a dry-farmed, hillside site, this bold, beautiful red is a celebratory expression of crushed rock, dusty soil and floral teases of rose and lavender. Hearty, thick and rich in its youth, it offers a wealth of blue fruit, leather and brown sugar. The oak is integrated and the tannins are grippy yet beginning to show polish.
Name: Devil Proof 2015 Farrow Ranch Malbec (Alexander Valley)

Description: From a new dry-farmed site, this is fleshy and expansive in complex waves of flavor and texture. Mocha, coconut flakes and blueberry combine around a rich and rounded body that boasts power and grip.
Name: Devil Proof 2015 Rockpile Ridge Malbec (Rockpile)

Description: This project from Doug Shafer and Elias Fernandez continues to impress, showing the beauty of this variety in California when in the right hands. The nose offers an undeniable wealth of violet and lavender while the palate exudes smoked cherry, juicy blueberry and an underbelly of garrigue.
Name: Eighty Four 2014 Malbec (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Powerful and earthy, this rich and concentrated wine is full bodied, broad in texture and has envelope-pushing spice and leather aromas backed by well-concentrated wild-berry and plum-compote flavors of significant depth. It's seductive and lavish in character.
Name: Ruby Hill Winery 2015 Jewel Collection Series Estate Reserve Malbec (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Lovely earth, mushroom and leather aromas bring softness to this full-bodied wine. It's packed with black fruit, cola, coffee, smoke and baking spice notes, all well integrated, with impressive length and complexity.
Name: Ryan Rose 2016 Malbec (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Plentiful blueberry, plum, orange peel, potpourri, spice and herb aromas are followed by plump, fresh, palate-coating blue and purple fruit flavors in this wine. It's a textbook example of the variety and how delicious the state's renditions can be.
Name: Basalt 2014 Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Roasted blackberry and black-plum aromas meet with milk chocolate and baking spice on the nose of this bottling, which sees 21% new oak. The flavors are broad and rich with violets, black currants and blueberries, framed by strong tannins and a persistent deep acidity.
Name: Derby 2014 Derby Vineyard Malbec (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine is generously rich in red and blue berry, a density of fruit that is nicely contrasted against waves of peppery spice and leather. The oak is present yet polished alongside lengthy tannins and a lasting earthiness of sweet compost.
Name: Kokomo 2016 Malbec (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Fair Play, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: More than just fruity, this intense and concentrated wine is deep and dark in color, smells like wood smoke and black pepper and tastes like blackberries, anise and dark chocolate. It is full-bodied and firmly tannic in texture to pair well with the richest roast or steak.
Name: Obscurity 2015 Estate Geoff & Katy Vineyard Malbec (Fair Play)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: This is a sturdy, well-balanced and firmly structured wine that will pair nicely with birds and beef. It has enticing, light, toasted oak aromas, tasty black-cherry and blackberry flavors and an appetizing, moderately tannic texture.
Name: Writer's Block 2015 Malbec (Lake County)

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Blackberry, roasted coffee and spicy white-pepper aromas play on the nose of this Malbec, a strong performer in this region. There is strong tannic tension to the sip and loads of acidity, which carry flavors of boysenberry juice, spice cake, herbs and espresso.
Name: Jason-Stephens 2014 Malbec (Santa Clara Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This wine's impressive nose suggests mixed berries and plums, with minty chocolate highlights. It's smooth and supple, with satiny raspberry, blueberry and black cherry fruit. Lovely and seamless, it finishes with just a hint of toast.
Name: Silvan Ridge 2016 Malbec (Rogue Valley)

Description: Herbal in cedar, wood and a thick concentration of blueberry and dark cherry, this is a fruity and likable wine that finishes in a dollop of milk chocolate.
Name: V. Sattui 2015 Malbec (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: This wine's bright plum, vanilla and barrel spice aromas lead to persistent, palate-coating fruit flavors. It's a full-bore, enjoyable interpretation of this variety that shows some warmth on the finish.
Name: Castillo de Feliciana 2015 Estate Malbec (Walla Walla Valley (OR))

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: There's lovely fruit here, reminiscent of blackberries, loganberries, cherries and raspberries, along with some scents of overripe fruit. Drinking more mature than other recent vintages, it's light at first, opening into citrus highlights. It includes 12% Cabernet Sauvignon and 4% Merlot and was aged in 40% new oak.
Name: RoxyAnn 2013 Malbec (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine's barrel aromas are up-front, with vanilla, anise, cocoa and baking spice notes obscuring its dark fruit and varietal character. It's medium bodied and enjoyable, with a smooth finish.
Name: Obelisco Estate 2014 Malbec (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This young, peppery wine has compact purple fruit, moderate acidity and a spicy kick. Aged in 18% new French oak, it's still pulling itself together. Drink from 2020.
Name: 2Hawk 2016 Malbec (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This sports toasty aromas that enwrap its supple strawberry and cherry fruit. Those firm fruit flavors persist on the palate, encased in plenty of barrel toast. It's a substantial, chewy, tannic wine with generous alcohol and richness.
Name: Kriselle 2015 Malbec (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Alta Mesa, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Flavorful and exuberant, this wine is very fruity in aroma and flavor. It layers ripe cherry and blackberry with milk chocolate notes, feels broad and rich on the palate and keeps emphasizing fresh black fruit all the way through the finish.
Name: Wise Villa 2015 Estate Malbec (Alta Mesa)

Description: This is a generously full-bodied and layered wine, richly tannic and leathery in texture, with lasting flavors of vanilla cola and blackberry pie.
Name: Rodney Strong 2014 Reserve Malbec (Sonoma County)

Description: Blended with 20% Merlot, this wine has an earthy funk built around brawny thick layers of blueberry and blackberry that finish soft in black pepper.
Name: Spann Vineyards 2014 Five Barrels Malbec (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This is loaded with strawberry candy flavors supported by ample acidity. With its tangy orange, tangerine and Meyer lemon highlights, it's a tasty, forward, front-loaded style to drink now.
Name: Ledger David 2015 Malbec (Rogue Valley)

Description: This wine has a deep well of black fruit flavors and a smooth, slightly tannic texture. Blackberry, cherry and a touch of black pepper flood the palate. This is softly balanced and easy to enjoy.
Name: Barefoot NV Malbec (California)

Description: This is a gritty, grippy wine, tannic and showing a touch of herbal underbelly, with a strong sense of sweet compost and mushroomy earth.
Name: Medlock Ames 2015 Secret Ingredient Malbec (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Vanilla, baking spice, game, dried cherry, Band Aid and medicine cabinet aromas are at the fore in this wine. Light fruit and medicinal flavors follow. It doesn't come together.
Name: Arbor Crest 2015 Farrington Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Spicy berry aromas are tarry and suggest spent coffee grounds and animal hide. In the mouth, this Malbec is solid, with proper balance. Peppery, herbal berry flavors are wild and earthy, while this is hot and spicy on a finish that's not timid.
Name: Luminis 2013 Allamand Altamira Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Earthy, leafy plum aromas come with leather and graphite notes. Proper balance and a good structure give this Malbec the right kind of mouthfeel. Earthy berry flavors are a bit roasted and oaky, with coffee and chocolate accents that carry over to a finish with heat.
Name: Familia Cassone 2013 Obra Prima Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Earthy berry aromas come with hints of baked beans, graphite and toasty oak. An extracted palate features hard tannins and syrupy weight. Flavors of chocolate, sweet Sherry and oak land on clove and spice on the finish.
Name: Valle Austral 2013 Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A blend of fruit from Klipsun and Angela's vineyards aged in 17% new French oak, cherry, black raspberry, baking spice, anise and dark fruit aromas are followed by focused dark-fruit flavors with a citrusy finish. The tannins give a gentle squeeze.
Name: Sparkman 2015 Preposterous Malbec (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Vin de Liqueur, France Other, France
Description: Made by adding brandy to stop fermentation, this richly structured wine is sweet yet firm with tannins. Its jammy black fruit is balanced by acidity and a dry edge. Let it age for a few months and drink from 2019.
Name: Château du Cèdre 2015 Le Cèdre Vintage Malbec (Vin de Liqueur)

Description: A deep purple color and beefy berry aromas give this Malbec up-front strength. In the mouth, this is alert due to prodding acidity. Cherry, plum and berry flavors are textbook, while this is saucy tasting on a direct finish.
Name: Andeluna 2017 1300 Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: An opaque dark-purple color and thick raisiny aromas announce a wine at maximum ripeness and saturation. On the palate, this is syrupy, with only moderate acidity. Toasty, oaky prune and blackberry flavors are peppery prior to a warm, dense finish.
Name: Lamadrid 2013 Single Vineyard Gran Reserva Malbec (Agrelo)

Description: Spicy aromas of cedar, baking spice and green peppercorn hover above notes of vanilla, blackberry and blueberry on the nose. The powdery tannins are well balanced on the straightforward palate, with more notes of cedar and pepper alongside additions of leather and raspberry. The fruit is left behind on the finish but oaky tones persist with a grip of tannins.
Name: BookCliff 2015 Reserve Malbec (Colorado)

Description: Cranberry, pomegranate and black pepper aromas introduce a lush wine. Gentle tannins and well-balanced acidity add to the easy flavors of juicy red berries and vanilla speckled with peppery spice. The finish is all red fruit, with a whisper of vanilla and white pepper.
Name: The Infinite Monkey Theorem 2016 Malbec (Grand Valley)

Description: This is a curious, highly individual Malbec. The nose is briary, with sandalwood notes and a suggestion of blueberry. The palate, however, is severely ripped with acidity, such that this is borderline astringent. Flavors of plum, currant, lemon, spice and leafy herbs finish gritty due to enamel-peeling acidity.
Name: Casarena 2013 Naoki's Vineyard Malbec (Agrelo)

Description: Berry and plum aromas come with a roasted side note. A crisp ringing finish is a bit shearing and acidic, while this tastes of spicy, peppery plum and berry fruits. A tight finish with chalky grip helps this end on a positive note.
Name: El Ganador 2017 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Red-fruit aromas are dry and fresh, with a hint of red-apple skin. A clean fresh palate is a touch choppy, while crisp berry and racy plum flavors are clean on a fast-fading finish.
Name: Andeluna 2017 Filosur Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Ripe berry aromas are a touch raisiny and chocolaty. This mostly feels like it smells: full and ripe. Blackberry, prune and chocolate flavors finish chewy and slightly baked, with just enough acidity to make things right.
Name: Bodega Norton 2015 D.O.C. Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

Description: Aromas of tar and grilled meat run parallel to earthy berry and plum notes. This is wide but lacking in palate precision. Black cherry and baked berry flavors come with brown-sugar sweetness, while this is a touch hot and candied on the finish.
Name: Scotti Wines 2015 Grandelirio Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Horsey, slightly oxidized berry aromas and superficial oak are bettered by flavors of berry fruits, brown sugar and spice. After a lightly herbal finish dries out, this feels a bit raw and choppy.
Name: Tiza 2015 Malbec (Uco Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: With all of the fruit coming from Kestrel Vineyard, aromas of baking spice, anise, cherry, medicine cabinet and plum lead to elegantly styled fruit flavors that taper toward the finish. It's surprisingly dialed back considering the warmth of the vintage.
Name: Kestrel 2014 Winemaker's Select Series Malbec (Yakima Valley)

Description: From head to toe this is all about oak. The nose is heavily coated in clove and char, with a marshmallow undertone. On the palate, this is creamy with a palpable sense of wood grain. Spicy resiny black-fruit flavors finish with a lasting note of clove.
Name: Graffito 2015 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Black-fruit aromas are covered with marshmallow and chocolate accents. This Malbec is fleshy but soft in the middle, meaning the structure is not great. Flavors of oak-driven clove and nutmeg stand out more than the fruit.
Name: Alpasión 2015 Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: Roasted berry aromas come with notes of road tar, while as a whole this smells a touch underripe. Hard clamping tannins suggest a wine affected by harvest rains. Salty red-plum flavors are herbal, while this is minty on the finish.
Name: Casa de Campo 2015 Reserve Malbec (Argentina)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: This is a soft take on Malbec, with gentle tannins and plenty of red plum flavors. With a crisp edge of acidity, it's open and made to drink young. No need to wait; drink now.
Name: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2016 La Réserve Malbec (Vin de France)

Description: Rubbery berry aromas smell of clove. This is creamy and kind of obtuse in shape, with a slightly gummy texture. Flavors of bacon fat, clove and berry fruits transition to spice, clove and some bitterness on the finish.
Name: Bodini 2017 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Wild berry aromas are green and jammy, with a strong hint of bramble. On the palate, this Malbec is saucy and lean. Flavors of raspberry and plum are noticeably green, and thus the finish tastes herbal.
Name: Lazos 2015 Trio Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Jammy raspberry aromas share space on the nose with horse hide and saddle leather scents. A lean juice-like palate carries almost no weight or substance, while this tastes mostly of mint, clove and generic red fruits.
Name: SoloContigo 2015 Primera Amanta Malbec (Uco Valley)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Underripe fruit aromas are oaky, and that's about all the nose has to offer. In the mouth, this Malbec is hollow yet abrasive. Murky underripe fruit has resulted in a nutty, leafy, gritty flavor profile that carries over to the finish.
Designation: La Linda Private Selection Old Vines
Name: Luigi Bosca 2015 La Linda Private Selection Old Vines Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

Description: Muted aromas of cherry NyQuil and hard candies are tempered by whispers of sweet baking spice on the nose. Thick and flat, with papery tannins, the palate shows overripe strawberry and cherry dragged down by a bitter medicinal undercurrent. The finish is clipped, with a final swipe of cough syrup.
Name: Aridus 2015 Limited Production Malbec (Arizona)

Description: Minty currant aromas are green at the core, with a note of bath soap. A candied palate lacks structure and is flimsy. Weedy berry and clove flavors end flat and sweet, with an excess of residual sugar.
Name: Layer Cake 2015 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: This wine is powerful in its depth and concentration. Bold tannins, vibrant acidity and strong minerality combine with black plum and berry flavors. This major wine obviously needs to age. Drink from 2023.
Name: Château du Cèdre 2015 GC Malbec (Cahors)

Description: This single-vineyard wine—named after the classic pigeon house located near the vines—is bold in black fruit and spice tones, with a huge, dry and tannic structure from wood aging. There is a real sense of power and great concentration, making this an ageworthy wine. Drink from 2024.
Name: Château Lagrézette 2015 Le Pigeonnier Malbec (Cahors)

Description: This wine comes from a sweet spot on gravel soil in Alain Dominique Perrin's Clos Marguerite vineyard. It has a great sense of site, with power, a dense texture, huge tannins and layers of jammy black fruit. Rich and ripe, it will age over many years. Drink from 2023.
Name: Château Lagrézette 2015 Paragon Massaut Malbec (Cahors)

Description: The 6666 refers to the number of vines per hectare in this vineyard, and the high-density planting gives great concentration to the wine. It is packed with rich black fruits, an impressive wine with restrained power, great fruitiness as well as a strong structure. This special cuvée from the Mercuès estate needs to age. Drink from 2024.
Name: Georges Vigouroux 2015 Château de Mercuès Cuvée 6666 Malbec (Cahors)

Description: This wine, from a high-density vineyard, is as concentrated as the vines themselves. It is very young, still shaking off its immense tannins and developing the bold, opulent black fruits. The wine has power as well as great fruitiness and structure. Drink from 2025.
Name: Georges Vigouroux 2016 Château de Mercuès Cuvée 6666 Malbec (Cahors)

Description: New-wood aromas lead to a wine that has plenty of wood flavors and certainly needs to soften. But the great black fruits and balanced structure will see to that. This will be an impressive, rich wine, never overpowering, very much in the measured style of this estate. Drink from 2023.
Name: Château Haut-Monplaisir 2015 Pur Plaisir Malbec (Cahors)

Description: This is the top bottling from this organic estate. An impressive wine, it boasts rich tannins, powerful fruit and dense concentration. Black fruit flavors are laced with acidity on the firmly structured palate. This wine deserves to age, so drink from 2023.
Name: Clos Troteligotte 2015 K-2 Malbec (Cahors)

Description: This third-terrace parcel in the Baldès terroir Trilogie is clay and limestone with iron and lava deposits. The wine presents a rich medley of black fruits, ripe tannins and a powerful structure. It has concentration, ripe fruit and bright acidity. Drink from 2023.
Designation: Clos Triguedina Les Selections Parcellaires Les Galets
Name: Jean-Luc Baldès 2013 Clos Triguedina Les Selections Parcellaires Les Galets Malbec (Cahors)

Description: This wine, regarded as the top wine from the Mercuès estate is massively structured, packed with dark fruits and altogether a statement wine. Produced from selected parcels on the estate, it has layers of dark tannins as well as juicy black plum and berry fruits. All of this density and concentration need to soften. Wait to drink this wine until 2024.
Name: Georges Vigouroux 2015 Château de Mercuès Icône Wow Malbec (Cahors)

Description: This dense wine is named after the gravel in the vineyard. It has intense black fruits, smoky tannins and a powerful, complex structure. The dry core is still very young and needs to come together with the peppered black-plum flavors and acidity. Give it time, it will happen. Drink from 2023.
Name: Château Vincens 2015 Les Graves de Paul Malbec (Cahors)

Description: The top wine in the range made in a joint venture between the Bertrand Vigouroux family of Cahors and Sonoma winemaker/consultant Paul Hobbs, this wine is hugely dense. It has powerful tannins along with opulent black fruits and serious concentration. Expect this wine to age for several more years. Drink from 2023.
Name: Paul Hobbs & Bertrand Gabriel Vigouroux 2014 Crocus La Roche Mère Malbec (Cahors)

Description: This wine, regarded as the top wine from the Mercuès estate is massively structured, packed with dark fruits and altogether a statement wine. Produced from selected parcels on the estate, it has layers of dark tannins as well as juicy black plum and berry fruits. All of this density and concentration need to soften. Wait to drink this wine until 2024.
Name: Georges Vigouroux 2015 Château de Mercuès Icône Wow Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Now fully mature, this is an impressive wine. It still has a firm mineral texture, while the powerful black fruits (and black color) are a sign that this is serious Malbec. This was one of the original launches of the top-of-the-range wine from the Paul Hobbs and Bertrand Vigouroux joint venture, linking Sonoma and Cahors. Drink this wine now.
Name: Paul Hobbs & Bertrand Gabriel Vigouroux 2011 Crocus Grand Vin Malbec Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Aged for two years in wood, this wine has been named after Marguerite de Massaut, a 16th-century owner of the estate. It comes from a single parcel, producing a powerful wine. The young tannins and black fruits are surprisingly elegant given the weight of the wine with juicy acidity and blackberry fruit. It needs to age, so drink from 2024.
Designation: Cuvée Dame Honneur du Château Lagrezette
Name: Château Lagrézette 2015 Cuvée Dame Honneur du Château Lagrezette Malbec (Cahors)

Description: At the western end of the Cahors appellation, this estate produces some expressive wines. This wood-aged, ripe wine with polished tannins offers elegant black fruits and acidity. It comes from a low-yielding, 12-acre parcel, aged in new wood and promising great potential. Drink this wine from 2023.
Name: Château Lamartine 2015 Expression Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Named after the 15th-century owner of the chateau, this wine comes from selected parcels of the estate. It is packed with youthful, ripe tannins that are just beginning to soften and melt into the swathes of black fruits. It is a powerful wine, although not one that is overbearing. Drink from 2023.
Designation: Château de Haute-Serre Geron Dadine de Haute-Serre
Name: Georges Vigouroux 2015 Château de Haute-Serre Geron Dadine de Haute-Serre Malbec (Cahors)

Description: This is one of Baldès Trilogie single-vineyard wines that bring out terroir-by-terrace differences. The wine shows the rich side of Malbec from a sunny red clay-limestone plot on the second terrace. It is a powerful evocation of ripe black fruits, juicy acidity and some dense, concentrated tannins, all contained in an elegant package. Drink from 2022.
Designation: Clos Triguedina Au Coin du Bois
Name: Jean-Luc Baldès 2013 Clos Triguedina Au Coin du Bois Malbec (Cahors)

Description: The luxury cuvée from this estate, this is almost black in color, dense in texture and tightly firm in structure. It's a wine for aging, showing its wood flavors after 24 months in oak. It offers big spice, black fruits and layers of tannins at the end. Drink this powerful wine from 2023.
Name: Château Famaey 2015 Cuvée X Malbec (Cahors)

Description: From vines planted in the 1970s, this wine is the top cuvée of this estate. Rich tannins, generous fruit and good acidity combine to give a powerful, wood-aged wine. It is still young, with a burst of great fruit that needs to soften. Drink this impressive wine from 2022.
Name: Domaine de Cause 2015 La Lande Cavagnac Malbec (Cahors)

Description: A well-balanced wine, this is rich with black fruits and lifted by acidity. Hints of wood aging give a smooth, generous texture while the tannins keep everything in shape and also promise aging. This elegant wine is likely to age well. Drink from 2021.
Name: Georges Vigouroux 2015 Château Pech de Jammes Malbec (Cahors)

Description: This wine is a selection from the three best parcels of the estate. As such, it is the quintessence of Malbec from the chalk soil of the plateau above Cahors. It is rich but even now still structured with firm tannins. Low yields and organically grown grapes give concentration and purity. Drink from 2021.
Name: Château les Croisille 2014 Divin Croisille Malbec (Cahors)

Description: From a single parcel of especially stony land, this is structured and full of tannins. The fruit weight will allow the structure to soften, giving a warm, rounded wine although always with a mineral edge from the terroir. Drink this elegant wine from 2022.
Name: Château de Gaudou 2015 Réserve Caillou Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Produced from old vines and aged for two years in wood, this wine is still not quite ready to drink. Black fruits shine through the firm tannins and vanilla and spice flavors, but still need time. Licorice and dusty tannins give a perfumed character. Drink this rich wine from 2022.
Name: Château Famaey 2014 Cuvée X Malbec (Cahors)

Description: A dark color and black tannins mark this estate wine from Lagrezette. It is dense, rich with its black-plum and jammy berry flavors. Wood aging shows in the spice while the alcohol does creep through in a pepper touch. But then, this wine is all about power and richness. Drink from 2023.
Name: Château Lagrézette 2015 Malbec (Cahors)

Description: From old vines, this powerful wine is impressively smooth and rich, The tannins are beautifully integrated into the dense black fruits, giving a sumptuous wine that can be drunk for its fruit and also aged. This concentrated wine will be at its best from 2021.
Designation: Pure Malbec by Pech de Jammes
Name: Georges Vigouroux 2014 Pure Malbec by Pech de Jammes Malbec (Cahors)

Description: This is one of the wines in a joint venture between Bertrand Vigouroux of Cahors and California winemaker/consultant Paul Hobbs. It is rich without ever being too firm or extracted. The fruits are right there along with vibrant acidity and plenty of room for the wine to open up. Drink from 2021.
Name: Paul Hobbs & Bertrand Gabriel Vigouroux 2014 Crocus Le Calcifère Malbec Malbec (Cahors)

Description: This is an impressive wine with rich tannins and equally ripe, full fruit. Its structure and concentration give the wine a chance to age further. Already its solid structure has softened, allowing swathes of black fruit to come forward. But for best results keep until 2020.
Name: Domaine de Cause 2014 Notre Dame des Champs Malbec (Cahors)

Description: From vines around the medieval chateau of Cénac, 600 feet above the Lot river, this wine is compelling, rich and firm. With a dense structure, it is dry as well as boasting ripe red-berry fruits and acidity. The smoky character of the wine comes from wood aging. Drink this well-structured wine from 2019.
Name: Château de Cénac 2014 Grande Réserve Château de Cénac Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Seigneur means lord of the manor, yet this is a modern, smooth style of Malbec. It's packed with fruit as much as tannins. Rich berry flavors laced with crisp acidity yield a wine that is poised and elegant. Drink from 2021.
Name: Château Lagrézette 2016 Seigneur de Grezette Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Almost black in color, this is a dense and fruit-driven wine. Powerful tannins and oak aging play a supporting role, showing the ageworthiness of the wine. Produced from the best gravelly parcels of the estate with low yields, this concentrated wine needs to age. Drink from 2022.
Name: Château Vincens 2014 Les Graves de Paul Malbec (Cahors)

Description: This bold, black-colored, black-fruit-flavored wine also offers rich tannins, layers of toasty spice and acidity. The 15 months in wood have given a ripe, full-bodied wine that will age further. Drink this powerful wine from 2022.
Name: Château Vincens 2016 Origine Malbec (Cahors)

Description: This is an open, juicy wine, full of berries backed by tannins. Produced from organically grown grapes, the wine is an immediately friendly take on Malbec, never letting the tannins stand in the way of its delicious fruit. Drink from 2020.
Name: Clos Troteligotte 2015 K-Lys Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Aged in wood, this perfumed wine with eucalyptus aromas and spice and black-fruit flavors has the potential to be well balanced, poised between berry fruits and wood flavors. It is all set for aging, so drink from 2021.
Name: Château Famaey 2015 Fût de Chêne Malbec (Cahors)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This 100% varietal wine hails from Olsen Brothers vineyard in Yakima Valley and Upland vineyard on Snipes Mountain. The aromas leap from the glass, suggesting satsuma orange peel, jasmine, green herb and plum. They lead to plush red and purple fruit flavors, with prominent satsuma peel notes on the finish. It shows delightful purity.
Name: Structure 2015 Foundation Malbec (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: As with all this winery's reds, there's substantial extract here, giving deep color, dense flavors, and chewy tannins. Its blueberry and black cherry fruit is accented by earthy mushroom notes. It makes a strong case for growing Malbec in Southern Oregon, where Tempranillo and Cabernet Franc also shine.
Name: Leah Jørgensen Cellars 2015 Crater View Vineyard Malbec (Rogue Valley)

Description: Aromas of cherry, cassis and butterscotch open into flavors of cherry, strawberry, pomegranate, violet and smoke. Strong tannins are no match for powerful fruit flavors that softly fade into a finish marked with bitter almond, flint and pomegranate.
Name: Teperberg 2014 Essence Malbec (Samson)

Description: Although this is pure Malbec, the wine is generous rather than structured. It sings of ripe tannins and warm blackberry fruits. The wine shows off the fruity side of the grape, meaning it will be ready to drink from 2019.
Name: Jean-Luc Baldès 2015 Clos Triguedina Malbec du Clos Malbec (Cahors)

Description: This wine's bold but generic set of black fruit aromas is both familiar and pleasing. It's intense and fully saturated on the palate, with focused, ripe berry flavors backed by dark, toasty power. Drink through 2022.
Name: Santa Carolina 2015 Reserva de Familia Malbec (Rapel Valley)

Description: The result of a collaboration between Sonoma-based winemaker/consultant Paul Hobbs and the Bertrand Vigouroux family in Cahors, this wine is packed with fruit, acidity and generous tannins. Without any wood aging, it is all blackberry flavors, with a crisp edge and a dry core. Drink this perfumed wine from 2019.
Name: Paul Hobbs & Bertrand Gabriel Vigouroux 2014 Crocus L'Atelier Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Violet-red in color, this wine has aromas of blackberry, violet and anise. Lush tannins and flavors of black cherry, cassis, anisette, lavender and chocolate coat the palate, eventually revealing a finish laced with bright cherry and a hint of smoke.
Name: Carmel 2014 Admon Vineyard Malbec (Galilee)

Description: This smooth, ripe wine is ready to drink, displaying a forward black fruit flavor and rich, well-integrated tannins. A lovely balance of rich fruit and tannic structure. Drink now.
Name: Château la Caminade 2014 CY Malbec (Cahors)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This leads with high toned notes of clove, toast and plum. Its full-bodied purple fruit and spice flavors are tightly wound for now, backed by firm tannins. Abundant orange peel and black pepper flavors linger on the finish.
Name: Gård 2014 Lawrence Vineyards Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Full of new-wood flavors, this is a wine that shouts. It is almost black in color, full of black fruits and with huge tannins. It might be too much although those with a yen for loud statement wines will appreciate this. Don't drink before 2024.
Name: Georges Vigouroux 2014 Château de Haute-Serre Icône Wow Malbec (Cahors)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine blends Walla Walla Valley, Wahluke Slope and Columbia Valley fruit. Its blackberry, black plum jam, herb and spice aromas are followed by ripe, hedonistic black fruit flavors and a spice- and green herb-filled finish. It's an unabashed warm vintage wine that displays both power and charm.
Name: Dusted Valley 2014 Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: From the chalk plateau high above the River Lot, this well-textured wine is packed with fruit and minerality. Its structure is dense, lifted by acidity and softened from wood aging. Still young, it will be better from 2020.
Name: Château les Croisille 2015 Calcaire Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Now becoming mature, this wine, part of a joint venture between Bertrand Vigouroux of Cahors and Sonoma winemaker/consultant Paul Hobbs, is showing dusty tannins, a tarry rich smoky character and considerable wood-aging flavors. It is perhaps less sophisticated than later vintages from this producer, boasting of the power of Cahors rather than its elegance. Drink from 2019.
Name: Paul Hobbs & Bertrand Gabriel Vigouroux 2012 Crocus Prestige Malbec Malbec (Cahors)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dark red-cherry, sweet blueberry and ripe watermelon aromas make for a very voluptuous and unique nose on this bottling. The palate is also fruity and zesty with sharp energetic acidity, showing juicy cranberry as well as baking spice on the finish. The acid should mellow soon and make for an even better wine.
Name: Le Vigne 2015 Di Domenico Malbec (Paso Robles)

Description: Aging in wood for 15 months has given this dense wine both its tannins and smokiness. The wine is dense in texture, with the potential of great black fruit once the tannins soften. Drink from 2021.
Name: Clos d'Audhuy 2015 Malbec (Cahors)

Description: This wine's spicy berry aromas are edgy and a touch feral. Severe acidity and tannins result in dryness on the palate. Those tannins amplify its spicy plum and herbal flavors. Drink through 2023.
Name: Casas del Toqui 2015 Terroir Selection Gran Reserva Malbec (Colchagua Valley)

Description: The Delmouly family has produced a rich wine, aged in wood and packed with black fruits. Its tannins are still young, as are the berry flavors, so this wine is still developing. Its firm texture will soften into a ripe wine from 2020.
Name: Domaine du Maison Neuve 2015 Elevé en Fûts de Chêne Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Soft and ripe, this wine brings out the fruity side of Malbec. The tannins are there but are embedded in the delicious ripe blackberry and spice flavors. Drink this wine now.
Name: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2014 Malbec Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Loaded with black fruit and ripe tannins, this is a full, rich wine. Dark in color and with berry and black-currant fruitiness, this concentrated wine needs to age. Drink from 2020.
Name: Château Armandière 2016 Malbec Ancestrale Malbec (Cahors)

Description: This almost black-colored wine harks back to the old wines of Cahors in its density and powerful tannins. At the same time elegance comes from the good structure, balanced acidity and poise between richness and lightness. Drink this wine from 2022.
Name: Château de Gaudou 2016 Le Sang de Ma Terre Malbec (Cahors)

Description: The entry-level wine from this estate, this is all about black-currant fruit and balanced acidity. It has the typical firm Malbec tannins but these are toned down by the bright, fruity nature of the wine. Drink this wine from 2020.
Name: Château Famaey 2015 Malbec (Cahors)

Description: This young wine is all about fruit. Juicy black-currant and berry flavors are right up front, ably backed by the crisp acidity and layer of dry tannins. It will be a deliciously fruity wine from 2019.
Name: Château Haut-Monplaisir 2016 Tradition Malbec (Cahors)

Description: This is Lagrézette's easy-drinking wine. With soft tannins and bright black fruits, it is ripe, without any oak aging. Juicy acidity and berry flavors give the wine an easy character. It will be ready to drink from late 2018.
Name: Château Lagrézette 2016 Purple The Original Malbec Malbec (Cahors)

Description: This rich blackberry and black-plum flavored wine has tannins although the ripe fruit sings. It is structured, but this never detracts from the great fruitiness of the wine. Drink from 2019.
Name: Domaine de Cause 2015 Malbec (Cahors)

Description: This wine's name celebrates the Tahitian heritage of the husband of the present owner. Balanced, it is full of dusty tannins and rich black fruits, poised between richness and elegance, with good acidity. Drink from 2019.
Name: Château Saint-Sernin 2014 Varua Maohi Mana Malbec (Cahors)

Description: This fruity, spicy entry-level wine is ripe and generously tannic. Its dry core is surrounded by juicy black fruits, ripe tannins and balanced acidity. Made to drink young, it will be ready from late 2018.
Name: Château Vincens 2016 Malbec Malbec (Cahors)

Description: This is a soft, open style of Malbec, designed for early drinking. Black fruits and soft tannins give a ripe, juicy character, lifted by final acidity. Drink now.
Name: Clos d'Audhuy 2016 Les Polissons Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Pure black fruit without any hint of wood, this wine is packed with blackberry and black-currant flavors. With crisp acidity, ripe tannins and forward fruitiness, it is ready to drink.
Name: Georges Vigouroux 2016 Pigmentum Malbec (Cahors)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Exotic spice and dried fruit aromas are followed by plump, ripe fruit flavors in this wine. It's enjoyable but seems a bit evolved for its age.
Name: Kiona 2015 Heart of the Hill Vineyard Malbec (Red Mountain)

Description: The entry-level wine from this estate, this is warm, ripe and already approachable. Tannins are well integrated into the juicy, berry fruits and crisp acidity. Drink from 2019.
Name: Château Vincens 2015 L'Instant Malbec Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Made in a style that allows for drinking young, this fruit-driven, ripe wine has generous tannins, a dry core and, most importantly, bright berry flavors. It is juicy, with a crisp edge of acidity that gives the wine a final lift. Drink from 2019.
Name: Georges Vigouroux 2016 Tradition Familale Malbec Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Clammy, spicy wild berry aromas introduce this wine. Edgy acidity frames its dark fruit, prune and chocolate flavors. It finishes with wiry acidity that reverberates across the palate, thwarting harmony.
Name: Agricola Alchemysta 2016 Parróne Grand Reserve Malbec (Cachapoal Valley)

Description: Although this carries a regional appellation, the wine is effectively Cahors Malbec. It certainly tastes like that with its black tannins, although the texture and weight of the wine are light, with acidity and a crisp aftertaste. Drink the wine from late 2018.
Name: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2016 Pyrène L'Irrésistible Magie Noire Malbec (Comté Tolosan)

Description: Produced from biodynamically grown grapes, this wine is full of open berry flavors, with a crisp edge and good acidity. It offers tannins from the structured fruit as well as a crisp, juicy aftertaste. Drink the wine from 2019.
Name: Clos Troteligotte 2017 K-Or Malbec (Cahors)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine emphasizes the variety's savory side, with garden herb, freshly peeled orange, plum and exotic spice notes. The flavors are pure and juicy.
Name: William Weaver 2013 Artist Series Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This wine is made without added sulfur, which gives the juicy black-currant fruit a slightly oxidative quality. The no-wood wine is pure black fruits, crisp with plenty of acidity that needs to soften. Drink from 2019.
Name: Domaine du Théron 2016 Mise à Nu Malbec (Cahors)

Description: This Malbec's earthy black fruit and cassis aromas are deep and stewy. The palate is ribbed with fierce tannins, and its blackened berry flavors are covered with oak. It breaks down further on the finish and tastes green.
Name: Luis Felipe Edwards 2015 LFE 900 Malbec (Colchagua Valley)

Description: This soft, fruity wine is full of black-currant and blackberry flavors. Its gentle and poised tannins result from the lightest extraction, leaving the fruit to sing. Drink this open wine now.
Name: Rigal 2016 Les Fiefs d'Anglars Malbec (Comté Tolosan)

Appellation: Ancient Lakes, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is the winery's first varietally labeled rosé. Electric pink in color, it follows its cherry and fresh herb scents with lightly spritzy, fat and off-dry fruit flavors.
Name: Latah Creek 2016 Familigia Vineyard Rosé of Malbec (Ancient Lakes)

Description: This wine is all about ripe berries with a jammy texture. Matured in amphora, it has an oxidative character that, along with the smoky fruit and the lack of acidity, has produced a curious flat, flabby character.
Name: Domaine les Roques de Cana 2014 Le Vin des Noces Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Blackberry aromas are ripe to the point that this wine is showing mildly desiccated scents of prune and raisin. A sense of full ripeness is reaffirmed on a saturated, jammy palate. Roasted flavors of blackberry and cassis finish with spice, tea and chocolate notes. Drink through 2027.
Name: Viña Cobos 2014 Bramare Zingaretti Vineyard Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: A dark, smoky nose contains an elegant note of sandalwood that graces core blackberry aromas. This is an extracted but controlled Malbec, with weight as well as balance. Toasty, oaky blackberry flavors are chocolaty, while a powerful finish with unlimited length is well balanced. Drink through 2027.
Name: Luca 2014 Nico Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Blackberry, cassis, prune and chocolate aromas make for a ripe wine. This Malbec is full in body, with bright acidity that helps keep its heart rate up. Bold blackberry, cassis, herb and spice flavors are baked and chocolaty across the finish. Overall, this is a complete package, especially for 2014, which was a cold year. Drink through 2026.
Designation: El Tomillo Estate Plot N°1 Single Vineyard
Name: Salentein 2014 El Tomillo Estate Plot N°1 Single Vineyard Malbec (Paraje Altamira)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Toasty, slightly gritty aromas of blackberry mixed with peppercorn, coffee and woodspice are appealing. This Malbec is lively and juicy, with elegance and depth to the palate. Chocolaty, spicy oak sits on top of blackberry and cassis flavors. It's woody, spicy and dry on a firm finish. Drink through 2026.
Name: Trivento 2014 Eolo Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

Description: Ripe, heady aromas of prune, raisin, cassis and fig paste are not uncommon for this massive Malbec. A huge palate is bolstered by tartaric acidity. Ultraripe flavors of blackberry, cassis and toast are surrounded by chocolaty oak, while this wine is chunky as can be on a ripe, lush finish. Drink through 2023.
Name: Viña Cobos 2014 Cobos Marchiori Vineyard Malbec (Perdriel)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Ripe blackberry and cassis aromas hint at raisin. A saturated palate is creamy and rich, with just enough acidic kick to supply energy. Baked black-plum and blackberry flavors include mocha and oak notes, while a rich, chocolaty finish cements the wine's full-fledged status. Considering that 2014 was a cool, tough year, this Malbec excels. Drink through 2026.
Name: Viña Cobos 2014 Bramare Touza Vineyard Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

Description: Intensity and purity of fruit are virtues on an otherwise smoky nose with full ripeness. This wine is strong on the palate, with enlivening acidity. Peppery, chocolaty berry and cassis flavors finish dark, toasty and spicy, with some heat. Drink this bold Malbec through 2026.
Name: SignoSeis 2014 The Angel Oak Reserva Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: Ripe blackberry, raisin, rubber and woodspice aromas are huge but not overly rich. This blend of Malbecs from multiple vineyards is firm and potent, with a palate that doesn't give. Oaky plum and berry flavors are bold, while this wine finishes tough, with chewy tannins. Drink through 2025.
Name: Tikal 2014 Amorío Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Pure blackberry aromas are lifted by dark chocolate and mint on the nose of this reserve bottling from a historic wine-growing region south of Hollister. There's a sweet touch at first to the palate, but then gravelly tannins and zesty acidity delivers flavors of black plum, elderberry jam and tarragon. It is still quite young, and will improve in the cellar.
Name: Donati Family Vineyard 2014 Family Reserve Malbec (Paicines)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A broad black currant aroma leads the way on the nose of this bottling, of which just 17 cases were made. There is impressive density to the palate and a creamy mouthfeel, with flavors of black plum jam and peppery spice, with acidity that races into the finish.
Name: TW Ferm Co. 2014 Malbec (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: An pronounced earthy quality to the nose sends this wine towards leafy and stewed. A saturated palate could benefit from more acidic lift, while this tastes of roasted beet, spicy berry fruits and tea. A flat-feeling, rooty-tasting finish doesn't offer a ton of carry over or length. Drink through 2020.
Name: Viña Cobos 2014 Bramare Marchiori Vineyard Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

Description: Berry and cassis aromas are fruity and just complex enough. This wine is grapy and bursting with fruit, but with mild tannins. Plum and cherry flavors are not too extracted or dark, while this wine is wiry in feel, with tartaric acidity sticking out on the finish.
Name: Finca Flichman 2014 Dedicado Gran Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: A dense ruby color and hefty balsamic aromas of maple and woodsy black fruits set up a saturated palate that's sticky and oaky. Overly generous oak is a theme that's maintained on a thick palate with blackberry, caramel, wood resin and syrupy flavors.
Name: Valentín Bianchi 2014 Particular Malbec

Description: Jammy black-fruit aromas are accompanied by Christmas spice and clove scents. This Malbec is saturated and heavy, with a jammy composition. Blackberry, chocolate and fig flavors collapse a bit on a rich, oaky finish.
Name: Tapiz 2015 Alta Collection Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: Raisiny aromas are ripe but also flat and gummy. On the palate, this is weighty, with creamy, oaky flavors of raisiny berry fruits. Overall, balance and overripeness are issues on an otherwise enjoyable Malbec.
Name: Famiglia Meschini 2014 Gran Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Earthy berry aromas are dense and suggest allspice. This Malbec is fairly bumpy and choppy in feel, while roasted blackberry flavors are oaky in front of a savory, woody finish that's coarse due to pounding tannins.
Name: Andeluna 2014 Altitud Malbec (Tupungato)

Description: Prior to airing, this shows briny, almost volatile notes of foxy berry fruits and plum along with a hint of aged cheese. A full-bodied palate is chunky and a bit clumsy, while flavors of licorice, beef jerky and blackberry finish spicy and oaky, but short.
Name: Finca Flichman 2015 Gran Caballero de la Cepa Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: Soft aromas of pink rose petal, strawberry, watermelon and zesty grapefruit skin show on the nose of this rosé. The palate is very approachable and easy-to-like, with candied strawberry and raspberry flavors as well as watermelon juice, cut by just enough acidity. It's definitely a crowd-pleaser.
Name: Orange Coast WInery 2016 Rosé of Malbec (California)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Ripe blackberry and toasty oak aromas are clean but not complex. Pointy, choppy tannins make for a rougher than expected palate, while this wine tastes of oaky black plum and blackberry. Ripe flavors of raisin and chocolate control a tannic finish.
Name: Trivento 2015 Golden Reserve Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

Description: Woodsy blackberry and cassis aromas are robust and typical of Argentinean Malbec. This wine has a wiry, screechy palate with bold acidity, while herbal plum and woodsy spice flavors suggest clove. A full, loud finish is fitting.
Name: La Posta 2016 Fazzio Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: A dense nose with aromas of maple, animal fur and stewed berry fruits is full but not terribly fresh. Grabby tannins weigh down a saturated palate, while baked berry and chocolate flavors finish jammy. This wine is full and ripe but soft and lacking in structure.
Name: Lamadrid 2015 Single Vineyard Reserva Malbec (Agrelo)

Description: A black color and heavy gaseous aromas of brandied cherry and overripe black currant announce a sticky, syrupy wine that lacks energy. Baked, stewy black-fruit flavors ride along a flat plane on a finish with coffee and charred notes.
Name: Nieto Senetiner 2015 Don Nicanor Barrel Select Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Minty blackberry, plum and chocolate aromas are solid. This Malbec feels sticky, with a kick of acidity. Flavors of resiny oak, chocolate and herbal berry fruits end with minty notes of green herbs along with a touch of residual chocolaty oak.
Name: La Posta 2016 Paulucci Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A blend of Tudor Hills and Gunkel vineyards, this wine shows pleasing aromas of black plum, herb and spice, followed by ripe, full fruit flavors and a lot of barrel accents. There are good things going on but it finishes a touch bitter.
Name: Maryhill 2014 Proprietor's Reserve Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Herbal berry aromas are spunky and foxy. This Malbec feels tight and honest, with a shot of bracing acidity. Herbal plum and berry flavors are a bit woody, which results in a chocolaty finish with a note of black tea.
Name: Finca Flichman 2016 Caballero de la Cepa Reserva Malbec (Uco Valley)

Appellation: Malibu Coast, South Coast, California, US
Description: Primary aromas of Concord grape, grape seed and charred wood kick off the nose on this bottling, which is bolstered by 7% Cabernet Sauvignon and 4% Merlot. The palate is clean but simple, with grape, cola, cocoa and cappuccino flavors.
Name: Malibu Ridge 2014 Malbec (Malibu Coast)

Description: Raw aromas of road tar and tomato leaf dominate the nose on this organic Malbec. On the palate, this is loud, with tomatoey acidity and chewy, grinding tannins. Heavy oak and saucy berry flavors create a soupy flavor profile that's backed by a woody finish.
Name: Caligiore 2014 Nature's Legacy Organic Single Vineyard Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Bright aromas of candied plum, herb and baking spice are followed by plentiful ripe plum and black currant flavors.
Name: Waterbrook 2016 Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Spicy plum and raspberry aromas are on the hot side. This wine feels racy but mostly standard, with a medium body. Plum and berry flavors are a touch green, and it finishes with heat, crispness and spicy red-berry notes.
Name: Cholila Ranch 2016 Malbec (Patagonia)

Description: You don't see Malbec in New Zealand often. This one, from the renowned soils of Hawke's Bay's Gimblett Gravels, exemplifies many typical characters of the variety: It's inky black in color with ripe, slightly soapy plum and blackberry notes along with plenty of vanillin oak. The medium-bodied palate is plump and fruity, with soft tannins and an easy-going quality that makes this a decent contender against Argentine counterparts.
Name: Decibel 2016 Gimblett Gravels Malbec (Hawke's Bay)

Appellation: Rattlesnake Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine brings unusual aromas of freshly chopped parsley, orange twist, plum and hickory smoke. The palate is light, fresh and tart, bringing a sense of elegance. Floral notes linger on the finish.
Name: Roza Ridge 2015 Malbec (Rattlesnake Hills)

Description: Ripe berry aromas are oaky, with raisiny notes. A big, broad palate is obtuse and tannic. This wine tastes mostly of oak, char and toast, with black-fruit notes lurking below deck. A wide, tannic, scratchy finish suggests burnt toast.
Name: Ruta 22 2017 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: A deep purple color and foxy, grapy aromas form the greeting on this everyday Malbec. In the mouth, it's somewhat wiry and choppy. Plum and berry flavors are simple and forward, with an herbal note.
Name: Santa Julia 2017 [+] Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: The aromas bring unusual, not entirely harmonious notes of white pepper, citrus twist, green herb and spice. The flavors are quite light and elegant, with an attenuated finish. It doesn't have the stuffing to stand it up.
Name: Sawtooth 2015 Classic Fly Series Malbec

Description: Aromas of plum, vanilla, black pepper and barrel spice lead to light citrus and cherry flavors. It provides intrigue but is not entirely successful.
Name: Ste. Chapelle 2015 Panoramic Idaho Malbec

Description: Fairly dark, roasted berry aromas are more subdued than over the top. This Malbec has energy on the palate, while saucy flavors of plum and berry are just ripe enough. A wiry finish is raw in feel but gets the job done.
Name: Antis 2016 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Dark, charred aromas of burnt wood, shoe polish and inky black fruits set up a wiry, chewy palate that's more rough than lush and easy. Clear and present flavors of burnt wood and clove are more prominent than berry fruit, while this is breaks up on a tannic finish.
Name: François Lurton 2017 Piedra Negra Alta Coleccion Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Baking spice, green herbs, tire rubber, vanilla and slightly dried out blue fruit aromas lead to lighter styled flavors that seem very woody. It doesn't all come together on the palate.
Name: Basel Cellars 2015 Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Earthy berry aromas are candied and show a note of animal hide. This Malbec is snappy and lean in body. Briny, leathery plum flavors work hard to stay in form on the finish.
Name: Bodega Toneles 2016 Tonel 14 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Stable plum and berry aromas are a bit spicy. This wine feels wiry, snappy and generic. Lightly herbal plum and berry aromas don't have much to say, and it tastes briny on the finish.
Name: Chakana 2016 Maipe Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Leathery aromas suggest animal hide; otherwise, this smells of lean plum and berry fruits. This Malbec is simple, with thin berry and plum flavors that are slightly oaky in front of a snappy finish with lingering green notes.
Name: Pascual Toso 2016 Estate Bottled Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Pointy red-berry aromas are minty, reedy and wiry. This lean, snappy Malbec is more than fresh on the palate, while lean, spicy red-plum flavors register as slightly weedy and green. A juicy finish maintains the wine's lean, green style.
Name: Region 1 2016 Malbec (Argentina)

Description: Earthy aromas of coffee grounds and berry fruits are fiery and grassy. This Malbec is chunky and blocky in feel, with grabby tannins. Saucy berry flavors are oaky and a bit green, while it tastes largely of resiny oak on the finish.
Name: Quara 2017 Estate Malbec (Cafayate)

Description: A light color and weedy aromas of candied berry fruits are unappealing. This wine feels raw and closed, with no depth. Grassy plum flavors are bland, while this tastes odd and artificial on the finish.
Name: Cruz Alta 2017 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Weedy aromas of green fruits are jumbled and messy. High acidity creates a raw, almost caustic palate. A lead flavor of oaky clove seems forced and fake, while the rest of this Malbec is tart, with touches of red currant and plum.
Name: Restivo 2016 Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This sappy, sensational effort is bursting with an ultraripe flavor of crushed blueberry. Dusty tannins and a sprinkling of coffee grounds amplify the finish, with excellent texture and length, ending on a flourish of butterfat.
Name: Abacela 2014 Reserve East Hill Block Malbec (Umpqua Valley)

Description: This six-acre Malbec vineyard is one of a handful planted in Bourg and Blaye where the grape now ripens more easily than in the past. This Bordeaux view of the grape is rich, with warm tannins and black fruit along with acidity and spice. This powerful, ripe wine from Tutiac's single-variety, single-parcel range should age, so drink from 2020.
Name: Les Vignerons de Tutiac 2015 Lieu-Dit Ter Pointe  (Côtes de Bourg)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Malbec shines in Southern Oregon. Here it's given 16 months in new French oak, emerging supple with tangy berry and pie cherry fruit. Suggestions of citrus juice come with balancing acidity. Tannins are ripe, substantial and lightly earthy, with a hint of coffee.
Name: 2Hawk 2015 Malbec (Rogue Valley)

Description: Plummy blueberry, black cherry and black currant wrap around a softly layered core of toasted oak in this light and delicate take on the oft-hearty variety. Smatterings of vanilla and dark chocolate tease on the finish.
Name: Judge Palmer 2014 Blau Vineyard Malbec (Knights Valley)

Description: Made by proprietor Anna Monticelli, who also makes the Pina Napa Valley wines, this is a robust hearty vineyard-designate made in tiny numbers. With 5% Cabernet Sauvignon blended in, it offers earthy tannin and a soft muscular texture of lightly spiced oak and dark chocolate cherry.
Name: Sergio 2014 Dr. Reid Vineyard Malbec (Napa Valley)

Description: Inky red violet to the eye, this wine offers a bouquet of black cherry and anise. It is smooth on the palate, with flavors of bramble fruit, black plum, fennel bulb and black pepper. The tannins are soft, dropping off before the cherry and anisette finish.
Name: Golan Heights Winery 2014 Yarden Malbec (Galilee)
