Description: This wine exhibits hearty oak and ripe black cherry, cranberry and plum. Blended with 15% Cabernet Sauvignon, its grapes from Coombsville primarily, it's high-strung in supportive acidity and dried herb and tobacco.
Name: Ilaria 2014 Malbec (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas lean into the green, with notes of savory garden herb along with dark raspberry and plum. The plum flavors are plump with a lightly scratchy feel to the tannins. There's intrigue but it seems a bit underripe and leafy.
Name: J & J 2015 Summit View/Les Collines Vineyard Malbec (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: This is hugely tannic, nearly impenetrable wine, hard to break through, a mix of pencil lead, tobacco leaf and dried herb that presents as bittersweet and a touch green.
Name: Patland 2014 Terra Del Cuore Estate Grown Malbec (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Red Hills, Lake County, California, US
Description: Combining hyper-concentrated fruit flavors with enticing, sophisticated oak nuances, this wine is a gentle giant. The first thing to notice is the lightly spicy, toasted-baguette aroma, and then the palate floods with saturated, ripe and delicious blackberry and black-cherry flavors, while notes of dark chocolate and black pepper kick in on the finish. This wine ranks with the best yet from Lake County. Best after 2020.
Name: Cinnabar 2014 Malbec (Red Hills)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Very ripe and concentrated, this full-bodied wine has powerful fruit flavors, a big impact on the palate and very firm tannins to hold it together. The color is very deep, the aromas are like ripe blackberries dusted with cinnamon and cedar, and the flavors go deep and long, lingering on the finish.
Name: Everhart Cellars 2014 Dorado Canyon Vineyard Malbec (El Dorado)

Description: The aromas erupt from the glass, with notes of potpourri, orange peel, moist earth, stem and garden herb. The palate shows a pleasing mix of earth and savory flavors that deliver a lot of elegance and intertwine effortlessly through the finish. The variety seems a bit hard to find but the expression is quite intriguing.
Name: Charles Smith 2014 Broncho Stoneridge Vineyard Malbec (Washington)

Appellation: Yolo County, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Great structure and vivid fruit flavors make a winning combination in this full-bodied and firmly tannic wine. Powerful but well polished, it has blackberry and dark chocolate flavors, a solid, grippy texture and is nicely dry.
Name: Black's Station 2015 Malbec (Yolo County)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine smells just like blackberry jam, and tastes wonderfully rich, fruity and full. It has a very deep purple-black color, expressive dark fruit aromas and ripe, almost-sweet, flavors that spread across the palate and linger on the finish.
Name: Naggiar 2016 Estate Grown Malbec (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of baking spice, vanilla, coconut and cherry are followed by well-proportioned fruit and barrel flavors. Cocoa notes linger on the finish. It hits a lot of high marks, though the variety seems a bit hard to find.
Name: Nodland 2014 Malbec (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Single-vineyard Malbec is a rarity from this appellation. This one, which is 100% varietal, offers aromas of fresh and dried green herb along with clove, as the fruit lurks in the background. The palate brings ripe but in-balance purple-fruit flavors that show a sense of elegance. It's a pretty interpretation of this variety.
Name: Mustard Seed 2014 Cockburn Vineyard Malbec (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: This bottling, which includes 12% Merlot, 5% Cabernet Franc and 3% Cabernet Sauvignon, shows bright raspberry and pomegranate fruit as well as crushed slate and dried earth. The palate is fresh and light with cranberry and boysenberry flavors.
Name: Avensole 2014 Malbec (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Blended with 21% Cabernet Sauvignon, the aromas bring pleasing notes of plum, green herb and baking spice. The flavors show a sense of elegance, painting around the edges, with the middle a bit lacking. It finishes with a tart kick.
Name: Wind Rose 2015 Lonesome Springs Ranch Malbec (Yakima Valley)

Description: This is an oaky, smoky wine, with a full body and firm tannins. It smells like wood smoke and black pepper, tastes like smoked brisket and has an oaky sharpness in the texture.
Name: Scotto Family Cellars 2013 Malbec (Lodi)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of blackberry, dark plum, barrel spice and plum lead to super-soft-feeling fruit and barrel flavors that show a pretty styling. It comes up a bit short on the finish.
Name: Gamache 2013 Estate Grown Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of sweet herb, cherry and barrel spice are followed by pitch-black-fruit flavors that work around the edges, with a tart citrus filled finish that falls a bit short. The tannins bring a bit of grit.
Name: Airfield Estates 2015 Malbec (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of vanilla, baking spice and plum are followed by ripe but quite light cherry flavors. The tannins bring a slight sense of astringency that seems at odds with the variety.
Name: Mercer 2015 Malbec (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Hailing from Antoine Creek Vineyard, the aromas of herb, cherry and spice seem to show some oxidation. Meanwhile, the medium-bodied cherry and raspberry flavors are straight down the fairway, providing enjoyment if not a lot of complexity.
Name: Rio Vista 2015 Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: If you like cassis and blackberry aromas, this Malbec offers no shortage of that. Its lush, seamless palate offers toasty blackberry and chocolate flavors that carry into a finish that's as steady as a freighter on a calm sea. Drink through 2021.
Name: SoloContigo 2015 Colección Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Dark, tarry chocolate and blackberry aromas lead to a full-bodied and fresh palate in this wine. Its toasty black-fruit flavors are nicely spiced, finishing with peppery and toasty notes of coconut and chocolate. Drink through 2028.
Name: Pulenta 2013 Gran X Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

Description: With its licorice root, cassis and plum aromas, this juicy, tight Malbec shows a firm grip and racy acidity. Its raspberry and red plum flavors are fully oaked and spicy. On the finish, it's intense, prickly and acid driven. Drink through 2032.
Name: Bodega Catena Zapata 2013 Argentino Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: This is a luscious, oaky and smoky red wine, with firm integrated tannins. Spicy acidity provides a freshness against the ripe fruit, leaning floral on the nose and offering plenty of length.
Name: Thirty-Seven Wines 2014 Reserve Malbec (Sonoma Coast)

Description: This wine's dark, opaque color and jammy, sun-baked aromas are typical of Salta's best Malbecs. It's a saturated, hefty and intense red from some of the highest vineyards in the world, yet it's neither fiery nor aggressive. Its lush, fully developed flavor profile includes cassis, blackberry and chocolate notes that persist into the finish. Drink through 2024.
Name: Colomé 2013 Altura Maxima Malbec (Salta)

Description: Despite humid conditions in Mendoza in 2015, this old vins Malbec shows a fine combination of blackberry, smoke and mocha aromas. It's in tip-top shape on the palate, although the acidity is a bit wiry. Oaky flavors of vanilla and mocha work well with its black cherry and blackberry fruit, which is unwavering on the finish. Drink through 2022.
Name: Luca 2015 Old Vine Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: This wine's dark, smoky berry aromas include a reedy note. A selection from the rockiest part of the Adrianna Vineyard in Tupungato, it's so racy and bright that it's sharp and tangy on the palate. Its toasty red berry, plum and spice flavors finish with unusually high acidity. Drink through 2035.
Name: Bodega Catena Zapata 2013 Adrianna Vineyard River Stones Malbec (Tupungato)

Description: This wine smells toasty and creamy. Like all of Catena's 2013 Malbecs, it's wiry in feel, with screaming acidity. That electric feel carries into its plum and currant flavors, which have oaky, wood spice accents.Drink through 2035.
Name: Bodega Catena Zapata 2013 Adrianna Vineyard Fortuna Terrae Malbec (Tupungato)

Description: A broadly defined, soft round red wine made with the utmost attention and time in French oak, this estate-driven effort is impressive in strawberry, cherry and blueberry cobbler goodness, rich flavors that wrap around substantial tannins. The persistent sensibility on the nose is floral in violet and mountain sage.
Name: Hess 2014 Small Block Series Malbec (Mount Veeder)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This deep purple-hued wine is fragrant with crushed blackberry notes. The fruit is outstanding, and the tannins are ripe and smooth. Drink now for its exuberant youth or cellar for a few years and drink closer to maturity.
Name: Reustle 2016 Malbec (Umpqua Valley)

Description: This earthy Malbec offers savory, roasted berry aromas, with a hint of horse hide. Its tight, compact palate feels clipped, with salty plum and currant flavors. The finish is tight, oaky and a bit condensed.
Name: A16 2015 Refective Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Brushy in forest floor, this is a soft, velvety and bright red wine, with well-integrated oak that never takes over. A taste of cherry, blueberry and graham cracker combine nicely.
Name: Viluko 2013 Malbec (Sonoma County)

Description: This richly oaked selection from the high-elevation Adrianna Vineyard in Tupungato smells of berries, red currants and maple. It's angular on the palate, with acidity so high it's downright citric. Red berry, red plum and wood grain are the dominant flavors, and they're tarter than they are lush. Tannin is a noticeable element on its otherwise racy, high-acid finish. Drink through 2035.
Name: Bodega Catena Zapata 2013 Adrianna Vineyard Mundus Bacillus Terrae Malbec (Tupungato)

Description: When Cobos gets its heavyweight Malbecs right, they're some of the best in Argentina. But in a year like 2014, when the end of the vintage was cold and rain-plagued, many of the big wines seem stunted. With its fully oaked mint, smoke and spice aromas, this delivers nothing but power. Toasted flavors of blackberry, cassis and raisin mark the hard palate, finishing short and with some heat. Age this until 2020 for best results.
Name: Viña Cobos 2014 Cobos Chañares Vineyard Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: Altocedro likes to pile on the creamy oak, and this Malbec has that in spades. Wood spice and lacquer aromas weigh down its blueberry, blackberry and green scents. Chunky weight and creamy oak define the palate, as do burnt wood, resin and grassy berry flavors.
Name: Altocedro 2015 Gran Reserva Malbec (La Consulta)

Description: Wood smoke and clove aromas are the main features in this wine's barrel-driven nose. Combine a high-elevation vineyard like San Pablo with 2014's cold conditions, and the result is a massive Malbec with hard edges. Its dark fruit flavors are muscular and downright abrasive on the finish. Drink or hold indefinitely.
Name: Salentein 2014 Single Vineyard San Pablo Estate Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: This wine's grapey aromas are compact, and toasty oak fills in the rest of the nose. The palate is abrupt, almost vertical, and firm to the extreme, with chewy black plum and black cherry flavors.
Name: Viña Cobos 2014 Bramare Rebon Vineyard Malbec (Uco Valley)

Appellation: Valle de Uco, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Desiccated dark fruit aromas recalling prune, raisin and cassis open this lush and chewy Malbec. Heady flavors of smoky blackberry and cassis lead into a raisiny finish with chocolate cake notes. This falls just short due to weight and balance issues.
Name: Viñalba 2014 Gran Reserva Malbec (Valle de Uco)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Juicy red fruit is powerfully wound around a core of toasted oak and blueberry cobbler richness in this vineyard-designate, which finishes ripe and round.
Name: Kokomo 2015 Timber Crest Vineyard Malbec (Dry Creek Valley)

Description: This wine's oaky nose includes a stand-out scent of maple. Its full, saturated palate feels a bit overdone, with toasty, chocolaty black fruit flavors. Mocha and coffee notes dominate the finish.
Name: A16 2013 Apogeo Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: This wine's saucy plum and berry aromas are oaky but not overripe. It offers a round, resiny palate, with earthy, oak-laden berry flavors. Its fresh but saucy finish is a continuation of what came before.
Name: Altocedro 2016 Año Cero Malbec (La Consulta)

Description: This leads with jumbled plum and raspberry aromas. Its tight, intense palate is brightened by acidity and made rubbery by firm tannins. With its ripe plum and berry flavors were made for grilled steaks and chops. Just watch out for its toasty, tannic afterburn
Name: Finca Flichman 2015 Misterio Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: This wine's brambly wild berry aromas are more feral and funky than Alta usually delivers, more than likely a result of the cold 2014 vintage. On the palate, it's wiry, with raw tannins and plum and berry flavors that finish with juicy acidity and tension.
Name: Bodega Catena Zapata 2014 Alta Historic Rows Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: This wine's ripe, baked berry aromas suggest cigar box, pipe tobacco and raisins. It's heavy, stewed and choppy on the palate, saturated with prune, raisin and chocolate flavors. The finish is short and hints at overripeness.
Name: Finca la Celia 2014 Elite Malbec (Uco Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This is a bright and expansive wine, brick in color, with aromas and flavors of bread, black cherry and leather. Grippy and powerful, it has a whiff of violet and plenty of length on the finish.
Name: Arbor Bench Vineyards 2013 Estate Malbec (Dry Creek Valley)

Description: This leads with flat, earthy raisin and prune aromas. The palate is bulky, thick and syrupy, with stewy cassis and berry flavors laced with coconutty oak. It's dense and slightly overdone on the finish.
Name: Rutini 2014 Encuentro Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: This wine's plum and currant aromas are raw and wild, with a hint of animal and not a lot of overt ripeness. It's medium bodied and rubbery in mouthfeel, with a mix of salty and woody flavors and moderately ripe plum notes. On the finish, it tastes mostly of spicy oak and mint.
Name: Viña Cobos 2016 Felino Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Like many austere, power-packed 2014 Malbecs, this offers an intense attack. Its cool cola and blackberry aromas include a note of fennel. And its berry flavors are fiery and aggressive, with a long, drying, tannic finish.
Name: Andeluna 2014 Pasionado Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: This has generic berry aromas, with a strawberry candy note. Its saturated palate hits with drying tannins, while clove and bitter chocolate flavors accent stewed berry notes. Oak and toast dominate the finish.
Name: Valentín Bianchi 2015 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: This wine's grapey berry aromas are clean but basic. It has a focused, sinewy mouthfeel and lightly salty plum and berry flavors. Touches of herbs, spice and salt are present on the finish.
Name: Domaine Bousquet 2017 Made With Organic Grapes Malbec (Tupungato)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine was aged in half French and half American oak, 60% new. Wood spice, vanilla, plum and herb aromas lead to a broad palate that mixes fruit and barrel in equal parts, the two persisting on the finish.
Name: Goose Ridge 2014 Reserve Estate Bottled Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This Malbec is wide and full, lacking in cut and structure. Its chunky plum and berry aromas are a bit spicy, and its plum and herbal berry flavors finish round, with spice notes and dry tannins.
Name: Domaine Bousquet 2017 Finca Lalande Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: This wine's herbal berry and tomato aromas are as wild as the high desert it hails from. In the mouth, it's loud, with currant and plum flavors that finish with a note of fiery heat and residual acidity.
Name: Zorzal 2015 Terroir Único Malbec (Tupungato)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Gritty, with explosive power midpalate, this has a tartness of acidity that stands up to a softness of texture and tangy red fruit.
Name: Arbor Bench Vineyards 2012 Estate Malbec (Dry Creek Valley)

Description: This wine's spicy blueberry and plum aromas are scattershot and unfocused. It's a wiry, high-acid Malbec with plum, currant and herb flavors. A high-toned and front-loaded, it fades quickly on the finish.
Name: Domaine Bousquet 2017 Cameleon Made With Organic Grapes Malbec (Tupungato)

Description: This wine's stewy, herbal berry aromas are not very ripe or compelling. Its rough palate offers minty, herbal berry and carob flavors, finishing slightly hot and abrasive, with green notes.
Name: Laureano Gomez 2014 Malbec (Uco Valley)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Light orange in color, this wine brings sweet cherry and herb aromas. It drinks dry, with broad, fat-feeling but lightly concentrated fruit flavors.
Name: 14 Hands 2016 The Reserve Rosé of Malbec (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Soy sauce, grilled meat, red plum and currant aromas give an impression of underrripeness in this wine. It feels linear, with no give to the palate, and its savory, herbal berry flavors dry out on the finish.
Name: Bodega Calle 2013 Alberti 154 Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

Description: Roasted campfire and herbal blueberry aromas lead the nose of this wine. The palate lacks substance and structure. Its herbal, oaky berry flavors are green and stewy, finishing with unabsorbed oak and mint notes.
Name: Valentín Bianchi 2014 L10 Premium Malbec

Description: This wine's sugar beet and raspberry aromas are reedy like sweet grass. It dries out quickly on the palate due to rubbery tannins. Herbal berry flavors fill it out, feeling slightly astringent and begging for food.
Name: Cuma 2015 Made with Organic Grapes Malbec (Cafayate)

Description: This wine's dark fruit aromas are neither complex nor serious. It's a basic Malbec, soft and a bit overweight, with generic black fruit flavors and a hint of blackened toast on an otherwise innocuous finish.
Name: P15 2017 Malbec (Patagonia)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine has a grip to it that hits hard on the palate—a somewhat astringent turn to the tannins. Red fruit and violet work hard to integrate within a full-bodied concentration.
Name: Arbor Bench Vineyards 2014 Estate Malbec (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Thin blueberry and other blue fruit flavors are in evidence here, but they're quickly overshadowed by drying, tea leaf flavors. The aggressive tannins may be due in large part to aging in 30% new American oak.
Name: Weisinger 2014 Gold Vineyard Malbec (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Casarena's wines are always unique, for better or worse. This Malbec's earthy aromas of stewed berries and Hoison sauce are funky. It's narrow and raw, with herbal flavors of juniper, eucalyptus and overripe blueberry. On the finish, it lacks structure.
Name: Casarena 2013 Reservado Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

Description: Funky aromas of bath soap, sugar beets and spiced berry fruits lead the nose of this wine. Although the palate is grating, it delivers interesting spiced fruit and rhubarb flavors. Burnt notes rise up on the finish, recalling the texture of grape skins.
Name: Quara 2015 Estate Malbec (Cafayate)

Appellation: Valle de Uco, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Red-berry aromas control the nose of this hard-pounding Malbec. Its oversized palate is built on high acidity and hard tannins, with loud berry and plum flavors. Dry on the finish, its fruit disappears quickly.
Name: Lost Valley 2015 Reserva Malbec (Valle de Uco)

Description: This offers raw, lean earthy red berry aromas. It's a light-bodied and fresh Malbec, with herbal red fruit flavors. Its drawing finish tastes of herbal red fruits and plum skins.
Name: Mariposa 2016 Malbec (San Juan)

Description: This is a leathery wine, a bit thick yet soft in texture, with a full-bodied ripeness of cherry and oaky vanilla.
Name: AuburnJames 2013 La Cerezas Vineyard Malbec (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Pine Mountain-Cloverdale Peak, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This wine is a bit flat in black fruit and moderate structure,. It is soft and round but lacking somewhat in varietal character.
Name: Imagery 2015 Upper Ridge Vineyard Malbec (Pine Mountain-Cloverdale Peak)

Description: Medicinal aromas of latex blend with creamy, candied berry notes in this wine. The palate feels jammy and wide, lacking focus. Cheesy oak and berry fruit flavors are herbal and tomatoey through the finish.
Designation: Aruma Domaines Barons de Rothschild (Lafite) and Nicolas Catena
Name: Bodegas Caro 2016 Aruma Domaines Barons de Rothschild (Lafite) and Nicolas Catena Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: This wine's grassy red fruit aromas border on weedy and show a streak of oak. It's far from ripe on the palate, with dilute red fruit flavors and oaky notes of clove and mint. Its hollow finish tastes more of clove than fruit.
Name: Valentín Bianchi 2016 L10 Malbec

Description: This top wine from a major Cahors estate shows the potential of great Malbec. With its dense tannins, rich black fruit flavors, acidity and restrained power, it is a major force. Even with all its weight, it's stylish, complex and ageworthy wine. Drink from 2021.
Name: Château du Cèdre 2014 GC Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Since taking over a family estate in 1998, Cathy and Daniel Fournié have focused on making great wine with the help of their expert neighbors. This is the result. Produced from organic, low-yielding old vines and wood aged for nearly two years, the wine is concentrated and dense. Mint flavors show the new wood and give a polished edge to the black fruit. Powerful tannins and juicy acidity back up its fruitiness. This is a wine for long-term aging. Drink from 2023.
Name: Château Haut-Monplaisir 2014 Pur Plaisir Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Created as an homage to the traditional powerful “black wines” that set the reputation of Cahors in Medieval times, this wine follows the old practice of heating the grape must before fermentation. The result is enormous concentration, seriously tannic ripe black fruit and considerable acidity. These are all elements that demand aging, and even at four years old this wine is just starting out. Drink from 2021 at the earliest.
Designation: Clos Triguedina The New Black Wine
Name: Jean-Luc Baldès 2013 Clos Triguedina The New Black Wine Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Organically grown grapes go into this very fine wine. Its structure and balance confirm that it's still young, bursting with juicy ripe berry fruit and with firm background tannins. Its great fruitiness is contrasted with the strength of those tannins and with its concentration. Drink from 2020.
Name: Château du Cèdre 2014 Le Cèdre Malbec (Cahors)

Description: This wine is ripe in spicy black-currant aromas on the nose and intense in juicy black fruit on the dense palate. The rich, generous layers of fruit perfectly balance the tannins that build up to a harmonious whole. Still young, it will be best from 2019.
Name: Château du Cèdre 2014 Malbec (Cahors)

Description: This wine comes from a selection of parcels on the plateau above the Lot river in Cahors. It's rich and firm, with great wood and spice notes as well as exuberant black plum and berry fruit. With its acidity, still-young tannins and firm texture, it will age. Drink from 2020.
Name: Château Saint-Didier-Parnac 2016 Prieuré de Cénac Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Named after Roman emperor Probus, who allowed the replanting of vines in France, this finely mature wine is smooth, with a dry core. That structure supports secondary flavors and spice, which add to its juicy acidity and overall richness. Drink now.
Name: Jean-Luc Baldès 2009 Clos Triguedina Probus Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Wood aged and serious, this is a finely balanced wine. Its spice and toast notes are beginning to come together with its young, exuberant fruit and acidity. Black currant flavors dominate, giving it a crisp, juicy edge. Drink this impressive wine from 2021.
Name: Château Haut-Monplaisir 2014 Prestige Malbec (Cahors)

Description: This serious, ageworthy wine is the top in the series of three wines from the Moinié estate. It's powerful and perfumed, with rich dark chocolate and superripe black plum and berry flavors. The tannins are still firm, showing its considerable potential. Wait until at least 2021 before drinking.
Name: Château Ponzac 2015 Eternellement Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Grown on clay and chalk soil, this second wine in a series of three from the Moinié estate is intended for medium-term aging. With its dark color and solid tannins, it certainly needs time. However, its rich black fruit and acidity already show through that structure. Give it until 2019, and it will be ready to drink.
Name: Château Ponzac 2015 Patiemment Malbec (Cahors)

Description: This young wine is packed with firm tannins and juicy black plum fruit. Its structure of tannins, both from the fruit and from wood aging, gives it a rich texture. It's spicy and ripe and needs some aging. Drink from 2020.
Name: Château Nozières 2015 Amrboise de l'Her Malbec (Cahors)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Underripe black currant and elderberry aromas mix with campfire, cedar and roasted beef on the nose of this wine. Black cherry and crushed pencils show on the palate, which is framed by impressive tannins and a chalky mouthfeel.
Name: Ms. Behave 2014 Malbec (Paso Robles)

Description: This very fine wine is rich in fruit, with a strongly mineral texture. It comes from the third terrace above the river Lot, where the clay and flint soil results in ripe fruit and balanced acidity. It will develop relatively quickly and be ready from 2019.
Name: Château Haut-Monplaisir 2015 Tradition Malbec (Cahors)

Description: This rich, wood-aged wine has become smooth after three years of aging. It's rich, with fine, juicy black fruit, acidity and a core of tannins. It's balanced, ripe and ready to drink.
Name: Domaine de Maison Neuve 2014 Elevé en Fût de Chêne Malbec (Cahors)

Appellation: Vin de Liqueur, France Other, France
Description: Almost as a challenge, owners Pascal et Jean-Marc Verhaeghe set out to prove that Malbec could produce a fine Port-style fortified wine. It works: its ripe sweetness and the balance between brandy and wine are just right. Jammy black cherry flavors and soft tannins give it a rich, velvety character. Drink now.
Name: Château du Cèdre 2014 Le Cèdre Vintage Malbec (Vin de Liqueur)

Description: Malbec is on the list of allowed grapes in Bordeaux but is rarely found now because it used to be difficult to ripen. This rich, structured wine shows that the situation has changed. It's ripe, full of black fruit and likely to mature well. Drink from 2018.
Name: Château de Lagarde 2016 En Mémoire du  (Bordeaux)

Description: This big and ripe wine with dense blackberry fruit is concentrated and still young. The firm tannins under its bold fruitiness still need to soften to give a rich and fruity wine. Drink from 2019.
Name: Château du Caillau 2015 Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Here's an open, fruity and accessible style of Malbec from Clos Triguedina. Rich and juicy in ripe black-currant flavors, its fine fruitiness is shaped by soft tannins. Drink for its fresh fruit from 2018.
Name: Jean-Luc Baldès 2014 du Clos Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Strong but pleasant oak-based aromas of sandalwood complement lightly herbal plum and berry notes. This feels wiry and intense, with rugged tannins. Herbal, oaky berry flavors finish with scratchy tannins and a distant note of green.
Designation: Gran Terroir Estate Grown La Huella Vineyard
Name: Agustinos 2015 Gran Terroir Estate Grown La Huella Vineyard Malbec (Bío Bío Valley)

Description: Produced from organically grown grapes and bottled without added sulfur, this wine is full of life. With its juicy fruit and jammy texture, bursts with blackberry and black plum flavors. It's likely to age quickly, so drink from 2018.
Name: Château du Cèdre 2016 Extra Libre Malbec (Cahors)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are light, with notes of berry, herb, dried flower and spice. The palate brings plenty of plump cherry flavors along with pleasing spice accents. It's an intriguing example of this variety.
Name: Wilridge 2015 Conley Vineyard Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Black plum, blackberries, lilac and vanilla show on the easy if simple nose of this bottling. There's a load of perfume-like purple flowers on the sip, where a curiously strong acidity also carries cola spice.
Name: Rancho Sisquoc 2015 Malbec (Santa Barbara County)

Description: This smells ripe and bright, with grapy and chocolate praline aromas which lead to a palate that is immersed in oak spices and nutmeg. This is a nicley balanced wine with smooth tannins and a long, spicy finish.
Name: The Williamsburg Winery 2015 Limited Release Malbec (Virginia)

Description: Smoky, oaky aromas include hints of tobacco, green bean and berry fruits. This Malbec has a resiny, grabby, full-bodied feel and oaky flavors of black fruits and carob. A full, chunky finish includes meaty but nondescript berry notes.
Name: Junta 2015 Momentos Reserva Malbec (Curicó Valley)

Description: Bottled without additional sulfur, this wine has a barnyard aroma. The ripe berry flavors on the palate show plenty of fruitiness, as well as spice and soft tannins. Drink from 2018.
Name: Château Haut-Monplaisir 2016 L'Envie Malbec (Cahors)

Description: This wine shows ripe dark fruit, cedar, intense whole-bunch stalkiness and a perfumed quality throughout. The tannins are clunky and soapy while the alcohol feels a little hot.
Name: 5OS Project 2014 Malbec (McLaren Vale)

Description: One of three wines from the Moinié family with different aging potentials and prices, this is the simplest. It's fruity and made to be drunk young, with plenty of blackberry flavor. With its tannins, it will benefit from a few more months of age and be ready from 2018.
Name: Château Ponzac 2015 Maintenant Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Interesting aromas of licorice root and earthy, savory berry and smoked meat notes set up a fresh but acidic palate that's raw and smacking. Spicy, woody flavors match the nose, while this tastes of plum, tomato and resiny oak on the finish.
Name: Casa Donoso 2014 Gran Reserva Bicentenario Malbec (Maule Valley)

Description: Foxy, lightly green aromas of cherry and tomato are racy and raw. This Malbec has a grating feel, while herbal, oaky red-berry and plum flavors are foxy. A choppy, aggressive finish is led by herbal berry flavors.
Name: Concha y Toro 2015 Serie Riberas Gran Reserva Malbec (Marchigue)

Description: This wine opens with a perfumed nose of lavender and geranium. Wafts of blueberry, raspberry and red plum abound and carry through to the palate, which is also quite floral. Nicely balanced, easy to enjoy, the finish is smooth and flavorful but doesn't last long.
Name: Bogati 2016 B Malbec (Virginia)

Description: Charred oak aromas settle on creamy, with a note of plastic to go with heavy spice and secondary berry scents. This feels raw, tannic and grabby. Flavors of plum and clove are woody, while this has the texture of grape-skin extract on the finish, meaning it's rough and grabby.
Name: Chilensis 2015 Reserva Estate Bottled Malbec (Maule Valley)

Description: This wine is all about fruit. Balanced tannins and crisp, juicy acidity permeate its blackberry flavor. It has an attractive smoky character and finishes with dry tannins and stalky fruit. Drink now.
Name: Domaine de Maison Neuve 2014 Malbec (Cahors)

Description: This bold, purple-colored wine is fruity and soft. Its acidity combines with black fruit and a juicy, lightly tannic texture. Drink now.
Name: Château du Cèdre 2016 Cedrus Malbec (Comté Tolosan)

Description: This shows the soft, juicy side of Malbec. No serious tannins here, just red berry fruit and fine acidity. That means it's ready to drink this winter.
Name: Château du Cèdre 2016 Marcel Malbec (Comté Tolosan)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of marionberry jam and smoke leap out of the glass, along with orange peel and wilted flower notes that seem a bit unsettled. The flavors are plump around the edges but light in the middle, with a mesquite note that distracts.
Name: Telaya 2015 Boushey Vineyard Malbec (Yakima Valley)

Description: Earthy berry aromas are complex due to side notes of crushed leaves, charred meat and burnt wood. This single-vineyard Malbec is juicy and loaded with energy as a result of racy acidity. Plum, wild berry, herb and spice flavors finish dry, firm and focused. Drink this high-toned Malbec through 2025.
Name: Achaval-Ferrer 2014 Finca Bella Vista Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Big aromas of blackberry, leather, turned earth and white mushroom set up a bright, layered palate with fresh acidity at its core. Floral, exotic red-berry flavors are spicy and in sync with each other. A crisp, peppery finish with toasty oak ensures that this single-vineyard Malbec is built to last. Drink through 2025.
Name: Achaval-Ferrer 2014 Finca Mirador Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Exotic blueberry and cassis aromas are accented by cardamom and wild-herb scents. This Malbec from Altamira in the Uco Valley is jammy and saturated, but pure, with ripe berry, oak and spice flavors. A juicy fruit-filled finish is packed and tastes like berry compote. Lastly, a delicate herbal note gives this complexity. Drink through 2024.
Name: Achaval-Ferrer 2014 Finca Altamira Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Smooth blackberry, chocolate, violet and raisin aromas make for a complete nose. A saturated, ripe palate is a touch heavy, while heady flavors of licorice, black peppercorn and blackberry are slightly charred on a flush finish. Drink through 2022.
Name: Mendel 2014 Finca Remota Malbec (Uco Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Smoked strawberry and concentrated red plum aromas meet hickory smoke, fresh herb and rose petal scents in this great bottling. The zingy palate is fresh, lively and quite complex, from its oregano, thyme and tarragon notes to its core of pomegranate and dark raspberry fruit to its savory, leathery finish.
Name: Midnight 2014 Solstice Malbec (Paso Robles)

Description: Exotic black-fruit aromas are more surface-level than deep. This well-built Malbec has lift and intensity on the palate. Dark, toasty black-fruit flavors are delicious but typical for this type of full-bodied Mendoza Malbec. Pastry notes, oak grain and char are the most distinct characteristics on a full-force finish. Drink through 2023.
Name: Matias Riccitelli 2014 Vineyard Selection Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Valle de Uco, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: A ripe, raisiny nose with a black-fruit essence and mild warmth leads to a tight and tannic palate. Toasty blackberry and cassis flavors are powerful and include a note of oaky graphite. A dark, spicy finish with full-blast intensity ends the ride. Drink through 2022.
Name: Serca 2014 Single Vineyard Reserva Malbec (Valle de Uco)

Description: Aromas of tire rubber mix with plum and berry on a rustic nose. This wine displays a strong grip but also shearing tartaric acidity. Smoky plum and berry flavors suggest char and hickory, finishing spicy and savory. Drink through 2020
Name: El Enemigo 2015 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Raisiny berry aromas come with notes of spice cake and green herbs. This wine feels narrow, hard and gritty. Uncommon flavors of fennel, licorice and bitter chocolate are as prominent if not more so than blueberry and black-plum fruit. The wine is louder and more demanding on the palate than on the finish.
Name: Cielo y Tierra 2015 Celador Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: At first the nose on this Malbec seems granulated, with individual notes of heady black fruits, oak, iron and dried blood. The palate is saturated but without much lift. Solid blackberry and chocolate flavors extend across a finish with stature.
Name: Marchiori & Barraud 2014 Malbec (Perdriel)

Description: Charred, smoky blackberry aromas are chocolaty and stout. This Malbec has a rubbery palate with clamping tannins. Saucy, herbal berry flavors come with a mild green influence, finishing a bit clipped and angular.
Name: Alta Vista 2015 Estate Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Coffee, beef stock, blackberry and graphite aromas require patience to process. A lively, ringing palate is jammy at its essence. Dark, toasty flavors of blackberry and blueberry are mildly green and herbal. It feels rubbery on a tannic finish.
Name: Finca Flichman 2015 Paisaje de Tupungato Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Alto Valle del Río Negro, Other, Argentina
Description: Powerful berry, cassis and licorice aromas are intense on the surface but shallow underneath. A raw, extracted palate is rough and edgy in feel. Ripe blackberry flavors are savory. It's tough, grating and rubbery across a long finish.
Name: Verum 2016 Reserva Malbec (Alto Valle del Río Negro)

Description: Dominating aromas of clove and baking spices are forced and oak-based, and thus not natural. In the mouth, this lusty, extracted Malbec feels raw and choppy, with rough tannins. Flavors of clove, savory berry fruits and green herbs continue on the finish.
Name: ZaHa 2014 Toko Vineyard Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The age on this bottling is starting to show, so drink up. Slightly sour plum scents meld with rose petal, violet and dried blueberry notes on the nose. The palate is quite interesting, with dried strawberry, mocha and cappuccino flavors, culminating in a caramel-inflected finish.
Name: Opaque 2012 Irick Vineyard Malbec (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Coconut, vanilla and spice aromas are at the fore, with the fruit seeming a bit dried out. The black-plum flavors show pleasing depth, with baking-spice flavors speckled throughout. The wood is primary but it's still appealing.
Name: Waterbrook 2014 Reserve Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Dark but reduced aromas of tire and blackberry set up a muscular palate with pinching tannins. Roasted, oaky flavors of spicy berry, clove and cocoa finish with a final woody note and choppy toughness.
Name: Trapiche 2014 Broquel Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Roasted plum and tomato aromas are spicy but hard and gritty. That also describes the mouthfeel on this narrow, linear Malbec with beaming acidity. Plum and berry flavors finish direct, with no interference from heavy oak.
Name: Mendoza Vineyards 2014 Unsung Hero Malbec (Argentina)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Rubbery black-fruit aromas are a bit fiery. This Malbec is tightly wound, with rubbery tannins and more than enough acidity. Spiced plum and berry flavors give way to a bold, forward finish with herbal, savory notes.
Name: Nieto Senetiner 2016 Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

Description: Savory, grapy aromas include gamy notes and an herbal influence. A choppy, abrupt palate is gravelly in feel. Herbal plum and cranberry flavors are meaty and a touch green on the finish. For a Malbec that's not just about black fruits and oak, give this a shot.
Name: Finca la Celia 2014 Reserve Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: Funky green aromas ride high atop stewed plum, cardamom and coffee grounds. This wine feels saturated and jammy, as if it were spreadable. Herbal berry and juniper flavors are borderline weedy, and it tastes green on the finish.
Name: Achaval-Ferrer 2015 Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Green aromas are at the fore, with notes of underripe herb, mint, plum and spice. In contrast, the palate is full of spritely cherry and plum flavors. The aromas and flavors seem disconnected but it still brings intrigue.
Name: Desert Wind 2015 Estate Grown Malbec (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Southern Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Close to black in color, with a hint of rust around the rim, this reductive wine carries a scent of burnt rubber. Flavors suggest riper grapes than the listed alcohol would indicate, with brown sugar, ripe black cherry and some dusty tannins.
Name: Spangler 2013 Malbec (Southern Oregon)

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Prominent crushed gravel and stone notes meet leather and dust on the nose of this very earthy bottling, which shows a bit of blackberry as well. The palate is redolent with potpourri flavors and incredibly floral, with plum as the dominant fruit.
Name: Martin Ranch 2014 Therese Vineyards Dos Niñas Vineyard Malbec (Santa Clara Valley)

Description: Ripe berry fruit is a theme that replays like a loop on this Salta Malbec. Deep, ripe berry aromas lead to a saturated palate with mild acidity. Hefty black cherry and blackberry flavors collapse on a fruity, pulpy finish.
Name: Amalaya 2016 Esperanza Por Un Milagro Malbec (Salta)

Description: Raspberry and rubber-band aromas lead to a saturated palate with full tannnins and flavors of plum and plum skins. A mildly hot finish with grapeskin residue maintains the high volume this Malbec is putting out.
Name: Marco Zunino 2014 Estancia Argentina Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Latex and baked-bean aromas are candied at first, then grassy. This Malbec is intense but harsh in feel. Herbal plum and currant flavors are slightly horsey, and it feels hot and scratchy on a minty, herbal finish.
Name: Gimenez Riili 2014 Buenos Hermanos Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Jammy aromas of cassis and red-licorice candy lack framing. This wine feels dense and compact. Medicinal berry and plum flavors carry a bitter edge, while green tannins make for a raw finish.
Name: Finca la Celia 2014 Pioneer Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: Reduced, jammy berry aromas open this loud Malbec that ambles across the palate with no sense of restraint. All about gritty, screaming red-fruit flavors and baked notes, it lacks elegance.
Name: Pampas del Sur 2014 Estilo Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: This light-pink Malbec smells dry, oaky and bereft of fruit. A plump palate feels a touch resiny from six months of American-oak aging, while this wine tastes vaguely of wood, vanilla, cherry Pixie stick and powdered sugar.
Name: Vicentin 2016 Blanc de Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Brambly berry and leather aromas are rustic. This Malbec is hard and acidic. Short, generic plum and berry flavors don't expand or improve on the finish.
Name: Alpamanta 2014 Natal Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Stewy, earthy berry aromas are mulchy and lack freshness. This has a cooked and rubbery mouthfeel to go with stalky, savory berry and plum flavors. A green, leathery character shows on the finish.
Name: Ricardo Santos 2016 La Madras Vineyard Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Harsh, grassy, weedy berry aromas mix with a heavy amount of clove. In the mouth, this is screechy and way off balance. A clove-heavy flavor profile is oaky and messy on Kaiken's entry-level Malbec.
Name: Kaiken 2016 Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: One of the better Malbec-based wines of the region, this fairly priced blend, which includes 8% Cabernet Sauvignon, 4% Petite Sirah and 2% Syrah, offers a dense core of blackberry jam that's covered by layers of loam, charred beef, black pepper and smoke. The dense black-cherry and blueberry flavors are cut by intense pepper, vanilla bean and prominent cappuccino, all frame by woody tannins.
Name: Tooth and Nail 2014 The Fiend Malbec (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine comes from one of Washington's top vineyards, best known for Cabernet Sauvignon, however this Malbec seems to shine as well. Almost 100% varietal, it boasts vibrant plum, coffee, clove, vanilla and herb aromas. The palate is loaded with plump, creamy fruit and an oak note of lingering espresso.
Name: Januik 2014 Champoux Vineyard Malbec (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine's aromas are vibrant and fruit forward, with plum, blackberry seed, barrel spice, herb and clove notes. The palate delivers plush, tart, textured flavors. A compelling example of the variety.
Name: Baer 2014 Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This 100% varietal wine brings brooding aromas of black licorice, anise, dark plum and herb followed by rich, focused black plum flavors. It delivers a lot of charm and hedonistic appeal.
Name: Walla Walla Vintners 2014 Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Anise, barrel spice, clove, vanilla and plum scents lead to full-bodied fruit and barrel flavors in this wine. It shows some warmth on the finish, with lingering purple fruit and pepper notes.
Name: Milbrandt 2014 Ravenscliff Vineyard Malbec (Wahluke Slope)

Description: Slightly foxy red-berry and plum aromas are spicy and a touch earthy. A wide, blocky palate is trying hard to stay in line, but this Malbec weighs in on the heavy side. Flavors of toasty, minty blackberry finish with chocolate and spice notes.
Name: Loica 2014 Andes Series Malbec (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Vanilla, cocoa, barrel spice and herb aromas are followed by creamy fruit and barrel flavors. The vanilla notes overwhelm the nose and palate, however, distracting from the fruit.
Name: Novelty Hill 2014 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine shows cocoa, vanilla and barrel spice aromas on the nose. The medium-weight palate shows decent fruit tones however is overshadowed by heavy-handed oak.
Name: Milbrandt 2014 The Estates Malbec (Wahluke Slope)

Description: This wine starts out as dense and fruity, but turns floral with airing. In the mouth, it's a bit jammy and overextracted, making for a weighty drinking experience. Flavors of prune, blackberry and dark chocolate end quickly on a finish that lacks the structure to go the distance.
Name: Loma Larga 2014 Unfiltered Malbec (Casablanca Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Plum, herb, blue fruit, vanilla and spice aromas lead to soft, plush fruit flavors in this wine. The texture and blue fruit flavors bring appeal.
Name: Waterbrook 2015 Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dark red plum, cedar, clove and allspice show on the nose of this bottling of a variety rarely bottled alone in Santa Barbara County. The flavors are straightforward with light berry fruit, a touch of pepper and the slightest hint of licorice.
Name: Firestone 2014 Malbec (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine's unusual purple fruit, citrus, herb and wood spice aromas waft up from the glass. The palate brings abundant orange peel flavors supported by tannins that are surprisingly firm for the variety. Citrus twist notes linger on the finish.
Name: :Nota Bene 2013 Heart of the Hill Vineyard Malbec (Red Mountain)

Description: A nose with diverse aromas of herbal berry, grilled meat, carob and compost doesn't exhibit clean fruit scents. A grabby palate with rugged tannins hosts hard-edged flavors of plum and leafy berry that dry out on a slightly murky, funky-tasting finish.
Name: Polkura 2014 Malbec (Marchigue)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Green herb, vanilla, woodspice, plum and tire rubber aromas are followed by light but sweet barrel spice flavors in this wine. The variety is obscured beneath the heavy oak influence, the whole seeming disjointed.
Name: Stottle 2013 6 Prong Vineyard Malbec (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Rattlesnake Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine's cranberry, orange peel and herb notes are atypical for the variety. Its fruit flavors are tart and elegant, needing a bit more structure to prop them up. It's a bit thin in concentration, with consistent orange peel flavors throughout.
Name: Bonair 2013 Chateau Puryear Vineyard Malbec (Rattlesnake Hills)

Description: This pitch-black Malbec smells like prune juice. That overripe character also shows on the overweight palate that deals saturated flavors of fig, raisin and prune. The finish doesn't display a lot of balance or freshness. Two samples tasted with identical results.
Name: Altamana 2014 Single Vineyard Constanza Malbec (Maule Valley)

Description: Accents of cola spice and cardamom lend a spicy overlay to the black plum and berry core of this wine. It's surprisingly light in weight, with soft tannins and plush, sweet oak-spice tones that dominate the finish.
Name: Fortant 2015 Hills Reserve Malbec (Pays d'Oc)

Description: Made by Elias Fernandez in partnership with Doug Shafer, this red totally rocks in smoky toasted oak and a tease of char. Intense and electrifying, it offers rich layers of dark cherry, clove and dried herb. It's bulky and substantial while preserving a sense of grace, with a backbone of supportive refreshing acidity.
Name: Eighty Four 2013 Malbec (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Diamond Mountain District, Napa, California, US
Description: Estate-grown, this 100% varietal wine impresses in its total embrace of succulent blackberry, plum and mocha goodness, built upon a mountain of structured tannin and quiet oak. Touches of milk chocolate play along the palate as it rides along a velvety roadway, finishing soft and silky.
Name: J. Davies 2013 Malbec (Diamond Mountain District)

Description: Saturated in color as well as on the nose, this fruit-packed Malbec opens with grapy black-plum and cassis aromas. An intensely bold palate is loaded to the hilt with black cherry, blackberry and integrated oak and spice flavors. A lush, steady finish unfolds in due time and with no disparate parts; drink from 2019–2025.
Designation: Terroir Series Finca Ambrosia Single Vineyard
Name: Trapiche 2012 Terroir Series Finca Ambrosia Single Vineyard Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: Matilde 2012 is (once again) a richly oaked, massive Malbec. Aromas of mocha, shoe polish, graphite, violets and blackberry are first rate. Balancing acidity is a vital cog in this loaded specimen. Flavors of blackberry, cassis and raspberry are backed by brown sugar, chocolate and blackened spice on a long finish. Drink from 2018–2027.
Name: Lamadrid 2012 Matilde Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: This ripe, charred, dark-as-night Malbec captures the lush essence of Argentina at its finest. Deep aromas of licorice, blackberry, coffee and toast set up a full, layered palate, with vanilla, baking spice, black plum and blackberry flavors. A lusty finish with licorice, mocha and tobacco notes is generous and dandy. Drink through 2023.
Name: Pascual Toso 2013 Alta Barrancas Vineyards Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Dense, lush aromas of coffee, blackberry and turned earth give way to notes aged Gouda cheese. The jammy palate is packed with a mix of blackberry, plum and cassis flavors that blend together. A compact, grapy finish shows no hard edges, gaps or breaks. Drink through 2022.
Name: Tapiz 2012 Black Tears Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: Briary blackberry and tobacco aromas are a touch flat and jammy. This has a linear palate feel with acidity to spare. Spicy, woody flavors of plum and blueberry finish with acidic lift, leaving juicy brightness as this fades. Drink through 2028.
Name: Bodega Catena Zapata 2013 Nicasia Vineyard Malbec (La Consulta)

Description: Blackberry, cassis and floral aromas are the lead actors on a musky nose. This ripe Malbec feels thick and syrupy, while rich flavors of blackberry, cassis, chocolate and mocha finish smooth but shy. For such a big wine, this is light on tannic bite. Drink through 2021.
Name: Tapiz 2013 Black Tears Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: By Mendoza standards, this is a more delicate Malbec, with aromas of spices, cocoa and oak as opposed to heavily extracted fruit and toast. Mild acidic chop lends tension to flavors of tomato, herbs, licorice and dried plum. A bright and healthy finish preserves quality until the end. Drink through 2021.
Name: Punta del Cielo 2012 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Plum and blackberry aromas dominate a fruit-forward nose with palpable oak and toast. This is rock-solid and firm on the palate. Ripe flavors of baked black fruits are darkened by toast and chocolate notes. On the finish, this tastes of fig and peppery spice. Drink through 2023.
Name: Rule of Three 2013 Malbec (Uco Valley)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Impenetrably dark in color, this potent wine marries black fruit to ample barrel accents of smoke and char. Though aged in just 5% new French oak, those dark scents and flavors permeate the wine. It's a style with broad appeal.
Name: Abacela 2014 Barrel Select Malbec (Umpqua Valley)

Description: Dry, earthy, oaky aromas suggest sandalwood along with cassis and raisin. A full, grabby palate with muscular tannins deals bold blackberry, plum and prune flavors. Spicy oak and chocolate are prominent flavors on a well-done, burly finish. Drink through 2023.
Name: Rutini 2014 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Extracted, grapy aromas suggest raisin and prune but this wine is not overtly overripe. In the mouth, it is grabby and a bit raisiny. Rich, heady flavors of mocha, fig and prune finish with chunky weight. Drink through 2020.
Name: Zolo 2012 Black Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Charred, almost burnt aromas dominate the nose on this muscular, tannic Malbec. Like the nose, this tastes largely of blackened hickory and coffee, meaning the fruit is buried under a lot of barrel weight. Drink through 2027.
Name: Terrazas de Los Andes 2012 Single Vineyard Las Compuertas Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Interest-stirring aromas of tea, stewed berry fruits, vanilla and oak segue into a chewy, dense palate with bulk. Savory, lightly herbal berry flavors are draped with oak character, while this Malbec tastes of grainy oak and toast on the finish. Drink through 2021.
Name: Altocedro 2014 Reserva Old Vine Malbec (La Consulta)

Description: Tight in tannin weight and breadth, this big-boned wine is muscular in leather, blackberry and mocha, and robust in power and ripeness. The force of its flavor finds additional strength and length on the finish.
Name: St. Francis 2014 Wild Oak Vineyard Malbec (Sonoma Valley)

Description: Dark berry aromas are smoky and stout, and overall this well-oaked Malbec gives off a sense of seriousness on the nose. In the mouth, there's tension but also balance. Flavors of blackberry and cassis are oaky but expressive. It's spicy, a touch resiny and lasting on the finish. Drink through 2019.
Name: Trapiche 2014 Gran Medalla Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Stemmy and layered, this wine is velvety, thick and rich in red and blue fruit. The oak is forward, while the tannins resolve to become soft as an old leather glove through the finish.
Name: Ledson 2013 Malbec (Dry Creek Valley)

Description: Mixed black-fruit aromas include spicy oak accents. A plump, seemingly on-the-spot palate holds flavors of plum, berry, fresh tomato and herbs. This Malbec is a touch meaty-tasting on the finish while avoiding heavy oak. It's a wine that's good for all palates, wine novices and experts alike.
Name: Trapiche 2015 Perfiles Calcareo Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Heady berry and spice flavors are made darker and stronger by toasty oak notes. This wine has a fresh, tannic, pulling palate that's home to lightly herbal plum and berry flavors. Additional spice and toasty oak notes give a bright, juicy finish extra gravitas. Drink through 2022.
Name: SonVida 2014 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Chunky, ripe, spicy aromas of plum and prune suggest spice cake. A saturated palate is full but in shape. Blackberry, cassis and bitter-chocolate flavors linger on a toasty finish with blackened oak. Drink through 2020.
Name: Pampas del Sur 2014 Gran Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Black-fruit aromas come with notes of fresh-cut grass, rose petal and berry jam. The mouthfeel is creamy and sticky, with modest acidity. Ripe, rich flavors of berry fruits, cocoa and caramel finish jammy. Drink this tasty, saturated, soft-bodied Malbec through 2018.
Name: Antigal 2014 Uno Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Jumpy berry aromas are crisp and slightly charred. Rugged tannins and alert acidity create a high-energy palate. Dark flavors of black fruits and chocolate are slightly herbal, while flavors of herbs, clove and wood spice control an aggressive, fiery finish.
Name: Milo 2014 Gran Reserve Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Floral berry and plum aromas are direct and pure, emphasizing fruit over oak. A punchy palate follows the nose, while bright plum and berry flavors complete the package. This captures the essence of Malbec while not going overboard.
Name: Nieto Senetiner 2015 Don Nicanor Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

Description: Black-cherry aromas are rough around the edges due to a strong oak element and related clove scents. This Malbec is bulky and shows punchy tartaric acidity and hard tannins. Blackberry, tea and clove flavors are spicy and toasty across the finish.
Name: Septima 2014 Obra Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Saucy, earthy berry aromas are full of oak and clove notes. This wine feels full but not too heavy, with solid overall balance. Blackberry, dark plum, toast and spicy oak flavors finish peppery and stout, with ripe, chewy tannins. Drink through 2022.
Importer: New England Wine and Spirits Inc
Name: Humberto Canale 2014 Gran Reserva Malbec (Patagonia)

Description: Spicy, woody aromas of oak and root beer are equal to the black-fruit aromas this Malbec is offering. A mix of fresh acidity and creamy oak clash a bit on the palate. Flavors of herbal berry fruits and chocolate finish with rubbing tannins, a flavor note of hickory, and a hint of toasty mint.
Name: Bodega Catena Zapata 2014 High Mountain Vines Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Oaky aromas of mocha and spice blend with racier scents of tomato and red plum. This Malbec feels full in body but sinewy and tough. Flavors of spiced tomato, herbs and salty berry fruits are savory. It finishes with toasty, peppery flavors and choppy tannins.
Name: Lagarde 2014 Guarda Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

Description: Aromas of cassis, dried cranberry and black cherry are backed by tobacco and a kick of licorice. The palate is ripe in raspberry, blueberry and black cherry, showing whispers of leather and white pepper. The tannins add balance, mellowing some of the ripeness. Currant and vanilla show on the medium-length finish.
Name: Messina Hof 2015 Private Reserve Double Barrel Malbec (Texas High Plains)

Appellation: Alto Valle del Río Negro, Other, Argentina
Description: Jumpy plum and berry aromas are a bit gritty and reduced. A fresh palate has a solid grip, while grapy flavors of black cherry and dark plum finish with toast and spice notes. This is fruity, not oaky, with all the basics required of good Malbec.
Name: Verum 2016 Malbec (Alto Valle del Río Negro)

Description: Solid berry and oak spice aromas turn darker and more rubbery as this airs out. A strong-boned, grabby palate holds medicinal berry and mild hickory flavors. On the finish, this is big but also tannic and bumpy.
Name: Benvenuto de la Serna 2016 Mil Piedras Malbec (Vista Flores)

Description: Dusty peach aromas are round and hold up to scrutiny. This densely colored Malbec rosé is ready to drink, with flavors of melon and peach. A touch of skins character adds complexity and texture to the finish. Drink immediately.
Name: Bodini 2016 Rosé of Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Ripe berry, toasty oak and vanilla notes drive the nose on this Salta Malbec. In the mouth, it is creamy and thick, with modest acidity. Oaky flavors of baked berry fruits and black currant finish jammy, soft and spicy, with a pervasive note of oak-based clove.
Designation: Oasis en Altura Flor de Cardon
Name: Anko 2014 Oasis en Altura Flor de Cardon Malbec (Salta)

Description: Cherry and plum aromas are solid but slightly herbal. A dense, compact palate is a bit heavy as cassis, spicy berry and oak flavors spread out. Medicinal herbal notes are notable on a lush, powerful finish with minty oak.
Name: Alfredo Roca 2016 Fincas Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Heavy-handed oak on the nose is reflected through aromas of wet cement, char and wood resin. A grabby palate is full of oak tannin, while this tastes saucy and earthy, with savory berry and black-plum flavors. On the finish, the flavor of residual raw oak is strong.
Name: Cielo y Tierra 2014 Don Juan Nahuel Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Blueberry, plum and cardamom aromas include a whiff of wood smoke. A balanced palate has energy along with brambly berry and chocolate flavors. A chewy, solid finish is good but less lively than the palate.
Name: Rubus 2014 Icon Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Though this wine's mouthfeel is chalky, its dark fruit, touched with black olive, coffee and licorice, offers interesting, complex flavors. It's tight, tart, lightly saline and peppery, with the fresh berry fruit flavors holding up through the finish.
Name: Grizzly Peak 2014 Reserve Malbec (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: This well-structured wine strikes a good balance between tannins and blackberry fruitiness. A touch of dark chocolate comes through to underline its ripe structure. It's ready to drink.
Name: Wild Pig 2016 Malbec (Vin de France)

Description: Inky berry, beet and oak aromas smell more worked than natural in this full-bodied Malbec that's a bit clunky on the palate. Flavors of plum, herbs and cool mint finish spicy and slightly green.
Name: Filus 2015 Reserve Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: Dark, burnt, crusty aromas lead to a palate with choppy tannins. Spicy, rooty, peppery flavors of red bell pepper, tomato and plum finish spicy, peppery and savory, with a burst of freshening acidity that adds energy and jump.
Name: Phebus 2014 Gran Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This is the brightest, least char-inflected of the winery's red lineup, though it still wraps its berry fruit flavors in a thick cloak of roasted coffee and charred wood notes. Heavy toast seems to be the winery's preferred style, though here it doesn't completely cover the lovely fruit.
Name: Kriselle 2014 Malbec (Rogue Valley)

Description: Cranberry, tomato leaf and herbal plum aromas lead an earthy bouquet. This Malbec feels saturated and dense, with rugged tannins. Baked blackberry, toasty oak and hard spice flavors feature some funkiness and savory notes prior to a drawing, minty finish.
Name: Familia Cassone 2016 Finca La Florencia Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Racy plum and cherry aromas lead to an edgy palate with bold acidity. Crisp, foxy flavors of raspberry and plum finish spicy and with pronounced acidity. This wine emphasizes acidity and freshness over ripeness and heft.
Name: Domaine Bousquet 2016 Finca Lalande Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Saucy plum and cherry aromas are respectable but unsophisticated. This Malbec feels full and rugged, with hard tannins. Generic berry flavors include a note of prune, while this tastes herbal and slightly chocolaty on the finish.
Name: Valle Austral 2016 Selección Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Cocoa powder, anise and cowhide aromas lead, with hints of fresh currants. Juicy cherry and ripe raspberry are appealing on the palate, paving the way for sweet baking spices and vanilla. The tannins are disjointed from this soft-structured, fruit-forward offering. The lack of acidity is most apparent on the finish, which shows overripe cherry and hints of clove.
Name: Haak 2014 Malbec (Texas High Plains)

Description: Spice and clove aromas are prominent on an oaky nose. This feels sassy and a bit abrasive. Rooty, lightly green-berry flavors finish earthy, minty, peppery and with modest residual fruit.
Name: Aymara 2015 Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Mildly abrasive berry and plum aromas are a bit rough and roasted. This feels good but normal for basic Malbec. Spice, mint and light green notes have a mild impact on cherry and plum flavors. It tastes peppery and persistently minty on the finish.
Name: Filus 2016 Uco Valley Vineyards Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: This is Malbec in a South American style: soft, with ripe and gentle berry fruit. It has a light structure and plenty of acidity on the finish.
Name: Les Domaines Auriol 2016 Le Réveil Malbec (Vin de France)

Description: Woody aromas of clove and spice clash a bit with jammy, stewy berry scents. This wine feels pushy and resiny, with high acidity that makes the palate feel tomatoey. Herbal, oaky plum and tomato flavors finish with a blanket of oak and related clove flavors.
Name: Valentín Bianchi 2015 Famiglia Bianchi Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Crisp cherry and plum aromas are gritty. This Malbec shows wiry acidity but the palate is still a touch soupy. Salty plum and oak spice flavors include notes of clove and pepper. As a whole, this is oaky and fairly heavy.
Name: La Posta 2015 Pizzella Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Leather, raisin, cherry and mild green aromas feed into a full, chewy palate that's kind of blocky. Medicinal, herbal plum and berry flavors are standard and finish with herbal, spicy notes.
Name: Finca Las Moras 2016 Alma Mora Malbec (San Juan)

Description: Lightly spicy raspberry aromas are raw and peppery. This feels fleshy and pulpy, with punchy acidity. Peppery berry flavors are boosted by toasty oak that carries over to a mildly hot finish.
Name: Valentín Bianchi 2015 Sensual Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Earthy, murky aromas of cherry and plum lack freshness and brightness. This wine is jammy and a bit clumsy on the palate, with saucy, savory berry and plum flavors. An herbal, jammy-tasting finish leaves you wanting more.
Name: Finca Adelma 2014 Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Medicinal cherry and plum aromas set up a palate with clipped, hard tannins. Forced flavors of oak and carob are more obvious than the wine's plum and cassis notes. Oak dominates the creamy, charred finish.
Name: Finca El Origen 2016 Estate Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Earthy berry aromas come with woodspice notes. This is raw and acidic on the palate, and overall it feels prickly and a bit disjointed. Saucy plum flavors are salty, while the punch of red-fruit acidity propels a tangy finish.
Name: Los Andicos 2016 Selección Especial Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: Bright red fruit highlights this soft wine. Acidity and hint of stalky tannins give its red berry flavors a boost. It's easygoing and ready to drink.
Name: Fat Bastard 2016 Malbec (Vin de France)

Description: Jammy, roasted aromas are more savory and offbeat than common and fruity. This Malbec has a fresh but choppy mouthfeel and flavors of tomato, basil and herbal berry fruits. A savory finish conforms with the rest of the wine.
Name: Ruca Malen 2015 Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Black plum and black currant are jammy on the brambly nose. The smooth tannins take a backseat to the jammy and plummy black fruits on the medium-bodied palate. There is just enough acidity to keep this wine from turning flabby. Black plum, a touch of baking spice and warmth linger on the finish.
Name: The Infinite Monkey Theorem 2015 Malbec (Grand Valley)

Description: Earthy, mulchy berry aromas lack freshness and clarity. This is a dense, meaty, thick Malbec with stewed black-plum and woodspice flavors. Used tea bag and baked berry flavors show on the finish.
Name: Maal 2015 Biutiful Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Raisin and prune aromas are up front, and overall this Malbec is not showing any fresh fruit on the nose. A wide palate lacks cut and shape, while this tastes weedy, raisiny and green.
Designation: Famiglia Bianchi Made with Organically Grown Grapes
Name: Valentín Bianchi 2015 Famiglia Bianchi Made with Organically Grown Grapes Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux, Bordeaux, France
Description: Although it effectively disappeared from Bordeaux after phylloxera, Malbec hung on in Blaye on the north side of the Gironde Estuary. This wine, part of a single-parcel (lieu dit in French) single-varietal range, is richly structured and powerfully dense. It has great tannins and also bold ripe black fruits. Drink this concentrated wine from 2020.
Name: Les Vignerons de Tutiac 2014 Lieu-Dit Ter Pointe  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of raspberry, plum, freshly ground black pepper, herb and wood spice lead to pure tart cranberry and cherry flavors that bring a compelling feel. The tannins bring a light squeeze. It's a lovely example of the variety.
Name: Spring Valley Vineyard 2014 Estate Grown Malbec (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine opens with aromas of green herb, purple fruit, orange peel and wood spice. The palate brings sweet but tart cranberry and cherry flavors that possess a velvety feel. It's an intriguing example of the variety.
Name: Stevens 2014 StevensTimley Malbec (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Varietal Malbec is rarity from this appellation. This one brings aromas of purple fruit, barrel spice, black pepper, plum and spice that are followed by pitch-black-fruit flavors. The tannins bring a gentle squeeze.
Name: Col Solare 2014 Component Collection Estate Vineyard Malbec (Red Mountain)

Description: This 100% Malbec from Hervè Lhuillier's young 2.5-acre parcel is a spicy ripe wine that reflects the warmth of the vintage. Great tannins and bold fruitiness are well blended for a wine that has good potential. Drink from 2019.
Name: Château Fleur Haut Gaussens 2015 La Viminière  (Bordeaux Supérieur)

Appellation: Snipes Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: It's relatively rare to see bottles from this appellation. High-toned aromas of herb, flower, dark plum and white pepper lead to ripe sweet plump cherry flavors. The structure is light but it delivers a lot of easy-drinking appeal.
Name: Lauren Ashton Cellars 2013 Malbec (Snipes Mountain)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Purple fruit and wood spice intermingle on the aromas, along with clove, herb and baking spice, showing a touch of volatility. The fruit flavors are big and bold, bringing a sense of structure and liveliness. It's an intriguing example of the variety from an up-and-coming vineyard.
Name: Kontos 2014 Summit View Vineyard Malbec (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Rattlesnake Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas of marionberry, licorice and herb bring a sense of purity, along with light whiffs of oxidation. The dark-fruit flavors are a strange mixture of sweet and tart, not entirely coming together. It doesn't quite stand up on its own but should fit in well at the dinner table.
Name: Catman 2015 Malbec (Rattlesnake Hills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas bring notes of apple, hay, medicine cabinet, pepper and game. The flavors are plush in feel, seeming ever so slightly dried out. Still, it brings some appeal.
Name: Guardian 2015 Newsprint Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Bold, but complete and well-balanced, this full-bodied wine from a Sierra Foothills stalwart is packed with opulent black plum and cassis flavors and a firmly tannic texture. It starts with lightly smoky, peppery aromas and finishes with lingering fruit, spice and mocha notes. Best after 2020.
Name: Miraflores 2013 Estate Malbec (El Dorado)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Cloak & Dagger's film noir styling fits the dark and brooding character of this wine. Cola and graphite aromas mix with fresh blackberry and blueberry on the nose. The palate is well-structured with tangy, plum skin-like acidity while delivering satisfying dark chocolate, black olive and black cherry flavors.
Name: Cloak & Dagger 2013 Espionage Bon Niche Vineyard Malbec (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is an aromatic wine, with generous notes of potpourri, clove, dried herb and purple fruit. The palate is lush and fruit forward, supported by tart, vibrant acidity. It's lovely on its own but should really sing at the dinner table.
Name: Seven Hills 2014 McClellan Estate Malbec (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This wine tastes concentrated and powerful, from the first whiff of spicy cedar and black pepper to the smoky, dried fruit flavors and mouth-coating texture. It owes its savory, smoky character to its exceptionally long 30-month oak ageing. Yet while bold and assertive, its alcohol is restrained.
Name: Cuda Ridge Wines 2013 Reserve Malbec (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Red Hills, Lake County, California, US
Description: Dark color and black fruit aromas set the expectation for a big wine, but this is remarkably well-balanced, poised and smooth. Its black cherry and blackberry flavors are satifying, dry and not overripe, and its hints of cocoa add delicious complexity.
Name: Chacewater 2013 Malbec (Red Hills)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Classy and complex oak nuances give the aromas and flavors of this wine a suave, spicy personality. Grilled baguette and cedar notes merge nicely with its focused and concentrated berry and black cherry flavors.
Name: Fenestra 2012 Ghielmetti Vineyard Malbec (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Heavily toasted oak aromas precede spicy, black fruit flavors in this full-bodied, tannic wine. It fires on all cylinders, from its intense smoky, charred aromas to its concentrated blackberry flavors to its mouth-coating, fine-grained tannins that grip the palate and help the finish linger.
Name: Shannon 2014 Home Ranch Reserve Malbec (Lake County)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Big, ripe and a touch earthy, this wine embraces dried fruit flavors, full body, firm tannins and broad, mouth-filling texture. Dried plum and black cherry flavors follow toasty, oaky, new leather aromas.
Name: Las Positas 2014 Estate Malbec (Livermore Valley)

Description: Not your typical Malbec, this Bulgarian version has aromas of tobacco leaf and cassis, and flavors of tart cherry and red plum. It offers soft tannins and a finish filled with tastes of red fruits.
Name: Midalidare 2013 Grand Vintage Mogilovo Single Vineyard Malbec (Thracian Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas are quite light, with notes of woodspice and herb. The palate is more showy, with sweet, ripe purple-fruit flavors backed by oak spices, missing a bit in the middle.
Name: Swiftwater Cellars 2014 Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Unique, high-toned aromas of freshly peeled orange, potpourri, clove and blue fruit lead to lighter styled, tart, plentiful plum flavors. This wine doesn't stand up on its own but should fit in well at the dinner table.
Name: Three Rivers 2014 Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: On first pour, the aromas of toast, char, spice and herb show some reduction that blows off over time. The purple-fruit flavors are lighter in style, showing a pleasing sense of purity, with the concentration dipping in the middle before coming back together on the finish.
Name: Columbia Crest 2014 Reserve Beverly Vineyard Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Barrel notes dominate, with aromas of vanilla, pencil lead and coconut shavings out in front of purple fruit that's struggling to get to the surface. The palate is tart and elegantly styled, but the wood takes over the show.
Name: Ribbon Cliff 2013 Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This aromatically unusual wine, with notes of cocoa and green herb, seems to show some oxidation. The purple fruit and orange-peel flavors are on the lighter side of medium bodied, pulling up on the finish.
Name: Gamache 2012 Estate Grown Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Central Spain, Spain
Description: Exotic cardamom and mint notes turn green the longer this rough wine breathes. Its narrow palate recalls alfalfa, mint and boysenberry, helping explain why Malbec is almost nonexistent in Spain.
Name: Finca La Estacada 2015 Ocho y Media Malbec (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

Description: Coming from a seven-acre vineyard named after the dovecote on the property, this is a magnificent wine. Powered by both fruit tannins and the 28 months of new wood aging, it is darkly rich and with great concentration. As a sign of its pedigree, there is also elegance here, a restraint which is new to this wine. That makes it a wine for long-term aging. Drink from 2022.
