Description: Gritty plum and berry flavors are a touch rough. This is tight on the palate, but fair. Dry flavors of minty oak and clove are more out front than salty berry notes, while this is firm and tastes like roasted fruit, oak and salted tomato on the finish.
Name: Fincas Don Martino 2015 Old Vine Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Foxy plum and berry aromas suggest wet animal fur. This feels jammy and resiny, with herbal flavors of minty plum. A spicy minty lightly green finish revolves around medicinal berry flavors.
Name: Aniello 2015 006 Riverside Estate Malbec (Patagonia)

Description: Gritty aromas of grilled beef and asphalt blend with savory berry scents. Frankly, this is rough on the palate, with abrasive tannins. Savory herbal green-leaning flavors are peppery and bitter on a grabby finish.
Name: Altamira 2010 de los Andes Reserve Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: Jumbled jammy berry aromas lack specificity. This has a forceful tartaric mouthfeel that supports tart plum and currant flavors. Keeping things consistent, this is angular and acidic on the finish, with sour plum and racy berry flavors.
Name: Finca La Luz 2015 Callejon del Crimen Reserva Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: Merlot makes its way into this blend at 15%, contributing additional smoothness and approachability. Simple layers of plum and dark cherry vie for attention against a backdrop of leathery meat before a straightforward finish.
Name: Spann Vineyards 2012 Five Barrels Malbec (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Citrus and cherry fruit flavors come up together, in a wine with chewy drying tannins. Aged in 30% new American oak, it finishes tart and astringent.
Name: Weisinger 2013 Gold Vineyard Malbec (Rogue Valley)

Description: Generic berry aromas are a touch gritty. This Malbec feels grabby and rubbery, while savory, lightly stewed and herbal berry flavors end with a light brushstroke of oak along with a lasting note of gamy meat.
Name: Whatabout Me 2014 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Reedy green-leaning aromas of plum and raspberry feed into a creamy palate. This tastes primarily of herbal red-berry fruits that finish oaky, dry and spicy.
Name: Trapiche 2014 Oak Cask Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: This is a somewhat dull red, leathery in texture and simple in approach, offering a mix of black cherry and licorice.
Name: St. Supéry 2013 Dollarhide Estate Vineyard Malbec (Napa Valley)

Description: Heavy raisin and prune aromas are inescapable. Plodding and overweight, this tastes like it smells, while the finish is raisiny. This strives for that lush style of Malbec, but it's short on balance.
Name: Alpamanta 2010 Estate Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Soupy, creamy black-fruit scents are smothered by heavy oak-based aromas of clove and resin. This is so thick and viscous that it feels greasy. Dominant flavors of clove and raw oak finish with notes of carob and mint.
Name: Finca Adelma 2014 El Capitan Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Valle de Uco, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Ripe, dark, baked aromas of pastry, turned-up earth, campfire and wild-berry fruits set up a seriously deep and tannic palate that's stacked with black-fruit power, toasty oak and intensity. This tastes blackened, toasty and chocolaty on top of core blackberry and cassis flavors, while an oaky finish with peppery spice is just right for this type of burly wine. Drink through 2022.
Name: François Lurton 2013 Chacayes Malbec (Valle de Uco)

Description: Big, full, ripe and black as night, this may be the best Apartado Gran Malbec to date. With ripe berry weight and fresh acidity, this is in fine balance. Toasty, blackened flavors of blackberry finish deep, smooth and dense. While this cuts no new ground, it's a delicious, well-made, power Malbec. Drink through 2022.
Name: Rutini 2013 Apartado Gran Malbec (Argentina)

Description: This wine opens in a depth of compostable earth and leathery smoke, unleashing a bold, big-boned body of tannin and oaky weight as it expands on the palate. Juicy, it releases aromas of violets within the more robust waves of flavor.
Name: Patland 2013 Terra Del Cuore Estate Grown Malbec (Napa Valley)

Description: Grapy, jammy boysenberry and blueberry aromas are exotic, with integrated barrel and spice notes. This feels weighty but balanced; flavors of blueberry, currant and chocolate finish with plum-like juiciness and length. Drink through 2021.
Name: Gimenez Riili 2013 Gran Familia Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: With an opaque purple color and boysenberry aromas that include notes of raisin and prune, this obtuse, chunky Malbec shows hard tannins and deep, dark flavors of black olive, fig, prune and roasted meat. A toasty, slightly hot finish with licorice notes is bullish. Drink this concentrated, ripe Malbec through 2020.
Name: Bodegas Fabre 2013 Phebus Gran Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Opaque to the eye, this is rich, heady and full of inky blackberry aromas and notes of graphite, balsam wood, tobacco and coconut. A lush, mile-deep palate offers chocolaty flavors of blackberry, roasted meat and salt. Ripe black-fruit flavors dominate a lush finish. Drink through 2020.
Name: Fabre Montmayou 2013 Gran Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Jammy raspberry and plum aromas come with accents of dusty herbs and black licorice. A saturated, lush, jammy palate features soft, baked flavors of cassis and wild berry, while the finish delivers mint, chocolate and lasting berry ripeness. Drink through 2019.
Name: TintoNegro 2013 Finca La Escuela Estate Grown Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A youthful expression of the grape, this bottling is clean and fresh on the nose with pressed olallieberries, candied blueberries, violet extract and a nicely smoky char component as well. There is exuberant energy on the sip, where that candied blueberry flavor is cut by savory miso-like flavors. Relatively light and lithe, this would pair with a wide variety of foods.
Name: Rideau 2014 Siempre Happy Canyon Vineyard Malbec (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

Description: Perfumed in violet, white pepper and leather, this expansive, medium-bodied red is sourced largely from vineyards in Coombsville, with 4% Cabernet Sauvignon added in. It explodes in blueberry, while taming its tannins through bright acidity.
Name: Ilaria 2013 Malbec (Napa Valley)

Description: Ripe black-fruit aromas are backed by hints of road tar and toasty oak. A round, firm palate feels right, while familiar high-end Malbec flavors of blackberry, baking spices and chocolate end with controlled tannins, spice notes and a full-bodied feel that's not too fleshy or soft. Drink through 2021.
Name: Nieto Senetiner 2013 Don Nicanor Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: This charred specimen smells resiny and of blackened oak, with grapy berry scents thrown in. In the mouth, this is rock solid and balanced. Heavily oaked resiny flavors rest on top of core blackberry fruit, while this shows woody dry tannins and salty baked berry flavors on the finish.
Name: Alma de los Andes 2013 Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Warm woodsy berry and prune aromas blend with notes of animal fur and mint. This is full and grabby, but not out of shape. Flavors of raisin and blackberry feature accents of charred oak and creosote, while this ends with roasted, blackened, meaty flavors, mild heat and sticky tannins. Drink through 2021.
Name: Finca Sophenia 2014 Synthesis Malbec (Tupungato)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This 100% varietal wine opens with alluring aromas of plum, clove, stems and spice. The purple-fruit flavors are palate coating, speckled with cocoa and barrel accents throughout.
Name: JM Cellars 2013 Margaret's Vineyard Malbec (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Cracked pepper, dried blueberries, dried violets and strong bay-leaf aromas show prominently on the nose of this bottling from the southern stretches of the Bay Area. There is solid depth to the flavors, with dill, fennel and a savory, peppery teriyaki element spicing up the blackberry and olallieberry fruit.
Name: Martin Ranch 2013 Thérèse Vineyards Dos Niñas Vineyard Malbec (Santa Clara Valley)

Description: This vineyard is within the relatively cool Coombsville appellation. It leaves a memorable impression in its happy mix of violets, white pepper and blueberry, completely robust in integrated tannin. Boldly built, it's balanced, with a softness to the finish.
Name: Sergio 2013 Dr. Reid Vineyard Malbec (Napa Valley)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Plump lusciously ripe black plum and cherry flavors are offset by a tantalizing edge of acidity and fine penetrating tannins in this neatly composed Malbec. It's supple and full in body yet refreshing and brisk. Drinks well already but should continue to improve through 2021.
Name: Harbes Family Vineyard 2014 Malbec (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: Depths of earth and tobacco define this well-made, robust and lengthy wine, given to both red and blue berry fruit and plenty of juicy acidity. It shows again how well the grape seems to do in this appellation from specific sites.
Name: J. Rickards 2014 Zanzi Curve Vines Malbec (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Blueberry, blackberry, black pepper and smoke swirl into a rather reserved and elegant nose on this bottling, one of the few Malbecs made in the mountainous region. There is great tannic tension to the acid-driven palate, with blackcurrant and dried-violet flavors adding to that blackcurrant and black-pepper base.
Name: Lexington 2013 Gist Ranch Estate Malbec (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Description: Roasted, gritty, herbal berry aromas are more rustic than polished. This feels big but obtuse. Flavors of blueberry and savory plum are a touch salty and leathery, while this tastes of briny blue fruits on an oaky, grabby finish.
Name: Finca Decero 2013 Remolinos Vineyard Malbec (Agrelo)

Description: Jammy and reduced on the nose, this smells gritty and gaseous. In the mouth, this is clampy and tannic. Medicinal flavors of blueberry are proprietary to this wine and frankly a touch green in the middle. That said, the heavy and herbal tasting finish seems fitting.
Name: Viña Cobos 2013 Malbec (Perdriel)

Description: Challenging aromas of roasted beet, horseradish, herbal blackberry and animal hide lead to a meaty dense palate with rock-hard tannins. Flavors of black plum, blackberry and toasty oak are fiery, intense and carry over to a hot finish.
Name: Benvenuto de la Serna 2014 Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: Wiry, slightly volatile aromas of blackberry and cassis come with rooty notes and a mild shot of vinegar. This feels solid and creamy, with lactic oak creating chewy weight. Flavors of blackberry, vanilla and caramel are roasted and salty, while the finish tastes toasty, minty and oaky, with hard tannins.
Designation: Gran Reserva Vista Flores Single Vineyard
Name: Finca El Origen 2014 Gran Reserva Vista Flores Single Vineyard Malbec (Uco Valley)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of vanilla, clove, cocoa, tar and plum are followed by generous purple-fruit flavors, speckled with baking-spice accents. It dips in the middle but otherwise shows a pretty sense of elegance.
Name: Market Vineyards 2012 Merval Malbec (Red Mountain)

Description: Deep, dense raisin, prune and blackberry aromas set up a chunky palate that follows the nose. Blackened, slightly bitter flavors of baked berry fruits and licorice finish with some chop and heat along with a continuation of the wine's licorice flavor.
Name: Bodegas Fabre 2014 Phebus Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Reedy red-fruit aromas are woody and a touch medicinal. This feels round but edgy, with grabby prodding tannins. Savory herbal berry flavors with salted plum notes finish with overt oak and rubbery tannins.
Name: Luigi Bosca 2014 Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

Appellation: Vin de Liqueur, France Other, France
Description: This ripe, sweet wine is rich and full of dried and fresh fruit flavors. It is spicy, with a touch of spirit on the palate as well as bold black-plum fruit, dense tannins and a sweet aftertaste. Drink from 2017.
Name: Château du Cèdre 2012 Le Cèdre Vintage Malbec (Vin de Liqueur)

Description: Chocolate, mocha and espresso mark this big, bold and full-bodied wine that includes a touch of Petit Verdot in the mix. Smoky and smooth, it's ready for cigars or hearty winter platters.
Name: Charles Krug 2013 Limited Release Malbec (Napa Valley)

Description: Dry earthy aromas of herbal raspberry and tomato are reserved in a good way. There's acidic lift to a rugged palate, while berry fruit flavors blend with spice notes prior to a tannic finish.
Name: Tamarí 2014 Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: On the nose, this smells of burnt oak, raisin and ultraripe cherry. The palate is compact and heavy, with chewy density. Baked, rooty flavors of cola, prune and chocolaty oak finish with thick, candied berry residuals.
Name: Durigutti 2015 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Earthy aromas of raisin, blackberry, barnyard and animal are dense. This feels clampy, grabby and heavy, with just enough acidity to maintain a sense of balance. Salty, savory plum and berry flavors finish with a final wave of salt and earthy, roasted berry fruit.
Name: Chakana 2014 Estate Selection Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Aromas of oak, mint and cola accent earthy black-fruit scents in front of a palate that's tannic and raw but firm and structured. Berry and salty, oaky flavors finish with grabby, drying tannins and peppery spice.
Name: Zuccardi 2014 Q Malbec (Valle de Uco)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas of tar, clove, wood spice and dark fruit show nuance. The flavors are velvety and full, pinching together on the finish. The oak seems a bit prominent at times.
Name: Swiftwater Cellars 2013 Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Grapy aromas of violet petal and blackberry are gritty and earthy. This feels outright tannic and edgy. Herbal, lightly green flavors of roasted black fruits settle on chocolate, spice and more herbs on a powerful but hot finish.
Designation: Aruma, Domaines de Barons de Rothschild (Lafite) + Nicolas Catena
Name: Bodegas Caro 2015 Aruma, Domaines de Barons de Rothschild (Lafite) + Nicolas Catena Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Inky cool herbal black-fruit aromas set up a choppy tight palate with pounding tannins. Flavors of black coffee and blackberry are heavily toasted. The finish keeps that toasty theme while introducing notes of pepper and horseradish.
Name: Gimenez Mendez 2015 100 Años Viñas Mendoza Malbec (Montevideo)

Appellation: Valle de Uco, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Cherry and currant aromas come with soupy notes and a blast of animal fur. Although this is aggressive and choppy on the palate, it's loaded with grapy, slightly stewed berry and plum flavors. A similar tasting finish turns more rough and warm with airing.
Name: Santa Julia 2015 Reserva Malbec (Valle de Uco)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Rustic, gritty berry aromas come with notes of plastic, oak grain and grass. This is raw, chewy and tannic in feel, with roasted, spicy berry flavors that run low on ripeness. A salt-and-pepper finish includes herbal berry flavors and sticky tannins.
Name: Luigi Bosca 2014 Single Vineyard A.O.C. Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Already a full five-years-old, this cool vintage wine brings aromas of freshly brewed coffee, baking spice, vanilla, green herb and tobacco. The flavors are light and elegant, showing a pretty styling but the concentration doesn't always seem fully there.
Name: Basel Cellars 2011 Estate Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Minty oak aromas are the greeting on this herbal and foxy Malbec that feels crisp and chippy due to high acidity and grating tannins. Flavors of herbal berry and plum are oaky and a touch hot, while rubbery tannins and herbal berry leftovers drive the finish.
Name: Casarena 2014 Estate Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

Description: Dark dense tarry aromas of blackberry and cassis are a touch stewy and flat. This feels wide and grabby, with grapy flavors of blackberry and plum. A jammy feeling finish with berry flavors has a dark and toasty side to it.
Name: Rutini 2015 Trumpeter Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: A huge blast of hickory, clove and grainy oak controls the nose on this tannic, wide-bodied Malbec that's outright woody and resiny from front to back. Oak-driven flavors of savory spice and clove lead to a resiny tasting finish with sticky tannins.
Name: Valentín Bianchi 2014 Famiglia Bianchi Malbec

Description: Grassy and herbal berry aromas suggest beet root. This is gritty and severe on the palate, with bone-dry tannins. Blackened, lightly bitter berry flavors finish with drawing tannins and a charcoal-like burn.
Name: Alma de los Andes 2014 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Aromas of wet cement, plastic and berry fruits are derivative of heavy oak. This feels as weighty as the nose, but with creaminess. Roasted black-fruit flavors share the stage with campfire and clove, while oak and clove are the dominant flavors on a forceful, heavy finish.
Name: François Lurton 2015 Santa Celina Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Juicy brick tar and a sumptuous offering of blueberry and blackberry pie characterize this medium-bodied, softly approachable and easygoing red. Hints of smoky oak and dried herb lurk in the background.
Name: Picket Fence 2014 Miller Creek Vineyard Malbec (Alexander Valley)

Description: Floral raspberry aromas are jammy and funky, like many Cafayate Malbecs are prone to be. This feels juicy but high in acidity, so it's pointy on the palate. Exotic plum and raspberry flavors follow the nose, while the finish is fresh, high in acidity and low on cushion.
Name: Quara 2014 Special Selection Malbec (Cafayate)

Description: Aromas of blackberry and prune are earthy, warm and cheesy. This feels heavy and syrupy but not out of whack. Roasted, blackened flavors of grapy berry fruits finish with mint, clove and peppery notes.
Name: Black Cabra 2015 Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Leathery aromas of dried, sour blueberries show on the nose of this bottling. That sour-berry component extends to the palate, where tar, dried tobacco and more leather make for a somewhat tired sip.
Name: Midnight 2013 Solstice Malbec (Paso Robles)

Description: Despite showing somewhat volatile berry aromas, this is more than solid as a whole. Wiry angularity on the palate is offset by fleshy berry fruit, while flavors of plum, blackberry and salt are a touch grassy in front of a superficial finish that's slightly hot.
Name: Torrevieja 2015 Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Valle de Uco, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Grapy aromas suggest minerals and iodine along with wet animal fur and plum. It's firm and tannic on the palate, with herbal, rooty plum and berry flavors and a tight finish.
Name: Zuccardi 2015 Serie A Malbec (Valle de Uco)

Description: Uncommon exotic blueberry aromas are lean and grassy. In the mouth, this is high in acidity and scouring. Flavors match the nose, meaning this tastes sour and exotic, while the finish is sharp and scrubbing.
Name: Casa Montes 2014 Ampakama Malbec (San Juan)

Description: Stewed, saucy aromas of grassy tomato and herbal berry fruits are foxy. This feels cutting and rough, while minty green-berry flavors come with a note of animal fur.
Name: Cruz Alta 2014 Reserve Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Sappy volatile berry and plum aromas lead to sharp citric palate. This tastes of sour plum and herbs, while oaky spice and clove notes rise up on the finish.
Name: Valentín Bianchi 2015 Elsa Bianchi Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Aromas of plastic and weedy berry fruits are not a draw. This feels dilute and pulling. Weedy, raw, tart red-berry flavors finish with green notes of mint and leafy herbs.
Name: Michel Torino 2015 Coleccion Malbec (Calchaquí Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: So dark the wine stains the glass the instant it's poured, this plush, dense and pure varietal effort pulls together crushed raspberries, ripe cherries, tanned leather, cut tobacco, cedar and spice components. They are well-matched and captivating; the aromas are like sticking your nose into an especially spicy cigar box.
Name: Troon 2013 Malbec (Rogue Valley)

Description: This is a rich wine, full of juicy fruit and attractive acidity. A blend of 95% Malbec and 5% Merlot, it has touches of wood aging along with the tannins. It will develop quickly, so drink from 2018.
Name: Vignobles Arbo 2014 Arbo Malbec  (Côtes de Bordeaux)

Description: Produced from organically grown grapes, this powerful and impressive expression of pure Malbec is generous while also solid and firm. It has plenty of dark tannins to go with the solid fruits and tense acidity. Produced from selected parcels, it is a wine to age further. Drink from 2019.
Name: Château Haut-Monplaisir 2012 Pur Plaisir Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Produced from organically grown grapes, this is the top of Troteligotte range. It is made from 25-year-old vines, and aged in amphorae. That gives a wine that is rich with soft rounded tannins and juicy blackberry fruits. It has a dense texture from aging on the lees in the amphorae. Rich and concentrated it will age and should not be drunk until 2020.
Name: Clos Troteligotte 2014 K-2 Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Pure Malbec, this wine from organic grapes is black, dark and powerful. It's driven by its tannins and dry wood and fruit flavors. For the moment, this serious, structured wine is waiting on the fruit to develop. It's a complex, spicy, dense wine that shouldn't be drunk before 2020.
Name: Château du Cèdre 2013 Le Cèdre Malbec (Cahors)

Description: This is a powerful wine, full of dark fruits and dense dry tannins. Even at four years old, it is still young. It is impressive in its concentration with fine acidity  and black-plum flavors mingling with the tannins. Drink this serious wine from 2018.
Name: Château Haut-Monplaisir 2012 Prestige Malbec (Cahors)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Boysenberries and olallieberries explode on the nose of this bottling by the ever-adventurous Riboli family, bolstered by dried tarragon and turned earth. It is wondrously smooth and silky on the sip, with rising blueberry fruit and tons of depth, offering dried sage and other roasting herbs as well as dark chocolate and espresso flavors.
Name: Opaque 2011 Malbec (Paso Robles)

Description: The top wine of the trilogy made at Château Ponzac, this is designed for aging. Mint flavors from new-wood barrels mingle with dark tannins and a concentrated texture. It is a powerful, ripe wine that certainly does need some time. Don't drink before 2020.
Name: Château Ponzac 2014 Eternellement Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Old vines (more than 45 years old) have produced this firm structured wine. It has dark tannins that give the wine concentration and a dense texture. Black-plum skin and blackberry fruit are shot through with acidity. The wine will be still better after some more aging, so drink from 2018.
Name: Château Nozières 2012 L'Elégance Malbec (Cahors)

Description: From a small parcel of vines in the Gaudou vineyard, this impressive wine is rich and still very young. Matured in egg-shaped tanks, it is dense with fruit as much as tannin, poducing a spicy wine full of black fruits and a dry core that is already well integrated. Drink from 2019.
Designation: Le Sang de la Vigne Signé Benjamin Cooker
Name: Château de Gaudou 2015 Le Sang de la Vigne Signé Benjamin Cooker Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Although there is a little Merlot and Tannat in the wine, it is 90% Malbec. Still firmly tannic, it is concentrated and spicy. It has a dark dry texture that is lifted by ripe blackberry fruit. With acidity cutting right through, the wine is nowhere near ready to drink. Wait until 2019.
Name: Château du Cèdre 2013 Malbec (Cahors)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine announces itself with bright aromas of plum, blueberry, dried herb and spice. The flavors are broad, with espresso and citrus flavors on the finish. It's a prototype for the variety.
Name: Dusted Valley 2013 Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Produced from 25-year-old vines, the wine was aged in oak for 24 months. It is a concentrated wine that is ripely spicy, full of black fruits and tannins that are still very present. It is a dense wine that will develop well, impressively rich and still balanced. Drink this wine from 2019.
Name: Clos Troteligotte 2012 K-Lys Malbec (Cahors)

Description: The wine is rich with a dusty tannic character. It has black-currant flavors that are packed with both fruitiness and balanced acidity. The organic grapes give a pure line of ripe fruits that are going to integrate well with the tannins. Drink starting from 2018.
Name: Clos Troteligotte 2015 K-Or Malbec (Cahors)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Vanilla, baking spice, coconut and dark fruit aromas lead to plush, plentiful purple-fruit flavors. It provides a lot of enjoyment and appeal, showing equal parts fruit and barrel.
Name: Fielding Hills 2013 Estate Riverbend Vineyard Malbec (Wahluke Slope)

Description: Aged in wood for 18 months, this eucalyptus-perfumed wine is solid, structured and still packed with tannins. It is made for long-term aging with its rich black fruits and dark structure. The concentration and ripe fruit both promise a fine future. Drink from 2020.
Name: Château de Gaudou 2013 Renaissance Malbec (Cahors)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas bring notes of plum, dark chocolate, clove and barrel spice. The flavors are forward and lush, showing irresistible appeal.
Name: Januik 2013 Weinbau Vineyard Malbec (Wahluke Slope)

Description: The middle wine in the trilogy of wines from the Molinié family at Ponzac, this is a ripe wine that has density, some firm tannins and rich black-plum fruit flavors. It is concentrated and firm at first and then fills out with the richness. Drink this wine from 2018.
Name: Château Ponzac 2014 Patiemment Malbec (Cahors)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Pleasing aromas of dark plum, clove, vanilla and spice are followed by a deft, flavorful palate. It hangs on the finish.
Name: Novelty Hill 2013 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Klipsun Vineyard provides the fruit for this wine, with 10% Boushey Syrah rounding it out. This wine offers aromas of herb and wet copper penny that lead to full-bodied, boisterous fruit flavors. It the aromas come together it could move up a notch or two.
Name: Sparkman 2014 Preposterous Malbec (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A smoky aroma of plum-sauce-coated beef roast wafts on the nose of this lush bottling, which also offers white pepper and lilac. Plump berries and a fine-grained tannic structure consume the palate, finishing on a light caramel note.
Name: Lucas & Lewellen 2013 Valley View Vineyard Malbec (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas of clove, flowers, black olive and spice are bright, followed by penetrating notes of boysenberry and plum. The palate is supple and in feel, showing concentration but still elegance to the fruit flavors.
Name: Gård 2013 Lawrence Vineyards Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Jammy blueberry and cassis aromas are sturdy but not flamboyant. This chunky, full-bodied cheek grabber deals flavors of roasted berry, savory plum and spice. That same roasted character carries onto the finish.
Name: Echeverria 2013 Gran Reserva Malbec (Aconcagua Valley)

Description: Ripe aromas of baked cherry and plum lead to a powerful, firm palate with energy. This tastes meaty, salty and rugged, with black plum and cassis notes. The finish remains salty in flavor, with depth and cushion.
Name: Odfjell 2012 Orzada Made With Organic Grapes Malbec (Lontué Valley)

Description: This wine, with its black fruits and still-firm tannins, is crisp with intense acidity as well as black-currant fruitiness. Its ripe structure suggests the ability to age a little longer, and the wine will be best from 2018.
Name: Château Haut-Monplaisir 2014 Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Candied berry aromas are clean and pleasant. This is solid on the palate, with a bit of reduction. Jammy plum, cassis and spice flavors finish slightly raw in feel, with an oaky shading.
Name: Calcu 2013 Malbec (Colchagua Valley)

Description: Aromas of earthy cherry and plum are herbal in that patented Chilean way. Raw, fresh and with a mouthfeel pushed by acidity, this tastes of salty roasted plum and gamy meat. Tangy acidity and hard residual tannins make this more “country” than refined as a whole.
Name: Caliterra 2013 Tributo Single Vineyard Malbec (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Varietal Malbecs are an extreme rarity from this esteemed vineyard. This wine shows aromas of tar, plummy fruit and spice. The fruit flavors are generous yet reserved, trailing toward the finish.
Name: Januik 2013 Champoux Vineyard Malbec (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Rattlesnake Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: All Malbec aged in neutral oak, this wine opens with pure, penetrating aromas of plum, cedar, mushroom, spice and high-toned herbs. The palate is elegant in style—almost delicate—with bright, tart fruit flavors. Will show best at the dinner table.
Name: Savage Grace 2014 Côt Red Wine Dineen Vineyard Malbec (Rattlesnake Hills)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: An elegant balance of earth and fruit, this ripe, full-bodied Malbec offers luscious black-cherry flavor against a savory backdrop of bramble, mushroom and mineral. Dusty cocoa and blackberry-jam flavors are penetrating but comforting. Fine persistent tannins and a subtle singe of heat mark the finish.
Name: Clovis Point 2013 Malbec (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: Earthy cherry and cassis aromas are backed by bacon and generic gritty scents. This Maule Malbec feels chunky, while salty plum and oaky flavors finish with notes of hickory, savory meat and controlled heat.
Name: Viña el Aromo 2012 Private Reserve Malbec (Maule Valley)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of cocoa, vanilla, coconut and purple fruit are followed by ripe, generous fruit flavors. The oak seems a bit primary, making it drink more like a red wine than its variety.
Name: Bergevin Lane 2013 Dreamweaver Malbec (Wahluke Slope)

Description: In the trilogy of wines made at Ponzac, this is the one to drink young. It comes from chalky soil that gives soft tannins and ripe blackberry fruits. It is fruity and soft with just an edge of structure and with plenty of acidity to finish. Drink from 2017.
Name: Château Ponzac 2014 Maintenant Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Punchy, mildly herbaceous aromas of olive, herbs, tobacco and plum are classic Chilean scents. This cool-vintage Malbec is lively and a bit raw on the palate. Savory, roasted, oaky flavors of minty blackberry and plum finish dry, hot, peppery and ultimately a touch salty.
Name: Montes 2013 Alpha Malbec (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Succulent black cherries and berries are accented by sweet-savory touches of Graham cracker and nut on the nose of this fruit-forward Malbec. The palate is juicy and primary but bright acidity and bold, slightly tacky tannins lend structure to the finish.
Name: Osprey's Dominion 2013 Malbec (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: This crisp wine, flavored with black fruit is lightly tannic and deliciously full of lively fruit. It is full of juicy black-currant fruit and acidity with a soft texture that means it can be drunk now.
Name: Château du Cèdre 2014 Chatons du Cèdre Malbec (Cahors)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Black cherry, crushed rocks and light tarragon aromas hit the nose on this bottling that is perfect for everyday sipping. Tingling acidity unveils black cherry roll-up flavors and a touch of mocha foam.
Name: Clayhouse 2013 Red Cedar Vineyard Malbec (Paso Robles)

Description: There is no hint of wood in this fruity, lightly tannic wine. It has black-currant fruit, just a touch of dryness and juicy acidity. It's a simple, delicious wine that is ready to drink now.
Name: Château du Cèdre 2015 Marcel Malbec (Comté Tolosan)

Description: A fruity wine that is made to drink young. It has crunchy black-currant fruits that are cut with acidity, soft tannins and a juicy aftertaste. Drink this wine from 2017.
Name: Château du Cèdre 2014 Cèdre Héritage Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Light and fruity, this wine has blackberry flavors to balance its soft texture and dusty tannins. The wine has an earthy edge to go with its simple fruit and lively acidity. Drink now.
Name: Château du Cèdre 2015 Cedrus Malbec (Comté Tolosan)

Description: This is a fruity, perfumed wine with just enough structure to keep it all together. Fresh and with red fruit flavors, it is already drinkable.
Name: Rigal 2014 Oltesse Malbec (Cahors)

Description: From organic grapes and bottled without added sulfur, this is a fruity juicy wine with a strangely perfumed, geranium character. It has soft tannins, and hints of red fruits behind the perfume. The aftertaste is the only firm part of this fresh wine, which can be drunk young.
Name: Clos Troteligotte 2015 K-Pot' Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Earthy and stewy plum and berry aromas lead to heavy, clunky palate with leafy mulchy berry flavors. End notes of carob are mostly oak-based, while defined fruit notes are lacking.
Name: Conde de Velázquez 2013 El Conde Gran Reserva Malbec (Aconcagua Valley)

Description: This smoothly oak-aged wine is spicy with red fruits and light tannins. It has a juicy character with acidity and a soft texture that indicates the wine is ready to drink.
Name: Meyblum et Fils 2014 Les Illustres Honoré de Balzac Malbec (Cahors)

Description: This forcefully oaked, jammy Malbec smells like plastic, wood grain and cassis. The palate is a bit sticky. Flavors are herbal and sugary at the same time, while leftover herbal flavors control a low-acid finish.
Name: Montes 2013 La Finca Clos d'Angel Malbec (Colchagua Valley)

Description: This is a light fruity wine with surprisingly few tannins for a Malbec. It does have red fruits and some juicy acidity along with a bright aftertaste. Drink now.
Name: Rigal 2014 Les Fiefs d'Anglars Malbec (Comté Tolosan)

Description: Earthy mulchy aromas of tea and coffee grounds are oaky but unfocued, with a stewed-fruit character that's vintage Elqui Valley. This is creamy and resiny, a reflection of 24 months of oak aging. Herbal, heavily woody flavors of clove and roasted dark-berry fruits finish minty and resiny.
Name: Elqui Wines 2013 Limited Release Malbec (Elqui Valley)

Description: This is a simple, red-fruit-flavored wine. It has soft tannins, a bright texture and fresh aftertaste. Drink now.
Name: Meyblum et Fils 2014 Les Illustres Chateaubriand Malbec (Cahors)

Description: If you're into big Argentinean Malbecs with great fruit, oak and balance, look no further. This is exact and pointy on the nose, with graphite and spice notes framing huge blackberry aromas. Deep but well balanced, this muscular Malbec tastes of chocolate, peppercorn, fine oak and black fruits. A smooth, toasty finish is bold, with a touch of unresolved heat. Drink through 2022.
Name: Lamadrid 2011 Matilde Single Vineyard Malbec (Agrelo)

Description: Blackberry and toasty aromas show rich notes of fig and oaky coconut. Wall-to-wall tannins make for a firm mouthfeel, while balsamic, earthy berry and cedar flavors feature a shot of red raspberry for balance. Drink this integrated Malbec through 2022.
Name: Mi Terruño 2011 Mayacaba Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: This is a top-dog Malbec from start to finish. Aromas of cassis, black plum and blackberry are well oaked and in harmony with each other. While this is tannic, rubbery and hard in feel, the wine's lusty plum, raisin, chocolate and herbal flavors can handle it. A spicy, toasty, chocolaty finish is fully oaked and strapping. Drink through 2023.
Name: Salentein 2013 Pr1mum Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: This Malbec is exceedingly ripe from start to finish. Aromas of blackberry, raisin, char and loamy earth announce a 16% heavyweight that holds onto its elegance. Flush, plump and elastic on the palate, this tastes of fig, blackberry, cassis and mocha. Chocolate and woodspice flavors drive a lush, dense finish that's a touch hot. Drink through 2020.
Name: Bodega Renacer 2012 R Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Deep, ripe, layered berry aromas come with notes of pastry and licorice. This feels tight and pure, with juicy acidity that prevents things from seeming too heavy. Blackberry, cassis, wood grain and peppery spice flavors finish long and impressive, with rich notes of fig paste and chocolate. Drink through 2022.
Name: Finca la Celia 2012 Heritage Single Vineyard Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: This fully ripe vineyard-designated Malbec deals aromas of blackberry, cassis, raisin and cedar cigar box. Seriously built and almost monolithic in size and stature, this offers a wave of upfront oak that frames blackberry, loamy earth and baking spice flavors. A woody, persistent, elegant finish is a fine way for this to fade out. Drink through 2023.
Name: Salentein 2013 Single Vineyard La Pampa Estate Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: Aromas of balsam wood, blackberry, asphalt, leather and peppercorn combine into a complex and appealing whole. This is big and tannic, but with snappy acidity, it's harmonious. Blackberry, cassis and boysenberry flavors show chocolaty richness, while a moderately hot finish keeps things going in the right direction; drink through 2020.
Name: Bodega Rolland 2013 Mariflor Michel Rolland Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: This opaque Malbec weighs in heavy, with fully ripe aromas of jammy blackberry, raisin and baking spices. A gigantic palate is packed with lemony acidity and resiny oak. Flavors of blackberry, prune and cassis come with chocolaty richness. The finish is rugged and hard, with massive tannins. Drink through 2022.
Name: Mendel 2013 Finca Remota Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: Bold center-cut oak aromas are lemony and resiny, while notes of coconut and vanilla are present along with cassis and plum scents. A saturated palate is full of power and energy. Flavors are heavily oak influenced, meaning mocha and coffee notes are as prominent as plum and berry fruit. Drink this serious Malbec through 2023.
Name: Mi Terruño 2010 Mayacaba Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Ripe, earthy aromas of cola, raisin, cassis and blackberry roll smoothly onto a fleshy but well-balanced palate. This high-end Malbec tastes ripe, a touch raisiny, earthy and loamy. Throw in a sensation of warmth and a note of chocolate on the finish, and this delivers the goods along with complexity. Drink through 2023.
Name: Vicentin 2012 Colosso Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Valle de Uco, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Ripe, loamy blackberry, prune and cassis aromas lead to a structured palate that boasts big, firm tannins. This offers dark, ripe flavors of wild berry, black plum and chocolate prior to a toasty finish that's largely subtle and smooth. Drink through 2021.
Name: Salentein 2013 Numina Spirit Vineyard Estate Bottled Malbec (Valle de Uco)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Ripe plum and berry aromas are wrapped in a bed of creamy, spicy, cheesy oak and related vanilla and tobacco scents. This is full and generous on the palate, but also a touch acidic. Plum, boysenberry and cherry flavors finish with spice, toast and blackened notes. Drink through 2021.
Name: Doña Paula 2011 El Alto Parcel Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Ripe berry aromas come with a smoky accent of tree bark. This wine is extracted and brimming with black-fruit tannins. Flavors of blackberry and cassis are secure and framed by toasty, slightly burnt oak. Blocky, big and long-running on the finish; drink through 2022.
Designation: Don Nicanor Single Vineyard Villa Blanca
Name: Nieto Senetiner 2010 Don Nicanor Single Vineyard Villa Blanca Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

Description: Raspberry, blackberry and tobacco aromas settle in front of a chewy, round, solidly built palate. Medicinal berry flavors come with notes of rooty spice and resiny oak. A finely oaked finish holds root beer and dark-berry flavors that smoothly fade out. Drink through 2021.
Name: Gratia 2011 Raftacco Vineyards Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Composed, mossy aromas of fern, black fruits and cedar are more subtle than the palate, which is intense and a bit grating. Dark flavors of chocolate, wild berry and mocha finish with depth, integrated tannins and chocolaty richness. Drink this blend of three vineyards through 2021.
Name: Alta Vista 2012 Terroir Selection Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Heady aromas of olive and balsamic blackberry come with touches of rubber and road tar in front of a dense, well-groomed palate that doesn't bite or overpower. Ripe blackberry, toast and baking spice flavors end with warmth and clarity. Drink through 2019.
Name: Vicentin 2013 Voraz Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Ripe, concentrated blackberry, cassis, oak and graphite aromas set up a burly palate that's stacked to the max. An oak-based note of popcorn sits atop a heavy palate with deep black-fruit and graphite flavors. An oaky finish with salty blueberry and cassis flavors is bolstered by fresh acidity. Drink through 2022.
Name: Kaiken 2012 Mai Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Blackberry and cassis aromas are malty and rich, with a lightly charred note of smoke. A smooth palate shows depth and balance, while this tastes of blackberry, chocolate, barrel spice and toast. On the finish, this is toasty, baked, warm and generous. Drink through 2022.
Name: Valentín Bianchi 2012 Particular Malbec

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Jammy blackberry and cassis aromas are weighty and touch up against raisiny. This feels deep and bold: Flavors of cassis, black plum and smoked meat end ripe and long, with racy acidity fueling the afterburners. Drink through 2022.
Name: Viña Cobos 2013 Bramare Marchiori Vineyard Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

Description: Crisp, toasty aromas of black cherry and cassis are impressive. This is a full-bodied Malbec with edgy tannins that stop short of being hard. Berry, chocolate and woodspice flavors finish smooth, long and complex, with a welcome note of cedar. Drink through 2020.
Name: Alpamanta 2012 Estate Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Valle de Uco, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Toasty cherry, blackberry and cassis aromas are lightly charred. Jammy but thorough and lush, this tastes of raisin, stewed berry fruits and baking spices. A dry, peppery, oaky finish is well integrated and echoes with a note of medicinal black fruit. Drink through 2021.
Name: Viña Cobos 2013 Bramare Zingaretti Vineyard Malbec (Valle de Uco)

Appellation: Valle de Uco, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Ripe, heady, slightly malty aromas of blackberry and plum set this on its way. In the mouth, there are scratchy, unresolved tannins and acidity to deal with along with salty flavors of oak, plum and cassis. A lasting, oaky finish with vanilla and butter notes provides for a good close out. Drink through 2020.
Name: Viña Cobos 2013 Bramare Malbec (Valle de Uco)

Description: With a mere 422 bottles produced, this review is barely more than academic, as it will be near impossible to track down some of this. Lucky/persistent lotto winners will experience a medium- to full-bodied red with a velvety mouthfeel, cassis, vanilla and cedar notes and something akin to charred tomato.
Name: Cloudburst 2012 Malbec (Margaret River)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Earthy berry aromas come with a note of balsam wood, tobacco and soy sauce. This is juicy, with sinewy tannins and a sense of perpetual hardness to the palate. Lightly herbal blackberry and plum flavors exhibit a stalky note. Toasty and tannic on the finish. Drink through 2022.
Name: Doña Paula 2010 El Alto Parcel Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

Description: Warm, earthy, slightly horsey berry aromas are brambly and spicy. This Malbec feels flush but reduced and hard at the edges. Potent but crude boysenberry and plum flavors show a raisiny note, while this is long at the end, with earth notes and lemon peel. Drink through 2018.
Name: Doña Paula 2011 Alluvia Parcel Malbec (Tupungato)

Description: Fiery cherry, blackberry, spice, toast and animal aromas lead to a racy, intense, narrow palate. Plum, blackberry and peppery flavors finish with toastiness, spice and juicy acidity that highlights the high tones in this blend of three Malbec vineyards. Drink through 2022.
Name: Doña Paula 2011 Selección de Bodega Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Smoky, roasted aromas of hickory and foresty berry fruits roll onto a palate that's bright and lifted by acidity. Oaky, spicy flavors of vanilla and mocha accent berry fruit, while a juicy finish with bold acidity and smoky, toasty notes of new oak closes this out. Drink through 2021.
Name: Nieto Senetiner 2012 Terroir Blend Estate Bottled Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Valle de Uco, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: A fully ripe bouquet brushes up against raisin notes but pulls back. This feels juicy and full of life. Flavors of toasty, spicy plum and cassis roll onto a rugged, slightly hot finish with chocolaty spice and lasting berry intensity. Drink through 2021.
Name: Viña Cobos 2013 Bramare Rebon Vineyard Malbec (Valle de Uco)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Woody berry and cassis aromas are inviting and strong. This feels high in acidity and maybe more racy than you'd expect for Luján. Dry, spicy red-fruit flavors flow on a stream of potent acidity, while this finishes tangy, herbal and spicy, with a zesty note of pie cherry. Drink through 2022.
Name: Viña Cobos 2013 Bramare Touza Vineyard Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

Description: Blackberry, earth and spice aromas prove that a bouquet can be complete with only a few ingredients. This feels rugged and tannic. Flavors of coconut, buttery oak and toast support berries fruit. This is choppy and pounds its way through the finish. Drink through 2021.
Name: Siete Fincas 2011 Gran Secreto Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: There's plenty to like in this Tupungato Malbec, but since it was made from young vines, it's limited in depth, with angularity to the palate. Flavors of spicy plum and berry come with substantial oaky support, while the finish is lively, bouncy and holding onto its acidity. This may not improve but it's definitely not fading; drink through 2024.
Name: Doña Paula 2010 Alluvia Parcel Malbec (Tupungato)

Description: Boysenberry and raspberry aromas are not simply dark, ripe and macho, but instead show herbal accents along with floral notes and cardamom. This is old vines Malbec with particular flavors of herbal, brushy berry and plum. On the finish, oaky spice, toast and coffee flavors keep the momentum going. Drink through 2021.
Name: TintoNegro 2013 1955 Vineyard Estate Grown Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Ripe and balsamic off the bat, this Malbec deals earthy, well-oaked aromas of baked black fruits. This is full but balanced, with nothing too severe or heavy on the palate. Black cherry, berry and vanilla flavors finish clean, mild and smooth. Drink through 2020.
Name: SonVida 2013 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Aromas of earthy, raisiny berry fruits, graphite, coffee grinds and wood smoke set up a jammy, plump palate with wavering focus. Spicy prune, berry and cassis flavors are rooty, while coffee, mocha and oak flavors dominate the finish. Drink through 2019.
Name: Sur de los Andes 2013 Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Cool aromas of cola, blackberry and earth come with cedary oak. In the mouth, this blend of three vineyards is abruptly tannic, actually choppy and hard. Plum and raspberry taste dry and toasty before a grating finish. Drink through 2023.
Name: Doña Paula 2010 Selección de Bodega Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Cool, earthy black-fruit aromas hint at leather and compost without fully going there. A smooth palate with mild to low acidity offers hardly any resistance or grab. Earthy flavors of baked plum and berry end with a hint of tea and stewed meat. Drink this soft-bodied Malbec through 2018.
Name: Vicentin 2013 Blend of Malbecs Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Moderately ripe berry and cassis aromas show an increasing level of wood grain as this breathes. A jammy palate is plump and medium deep, while flavors of earthy berry fruits and stewed plum taste smooth at the start but herbal and mossy on the finish.
Name: Viña Cobos 2013 Bramare Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

Description: Crisp, minerally cherry aromas come with a complex note of desert herbs. This feels totally fresh and full, basically just right. Nicely oaked, ripe flavors of plum and berry fruits are chocolaty, dry and spicy on the finish.
Name: Mascota 2015 La Mascota Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Deep, lush black-fruit aromas are warm and horsey. Tight and well built, this ripe Malbec tastes of toasty blackberry blended with chocolate. A smooth, balanced finish with lift and nothing overly heavy or oaky is fitting.
Name: Kaiken 2014 Ultra Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Lightly volatile, balsamic aromas blend with cedary notes and berry scents. This feels round and fresh, which is typical of the Uco Valley. Blueberry, spiced plum and cassis flavors finish with chocolaty oak and mocha flavors as well as juicy acidity.
Name: Filus 2013 Reserve Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: Depth and complexity are key parts of this ripe Malbec that opens with hints of mushroom and stewed berry fruits along with cedary oak and tobacco. Mature and dense on the palate, this mixes blackberry fruit with raisin and prune, then follows with tea, spice and chocolate flavors on the back palate and finish. Drink now.
Name: Finca Adelma 2012 El Capitan Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: This Malbec is strangely exotic, with unusual floral aromas that blend in Middle Eastern spices including cardamom. Massive and borderline over-extracted, this tastes earthy and baked, with herbal blackberry flavors. A blackened, peppery flavor dominates a finish that comes across as stewed.
Designation: Terroir Series Finca Orellana Single Vineyard
Name: Trapiche 2012 Terroir Series Finca Orellana Single Vineyard Malbec (La Consulta)

Description: This pitch-dark Malbec from Cafayate is concentrated and heavy on the nose, with grapy blackberry aromas that are doing their best to stay fresh and clean. A full-force, grapy palate deals chocolaty black-fruit flavors in front of a warm finish where toasty oak and graphite notes come onto the scene.
Name: Piattelli 2014 Grand Reserve Malbec (Cafayate)

Description: Upfront earthy aromas of black olive render this Malbec's berry notes as secondary. This feels chunky, even a bit flabby. Flavors of black fruits and peppery spice finish with a note of oaky mint and drying tannins. Drink now through 2018.
Name: Vicentin 2013 Gen Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Smoky, gritty black cherry and blackberry aromas are herbal and smell a bit like road tar. This is flush on the palate at first, then more tight and tannic. Flavors mostly reflect the nose, meaning this tastes gritty, peppery, toasted and herbal, with spicy berry flavors rolling out over the finish.
Name: Ruca Malen 2013 Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Alto Valle del Río Negro, Other, Argentina
Description: Wiry aromas of cherry and plum are forward and demanding. This is gravelly and a touch jagged in feel, with ripe, nicely proportioned plum and berry flavors. Baked, muscled-up qualities are spread evenly throughout this beefy Patagonian Malbec.
Name: Verum 2014 Malbec (Alto Valle del Río Negro)

Description: Horsey leather aromas are a big part of this Malbec's nose, which also includes vanilla and blackberry scents. Creamy and thick on the palate, this delivers meaty berry flavors that come with notes of root beer and chocolate. Round, warm, beefy berry flavors form the finish.
Name: Cadus 2013 Gualtallary Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: A heavily charred nose puts a burnt crust on top of earthy, savory red-berry aromas. This feels big and blocky. Savory, salty red-fruit flavors live under a heavy oak blanket, while char and burnt-meat flavors linger on the finish.
Name: Casarena 2011 Lauren's Vineyard Malbec (Agrelo)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Black plum, graphite and herbal tomato aromas are solid but subdued. There's weight to this Malbec but not much depth to the palate, while flavors of berry, cassis and tomato run low on complexity.
Name: Mendel 2013 Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

Description: Earthy, spicy plum and berry aromas are racy and a touch leathery. Grabby tannins make for a drawing mouthfeel, while this tastes of herbal plum and wild berry along with chocolate and mint. A dry, lightly oaked but spicy finish provides for a good ending.
Name: Valentín Bianchi 2014 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Dark, woody berry, mocha and herbal aromas are potent and fiery. This has a layered mouthfeel with raw tannins. Rich, oaky blackberry and cassis flavors finish with notes of prune, coffee and lingering spice.
Name: Sur de los Andes 2014 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Saucy, woody aromas of plum and berry are good but strained. This smacks down with high acidity and a sense of tomato. Salty flavors of tomato, herbs, red plum and currant remain salty on the finish.
Name: TintoNegro 2013 Finca La Escuela La Arena Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Stout up front, the nose is packed with black-fruit aromas. The palate feels a bit prickly and raw, while blackberry flavors run quick, with a chocolaty oak character popping up on a lean finish.
Name: Casa Montes 2012 Don Baltazar Malbec (San Juan)

Appellation: Valle de Uco, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Reedy aromas of olive, leather and oak are less than fruity and lush. This has a hard, edgy, abrasive mouthfeel along with pinched, salty flavors of plum and berry fruits. Earthy berry flavors and drying tannins are in charge on the finish.
Name: SignoSeis 2013 The Angel Oak Malbec (Valle de Uco)

Description: Floral currant and plum aromas fall squarely into the red-fruit spectrum. While not overly deep or dense, this has some weight to go with flavors of cassis, berry and chocolaty oak. It finishes mildly, with soft oak and a light herbal note.
Name: TintoNegro 2014 Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: This opaque Malbec smells grapy, with foxy animal notes mixed in. Flush on the palate, but with abrasive tannins, this tastes like it smells: grapy blackberry with herbal notes and mild toast make up the flavor profile. A dark, blackened finish is big and spicy more than fruity and refined.
Name: Tapiz 2015 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Forced woody aromas and flavors are a persistent theme on this Uco Valley Malbec, which smells a bit horsey and stewed. Dense black-fruit flavors are roasted and peppery, while wood and related resin notes rise up on the back palate. Rustic power and fiery heat are loud elements on a fully oaked finish.
Name: Altocedro 2014 Año Cero Malbec (La Consulta)

Description: Olive, saucy berry and a sense of rawness on the nose drive this Malbec towards a solid but slightly scratchy feeling palate. Plum, blackberry and minty oak flavors are short and lightly herbal, while this ends without much force.
Name: Finca Lalande 2015 Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Spicy, rubbery aromas of plum and berry fruits feature a coating of heavy oak. This is tannic and narrow on the palate, while burnt, herbal berry flavors finish rooty and with rubbery tannic grab.
Name: Graffito 2014 Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

Description: Rubbery, gaseous initial aromas give way to piquant red-fruit notes. This feels lean, racy and very high in acidity. Limited flavors of currant, tomato and salty red plum finish with herbal notes and persistent saltiness as well as abrasive acidity.
Name: Altos Las Hormigas 2013 Appellation Gualtallary Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Smoky, spicy aromas are highly wood-driven, which creates hickory and campfire scents rather than discernible fruit. This feels a touch sticky and soupy, while baked, woody berry, black plum and cassis flavors are charred prior to a spicy, chunky finish.
Name: TintoNegro 2014 Limestone Block Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Strong aromas of mint and licorice root share space on the nose with herbal, foxy cassis and raspberry scents. A grabby, scratchy mouthfeel and flavors of black fruits infused with an herbal component finish with notes of rosemary, licorice and peppery spice as well as a grating feel.
Name: Ricardo Santos 2014 La Madras Vineyard Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Smashed berry aromas are backed by earth and toasty oak notes. Fairly hard and tannic on the palate, this shows herbal plum flavors in front of a bold finish with dry tannins and a hint of wood spice.
Name: Graffigna 2012 Grand Reserve Malbec (San Juan)

Description: Stalky, lightly herbal aromas of red fruits and tomato filter onto a full but bland and chunky palate. Stalky, salty flavors of plum and currant lack full ripeness, while this finishes solid but stewy in flavor.
Name: Mendoza Vineyards 2013 1907 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Roasted, woodsy, rubbery aromas are gamy and staunch, with berry notes interspersed. Grabby, rubbery tannins make for a rugged palate, while roasted plum and gamy flavors are a touch salty. A tannic finish doesn't change much.
Name: Bodega Calle 2014 Alberti 154 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: This Malbec is a collection of disparate parts that doesn't justify its price. Reduced plum and grapy berry aromas come with woodsy notes of menthol and cola. Highly herbal, saucy, savory flavors are more oaky than fruity, while this finishes with muscular tannins and savory, grapy notes.
Name: Antonio Mas 2011 Roll Fermentor Malbec (Tupungato)

Description: Floral aromas, berry scents, wet cement and saucy notes drive the nose on this viscous, almost sticky Malbec. Baked berry flavors don't show much follow through on the finish, which offers more minty oak than fruit.
Name: Manos Negras 2015 Atrevida Malbec (Agrelo)

Description: Saucy, stewy plum and licorice aromas lead to a wiry palate with grabby tannins. Lightly herbal berry flavors come with a shading of oak, while the finish is herbal and minty tasting, with a sense of raw freshness stemming from latent acidity.
Name: El Solar de Orfila 2013 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Heavily oaked up front, this smells of sweet spices, lactic berry fruits and hickory. The palate is fairly blocky and grabby, with resiny wood notes. Flavors of hickory and lactic berry match the nose on this oaky rendition of Malbec.
Name: Kaiken 2014 Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Choppy plum and berry aromas are mildly raw and herbaceous, but not overly so. Round and standard in feel, this Malbec tastes of creamy, herbal berry fruits that turn slightly green and oaky. Peppery, medicinal, herbal flavors drive the finish.
Name: Pascual Toso 2015 Estate Bottled Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Savory but also stewy on the nose, this Malbec offers muddled berry and spiced cherry aromas. In the mouth, this is flush and jammy but not all that exact. Spicy, herbal, peppery plum and black-currant flavors finish with heat and roasted notes.
Name: Finca Flichman 2014 Misterio Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Saucy and briary smelling up front, with additional horsey, earthy berry aromas, this Malbec is chewy in feel, with baked berry and a hint of chocolate for flavors. A resiny, sticky finish tastes stewy and baked, with a leftover touch of chocolate.
Name: Guanaco 2013 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Jammy, stewy berry aromas are accented by brick dust and sweet oak that smells like plastic. Saturated, jammy and clumsy in feel, this tastes of baked, peppery black fruits and oak. Finishing notes of chocolate, herbs and licorice are chunky and a touch hot.
Name: Mas 2015 Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: This lush wine leads with rich aromas of vanilla-infused blackberry, raspberry preserves and plum sauce. The medium-weight palate is plush and velvety in texture, with supple blackberry and plum flavors that carry through to the medium-length finish.
Name: Kiwi Cuvée 2015 Bin 168 Malbec (Vin de France)

Description: Moderately stalky aromas of tomato and horsey plum lead to berry and plum flavors that are herbal and stalky, much like the nose. A roasted, stalky character is maintained on the finish.
Name: Bodini 2015 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Baked, spicy berry and dark plum aromas are leathery and a touch hot. Rather dense and soupy, with slightly rough tannins, this tastes of baked berry fruits, while the finish tastes lightly salty and feels rubbery.
Name: Tercos 2015 Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Roasted, stewed berry aromas are rustic and suggestive of grilled meat. This is high in acidity, and thus it feels sharp and edgy. Flavors of forced oak, related spice and tart plum end with a scraping, tannic feel and herbal berry flavors.
Name: Lagarde 2013 Henry Legarde Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

Description: Gritty berry and plum aromas are blocky. This feels choppy, almost rocky, while baked berry flavors ramble towards a spicy, sappy finish with stewed fruit notes and some residual heat.
Name: Finca Flichman 2015 Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Herbaceous aromas of mint and catnip are heavy on the nose, which also gives off a note of licorice gumdrop. This Malbec is tight and raw in feel, while herbal, spicy plum and currant flavors finish somewhat green.
Name: Luis Segundo Correas 2013 Valle Las Acequias Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Deep purple in color, with jammy boysenberry aromas, this smells like it has a burnt topping. Formless on the palate, this is mostly a big, extracted, scattered Malbec that's grapy and dark but devoid of complexities.
Name: Los Clop 2012 Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Harsh berry and plum aromas are damp and rubbery. This feels rubbery as well, with rough tannins. Stewy, nondescript berry flavors finish tannic and dry.
Name: Alba Roja 2012 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Vegetal-leaning, stewy aromas of plum and jammy berry are saucy. This feels sticky and low in acidity. Grassy, herbal plum and berry flavors are a bit green on the finish.
Name: Finca Flichman 2015 Misterio Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Horsey and raisiny on the nose, which indicates what's coming: that's a chunky palate and a one-note flavor of prune. This is what overripe raw materials can produce.
Name: Viña Alicia 2011 Las Compuertas Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

Description: Herbal berry aromas shift to outright green, horsey and soapy. This has no mouthfeel to speak of, and it tastes weedy and a bit spoiled. A minty, green finish is no savior.
Name: Luis Segundo Correas 2013 Choique Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: All varietal, this wine is a blend of Scooteney Flats, Kiona and Canyons vineyards. Aromas of exotic spices, clove and purple fruit lead to elegant supple flavors that linger. It still needs time to fully blossom.
Name: Fidelitas 2013 Malbec (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The variety announces itself with aromas of dark plum, fig, herbs and blackberry bud that enchant the senses. The fruit flavors are soft and plush, showing a dazzling sense of purity along with a finish that lingers. It flat out impresses.
Name: Baer 2013 Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Blended with 22% Cabernet Sauvignon, this aromatically generous wine offers notes of clove, purple fruit, coffee, black pepper and spice. It's ripe but in balance, with palate-coating, velvety fruit flavors that linger.
Name: Kerloo 2014 The Apocalypse Stone Tree Vineyard Malbec (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a rare, 100% varietal, single-vineyard Malbec. It downright dazzles with notes of dark plum and spice that are followed by seamless, pure, elegant fruit flavors.
Name: Walla Walla Vintners 2013 Pepper Bridge Vineyard Malbec (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas of dark berries and barrel spice are dense and brooding, with herb notes providing accents. The flavors are sweet, rich and full, showing depth, generosity and length. The oak is a bit prominent but it still delivers a lot of enjoyment.
Name: Milbrandt 2013 The Estates Northridge Malbec (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Dark plum, black-pepper and fresh herb aromas intertwine with light barrel spices. It's fresh, fruit forward and flavorful, bringing a whole lot of enjoyment and showing a real sense of deftness despite the warmth of the vintage.
Name: William Church 2013 Gamache Vineyard Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Coming from an up-and-coming region of the valley, this wine is direct in its appeal, with opulent aromas of dark plum, grape gummy, peppery spices and an herbal top note. The flavors are broad and pure, showing a deft touch. Coffee flavors linger on the finish.
Name: Kontos 2013 Summit View Vineyard Malbec (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Lake Chelan, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The variety announces itself, with pleasing aromas of plum, boysenberry, black pepper and dried herbs. The flavors are elegant and show a dazzling sense of purity.
Name: Nefarious 2013 Defiance Vineyard Estate Grown Malbec (Lake Chelan)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of plum and wood spice lead to plentiful blue-fruit flavors that show a fine sense of purity. The tannins provide a dry, lightly astringent squeeze.
Name: Mercer 2013 Malbec (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Light aromas of clove, spice and herb are followed by plump plum and herb flavors that bring freshness, with grainy tannins providing support. It brings a lot of easy-drinking appeal.
Name: Three Rivers 2013 Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: All varietal, the aromas juxtapose notes of dark plum and chocolate with generous wood spices. The wood and fruit seem to tussle on the palate, with the wood winning out on the finish.
Name: Tenor 2013 Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Vanilla, wood spice, herb and plum aromas are followed by soft, silky purple-fruit flavors. The tannins give a light squeeze on the finish.
Name: Mercer 2013 Robert Willis Reserve Malbec (Horse Heaven Hills)

Description: Bordeaux has always had Malbec in its vineyards although it is rare. This unusual wine shows how, in a fruity year, the grape can work well. The tannins are soft, giving a juicy black-fruited wine that is forward and delicious to drink now for its succulent fruit.
Name: Vignobles Raymond 2014 En Mémoire du  (Bordeaux)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is a blend of fruit from Summit View, Klipsun and Doval vineyards. Aromas of wood spice, purple fruit, vanilla and exotic spice are followed by tart cranberry and cherry flavors, with the midpalate dipping in concentration. The tannins bring quite a bit of grip.
Name: Browne Family Vineyards 2013 Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are light, with the notes of green herbs, flowers and plum, leaning pretty far into the green and savory. The flavors are plump and soft, with the concentration at times seeming faint.
Name: J & J 2013 Les Collines Vineyard Malbec (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are quite subdued with notes of herbs and red fruit. The flavors are more generous but still come off as quite light.
Name: Maryhill 2013 Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of smoke, matchstick, mineral and red fruit are followed by lightly styled cranberry flavors that winnow toward the finish.
Name: Latah Creek 2012 Alice Vineyard Malbec (Wahluke Slope)

Description: Barrel aromas of vanilla and baking spice are at the fore, with cranberry lurking in the background. The dried fruit flavors drink off dry, with cranberry flavors on the finish.
Name: Almquist 2010 Sumi's Malbec (Washington)

Description: With a slight addition of Cabernet Sauvignon, this wine features brushy black cherry and raspberry around a full-bodied, quite-ripe core that rides the palate softly and succulently. Bright and herbal, it has a mellow finish.
Name: Raymond 2013 Small Lot Collection Malbec (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This is a forward, fruity take on the grape, mixing plum and berry and vivid citrus components. Oak aging brings in dark chocolate highlights, which complement the highlights of candied orange peel in the finish.
Name: Grizzly Peak 2013 Reserve Malbec (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This is a dark, fragrant wine, showing a burst of black cherry and cassis. It's forward and buoyant, juicy and clean, with a youthful grapy character. It should drink best now through 2018.
Name: Reustle 2014 Golgotha Bloc Malbec (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This wine is serious in style, from the deep, dark color to the tempting touch of oak in the aroma to the plump but tangy fruit flavors. Its full body and nicely tannic texture gives it some grip on the palate.
Name: Cuda Ridge Wines 2013 Malbec (Livermore Valley)

Description: This is a juicy, medium-bodied wine that gushes with cherry and ripe plum flavors, and has an easy texture without much tannin. It's nice and smooth and easy to appreciate.
Name: Heringer 2013 Estate Bottled Malbec (Clarksburg)

Description: The generous fruit flavors in this medium-bodied, smooth-textured wine are like those in a cherry-rhubarb pie but without the sugar. Light herbal olive aromas start it out.
Name: Peirano 2013 The Heritage Collection Malbec (Lodi)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Plump blackberries and blueberries gain complexity on the nose of this bottling with touches of chipped cedar and smashed grapeseeds. Woody flavors show on the palate, with more grapeseed and some black tea. It's quite firm in tannins.
Name: Four Sisters Ranch 2011 Limited Edition Malbec (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Côtes du Lot, Southwest France, France
Description: The wine is perfumed and full. It is so soft, missing tannins, and already easy to drink. Black fruits are super-ripe and generous. Drink now.
Name: Pelvillain Frères 2014 Zee Original Malbec (Côtes du Lot)

Description: This vintage is even better than the prior version, which is almost unimaginable, but there it is. Floral and as tempting as blueberry pie, this concoction from Jesse Katz is velvety smooth and silky on the palate. White chocolate dances around its edges, along with a strong suggestion of cigar, which may perhaps come from the fine lady on the label.
Name: Devil Proof 2013 Farrow Ranch Malbec (Alexander Valley)

Description: Achaval-Ferrer's wines are unique across the board. This one from La Consulta in the Uco Valley shows boysenberry aromas with an herbal cut and a note of leather. The palate is at once juicy and smooth—flavors of desert brush, herbs, blueberry, savory plum and mixed spices finish with energy and subtlety. Drink through 2023.
Name: Achaval-Ferrer 2013 Finca Altamira Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Smoky, charred aromas of blackberry and blackened spices set up a bold palate with energy to spare. Blackberry and cassis flavors are rich, toasty and chocolaty, while the finish on this full-bodied, ripe Malbec is lengthy and moderately complex. Drink through 2021.
Name: Clos d'Argentine 2013 Winemaker's Selection Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Smoky and intense from the get-go, this saturated, black-as-night Malbec is full of blackberry, cassis and gamy aromas. While it goes heavy on the gas, the wine's structure is up to it. Flavors of chocolate, burnt toast, salt and blackberry finish toasty and long, with savory blackened spice notes. Drink through 2023.
Designation: Benegas Lynch La Encerrada Estate Vineyard
Name: Benegas 2011 Benegas Lynch La Encerrada Estate Vineyard Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Piercing blueberry and wild berry aromas are prototypical of this label. A juicy, high-acid palate is linear and a bit edgy, but its composition bodes well for the future. Spiced plum and currant flavors finish with toast, spice and berry notes. Drink through 2024.
Name: Achaval-Ferrer 2013 Finca Mirador Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Concentrated blackberry and desert brush aromas are dense and intense. While this is very rich, it's not overbearing or out of whack. Blackberry flavors with savory spice and earth notes end toasty but not overly complex. Drink through 2019.
Name: Bodega Rolland 2011 Mariflor Michel Rolland Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Bright, jammy red-berry aromas are gritty and a bit herbal. A fleshy, jammy mouthfeel belies the snappy raspberry and blueberry flavors that follow. A lot of blue-fruit character and herbal notes grace a high-energy, bright finish. Drink through 2023.
Name: Achaval-Ferrer 2013 Finca Bella Vista Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Attractive aromas of fresh berry fruits are vital and announce a plump but punchy palate with toasty, blackened flavors of wild berries and lactic oak. A toasty finish stops just short of bitterness, while pouring on the power. Drink through 2022.
Name: Cadus 2013 Single Vineyard Valle de Uco Malbec (Uco Valley)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: There's an intently Old World feel to this powerful Malbec that is bolstered by shades of leather and barnyard, char and dark toast. The palate is rich, almost ruddy, with black plum and cherry flavors, but balanced by zesty acidity. Coarse, mouth dampening tannins mark the finish now, but should meld nicely from 2020 through 2023.
Name: Raphael 2013 Reserve Malbec (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: This wine has a big presence of both fruit and body and yet is relatively tamed for the variety, the vintage and the appellation, finding balance in a tart, twisted knot of dark cherry, blueberry, black pepper and a distinct hit of fresh-cut roses.
Name: Judge Palmer 2012 Bavarian Lion Vineyard Malbec (Knights Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Smashed berries, honeyed coffee, leather, beef jerky, cola and black pepper show on the nose of this complex wine by the legendary Hearst family. The mouthfeel is medium-bodied, with lightly roasted coffee notes, touches of seared caramel, sesame oil and teriyaki and a base of dried black-plum fruit.
Name: Hearst Ranch 2013 Babicora Malbec (Paso Robles)

Description: This muscular Malbec opens with a blast of ripe berry aromas offset by oaky coconut notes. A plump palate avoids being pudgy, while plum, black cherry and blackberry flavors end with a turn of oaky vanilla and balancing residual acidity.
Name: Finca Sophenia 2013 Reserve Malbec (Tupungato)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Cool, grapy black-fruit aromas are front and center on the nose. This feels dense and a touch hard and tannic. Bumpy, chewy blackberry and dark plum flavors are lusty and come with a hint of sawdust and oak prior to a tannic finish that's hard, powerful and can still use some time. Drink through 2020.
Name: Cadus 2011 Single Vineyard Finca Las Tortugas Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

Description: From a two-acre block planted to the variety within this stately place, more famous for Zinfandel and Cabernet Sauvignon, this wine is herbal in dried sage, girded in big tannin and exhibiting plenty of density. Leathery black fruit, especially currant, and black pepper provoke the palate.
Name: Louis M. Martini 2013 Monte Rosso Vineyard Malbec (Sonoma Valley)

Description: Strapping currant and berry aromas come with a full dosage of toasty oak. This Malbec feels sinewy, with good depth. Oaky notes of toast and blackened spice lend a chocolaty essence to berry and plum flavors, while this finishes with an herbal, spicy aftertaste.
Name: Terrazas de Los Andes 2013 Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Luscious blackberry and cherry flavors take center stage here, showing just a glaze of nuttiness and roundness from judicious oak aging. Tart cranberry acidity and fine but slightly puckering tannins frame the palate squarely.
Name: Bedell 2014 Malbec (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: Earthy, field-like aromas include plum and currant. This Malbec shows tough, edgy tannins and toasty black-plum flavors. A bit of heat and burn is detectable on a bold, rugged finish.
Name: François Lurton 2013 Santa Celina Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Blackberry and cassis aromas are ripe and floral like violets. The palate is more tannic than fully built. Berry and plum flavors show tea and light herbal notes, while flavors of coffee, thyme and plum share space on a bright finish.
Name: Alta Vista 2014 Estate Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
