Description: Aromas of tomato, spiced plum, cherry and asphalt are encouraging. This feels somewhat syrupy and clunky, while candied berry and spice flavors are strong. A modicum of varietal herbal spice rises up on an otherwise sweet-tasting finish.
Name: Loscano 2012 Private Reserve Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Floral, leathery aromas of cassis and raspberry are appealing and complete. This medium-weight Malbec is a touch jammy in feel as it delivers fresh, lightly herbal plum and raspberry flavors. On the finish, which is bright and agile, a minty flavor takes over.
Name: Luigi Bosca 2013 Finca la Linda Old Vines Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Coming from a vineyard best known for its Syrah, this wine intrigues with aromas of black pepper, wood spice, earth and dark fruit. The dark-fruit flavors bring a sense of depth and texture.
Name: Ott & Murphy 2012 Boushey Vineyard Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Wiry, pinched aromas of berry fruits are forward and direct. This feels chunky and a touch jammy, while herbal berry, plum and peppery flavors end with heat, power, rawness and medicinal berry notes.
Name: Mascota 2015 ROD Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Ripe blackberry aromas are welcoming and clean. This features a flush palate that hollows out while delivering generic but fresh black-fruit flavors. A tasty, fresh finish makes this good for everyday drinking.
Name: Trivento 2014 Reserve Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Dry, spicy aromas of brick dust, cherry and plum announce a fairly full palate with earthy, savory plum and berry flavors backed by smoky bacon notes on a leathery but solid finish.
Name: Salvatore Principe 2013 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Cherry and berry aromas open this slick feeling Malbec. Sweet berry flavors are ripe, candied and medicinal. A candied flavor carries onto the finish, which darkens a bit at the end.
Name: Antucura 2013 Intuition Malbec (Vista Flores)

Description: Standard cherry and raspberry aromas are simple and pleasant. This feels fresh and bright, with a moderate mouthfeel. Flavors of red-berry fruits and dry spice finish steady, with balancing acidity.
Name: Cruz Alta 2015 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: This grapy, fruity Malbec is quite enjoyable. Aromas of boysenberry and blueberry are solid despite some reduction. Plum, boysenberry and creamy oak flavors finish on a note of clove.
Name: Kirkland Signature 2014 Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This pink wine, originally started by figure skater Peggy Fleming as a benefit for breast cancer research, shows peach, nectarine, strawberry flesh and cotton candy aromas. There is a touch of sweetness to the sip, with baked orange and lemon curd flavors.
Name: Darcie Kent Vineyards 2015 Victories Rosé of Malbec (Paso Robles)

Description: Grapy aromas are candied and suggestive of a powdered fruit drink. This feels plump and pulpy, with plum flavors that carry a skin-related astringency. Herbal, rooty notes come up on the finish.
Name: Filus 2014 Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: Odd and unfamiliar aromas of citrus peel, soapy cleanser and reedy red-berry fruits elicit contemplation, not sensory pleasure. This feels narrow, with astringent tannins. Flavors of herbal tea, red berries and spice are almost like Pinot Noir, while this finishes raw, rubbery and tannic, with herbal notes.
Name: Luis Segundo Correas 2011 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: An addition of 7% Petit Verdot gives additional color and heft to this wine. This is a thick, meaty red with firm, robust tannin and use of oak that doesn't impart much on the nose, but surrenders a taste of ripe blueberry and chocolate on the finish.
Name: Wellington 2013 Estate Malbec (Sonoma County)

Description: Aromas of vanilla, marshmallow and milk chocolate dominate subtle berry scents. This feels grabby, creamy and medium in body, with pushy flavors of clove and woodspice leading generic black-fruit notes. For basic Malbec, this is quite oaky.
Name: Ruta 22 2015 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Aromas of generic red-berry fruits, leather and a drop of vinegar feed into a grabby palate with medicinal red-berry flavors. This tastes a touch herbal on a standard finish.
Name: Santa Julia 2015 (+) Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Jammy berry and raisin aromas are compact and tell a lot about what's coming next. That's a saturated but rough and tannic palate with extremely ripe flavors of prune, licorice and blackberry jam. A peppery, syrupy finish is anything but lean.
Name: Lamadrid 2013 Single Vineyard Reserva Malbec (Agrelo)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: This wine is made to be drunk young when it is still in the first flush of its fruitiness. Black plum and blackberry flavors are fleshed out with soft tannins. The aftertaste is fresh with bright acidity. Drink now.
Name: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2014 La Réserve Malbec (Vin de France)

Description: Stalky, leathery aromas are low on fruit and freshness. This has a grabby feel, sort of like leather straps. Herbal berry and plum flavors are mildly bitter, while a green note is apparent on the finish. 90+? Not exactly.
Name: Ninety+ 2014 Old Vine Lot 23 Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: Named after the Citroën 2CV car still sometimes seen on French roads, this lightly tannic wine has black fruits and a stalky structure that serves as a reminder that Malbec can produce structured wines. As a contrast, the fruit and acidity at the end give a lift, so that the wine is ready to drink.
Name: Voiturette 2015 Malbec (Vin de France)

Description: Lightly abrasive, scratchy aromas of red fruits include a note of bath soap. A lean, prickly palate holds sweet berry and tart plum flavors that struggle to blend. A medicinal tasting finish is regular in feel and length.
Name: Valentín Bianchi 2015 Finca Los Primos Malbec

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: Capitalizing on the fashion for Malbec, this wine is closer to Argentina than Cahors. It has soft tannins and a ripe and juicy flavor of red-berry fruits. Acidity and a soft aftertaste reinforce this New World feel.
Name: Le Petit Cochonnet 2015 Malbec (Vin de France)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: More crisp and spicy than overtly fruity on the nose, this is both bulky and high in acidity. A blast of savory plum flavor is the main show, while noticeable oak and pepper notes turn dry and wiry on the finish.
Name: Nieto Senetiner 2013 Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

Description: Cool, dark-plum aromas are mildly herbal. This feels drawn-in and tough. Disposable berry flavors come with peppery notes, while the finish doesn't offer much new.
Name: Andean 2013 Reserve Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: Black currant aromas lead on to a soft, off-dry wine with red-berry flavors and a stalky texture. With the softness, it is an immediate wine, easy to drink.
Name: L'original French Kiss 2015 Malbec (Vin de France)

Appellation: Valle de Uco, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Earthy, murky, raw aromas of generic berry fruits topped with vanilla and marshmallow set up a chunky but lazy palate with herbal plum flavors that border on green.
Name: Salentein 2014 Portillo Malbec (Valle de Uco)

Description: Warm, earthy plum and tomato aromas turn horsey with airing. Flavors of spiced but lightly weedy red-berry fruits, tomato and herbs finish with a creamy, candied texture.
Name: Gnarly Head 2014 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Aromas of prune and cocoa powder accurately portend a chunky, plodding palate with flat tannins. This is at maximum ripeness, but it's not totally balanced, as raisin, mint and black pepper flavors finish with heat and herbal notes.
Designation: Sustainably Farmed Estate Grown and Bottled
Name: Zolo 2014 Sustainably Farmed Estate Grown and Bottled Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: This lean, thin wine has stalky berry fruits and a touch of spice. The tannins are integrated into the light, tart fruit. Drink now.
Name: Café du Midi 2015 Malbec (Vin de France)

Description: Leafy, spicy, dry berry aromas lead to a jacked up, edgy palate with hard, scraping tannins. Forced woodspice and raw plum flavors finish more spicy than fruity.
Name: Fat Gaucho 2013 Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Damp and furry on the nose, this is all tannins and scratch. High acidity only contributes to the grating mouthfeel, hence it's a bumpy ride where standard berry flavors are a sideshow. Chento 2012 is a better bet if it's still on the shelf.
Name: Bodega Cuarto Dominio 2013 Chento Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Earthy cherry and prune aromas lack pop and seem damp. This is astringent across the palate, with flavors of prune and oaky vanilla. A raisiny, mealy finish is choppy and exits with the aftertaste of prune.
Name: Region 1 2014 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Rubbery, jammy, unfocused berry aromas are blurry. This feels heavy and low on pulse. Flavors of stewed plum and berry fruits end with a mild, weedy, green note.
Name: Tercos 2014 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Rough, grassy aromas and flavors along with a choppy mouthfeel render this one rung above unacceptable. Overall, this is about as raw, punchy, green and herbaceous as a Malbec can get.
Name: Pampa 2014 Estate Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: This is the Couture family's top-of-the-range wine from Eugénie. It is dense and layered with wood, blackberry fruits and a complex structure of tannins, smoky flavors and acidity. This is a serious wine that needs to age. It is still developing so drink from 2019.
Name: Château Eugénie 2013 Haute Collection Malbec (Cahors)

Description: This wine is always immense and the latest release, from a six-acre parcel surrounding Lagrézette's 17th century dovecote, is no exception. There is a sense of pent-up power here although it is not without its stylish elegance. Because it still so young, the black fruits stand out along with the concentrated tannins. It explodes in the mouth; dark and brooding. Drink this wine from 2022.
Name: Château Lagrézette 2013 Le Pigeonnier Malbec (Cahors)

Description: A rich, round and silky texture provide pure pleasure in this exotically perfumed vineyard-designate that's full bodied and exuberant in baked plum, black pepper and anise. Well integrated and complex, it traffics in deeper, darker plumes of smoke and tobacco toward the lengthy finish.
Name: Trinchero 2012 Haystack Vineyard Malbec (Atlas Peak)

Description: Despite the age, the color of this wine is still impressively vibrant and the ripe fruit and dense structure both speak of a wine that is still developing even nine years later. Such is longevity of a great Malbec. Blackberry fruit flavors charge through this wine that's reached the point of balance with the tannins. Drink now, although the wine will still be developing in 2018.
Name: Jean-Luc Baldès 2007 Clos Triguedina Probus Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Named after the Roman emperor who allowed planting of vines in Cahors (and elsewhere in France), this wine is a fine expression of rich, concentrated Malbec. It is powered by its tannins and young black fruits at this stage and needs several years to present its full, rich and concentrated potential. From 2019, this will be a serious wine.
Name: Jean-Luc Baldès 2013 Clos Triguedina Probus Malbec (Cahors)

Description: The Chambert estate was first planted in 1690. Now owned by Philippe Lejeune, it is farmed biodynamically. With consultant Stéphane Derenoncourt as part of the team, this top wine from the estate's best parcels is concentrated, dense and firmly tannic. The wine's young acidity and structure are in place so it just needs time to age. Drink from 2020.
Name: Château de Chambert 2012 Grand Vin Malbec (Cahors)

Description: A new wine for Alain Dominique Perrin's Lagrézette, this comes from a single vineyard on mainly gravel soil. It is dark, dense and powerfully concentrated. The dry tannins with their edge of minerality still dominate the black plum and berry flavors. Along with power and depth, the wine has its elegant side with the acidity giving a lift and even freshness at the end.
Name: Château Lagrézette 2013 Paragon Terroir de Massaut Malbec (Cahors)

Description: This wood-aged, perfumed wine is serious, complex and will take its time to develop. It is full of dark tannins and ripe black fruits, laced with acidity. It comes from old vines, planted in the 1970s, which give great concentration and depth to the wine. It will be ready to drink from 2019.
Name: Domaine de Cause 2013 La Lande Cavagnac Malbec (Cahors)

Description: From vines that surround the castle of Mercuès that crowns a rock above the River Lot, this wine is richly structured, packed with juicy black fruits as well as a firm dry core. It's a dense wine, dark with intense tannins. It is serious as well as opulently fruity. Drink this wine from 2020.
Name: Georges Vigouroux 2012 Château de Mercuès Malbec (Cahors)

Description: From a 16-acre vineyard, this 100% Malbec wine is properly dark in color, with dense tannins as well as ripe black plum fruits. There is a strong mineral character from the chalk in the soil, giving a powerful texture as well as structure that will allow the wine to age. This rich wine should be drunk from 2020.
Name: Château de Cénac 2014 Cuvée Prestige Malbec (Cahors)

Description: This is a ripe and opulent wine. It has rich tannins and generous black fruits but it still offers a spicy wood-aging flavor. As it develops, the intense fruits and smoky flavors will come to dominate, while always preserving the structure of the wine. It is a wine to age a bit, so drink from 2017.
Name: Château Vincens 2014 Origine Malbec (Cahors)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The nose on this savory, crowd-pleasing wine is great, with attractive notes of black plum, sesame oil, soy, hoisin and salted caramel. An array of well-integrated flavors flood the palate, like black cherry stewed in Indian spice, Asian plum sauce, blackberry preserves and stewed peppercorns.
Name: Edna Valley Vineyard 2013 Winemaker Series Malbec (Central Coast)

Description: This top wine from Lamartine is a fine, solid expression of the firm nature of young Malbec. It has dark, dense black fruits layered behind the dry, tight tannins. With this concentration, this is a wine that needs to age. Leave until 2020.
Name: Château Lamartine 2012 Expression Malbec (Cahors)

Description: A beautifully perfumed wine that comes from vines planted in the 1980s. Touches of the wood aging are apparent, along with the black plum and berry fruits. It's a dense while also elegant wine with acidity and fresh fruitiness alongside the complex structure. Drink this wine from 2019.
Name: Georges Vigouroux 2012 Château Pech de Jammes Malbec (Cahors)

Description: The 147-acre vineyard on a high chalk plateau in the east of Cahors was first planted in the Middle Ages. It has produced a structured, mineral wine, very textured and with firm, dusty tannins. Underneath the black currant fruits are developing and will give a fine juicy wine from 2019. Grands Vins de Seigneur is a group of growers who approve each other's wines.
Designation: Château de Haute-Serre Grand Vin de Seigneur
Name: Georges Vigouroux 2012 Château de Haute-Serre Grand Vin de Seigneur Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Still firm and structured, this pure Malbec wine is rich and tannic. At the same time, it has layers of ripe black fruits that are coming through strongly. The smoky, textured character of this wine comes from the wood aging that has added an extra layer. Drink from 2018.
Name: Château Lamartine 2013 Prestige du Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Low-yield vines on the best parcels of the Vincens estate are the source of this wine. It is super-rich and concentrated, maybe too much in its opulent excess. The wine does have great plum and berry flavors that are generous and full in the mouth. The wine even now is still young and will be better from 2018.
Name: Château Vincens 2012 Malbec (Cahors)

Description: This cuvée, named after a statue in the vineyards, is dark and dense. There is a strong chewy character to this wine which is obviously much too young to drink now. The dark fruits are surrounded by considerable tannic structure. It is powerful and concentrated, perhaps all too much. Drink from 2020.
Name: Domaine de Cause 2012 Notre Dame des Champs Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Dark, brooding and baked in character, this well-made wine is a study in red and black licorice tones, with juicy blue fruit at the core. Good grip and power find structure around a full body and leathery finish.
Name: Trinchero 2012 Cloud's Nest Vineyard Malbec (Mount Veeder)

Description: This second wine from Alain Dominique Perrin's Lagrézette team comes from a separate vineyard to the grand vin. It is structured, ripe and fruity. The tannins are soft well integrated into the black fruits. The wine is still at the bright fruit stage and will age, so drink now for its fruit, but better to wait until 2018.
Name: Château Lagrézette 2013 Château Chevaliers Lagrézette Malbec (Cahors)

Description: As part of a range of wines that uses the figure seven because of its mystic qualities, grower Didier Pelvillain has produced a wine that is dark, smooth and ripe. It has fine berry fruits and dusty tannins that are still lifted by the youthful acidity. Give it until 2019 to fully develop.
Name: Pelvillain Frères 2014 Inspiration 7.5.3 Malbec (Cahors)

Description: This is a big-hearted, ripe wine from the Verhaeghe family, one of the top producers in Cahors. It is packed with black fruits and firm tannins. They promise richness to come with structure, wood aging flavors and density. It's a wine that is just starting out, still boasting its youthful fruit. Give it until 2020 before drinking.
Name: Château du Cèdre 2014 Cèdre Heritage Malbec (Cahors)

Description: A full, loamy bouquet with minerally blackberry and cassis aromas is modern in style despite this coming from old Maule vines. A generous palate deals woody, toasty flavors of baked black plum and blackberry, while peppery spice and a hint of clove are prominent on an oak-driven finish. Drink through 2021.
Name: Altamana 2014 Grande Reserve Malbec (Maule Valley)

Description: This is a ripe structured wine produced by the Pelvillain family at their 30-acre vineyard in Prayssac, to the west of Cahors. It is a fresh wine with tannins that will soften quickly and easily. Fresh berry fruits and a touch of minerality are combined with acidity to form a fine, ripe and balanced wine. Drink from 2017.
Name: Domaine du Théron 2014 Prestige Malbec (Cahors)

Description: This is the most extravagant version of three wines in a range in which grower Didier Pelvillain uses the figure seven for its mystic qualities. Here, the wine is ripe, brimming with fresh black fruits and acidity. The structure is firm in the background, allowing the wine to age. Drink from 2019.
Name: Pelvillain Frères 2014 Inspiration 7.9 Malbec (Cahors)

Description: This wine comes from the highest terrace above the Lot River, giving it a cool, fresh feel. Gravel and chalk soil give both lightness and minerality. Black fruits, integrated tannins and juicy final acidity mean this is a wine that will be ready to drink soon. Drink from 2018.
Name: Château du Port 2014 Cuvée Prestige Malbec (Cahors)

Description: This ripe, fruity wine that was matured in tank is made to be drunk young. Even though it does have plenty of tannins, it is also full of black fruits and a lightly earthy character that shows in the acidity and the smoky aftertaste. Drink now.
Name: Château Vincens 2014 L'Instant Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Calling on the inspiration or mysticism of the figure 7, grower Didier Pelvillain has introduced this version, one in a range of three. This wine is balanced between juicy acidity and firm, dark tannins. The black plum fruit flavors are still in the background as it develops. Give this wine time to fill out and start drinking from 2018.
Name: Pelvillain Frères 2014 Inspiration 7.5 Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Ripe, rugged, leathery berry and plum aromas set up a tight, rubbery palate. This tastes good, albeit different than your average Malbec—it's a bit citrusy, with orange peel and reedy cherry and plum notes. On the finish this clamps down with tannic grip.
Name: Pura 8 2014 Reserve Malbec (Rapel Valley)

Description: Nicely touched by wood, this ripe and spicy wine is full of fruit and with a firm structure. Blackberry flavors show strongly, giving a rich foreground to the dry tannins that are at the core. Drink this concentrated wine from 2018.
Name: Georges Vigouroux 2012 Château Leret Réserve Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Dark blue-purple in color, this is a breezy, giving wine on the palate, fresh and light in blueberry preserves and soft layers of integrated oak and tannin. It finishes smooth and with a hint of chocolate.
Name: Napa Cellars 2013 Classic Collection Winemaker Series Malbec (Napa Valley)

Description: Ripe aromas of blackberry come with sides of horsey leather and baking spices. This Malbec is slightly tannic in feel, yet balanced by savory, woody black-fruit flavors. This is long, minty and lightly herbal on the finish.
Name: Chilensis 2014 Reserva Estate Bottled Malbec (Maule Valley)

Description: This Malbec is soft in style, with plenty of black currant tones balanced by vibrant acidity and ripe tannins. The black fruit flavors have a succulent character that makes the wine now ready to drink.
Name: Vignobles 46N118 2010 Noir 46 Malbec (Cahors)

Description: This majority varietal wine contains 2% Cabernet Sauvignon, which doesn't help to soften its powerful grip of sturdy tannin and sideshow of oak. Blueberry and chocolate come to the fore slowly between meaty leather and a dusty aroma.
Name: Patland 2012 Terra Del Cuore Estate Grown Malbec (Napa Valley)

Description: Apart from the spectacular Polynesian name and label winemaker Heifara Swartvagher chose to honor his Tahitian mom, the wine is classic ripe Malbec. With firm tannins and solid fruits, it's full of structure as well as blackberry flavors. It has spice, dry tannins at the core and is still young. Drink from 2018.
Name: Château Saint-Sernin 2011 Varua Maohi Mana Malbec (Cahors)

Description: This is a wine that relishes its dark color, its deep pigment. It's just as dense on the palate with concentrated black fruits and an earthy edge. There's no wood here, just ripe blackberry fruitiness that will age for a year before being ready to drink. Drink from 2017.
Name: Georges Vigouroux 2014 Pigmentum Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Red fruits and a bold color emphasize the fruitiness of this wine. It's ripe with some tannins that do need to soften; however, the explosive fruits are the stars here. Drink from 2017.
Name: Domaine de Cause 2012 Malbec (Cahors)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: The winery aims for Loire valley characteristics in its wines, hence the reference to Côt, as Malbec is known in the region. This is grapy, purple and young. At this point it's difficult to see much else beyond the fruit and lip-sticking acids. It's a good warm-weather quaffing wine, best served slightly chilled.
Name: Leah Jørgensen Cellars 2014 Crater Lake Vineyard Loiregon Côt Malbec (Rogue Valley)

Description: Although this opens with aromatic notes of inner tube and iodine, airing reveals dry herb scents and medicinal cherry and berry aromas. With proper weight and balance, this basic Malbec tastes of cherry cough drop and plum, with a dash of green herbs.
Name: Concha y Toro 2014 Reserva Casillero del Diablo Malbec (Central Valley)

Description: This is a young, fresh wine from Château Pech de Jammes. Black currant flavors are offered a bit of support from gentle tannins and pulsing, exuberant acidity. Drink now.
Name: Georges Vigouroux 2014 Petit Jammes Malbec (Cahors)

Description: This is a thick and burly version of the variety from a rocky, high-elevation appellation well known for Zinfandel. Leathery tar overlaps with herbal, vegetal elements before a bittersweet finish.
Name: Keating 2012 Malbec (Rockpile)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dense blueberry, concentrated purple flowers and a touch of tar show on the nose of this bottling of a fairly rare grape in the region. The palate intrigues with tar, beef crust and tart, tannic elderberry fruit, but it's quite wound up in a very solid structure that still needs time to unwind.
Name: Rancho Sisquoc 2013 Malbec (Santa Barbara County)

Description: Bright purple in color, this dwells on the natural dark fruitiness of Malbec, without any wood aging. Black currants and berries dominate this bright wine with its attractive acidity. It's a wine to drink now for its vigorous fruitiness.
Name: Georges Vigouroux 2014 Gouleyant Malbec (Cahors)

Description: The wine is full of gushing fruit. It's purple in color (the name is right) with young black fruit flavors and balanced acidity. It's a wine to drink now (because of its fruitiness) and until 2020.
Name: Château Lagrézette 2014 The Original Purple Malbec (Cahors)

Description: An immediately attractive wine that is bursting with black currant fruitiness. Along with light tannins and red berry fruits, it is fresh without any hint of wood aging. The wine is ready to drink.
Name: Domaine du Théron 2014 Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Immediately this Malbec is defined by loud, toasty, overbearing oak. On the nose, it smells like vanilla, sawdust, campfire and creamy but generic black fruits. In the mouth, it's blocky, while heavy oak-influenced flavors of chocolaty mint and vanilla finish like an ice cream sundae.
Name: Millaman 2014 Limited Reserve Malbec (Curicó Valley)

Description: The Comté Tolosan PDI covers vines throughout the southwest wine region. This Malbec is a ripe, structured wine that is rich with ripe black fruit flavors. It has an edge of minerality as well as juicy berry fruits and generous tannins. The wine is ready to drink.
Name: Vinovalie 2014 Tarani Malbec (Comté Tolosan)

Appellation: Côtes du Lot, Southwest France, France
Description: This dark purple wine expresses the bold blackberry flavors of Malbec. It has ripe fruit, soft tannins and a generous richness. The aftertaste adds some freshness. Drink from the end of 2016.
Name: Pelvillain Frères 2014 Albatros Malbec (Côtes du Lot)

Description: There is no sign of the tannic punch of Malbec in this wine. Instead the texture is soft and open with just enough tannins to give shape to the delicious black currant fruitiness. The wine is ready for a glass now.
Name: Pelvillain Frères 2014 Gariottin Sélection Malbec (Cahors)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Smoky and oaky past the point of balance, this tastes of charred wood rather than fruit. The tannins are chewy and smoky. After considerable breathing time, blackberry fruit emerges. Aeration is highly recommended.
Name: Kriselle 2013 Malbec (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: All varietal coming from two blocks of this vineyard, this wine dazzles with its strikingly pure aromas of plum, herbs and spice. The flavors don't disappoint, coating the palate with velvety, restrained, exquisitely balanced fruit flavors that perfectly capture the essence of this variety. For those looking for a primer on Malbec in Washington, look no further.
Name: Kerloo 2013 Stone Tree Malbec (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Red Hills, Lake County, California, US
Description: This makes a great showing for Boatique's first review. A deep color, superconcentrated flavors and a big but agile body set this wine apart. It smells like ripe blackberries and tastes like cherries and blueberries dusted with very dark chocolate. This wine is is dry, refined and very young, so cellar it until at least 2020 if you can wait that long.
Name: Boatique 2013 Malbec (Red Hills)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas of dark plum, thistle and earth captivate the senses, with the variety unmistakable. The flavors coat the palate from end-to-end, lingering on the finish.
Name: K Vintners 2012 Bronco Malbec (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine has hints of cedar and coriander, a luxurious, velvety and appropriately tannic texture, and flavors that are ripe and delicious. Its personality seems confident, well balanced and well behaved, but strong and focused.
Name: Naggiar 2013 Estate Grown, Produced and Bottled Malbec (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of fresh dill and other green herbs leap up from the glass. The plum flavors are pure and persistent. It's a unique expression of the variety.
Name: Merry Cellars 2013 Seven Hills Vineyard Malbec (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas of leafy green herbs, plum and spice are vibrant and fresh. Its flavors are finesse-driven, soft and elegant, with tart acids backing them up. The variety is unmistakable. Put it on the dinner table to see it at its best.
Name: Gordon Estate 2013 Estate Grown Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: HandCraft has been consistently good with this grape, and this complex wine is another excellent example. Intriguing aromas of wood smoke and rosemary lead to concentrated fruit flavors like pomegranate and cranberry. The mouthfeel is layered and nicely tannic, and flavors seem to go deep.
Name: HandCraft 2014 Artisan Collection Malbec (California)

Appellation: Red Hills, Lake County, California, US
Description: This wine smells smoky, minty and almost meaty. It tastes rich and complex, brightened and spiced by lavish use of new oak, yet built on enough ripe blackberry flavors to achieve a robust balance. It's well made in a deliberately oaky style.
Name: Cinnabar 2012 Amber Knolls Malbec (Red Hills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Clove, vanilla and other spice aromas are followed by full-feeling fruit flavors which are backed by soft, velvety tannins. It offers much to enjoy.
Name: Waterbrook 2013 Reserve Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: A unique offering of the variety, this wine displays aromas of fresh and dried tobacco, allspice, smoke and blue fruit. The plum flavors are sweet and supple, showing good concentration with a mesquite-filled finish.
Name: Huston 2012 Malbec

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine offers aromas of clove and woodspice, with blue-fruit notes in the background. The flavors showing pleasing density and weight, shortening up on the finish.
Name: Waterbrook 2014 Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: An appealing personality makes this a good go-to wine. Aromas combine a light spicy quality with tasty black cherry and berry notes. Flavors add rich fruit and a little spiciness, and the mouthfeel is supple.
Name: Scotto Family Cellars 2012 Malbec (Lodi)

Description: Bright, jammy aromas and ripe, lively, chocolate and cherry flavors give a lot of personality to this velvet-textured wine. Medium to full bodied, it has a good blanket of fine tannins to coat the tongue and give the wine grip.
Name: Ironstone 2010 Reserve Malbec (Lodi)

Appellation: Yorkville Highlands, North Coast, California, US
Description: Whiffs of butter and vanilla in the aroma lead to a soft and supple wine that tastes like baking spices and cherries. It's very polished and almost soft in texture.
Name: Yorkville Cellars 2013 Rennie Vineyard Organic Grapes Malbec (Yorkville Highlands)

Appellation: Suisun Valley, North Coast, California, US
Description: This big, ripe, well-oaked and very firm textured wine could be paired with equally big proteins. It has generous blackberry and black-cherry flavors. Overt tannins give a drying sensation, especially on the finish.
Name: Brooklyn Winery 2012 Malbec (Suisun Valley)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is the winery's first bottling of Malbec from this up-and-coming vineyard. Woodspice, cedar and mushroom aromas are followed by seemingly dried-out cherry flavors that trail toward the finish.
Name: :Nota Bene 2012 Heart of the Hill Malbec (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: While the nose on this muscular Malbec is lush, ripe and minty, there's also a grounding, complex scent of graphite. Blazing with intensity, this tastes like a glorious blend of plum, prune, chocolate and caramel. Dry spice, toasty oak and ripe berry flavors touch up against raisiny on the finish. Drink through 2019.
Name: Terrazas de Los Andes 2009 Single Parcel Los Cerezos Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

Description: Take note, this could be the best wine Colomé has ever bottled. Cedary oak aromas grace ripe, almost desiccated wild berry notes that are slightly herbal and sauvage. A well-layered mouthfeel is ideal in power and precision. Requisite blackberry, cassis, toast and peppery flavors finish dry and long, with little heat or burn. Drink through 2021.
Name: Colomé 2010 Reserva Malbec (Salta)

Description: Rarely do you come across something like this: mature and complex Malbec from Cafayate. Earthy aromas of plum, prune, raisin and tobacco give this an Old World bouquet. Saturated but with enough acidity to maintain balance, this tastes rooty, chocolaty and earthy, with mocha, toast and toffee flavors on a heady finish. Drink now.
Name: Bodega Rolland 2006 Yacochuya Malbec (Cafayate)

Description: Pure, ripe blackberry aromas are heady, toasty and crisp like burnt bread crust. This Malbec has a profound, drawing mouthfeel defined by full extraction and muscular tannins. Savory flavors of blackberry and roasted plum end with depth, focus and welcome freshness. Drink through 2023.
Name: Tapiz 2011 Black Tears Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: This lush, extracted Malbec oozes grapy aromas of blackberry and cassis. The palate matches the nose: it's intense and fully extracted. Toasty oak frames blackberry and marzipan flavors prior to a rich finish that's almost syrupy. This is a monster Malbec. Drink through 2022.
Name: Kaiken 2010 Mai Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Ripe, rooty aromas of licorice, leather and peanut are matched by cedar, tobacco and other complex scents. This mature Cafayate classic is still rugged and solid on the palate despite showing a rusting color. Flavors of chocolate, prune and baking spices finish deep, with rooty, chocolaty notes and pent-up energy. Drink now.
Name: Bodega Rolland 2007 Yacochuya Malbec (Cafayate)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: The winery notes that this is their 16th vintage of Malbec, but just the first reserve bottling. Intense aromatics introduce a wine saturated with black fruits, coffee liqueur, soy and tobacco. It offers exceptional depth and power. Drink now through 2025.
Name: Abacela 2012 Northwest Block Reserve Malbec (Umpqua Valley)

Description: Dry oak, black fruit and floral notes suggestive of violet are the aromas that set off this tannic, clamping, deeply structured Malbec. Flavors of mocha, maple, savory blackberry and roasted plum end with a mix of creaminess and strapping tannins. Drink through 2025.
Name: Bodega Catena Zapata 2011 Argentino Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Compact, minerally aromas include notes of leather and licorice. Round and generous across the palate, this ripe, rooty tasting Malbec features flavors of blackberry and chocolate in front of a mildly raisiny finish. Drink this warm-vintage Malbec through 2019.
Name: Terrazas de Los Andes 2009 Single Parcel Los Castaños Malbec (La Consulta)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Concentrated blackberry and prune aromas are wrapped in a blanket of chocolaty oak. Side-to-side jamminess and beefy tannins make for a full-force mouthfeel, while minty blackberry flavors end plush but with focus. Herbal notes of rosemary, thyme and mint add complexity. Drink through 2024.
Name: Terrazas de Los Andes 2011 Single Vineyard Las Compuertas Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

Description: Cheesy oak is the greeting on the nose of this older Malbec from a notoriously tough vintage. After that, earthy, stewed blackberry and meaty aromas come up. This is saturated and a touch stewy, with baked black-fruit flavors as well as gamy animal notes. A dense finish tastes soupy and savory. Drink through 2018.
Name: Bodega Rolland 2008 Val de Flores Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Aromas of fresh-baked bread greet the nose on entry into this wine, an unusual find in the appellation that's blended with small percentages of Cabernet Sauvignon and Petit Verdot. Toast topped in plum jam accompanies a strong presence of blackberry, leather and tobacco, dusted in cinnamon. Drink now through 2023.
Name: Martin Ray 2013 Malbec (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This appealing wine demonstrates the exciting potential for Malbec in Southern Oregon. Fresh, zippy acids underscore bright raspberry and black-cherry fruit, framed in chocolate with a dash of sea salt. The finish resonates with lightly applied baking spices and cayenne pepper.
Name: Silvan Ridge 2013 Malbec (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This outstanding Malbec dazzles with scents of tobacco and chocolate, flavors of sour cherry and plum, and impressive concentration and persistence. The flavors gather strength and focus, adding details of lavender and lemon curd, as they roll into a lingering finish.
Name: Abacela 2013 Barrel Select Malbec (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Valle de Uco, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Right away, this smells smooth and complete, with a proper mix of berry fruit, oak and earthy aromas. This is Salentein winemaker José Galante's personal wine, and it's juicy on the palate and doesn't overreach. Blackberry, boysenberry and salty, meaty notes finish with a persistent dose of salt, which should make this all the more appropriate when served with beef. Drink through 2022.
Name: Puramun 2013 Reserva Malbec (Valle de Uco)

Description: Dry, mossy berry aromas carry punch, while this well-built Malbec feels concentrated but not heavy. Peppery, blackened berry flavors spill over with a black-coffee note on a slightly hot finish. Drink through 2020.
Name: Don Manuel Villafañe 2013 Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Those familiar with Altocedro's Malbecs know that oak will be a key player. For this 200-case, small-batch wine, the nose offers a blast of barrel power that initially smells like a sawmill. The palate is bold and full, with flavors of buttery oak, vanilla and salty black fruits. There's grip to the finish, which, not surprisingly, tastes woody, dark and minty. Drink through 2022.
Name: Altocedro 2013 Finca Los Gallegos Malbec (La Consulta)

Description: Dense aromas of plum, cassis and prune set up a powerful palate with core acidity and good balance. High-energy plum fruit blends with denser prune and beef jerky flavors in front of a solid but easy finish that's not too tannic or grabby. Drink through 2019.
Name: Nieto Senetiner 2012 Don Nicanor Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Valle de Uco, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Earthy black-fruit and spice aromas are clean and welcoming, while this is potent and full of life on the palate. Black cherry, coffee and chocolate flavors are intense and finish with a notable amount of minty menthol character. Drink through 2019.
Name: Salentein 2013 Reserve Malbec (Valle de Uco)

Description: Aromatics of raisin and earthy tobacco breathe complexities as this airs out. A balanced but ripe and mouthfilling palate holds deep flavors of blackberry and cassis. Loamy berry, fig and chocolate flavors provide pleasure on the finish. Drink through 2018.
Name: Bueyes 2012 Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: Earthy, chunky plum aromas get nice accenting from baking spice and leathery notes. This is a fully extracted, full-bodied Malbec with minty, slightly medicinal black-cherry and berry flavors. A bright, dry, spicy finish works well. Drink through 2019.
Name: La Posta 2013 Fazzio Malbec (Tupungato)

Description: Jammy blackberry aromas come with a hint of brine and a rubbery note of latex. This is big and tannic on the palate, but also a touch clumsy. Stewed black-fruit flavors run short, while minty oak, grapy berry and toasty spice flavors drive the finish. Drink through 2020.
Name: Andeluna 2013 Altitud Malbec (Tupungato)

Description: Wiry raspberry and plum aromas put this in the red-fruit category. A loud, tannic, expansive palate blazes with acidity, while fully toasted oak gives this a burnt element to match raspberry and red-plum flavors. Hard tannins and bold acidity make for a long, rugged finish.
Name: Altos Las Hormigas 2012 Terroir Malbec (Uco Valley)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Ripe blackberry and cola aromas comes across as foresty and nice as a whole. This saturated, dense Malbec shows brutish, choppy tannins along with flavors of blackberry, exotic spices and fig. The finish remains rough and turns hot. Drink through 2021.
Name: Belasco de Baquedano 2011 AR Guentota Old Vine Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

Appellation: Valle de Uco, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Inky, dark and smoky on the nose, this bold Malbec also shows aromas of rubber and turned earth. A blocky, chewy, raw mouthfeel and saucy, herbal flavors of plum and boysenberry combine into a tough, gritty, tannic whole, while the finish is saucy, with oregano and thyme flavors that suggest ragù.
Name: Luigi Bosca 2013 Terroir Los Miradores Malbec (Valle de Uco)

Description: Smooth on the nose, this smells fruity, honest and whole. Dark flavors of blue fruits and peppery spices are a little shallow, while the finish shows mild Cafayate tannins and not much bite.
Name: El Esteco 2013 Don David Reserve Malbec (Calchaquí Valley)

Description: Plum and berry aromas are floral and suggestive of perfumed soap. This has a friendly, easy mouthfeel and limited but good flavors of spiced plum and raspberry. A mild, low-tannin finish leaves a peppery aftertaste.
Name: Cruz Alta 2012 Grand Reserve Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Opaque purple in color, this extracted, grapy Malbec smells of blackberry, iodine and wood shavings. The palate is lush and fat, with more than enough tannic scrub. Hard, blocky black-fruit flavors give way to an oaky finish with spice notes.
Name: Finca Perdriel 2012 Colección Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Southern Oregon, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: The high alcohol is a good indication of the ultraripe fruit flavors here. Raisins and cooked cherries dominate, set against a background of tart cherry-pie acids. The concentration is impressive, as is the purity of the fruit flavors.
Name: Schmidt 2011 Malbec (Southern Oregon)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Though the winery claims just 10% new French oak was used, the impact of smoky, charred wood is clear. Some bright, tart raspberry fruit is at the core. The tannins carry flavors of coffee grounds and dark chocolate.
Name: Plaisance Ranch 2013 Malbec (Applegate Valley)

Description: This screaming violet-colored chunkster is big and blocky up front, with aromas of vitamins and grapy black fruits. A giant palate holds big tannins, while heady flavors of black plum and oak spice finish minty, toasty and with power.
Name: Bodega Norton 2013 Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: A blast of fruit along with vanilla and marshmallow notes open this bright Malbec. Plum and wild berry flavors steal the show, while a tight, firm finish with screechy tannins gives this gravitas.
Name: Chakana 2014 Maipe Reserve Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Dense to the eye, then fully oaked and extracted on the nose, this beefy Malbec smells like coconut and blackberry. The palate is the same: jammy and extracted. Meaty berry flavors are heaped with a ton of oak, while the finish is syrupy and mighty tannic. Drink through 2020.
Name: Alta Vista 2011 Terroir Selection Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Big and blocky up front, this tough Malbec smells like pencil lead, dusty berry fruits and herbs. The palate, typical of most Rutini wines, is grabby and clampy, with piercing acidity and rock-hard tannins. Flavors of minty oak shadow berry fruit, while char and mint flavors steer the finish.
Name: Rutini 2013 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Brushy aromas of wild herbs along with cherry and plum scents feed into a fresh, fairly full palate. This is generously oaked for basic Malbec, and thus spice and resin notes share the stage with plum and blackberry flavors. A dry, spicy, resiny finish is the close.
Name: Kaiken 2012 Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: A strong oak character drives the nose, which also shows aromas of mint, tobacco and prune. This is extracted to the point of being chunky, while flavors of spiced plum and berry fruits have an herbal undertone. Staunch tannins and soupy, minty flavors are prominent on the finish.
Name: Domaine Le Billoud 2011 Familia Giraud Billoud Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Boisterous black plum and blackberry aromas properly announce an extra grabby palate with rock-hard tannins. This tastes like roasted plum, cassis and blackened spices. Tannic and dry as a bone on the finish, with a savory note.
Name: Monteviejo 2014 Festivo Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Charred and rugged on the nose, with gamy cherry and plum aromas, this feels narrow and clampy. Short, herbal, gamy berry flavors end with a lot of wood and related spice. This is a particular and individual wine with both good and challenging components.
Name: Mogollon 2012 Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: Tutti-frutti aromas seem powdery and suggestive of crushed stones. The palate on this tasty Malbec is fresh and fair. Blackberry and mild pepper flavors end lean and quick.
Name: Don Miguel Gascón 2014 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Cherry and raspberry aromas offer an accent of freshly mowed grass. Jammy and slightly obtuse in feel, this Uco Valley Malbec tastes of minty, herbal plum and finishes with heat and controlled bitterness.
Name: Tomero 2014 Malbec (Uco Valley)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Rustic smelling at first, this is showing a fair amount of animal and leather on the nose. In the mouth, this is wiry and pointed, with crisp acidity. Angular currant and red plum flavors finish clean and juicy.
Name: Bodega Calle 2012 Alberti Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

Description: Cherry and cassis aromas are bright and bring an animal note. An energetic palate hosts plum, berry and herbal flavors, while a forward-charging finish is fiery and leaves a palpable herbal aftertaste.
Name: Argento 2014 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Grapy aromas of black cherry introduce a tight, rubbery but fair palate. Ripe berry, black cherry and bitter chocolate flavors finish with a note of toasty oak but also fiery burn. Let this aggressive Malbec air out and it will show best.
Designation: Sustainably Farmed Estate Grown and Bottled
Name: Zolo 2015 Sustainably Farmed Estate Grown and Bottled Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Very little differentiates this from the winery's other single-varietal reds. They all seem like components rather than complete wines. It's dry and austere, with barely ripe red berry fruit. The hard, short finish and drying tannins make this wine difficult to like.
Name: Griffin Creek 2012 Malbec (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Subtle red fruit aromas show a flash of lemon peel. This medium-bodied Malbec is regular in every way—the flavors are a touch earthy, with spice and plum notes. The finish hums along while offering nothing new.
Name: Notro 2012 Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

Description: Black cherry aromas are grapy and simple, with spice and forced oak notes chiming in. This feels rugged with firm tannins. Short, spicy black cherry flavors finish with a lasting burn.
Name: Finca El Origen 2015 Reserva Estate Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: Punchy and grapy on the nose, this bright Malbec feels edgy and rubbery. Flavors of spicy black cherry and kirsch finish solidly, with a hint of chocolate flavor.
Name: Domaine Bousquet 2015 Malbec (Tupungato)

Description: This smells a bit stalky and murky, without much pop or freshness to the nose. A medium-bodied palate feels about right, while this tastes earthy, stalky and like roasted plum. Herbal notes come up on the finish.
Name: Árido 2012 Sustainably Farmed Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Black fruit aromas come with spice and earth notes. This is saturated to the point of feeling heavy. Herbal raspberry and plum flavors end with grating, scratchy, unresolved tannic grab.
Name: Quattrocchi 2011 Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: This murky Malbec has odd, horsey, berry aromas. It's rough and raw on the palate, with leafy, herbal plum flavors that finish rugged and with a dull spiciness.
Name: Restivo 2015 Silver Series Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: This Malbec's high-toned floral aromas of plum and blueberry come in front of a raw, abrasive palate. This tastes like pickled cranberry, while a citric finish is an enamel-peeler.
Name: Luis Segundo Correas 2015 El Cipres Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Valle de Uco, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Stalky cranberry aromas are incomplete and properly announce a soupy, clumsy palate. Green, weedy red-berry flavors have an accent of carob. Tannic and herbaceous on the finish.
Name: Viñedos Altamira Valley 2011 VAV Malbec (Valle de Uco)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Thick, meaty and pure aromas of blackcurrant, crushed lavender and minty dark chocolate greet the nose on this special bottling from Iris Rideau. Black cherries wash onto the palate alongside an amazing array of spices, from Indian to Middle Eastern, showing allspice, mace and many dried herb components.
Name: Rideau 2013 Siempre Happy Canyon Vineyard Malbec (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of dried herb, clove and plum are fresh. The flavors are supple and reserved, showing a pleasing tension between the fruit and acid that keeps the attention high.
Name: àMaurice 2012 Gamache Vineyard Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Barrel aromas of clove, vanilla and woodspice are followed by purple fruit and herb flavors. This wine shows a sense of finesse, with the mouthfeel contributing much of the appeal.
Name: Columbia Crest 2013 Reserve Malbec (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The oak (two-thirds new French and American) leads, with aromas of cocoa, cinnamon and spice followed by plum. The palate shows an elegant styling but with good intensity to the flavors.
Name: Castillo de Feliciana 2013 Estate Vineyard Malbec (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Blue-fruit aromas intermingle with vanilla and other barrel spices. The coffee and plum flavors are full and supple in feel, followed by a tart finish. The wood seems a bit primary but the fruit and feel is still hard to ignore.
Name: Stottle 2012 Elerding 6 Prong Malbec (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of blue and purple fruit mix with notes of dried thyme and black pepper. The flavors are tart and elegant, showing a good sense of balance and restraint, with a finish that lingers.
Name: Gamache 2011 Estate Grown Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Vanilla, thyme, dill and plum aromas are followed by plentiful fruit and barrel flavors that possess a pleasing mouthfeel. The oak is out front at times, especially on the aromas, but the wine is appealing.
Name: Bontzu 2013 Malbec (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of gunsmoke, tire rubber, ripe plum and garden herbs seem unsettled but still offer appeal. The palate is über-restrained in style, with the oak and alcohol pulled way back, putting the focus on its freshness and vibrancy. Give it a decant and put it on the dinner table to see it at its best.
Name: Wind Rose 2013 Lonesome Springs Ranch Malbec (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Plummy aromas are light and subtle. The palate is tart, lithe and flavorful with the oak seeming dialed back, putting the focus on the freshness of the fruit. Put it on the dinner table to see it shine.
Name: Wilridge 2013 Angiolina Vineyard Malbec (Yakima Valley)

Description: Dark and muscular up front, with a bright purple color and grapy, woody aromas, this Malbec is pleasant, albeit clipped on the palate. Short, punchy plum and boysenberry flavors finish with a barrel note or two, but not much more.
Name: Autoritas 2014 Reserva Malbec (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The Cabernet Franc blended in (24%) tussles with the Malbec on the aromas, with notes of green herbs, lemon twist, plum and barrel spice that don't seem in harmony. The reserved flavors seem more united, showing a sense of elegance.
Name: Hightower 2013 Malbec (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine comes in with a low, unheard-of (in Washington) 12.2% alcohol. The aromas offer reticent and unusual notes of wheat, lemongrass, tobacco, vanilla and herbs while the flavors are tart and supple. It doesn't seem outright underripe but comes off as faint.
Name: Cougar Crest 2012 Estate Grown Malbec (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Leathery on the nose, this wine shows peppercorns, plum skins and anise aromas. The palate is a bit flat, with touches of pepper and boysenberry.
Name: Jason-Stephens 2012 Estate Malbec (Santa Clara Valley)

Description: Jammy berry and pastry aromas are basic but flat. This feels easy and fruity, but not the least bit exact. Generic black fruit and berry flavors end with notes of plum and licorice.
Name: Autoritas 2014 Malbec (Central Valley)

Description: Prickly aromas of juniper and cherry are sharp and lean towards green. This Malbec feels tight and lean, while plum and herbal aromas qualify as basic. A light, racy finish pinches and tastes generic.
Name: Apaltagua 2014 Reserva Malbec (Maule Valley)

Description: Murky, muddled aromas of ground peanuts, worn leather and stewed plum are a good measure of what's to come. This Malbec feels wide, with zero structure. Heavy, loamy flavors suggest cooked blackberry and prune, while the finish is thick and chunky, with a continuation of strange flavors.
Name: Santa Luz 2014 Alba Malbec (Central Valley)

Description: Aromas of mushroom, dirty water and mud puddle are far from inviting. Herbal, briny flavors of mushroom, salt and bitterness come with almost no fruit.
Name: Viña Requingua 2014 Los Riscos Malbec (Curicó Valley)

Description: Top of the range from Eugénie, this pure Malbec is huge, firm and very concentrated. Wood aging has added spice and emphasized the dryness that comes from the fruit and wood tannins. But the fruit is all there, a juicy background that will come out as the wine ages.Drink this impressive wine from 2020.
Name: Château Eugénie 2012 Haute Collection Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Named after enologist Benjamin Cooker, this wine was aged in egg-shaped cement tanks. Pure Malbec that is rich, rounded with spice and firm tannins, it has a generous, spacious character that is beginning to develop. With a dark background to the black-currant fruits, this needs to age. Drink from 2018.
Designation: Le Sang de la Vigne Signé Benjamin Cooker
Name: Château de Gaudou 2013 Le Sang de la Vigne Signé Benjamin Cooker Malbec (Cahors)

Description: This is the big wine from Famaey. Bold, ripe black fruits are rich and generous in character. With a tarry backdrop and some dry tannins from wood aging, the wine is dense, generous and still young. Drink this powerful wine from 2020.
Name: Château Famaey 2011 Cuvée X Malbec (Cahors)

Description: This is not your average power-packed Malbec. Opening scents of meaty, wild berry fruits are feral and interesting, and also quite bold. A layered, deep palate shows purity, black-fruit flavors and oaky additions of chocolate, spice and pepper. A dark, minty, spicy finish is fiery, so drink cautiously through 2023.
Name: Marchiori & Barraud 2013 Cuartel 2 Marchiori Vineyard Malbec (Perdriel)

Description: Black as night in color then lush, ripe and silky smooth on the nose, this heady Malbec offers aromas of marzipan, balsam, licorice and cassis. The palate is intense and tannic, with lusty flavors of blackberry, prune and chocolate. Finishing flavors of mocha, cocoa and toast are lush and long. Drink through 2018.
Name: Monteviejo 2009 Lindaflor La Violeta Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: Immediately appealing, this trendsetting Malbec proudly cranks out blackberry and spice aromas that are on the spot. Full and tannic on the palate, but not too fierce, this tastes of bold, earthy plum and black raspberry with savory notes kicking in. A long, tightly wound finish with well-integrated oak means this will last. Drink through 2022.
Name: Bodega Catena Zapata 2012 Catena Alta Historic Rows Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: This is a ripe oaky specimen with smoky aromas of hickory along with licorice, pencil lead and jammy blackberry. In the mouth, it's huge and spreads out like a blanket. Flavors of baked black fruits are fully ripe, while oak-driven toasty, blackened, chocolaty flavors push the finish. Drink through 2018.
Name: Monteviejo 2010 Lindaflor Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: Ripe, jammy aromas of smashed blueberry are elevated by hints of herbs and cola. A layered and lively mouthfeel is a big plus on this plot-selection Malbec, while blackberry, herb and smoked-meat flavors finish firm fresh and with depth. Drink through 2022.
Name: Salentein 2012 Single Vineyard Plot No 21 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: The oak aging, implicit in the name of the wine, is present in its smooth character. This bottling is in the elegant style typical of Famaey wines and also has weight and firm, concentrated black fruit with acidity and a dry core. Drink from 2019.
Name: Château Famaey 2011 Fût de Chêne Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Cool briary plum and blackberry aromas show lactic, creamy oak, which is nothing unusual for Cobos. Plump, dense and saturated in the mouth, this block-selection Malbec is extremely ripe, with medicinal black fruit and raisiny flavors touched up by mocha and peppery spice. An oaky, spicy finish is par for the course. Drink through 2021.
Name: Viña Cobos 2012 Marchiori Vineyard Block C2 Malbec (Perdriel)

Description: Stout bold berry aromas come with a hint of bacon. This feels condensed, with rubbery, pinchy tannins. Flavors of plum and wild berry are tightly wound, while this is long and loud on the finish, with a recurrence of abrasive tannins. Drink through 2020.
Name: El Enemigo 2013 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Smoky aromas of fresh-cut wood blend with berry and cassis form a welcoming, generous bouquet. This feels lively on the palate, albeit tartaric. Oaky plum, cassis and vanilla flavors finish full and agreeable. Drink through 2019.
Name: Navarro Correas 2011 Alegoría Gran Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Concentrated, ripe blackberry and cassis aromas come with peppery spice and cedary oak notes. This is big and generous on the palate, with roasted, well-oaked blackberry flavors. A touch of heat lends sizzle to the finish. Drink through 2020.
Designation: The Apple Doesn't Fall Far From The Tree
Name: Matias Riccitelli 2013 The Apple Doesn't Fall Far From The Tree Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Heavy oak is a major theme on this full-bodied Malbec that's cool and woody to start, with aromas of vanilla and sweet plastic along with ripe blackberry and cassis. Wall-to-wall huge in mouthfeel, this tastes mostly of toasty oak, with blackened, charred berry, mint and peppery flavors in the backdrop. In time look for the oak to settle and the fruit to emerge. Drink through 2021.
Name: Altocedro 2013 Finca Los Turcos Malbec (La Consulta)

Description: This ripe Malbec offers jammy blueberry aromas that hint at raisin but pull back in the nick of time. A round pulpy palate is home to black cherry, berry and plum flavors supported by loamy earthy notes. A fleshy finish isn't exact but it's friendly. Drink through 2019.
Name: Ricardo Santos 2013 La Madras Vineyard Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Ripe borderline raisiny aromas include earth, cedar and graphite scents. This is concentrated, grabby and fully extracted. Flavors of jammy black fruits blend with spicy saucy notes prior to a finish with flavors of tomato, herbs, salt and gamy meat. Firm acidity guarantees this will last at least another five years before falling off.
Name: Bodega Catena Zapata 2013 Catena Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: This is an unusual, exotic take on Malbec. The bouquet delivers cardamom, sandalwood and spiced black currant aromas. In the mouth, it's grabby with pinching tannins. Blueberry and cardamom flavors end ripe, with decent follow through. Drink now.
Name: Ricominciare 2009 Altísimo Malbec (Uco Valley)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Compact aromas of red berries get a boost from oak-based coconut, cedar and graphite notes. This is a blend of three Malbec vineyards of varying elevations; it's bursting with acidity, while high-toned plum and currant flavors are a touch salty. A lively, fiery finish is fueled by latent acidity. Drink through 2020.
Name: Nieto Senetiner 2011 Terroir Blend Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

Description: This wine is all about juicy blackberry and delicious ripe black plums. It is structured, with dry tannins in the background, but up front is fruity, bold and with a lightly smoky, perfumed aftertaste. It is almost ready to drink; just wait until late 2016.
Name: Château Saint-Didier-Parnac 2014 Prieuré de Cénac Malbec (Cahors)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Primary aromas of black cherry and cassis come with minerally notes, herbal hints and a drop of iodine. This feels good but narrow, while saucy, lightly herbal berry flavors end with tolerable saltiness. Drink through 2019.
Name: Piattelli 2011 Grand Reserve Limited Production Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

Description: Strong blackberry aromas come with hints of wood smoke, graphite and minerality. On the palate, it is high in acidity and a touch scouring, but also fresh and lively. Common blackberry and toasty oak flavors end fresh and crisp, but short.
Name: Mascota 2013 La Mascota Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: With plenty of solid tannins to keep the structure firm, this is also based around fresh black fruits. The two elements have produced a wine that, as it matures, will become balanced and poised. It's not dense, but presents elegant structure that has enough richness. Drink this wine from 2018.
Name: Château Famaey 2012 Classic Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Ripe but constricted plum and raspberry aromas are firmly in the red-fruit zone. This feels good and fresh, with tomatoey acidity. Saucy plum and red-currant flavors finish nicely, with rubbery tannins. Drink through 2019.
Name: Budeguer 2011 Cuatro Mil Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Boysenberry and exotic notes of all-spice and cardamom set this Malbec apart from the field. In the mouth, this is typically angular, with sharp acidity and not much cushion. A one-note, linear flavor of rooty plum is neither fruity nor dry, while the finish fails to rise or fall; it just hums along on a singular beam of acid. Drink from 2018–2030.
Name: Rutini 2012 Apartado Gran Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Jammy blueberry and boysenberry aromas include graphite and ink notes. This feels jammy to the point of being sluggish and heavy. Syrupy but not sweet flavors of herbal black fruits finish with a lasting gamy note.
Name: Zuccardi 2013 Q Malbec (Valle de Uco)

Appellation: Valle de Uco, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Plum and berry aromas are infiltrated by touches of leafy green and leather on the nose of this texturally sound, herbal-tasting Malbec. Flavors of plum and spice are a touch weedy, while baking spice and clove notes take over on the finish.
Name: SignoSeis 2013 The Angel Oak Reserva Malbec (Valle de Uco)

Appellation: Valle de Uco, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Macho grapy aromas are offset by spunky raspberry scents. Fruity and a bit narrow and grabby across the palate, this delivers Mendoza's patented black-fruit flavors wrapped in chocolaty oak. Spice and oak remain present on a full finish.
Name: Zuccardi 2013 Serie A Malbec (Valle de Uco)

Description: Dark spicy aromas of black plum and black currant are solid. In the mouth, this is saturated and hard, with heavy overall density and strong tannins. A dark, spicy, blackened set of dark-berry flavors finishes with more spice and mint than fruit.
Name: Durigutti 2013 HD Clásico Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: Stalky aromas of leathery berry fruits suggest animal and earth. This is raw, tannic and hard on the palate, with saucy berry flavors that fall off towards stalky and stewy. A dense tannic finish is structured but tastes herbal and stalky.
Name: El Hijo 2009 Prodigo Reserva Malbec (La Consulta)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This estate-grown effort is almost jet black, and scented with tar, smoke and black fruits. It's dense beyond dense, and completely shut down. Even after aeration, decanting, and hours of breathing time, it remained stubbornly closed. Brief hints of tobacco and earth, cassis and coffee suggest that with more bottle age, this one could really blossom.
Name: Ledger David 2013 Malbec (Rogue Valley)

Description: This wine comes from Alexander Valley-grown Malbec, a variety the producer has been planting in earnest over the last few years. Dark pink-red, it is medium bodied and refreshing, with notes of cherry, blueberry and vanilla.
Name: Rodney Strong 2014 Rosé of Malbec (Sonoma County)

Description: Big, blocky black-fruit aromas are reduced and potent. This is quite chunky and extracted in feel, with jammy gritty blackberry and plum flavors that are mildly herbal and simmer with heat and heft on the finish.
Name: Bodega Norton 2013 Barrel Select Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Earthy slightly grassy infusions work their way onto a hot energetic bouquet. This feels racy, drawing and a bit clampy, while woody spicy flavors of rubbery berry fruits finish bold and hot like the beginning.
Name: Tiza 2013 Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: Woody and dense at first, this smells bright and fruity as it opens. A solid palate houses lightly toasted flavors of blackberry that turn more peppery and toasty on a fairly oaky finish.
Name: Doña Paula 2013 Estate Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Rubbery slightly grassy berry and plum aromas give way to a fresh and fair palate that works. Oaky cherry and berry flavors are standard but well presented, while the finish is mild, with leftover plum and berry notes.
Name: Ruta 22 2013 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: This big, firm wine offers serious tannins as well as rich blackberry fruits. It's a structured, dark wine, spicy from wood aging and ripely concentrated. Drink from 2017.
Name: Château du Caillau 2013 Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Reduced rubbery aromas of blackberry and black currant come with a touch of mushroom. This is extracted, heavy and blocky on the palate, while baked blackberry flavors are massive but short on elegance. Bitter coffee flavors, rugged tannins and stickiness make for a heavy finish.
Name: Benegas 2011 La Encerrada Estate Vineyard Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Aromas of cedary oak, vanilla and spiced berry fruits are encouraging. In the mouth, however, this old-vines Malbec is jumpy and rubbery, with high acidity. Flavors of stalky red plum taste mildly oxidized and Sherried, while the finish is herbal and tastes burnt. All in all, this just doesn't fully come together.
Name: Lagarde 2012 Primeras Viñas Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

Description: Berry aromas are a bit stalky, leathery and roasted. This Malbec is lively on the palate, with energy and good balance. A creamy resiny flavor profile is oaky and a touch hot.
Name: Larrea 2013 Juana Larrea Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Jammy muscled-up aromas of blackberry show hints of spice, especially red chili flake. This feels full, round and comfortable, with moderate tannic clamp. Herbal black-fruit flavors finish bold, with a touch of dry bitter oak.
Name: Finca Sophenia 2014 Altosur Malbec (Tupungato)

Description: This smells rubbery, with oaky spice, but airing allows it to expand across a lively palate. Herbal, spicy red-berry flavors are strongest in the midpalate, while peppery flavors, rubbery tannins and scratchiness define the finish.
Name: Tomero 2013 Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: Brushy aromas of field herbs blend with scents of oaky vanilla, plastic and stalky berry fruits. This feels saturated and rubbery. A salty flavor profile holds onto the bouquet's stalky character, while the finishing flavors are peppery and herbal, with a hint of sweet plastic derived from oak.
Name: Revancha 2011 La Primera Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Grassy aromas of red currant suggest cowhide. This has a grabby narrow palate with green-leaning raspberry flavors. Overall, this is fresh and wiry in style, with a choppy, mildly tannic finish.
Name: Laberinto 2013 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: At first, this smells almost entirely of wood and stalky berry fruits; with time, it takes on a cedary quality but remains leathery, minty and rooty. On the palate this is grabby while stalky, briny flavors of herbal fruits end rustic minty and challenging.
Name: Septima 2013 Obra Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: This is a severely oaked wine that sizzles and smokes with aromas of campfire, creosote, road tar and coconut. On the palate, it's concentrated but also brutish. Roasted oaky black-fruit flavors echo the nose, while mint and chocolate dominate the finish. Time can only help this come around.
Name: Melipal 2013 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Light scratchy aromas of spiced plum and raspberry set up a racy lean palate that nobody would label as heavy. Quick simple flavors of red plum and red currant finish tangy but mild.
Name: Ocaso 2014 Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Côtes du Lot, Southwest France, France
Description: This wine reflects a fruity, young and fresh style. It's packed with bright red fruits; a soft texture hints at minerality and great acidity. It's made to be drunk young, without any wood aging, so drink now and until 2017.
Name: Château Famaey 2014 Chevalier Famaey Malbec (Côtes du Lot)

Description: Herbal rubbery plum aromas are fully oaked, and thus there's a campfire/brush fire quality to the nose. There's energy on the palate, which holds steady and feels in tune. Spicy herbal red-berry flavors with a ton of secondary oak finish mild and dry.
Name: Valentín Bianchi 2013 Famiglia Malbec

Description: Stewy foresty aromas of dark berry fruits are rustic and show a hint of graphite. This is severe on the palate, with hard pinching tannins. Stalky, salty flavors of roasted black plum and blackberry finish similarly, with tannic bite.
Name: Kirkland Signature 2011 Signature Series Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Although less common than it once was, Malbec is still often part of the blend in red Bergerac. However, this pure Malbec is unusual. It's dark in color, with an almost medicinal aroma. The palate is pure black fruit with firm tannins to support the smoky blackberry flavors. Drink young for the fruitiness.
Name: Château Laulerie 2013 Malbec (Bergerac)

Description: Flat cherry and clay aromas set up a scratchy, almost citric palate with short but bright plum and raspberry flavors. This is basic Malbec with a tart hollow wiry finish.
Name: Restivo 2011 Reserve Malbec (Patagonia)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Light cherry and raspberry aromas come in front of a grabby rubbery palate. This tastes like salty plum, with little variation of that theme. A solid finish tastes exactly like what came before.
Name: Lagarde 2014 Altas Cumbres Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

Description: This extracted purple Malbec is furry and grapy smelling. A heavy sticky palate feels creamy, while cherry and boysenberry flavors are so ripe that the word syrupy is in play. A note of chocolate and lasting creaminess come up on the finish.
Name: Zolo 2013 Reserve Estate Grown Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Brambly and wild on the nose, this Cafayate Malbec features a narrow palate with edgy, briary plum and berry flavors. This seems riper with time in the glass, but all the way through it's pinchy in feel and ultimately ends with candied sweetness.
Name: Altocedro 2013 Abras Malbec (Cafayate)

Description: Earthy stalky leathery aromas suggest modest ripeness. This feels medium in weight, while short salty flavors of plum and raspberry are herbal and arguably a touch weedy. This feels a little hot on the finish.
Name: Septima 2014 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: For a Cahors, this is a surprisingly light and gently fruity wine. It is dry, with some tannic character, but it is much more about youthful black fruit flavors than it is about structure. It is ready to drink now
Name: Clément Bosquet 2014 Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Big, raisiny and obtuse up front, this fully extracted Malbec is heavy on the palate, with raisin, prune and cassis flavors that show interior notes of green herbs. This tastes minty, herbal and hot on the finish, with barely any freshness.
Name: Bodega Cuarto Dominio 2014 Lote 44 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Scratchy raspberry aromas are jammy but also green, with a strange hint of perfume. This feels chunky and rubbery, with stretchy, elastic tannins. Flavors of baked berry fruits, prune and herbs finish hot.
Designation: Valle Las Acequias Finca Don Angelino Single Vineyard
Name: Luis Segundo Correas 2011 Valle Las Acequias Finca Don Angelino Single Vineyard Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Grapy candied berry aromas mix with loud oak that smells like clove and mint. This has a narrow astringent mouthfeel and strange-tasting berry flavors that end with a rugged finish.
Name: Quattrocchi 2013 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: This is overripe and raisiny, no two ways about it. Hailing from a very hot year, this feels flat and flabby, while raisin and prune are the dominant flavors. Blatant overripeness and a ton of weight render this out of balance.
Name: Budeguer 2009 Patrimonio Seleccion de Barricas Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Spearmint and weedy red-fruit aromas lead to raw palate. This is more herbal than fruity, with a lean rubbery finish.
Name: Pampa 2013 Reserve Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Rustic tomato and cherry aromas make for a scratchy opening. This is wiry and grating in feel, with sour plum and red-currant flavors. A fresh but scratchy and herbal tasting finish isn't exactly friendly.
Name: Michel Torino 2014 Cuma Made With Organic Grapes Malbec (Cafayate)

Description: Herbal berry aromas suggest density, and this is certainly dark full-sized and sticky. Pumped-up candied black-fruit flavors are thick and gooey, with cooked brown sugar, mint and toast flavors on the finish.
Name: La Riojana Coop 2014 Triada Malbec (La Rioja)

Description: Muddy plum and berry aromas lead to a sharp, rugged palate. Tart plum and pie cherry flavors end raw, rough and bitter.
Name: Callia 2014 Alta Malbec (Tulum Valley)

Description: Aromas of spearmint gum along with a weird coating of oak create a challenging nose. This is high in acidity, to the point of feeling shearing. Sour herbal plum flavors finish rough and bracing.
Name: Michel Torino 2014 Coleccion Malbec (Calchaquí Valley)

Description: Herbaceous red-fruit and forced fiery oak aromas give this a spicy, almost Pinot Noir-like nose. Raw as nails on the palate, this tastes like herbal green strawberry and chemicals. Weedy on the finish.
Name: Mountain Door 2014 Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is redolent with aromas of blackberry, leather and spice. It's full bodied, with sweet fruit flavors that show richness, depth and purity, finishing warm.
Name: Latta 2012 Northridge Vineyard Malbec (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Cocoa, baking spice and blackberry aromas lead to opulent herb and dark fruit flavors. This is high-octane but generally holds it well.
Name: Milbrandt 2012 Vineyard Series Reserve Malbec (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Light aromas of plum and spice are followed by cherry flavors that show pleasing purity. This is a delightful example of the variety.
Name: William Grassie 2012 Petit Colline Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Cocoa, coffee, spice and dark fruit aromas are followed by smooth fruit flavors. The barrel influence is primary but this still brings plenty of enjoyment, with good balance and depth of flavor.
Name: Mercer 2012 Spice Cabinet Vineyard Malbec (Horse Heaven Hills)

Description: Rich in oak and tannin, this wine delivers big flavors of blackberry and plum, supported by rounded layers of soft acidity and mouthfeel. Dark in color, it's a bold wine with plenty of personality and power.
Name: Rodney Strong 2012 Estate Vineyards Malbec (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromatically, this wine seems locked up with notes of tire rubber, herbs, pepper, woodspice and plum. Favors are supple and reserved in style. It's a unique expression of the variety from this cool vintage.
Name: Convergence Zone 2011 Black Cloud Malbec (Red Mountain)

Description: A soft and layered expression of dense black cherry, chocolate and spicy tobacco, this is easy to enjoy and approachable, rich and round. A taste of black licorice dots the finishing moments.
Name: Merryvale 2012 Malbec (Napa Valley)
