Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This tastes full of dark-fruit flavors and is well structured by moderate tannins and firm acidity. The color is deep red, while aromas are bright yet ripe like black currants. On the finish a hint of spicy oak comes through. It's bold and full-bodied.
Name: Cuda Ridge Wines 2012 Malbec (Livermore Valley)

Description: Dark, concentrated, mildly charred aromas of black plum and blackberry are toasty, strong and minerally. Following the nose, this Malbec is chewy, extracted and fairly rich. Blackberry is the lead fruit flavor, backed up by a lot of oak and vanilla.
Name: Lamadrid 2013 Single Vineyard Malbec (Agrelo)

Description: Hints of rubber, iodine and graphite accent concentrated blackberry aromas in front of a chewy, pruny palate. Flavors of rubber and herbs share the stage with prune and raisin, while the finish is rich and plodding, with depth but limited complexity. Drink through 2018.
Name: Andeluna 2012 Altitud Malbec (Tupungato)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a rich, full-bodied wine with powerful blackberry flavors complemented by notes of freshly ground coffee, cherry and barrel spices.
Name: Swiftwater Cellars 2012 Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aged in equal parts French and American oak (43% new), this initially puts barrel tones in the lead. Notes of toasty spices, cocoa, toffee and coffee come out in front of blue and black fruit. The flavors are sweet but reserved in style, trailing toward the finish. There's a lot to enjoy but the oak seems a little overweighted for the fruit that's in the bottle.
Name: Obelisco Estate 2012 Estate Grown Malbec (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas on this wine are light and elusive, with notes of black pepper, dried flowers and green herbs. It's elegant in style with tart acids and rustic tannins.
Name: àMaurice 2011 Amparo Estate Malbec (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Bold, clean and straightforward, this is a tasty red wine with lots of fresh fruit flavors. It smells like blackberries and licorice, and tastes rich and full bodied. It finishes dry with a hint of tannin that makes it appetizing. It would make a good house red.
Name: Drytown 2013 Estate Malbec (Sierra Foothills)

Description: Tasty, medium bodied and well balanced, this offers gushing red cherry, plum and spicy oak in the aromas and a touch of red bell pepper in the flavors. A slight bite of tannin keeps it from being one dimensional.
Name: Fenestra 2011 Silvaspoons Vineyard Malbec (Lodi)

Description: This creamy, oaky Malbec opens with aromas of rubber and raw oak, although with airing black plum, blackberry and chocolate scents rise up. Full, creamy and jammy in feel, this tastes of black plum, blackberry, chocolate and vanilla. A heady, oaky, sticky finish wraps it up.
Name: Don Miguel Gascón 2012 Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Reductive at first, this wine opens to show aromas of coffee, dried herbs, carob and eucalyptus, with the barrel notes initially taking the lead followed by blue fruit. The fruit flavors are silky in feel with abundant coffee and plum notes backed by rustic tannins.
Name: Castillo de Feliciana 2012 Phinny Hill Vineyard Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Focused berry aromas are cool and smell slightly rubbery. A medium-bodied, good-quality palate features generic but pleasant plum and berry flavors, while the finish holds steady, with a dash of spice and complexity.
Name: Bodega Renacer 2013 Punto Final Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Earthy aromas of cola, plum and blackberry come with a saline note. For the most part, this feels pure, good and fruity, albeit a bit rubbery. Short but solid blackberry and cassis flavors finish with mild oak and a touch of peppery spice.
Name: Salentein 2013 Killka Collection Malbec (Uco Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: All estate-grown Malbec, this pale salmon-colored wine shows high-toned notes of spice, herbs and cherry. It drinks dry with lightly styled fruit flavors, with the concentration a bit wanting.
Name: Gordon Estate 2014 Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This medium-bodied wine has personality. It smells like pencil shavings, black tea and plums, and tastes like prunes and pomegranate juice, finishing with that same spicy, tea-like character. The texture is smooth and the balance is good.
Name: Ripken 2013 Under the Sea Malbec (Lodi)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This 100% varietal wine has aromas of vanilla, milk chocolate and dark fruit along with light oxidative notes. It's fully flavored with coffee and dark cherry notes backed by gritty tannins.
Name: Henry Earl 2012 Malbec (Red Mountain)

Description: Dilute, oddball aromas of blueberry and currant are rendered earthy and less than fully clean by a whiff of compost. This feels basic and jammy, while floral berry flavors settle on herbal and peppery. It finishes lean.
Name: Alfredo Roca 2013 Fincas Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Aromas of cherry Lifesaver and red currant are medicinal. This has a thick, sticky, cough-syrup mouthfeel and dark, medicinal flavors of stewed plum, burnt brown sugar and crème de cassis. Heat and sticky grab define the finish on this sweet Malbec.
Name: Zuccardi 2011 Malamado Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Although a bit stalky and weak on the nose, this offers reasonably fresh red-berry aromas in front of a fair, slightly jammy palate. Herbal red-berry and plum flavors show a hint of chocolate on the finish.
Name: Tussock Jumper 2013 Malbec (San Juan)

Description: Smoky, roasted aromas of blackberry, cassis and graphite introduce a thick, layered, meaty palate that's well balanced despite being overtly ripe and generous. Flavors of toasty, blackened spice, lush blackberry and cassis finish rich, smoky and warming. Drink this benchmark Chilean Malbec through 2020.
Name: Viu Manent 2011 Viu 1 Malbec (Colchagua Valley)

Description: Rich, ripe blackberry, cassis and leathery aromas are full, stately and fitting for this lush, layered, tannic offering from Viu Manent's top Malbec vineyard. Toasty flavors of blackberry, black currant, herbs and chocolate finish chewy, beefy and full, with a hint of resiny oak. Drink through 2020.
Name: Viu Manent 2012 San Carlos Single Vineyard Malbec (Colchagua Valley)

Description: Oaky, deep berry aromas are slightly citric and stalky. In the mouth, huge tannins create a grating but mouthfilling sensation. Herbal, lightly green flavors of cassis, boysenberry, carob and salted beef finish strong and solid. Drink through 2019.
Name: Luis Felipe Edwards 2012 LFE 900 Malbec (Colchagua Valley)

Description: With a bright purple tint, this opens with aromas of raw oak, pencil lead, lettuce leaf and black currant. It's pinching and tannic on the palate, with lightly green, juicy blueberry and cassis flavors. A rubbery feeling, tannic palate is potent and calls out for a pairing of steak or lamb. Drink through 2019.
Name: Polkura 2012 Malbec (Marchigue)

Description: Aromas of orange peel and juniper berry go face-to-face with plum, berry and baking spice scents. This is a choppy, tannic, raw-feeling wine with cool flavors of herbal berry and eucalyptus. A drawing, high-acid, hard-tannin finish closes out this rugged Malbec.
Name: Caliterra 2012 Tributo Single Vineyard Malbec (Colchagua Valley)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Malbec is among the winery's better red grapes, showing the most fruit and varietal character. Purple berries and plums are in view, with chalky acids and a bit of toasty oak.
Name: Reustle 2013 Golgotha Bloc Malbec (Umpqua Valley)

Description: Blackberry and cassis aromas are so subtle, balanced and clean that they barely register while luring you in. An elastic, wide palate has firm, slightly abrasive tannins that should mellow with more time in the bottle, while blackberry, chocolate and spice flavors finish long and smooth, with a hint of raisin. Drink from 2016 through 2021.
Designation: Terroir Series Coletto Single Vineyard El Peral
Name: Trapiche 2011 Terroir Series Coletto Single Vineyard El Peral Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This 100% varietal wine hails from McClellan Estate and Minnick Hills vineyards. Notes of plum, licorice and fresh herbs partner with barrel spices that include chocolate and clove. It's soft and supple in feel, showing impressive flavor intensity while still retaining deftness of expression.
Name: Seven Hills 2012 Malbec (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Deep purple in color, this wine offers notes of plum and high-toned herbs with nary a barrel note in sight. Flavors are restrained, pure and fresh with tart, mouthwatering acidity, good depth and more tannic heft than this variety often displays. Best after 2016.
Name: Kerloo 2012 Stone Tree Malbec (Wahluke Slope)

Description: Smoky blackberry aromas hint at raw charcoal and hickory. A deep, lush mouthfeel is mildly tannic, while toasty flavors of chocolate, herbs and menthol brush shoulders with blackberry and spice. This is big, deep, fruity and oaky on the finish. More time will only help it out; drink from 2016–2023.
Name: Trapiche 2011 Terroir Series Orellana Single Vineyard Malbec (La Consulta)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Fermented with native yeast with a nearly 40-day maceration, this deep-purple-colored wine offers a complex, compelling assortment of aromas including mulberry, lavender, dried herbs, plum and incense. Over time it ramps up in intensity with rich, flavorful yet still deft dark blue-fruit flavors, showing freshness and vibrancy with mouthwatering acids that captivate the senses.
Name: Latta 2011 Northridge Vineyard Malbec (Wahluke Slope)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Compact and grapy up front, this is showing pure berry power on the nose. Lush and intense but also bright and balanced in feel, this Malbec is pumping out fleshy blackberry flavors offset by meaty notes. A full, mellow finish is deep and pure, with absorbed oak. Drink through 2020.
Name: Trivento 2012 Golden Reserve Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

Description: A rich, oaky opening salvo includes aromas of maple, graphite and raw wood atop blackberry and boysenberry. A full, loud, acidic palate is oaky but balanced and considerate. Toasty, woody, minty flavors ride high on a berry fruit base, while oak is more than prominent on the finish. Drink through 2020.
Name: Melipal 2012 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Blackberry, black cherry and crusty, toasty aromas of sawdust and shoe polish make for a bullish bouquet. This Malbec is concentrated and dark in color, flavor and feel. Blackberry, pepper, graphite and herbal flavors turn more complex and towards cola and tea on the finish. Drink through 2020.
Name: Durigutti 2012 HD Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: This opens with a gaseous blast of cheesy oak and volatility, although airing settles it down. In the mouth, tartaric bite blends with chewy, rubbery black-fruit tannins, while flavors of blackberry, cassis and coffee end with toasty bitterness and chocolaty notes. Drink through 2022.
Designation: Terroir Series Ambrosia Single Vineyard Gualtallary
Name: Trapiche 2011 Terroir Series Ambrosia Single Vineyard Gualtallary Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This atypical varietal offering comes from one of the state's top Cabernet Sauvignon sites. It's a Washington Malbec prototype that reveals herbs and brambly blue fruit along with barrel accents (22 months in 50% new French). The flavors and feel are pitch-perfect with soft, rich plum notes that lead to a lengthy finish.
Name: Hamilton 2010 Champoux Vineyard Malbec (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: This well-aged but still lively Malbec opens with cherry, rubber and earthy aromas that reflect time in the bottle. A focused mouthfeel belies the wine's age, while cherry, herb and medicinal flavors finish wide and flush, with more breadth than one might expect from an eight-year-old Malbec. Drink through 2019.
Name: Enrique Foster 2007 Limited Edition Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This 100% varietal wine is unabashedly appealing with pure, direct notes of coffee and plum. It's the feel that truly dazzles, with a supple velvety texture and a tart uptick on the lingering finish.
Name: Flying Trout 2012 Mary's Block Windrow Vineyard Malbec (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: Ripe berry and plum aromas are full and good. This Malbec has an easy mouthfeel that's weighty but well defined, with modest tannins and integrated acidity. Ripe cassis and berry flavors finish with a touch of creamy oak.
Name: Bressia 2012 Monteagrelo Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Right off the bat this gives off a saucy whiff of grass and green along with creamy red-berry notes and raisin. The palate is wide and tannic, with oak resin that hasn't been absorbed. Flavors of prune, raisin, raspberry, plum and herbs show a lactic note, while spice notes and a reprise of green carry the finish.
Name: Cielo y Tierra 2007 Don Juan Nahuel Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: With a warm nose of plum and blackberry, this sports a juicy, wiry palate, with woody weight. Raspberry, plum, toast and leather flavors finish earthy and lightly baked, with leftover oak that needs to be absorbed. Drink through 2018.
Name: Trapiche 2012 Broquel Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This appealing wine offers notes of fresh blue plums, huckleberry, tire rubber and woodspice. The flavors show purity, intensity and length—a very pretty example of the variety.
Name: Gård 2012 Lawrence Vineyards Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Full and ripe, this also smells a touch raisiny as well as green. Jammy and extracted in feel, with plenty of oak resin to wade through, this tastes woody, with related flavors of vanilla and cream mixing with berry and cassis. It's ripe, tannic and woody, but very good in that style.
Name: Pascual Toso 2012 Reserve Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Although this shows slightly fiery, hot notes on the nose, offsetting black-fruit and spice aromas are helpful. This has a rustic, meaty feel with hard tannins, while black-fruit and herbal flavors are loud and finish with earth notes, a hint of prune and warmth. In every way this comes across as a warm-climate Malbec.
Name: Famiglia Mosso 2012 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Heavy oak and spice aromas are the primary greeting on this muscular, thick, well-made Malbec. Following the lead set by the bouquet, this tastes of spicy oak, chocolate and creamy blackberry. Clove, nutmeg and chocolate flavors drive the finish.
Name: Chakana 2013 Ayni Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: This is stalky and rustic on the nose, with Band-Aid and leather aromas accenting berry and plum scents. In the mouth, it is both jammy and a bit abrasive; burnt flavors of plum, raspberry and blackberry finish with herbal influences and raw tannins.
Name: Luigi Bosca 2012 Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Intriguing aromas suggest barrel spices, vanilla and green herbs, with some of the notes seeming to tussle. The plum flavors are sweet with tart acidity and lightly chalky tannins.
Name: Columbia Winery 2012 Limited Release Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine doesn't seem to have fully ripened. Aromas that veer into the green compete with coffee, plum and woodspice. It's light and soft but concentrated in flavor, making up for any aromatic deficiencies.
Name: Hamilton 2010 Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Jammy, reduced aromas of cassis, blueberry and animal hide lead to a juicy, fresh palate that's not too thick or concentrated. Blackberry and blueberry flavors are lightly peppered, while the finish is quick and light for Malbec. This is a new wine that aims at freshness and simple fruit more than power and weight.
Name: Riglos 2012 Quinto Malbec (Tupungato)

Description: This friendly wine offers fresh, jammy berry and cherry aromas. The palate has a bit of grit and stickiness to it, while blackberry, black cherry and boysenberry flavors are ripe, sweet, not pushy and ultimately satisfying.
Name: Rutini 2012 Trumpeter Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Berry and plum aromas are spicy and saucy, with secondary notes of tomato and oregano. Snappy on the palate, this live-wire Malbec is a bit aggressive and acidic. Toasty oak and mint flavors accent fresh red-berry fruit prior to an energetic yet woody finish that's raw feeling but fair.
Name: Ferllen 2011 Reserve Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This saignée-style wine is pale salmon in color, showing some bricking. It drinks dry with rounded suggestions of cherry and watermelon providing easy-drinking enjoyment.
Name: Hamilton 2013 Rosé of Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Jammy, soft blueberry aromas are a touch green. This is syrupy, heavy and sticky on the palate, with chocolate, prune and peppery flavors. Tannic and heavy on the finish, this is an overweight Malbec that's lush to the point of being fat.
Name: Sur de los Andes 2013 Premium Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine shows a mixture of fruit and barrel notes, with vanilla, coffee bean and milk chocolate playing off plum and cherry. It's soft and plush in feel, trailing toward the finish.
Name: Thurston Wolfe 2012 McKinley Springs Vineyard Malbec (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Lake Chelan, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The oak—85% new French—plays a large role, with aromas of cocoa, vanilla and woodspice playing off plum and red fruit. It's sleek and sultry in feel, with the wood getting out in front of the tart fruit flavors.
Name: Tsillan 2012 Estate Malbec (Lake Chelan)

Description: Dark-berry aromas are crisp and show a note of minerality as well as barrel char. This is firm, juicy and modest in structure, with flavors of blackberry and cassis touched up by some oak. A non-pushy finish with a hint of mocha is a good close.
Name: Tupun 2012 Reserve Malbec (Tupungato)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Cardamom and vanilla lend warmth and spice to fresh black cherry and blueberry flavors in this sprightly wine. It's rich and ripe in fruit concentration, but delicately textured with a brisk, spry finish.
Name: Bedell 2012 Malbec (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: After a huge blast of mocha opens the show, there isn't a lot hiding behind the curtain. The palate is big, sticky and rubbery in feel, while flavors of baked berry, chocolate, oak and coffee finish chewy but also briny and herbal.
Name: Bodega Renacer 2012 Punto Final Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Rattlesnake Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The volatility on this wine is distracting. It's a shame because it's otherwise well constructed with notes of Red Vines, vanilla and cherry, with a palate-coating feel.
Name: Flying Trout 2012 Old Vines Konnowac Vineyard Malbec (Rattlesnake Hills)

Description: Strawberry and herbal aromas are decent but a bit green. This has a jammy feel, with basic berry flavors that finish minty but fresh. Overall, this is a middle-of-the-road Malbec.
Name: Familia Cecchin 2012 Made with Organic Grapes Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Mounds Bar-like barrel notes dominate the plummy, slightly raisined-seeming fruit found on this 100% varietal wine. The lighter fruit flavors of the vintage can't match the oak's intensity.
Name: Sawtooth 2011 Trout Trilogy Malbec

Description: Aromas of roadside brush, field greens and raspberry are suggestive of fruit punch. The palate is full but somewhat cloying, while jammy red-fruit flavors come with a green note. The finish is jammy like the palate, with a pronounced chocolaty oak flavor.
Name: Ombu 2012 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Candied cherry and red-plum aromas precede an edgy palate and herbal flavors of plum and berry that are slightly hot and spicy. Raspberry and red-currant flavors on the finish are dilute.
Name: Tercos 2012 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: This overoaked Malbec smells almost entirely of clove and chocolate. It's bulky and creamy in feel, with bland, stewy berry flavors and a blanket of oaky clove. Oak spice and heat control the finish.
Name: Viña Palaciega 2013 Gran Selección Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Cherry, dry spice and leather aromas are detectable on an otherwise lean and dilute nose. Like the bouquet, the palate on this basic Malbec is thin. Flavors of generic berry fruits finish earthy and scratchy.
Name: Cascada Peak 2012 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Candied red-fruit aromas are thin and limited. This is edgy, rubbery and tannic in feel, with rudimentary raspberry and red-plum flavors. A juicy finish is lean and tastes medicinal.
Name: Finca La Luz 2013 Callejon del Crimen Estate Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: Stalky aromas make for a sketchy opening. In the mouth, this is blocky and grabby in feel. Burnt, underripe flavors of berry fruits are herbal and finish with grassy notes.
Name: Diseño 2012 Old Vine Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Roasted, barnyard, leathery aromas of lemony oak and tomato are far from ideal. This has a scratchy, tartaric feel to it, while herbal raspberry flavors are backed by a mulchy aftertaste. It's stewed on the finish and weedy.
Name: Finca La Luz 2013 Callejon del Crimen Barrel Selection Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: LTU is a small-production label that reaches big. The 2010 Malbec is rich and smooth up front, with robust, lusty aromas of coconut, graphite, blackberry and blueberry. Creamy oak and fresh acidity make for a plush, modern mouthfeel, while flavors of coconut, toffee, vanilla and blackberry are deep and pure. A ripe, round, decadent finish with flavors of toasted coconut flake, berry extract and tight tannins wraps this up. Drink through 2020.
Name: LTU 2010 Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: The curtain rises to smooth, lightly balsamic aromas of blackberry, black cherry and cedar. On the tongue, this Malbec is plush, smooth, chewy and a touch creamy. Elevated berry, mocha and vanilla flavors are oaky but not overdone. The finish is pure, succinct and deep, with lasting black-fruit echoes. Drink through 2019.
Name: Melipal 2011 Nazarenas Vineyard Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Dusty cherry, wild berry and minerally aromas comprise a compact, deep nose that's entirely inviting. Juicy, bold and bright on the palate, with sturdy tannins, this offers exotic notes of cumin and baking spices along with wild berry flavors. It's elegant, complete and thorough on the finish; drink through 2020.
Name: Achaval-Ferrer 2012 Finca Bella Vista Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

Description: Graphite, lemon peel, cedar and blackberry aromas are lusty and high in quality. A flashy, fresh, slick mouthfeel is the perfect vessel for toasty, dark blackberry, coconut, vanilla and mocha flavors. The mocha note persists on the finish, which is juicy and fresh but also thick and chewy. Drink through 2018.
Name: Tapiz 2010 Black Tears Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Smoky oak aromas are a big part of the positive bouquet that includes plum, wild berry, fresh herb and peppery notes. This authentic, polished wine delivers a mix of juicy acidity and smoothness, while oaky plum and berry flavors come with cocoa and spice notes. A persistent, balanced finish confirms its elevated standing. Drink through 2020.
Name: Pascual Toso 2012 Alta Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Black currant, cherry, plum and floral aromas form a nose with freshness as well as power. Lively, layered and fruity on the palate, this single-vineyard Malbec is lightly herbal and toasty, with wild berry flavors leading the charge. A tight, firm finish with raspberry and red-currant flavors ensures that this will stand the test of time. Best 2016–2022.
Name: Achaval-Ferrer 2012 Finca Altamira Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

Description: Tobacco, herb, field grass and red berry aromas are fresh and attractive. The palate is gripping, with plenty of length and balance. Raspberry, cassis and herbal, minty flavors finish flush, with a touch of alfalfa and even more raspberry and red currant. Drink through 2018.
Name: Tomero 2010 Gran Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Ripe, deep, cedary and mildly raisiny on the nose, this high-alcohol Malbec is generous and full up front, with accents of prune and graphite. The palate is loaded with extracted berry fruit and oak. Flavors of blackberry, mocha, toast and licorice are highly appealing, while chocolaty oak, clove and black-fruit notes push the finish. Drink through 2018.
Name: Vicentin 2011 Colosso Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Ripe blackberry aromas accented by pencil lead, chocolate and charred oak are full and lusty. This dense Malbec has a grapy but structured palate that carries flavors of smoky blackberry, mint, chocolate and espresso. Heavy oak and char rise up on the finish of this meaty, robust wine.
Name: Capataz 2010 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Spiced cherry, brandied plum and overt but high-quality buttery oak aromas open this red-fruit-driven Malbec from the heart of the Uco Valley in Mendoza. Flavors of toasted, creamy oak rest easily on top of kirsch and red plum flavors, while chocolaty, toasty, spicy flavors direct the finish. Drink this well-oaked, expressive heavyweight now through 2020.
Name: Altocedro 2012 Gran Reserva Malbec (La Consulta)

Appellation: Valle de Uco, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Blackberry and spice aromas form a harmonious bouquet that's subtle and potent. In the mouth, this is tight, fresh and alert, with raspberry, plum and baking-spice flavors. Freshness rules from front to finish, which offers cinnamon notes mixed with bright berry flavors. Drink through 2020.
Name: SignoSeis 2012 The Angel Oak Reserva Malbec (Valle de Uco)

Description: A meaty, spicy, woody opening includes aromas of hickory and clove plus mint and heady black-fruit scents. This feels steady, sturdy and full on the palate, but also fresh and balanced. Blackberry, chocolate and resiny flavors finish with oak; drink through 2020.
Name: Tomero 2011 Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Early aromas of raisin and prune give way to richer, more inky scents of blackberry and cassis. But all the while there's an herbal note of oregano to the nose. This has a full, clampy feel and lightly herbal, oaky flavors of graphite, resiny oak, blackberry and cassis. Oak and resin characterize the finish. Drink through 2018.
Name: Terrazas de Los Andes 2010 Single Vineyard Las Compuertas Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

Description: Initially this is jammy, chunky and leathery on the nose, with raspberry and strawberry hints along with notes of hard spices and green herbs. A concentrated, sticky palate is home to berry, cassis, salt and leather notes. The short but round finish offers savory, meaty, baked flavors of jerky and blackberry. Drink through 2018.
Name: Mendoza Vineyards 2011 Gran Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: This oaky, full-force Malbec folds in just enough black-fruit aromas and flavors to offset a dominant wood character, although nothing diminishes heavy spice, sawdust and resiny notes. Savory, roasted blackberry flavors come with clove, baking spice and briny notes on the finish. Ripe, potent and extremely woody is the best way to describe this muscular Malbec.
Name: Raffy 2011 Grande Réserve Malbec (Tupungato)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Dark, extracted and woody almost to an extreme, this opens with resiny aromas of raw oak, coconut, vanilla and prune. A palate with pinching, hard tannins is fierce, with heavily oaked flavors of roasted blackberry feeding into a finish with dominant woodspice and resin flavors. Drink through 2020.
Name: Trivento 2011 Eolo Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

Description: Raspberry and cassis aromas are fresh and upright while showing wiry, grassy accents. Full bodied, this features a jammy, pulpy palate that's fresh but low on definition. Herbal, lightly green infiltrations drift onto a solid, tannic finish. Drink through 2018.
Name: Finca Las Moras 2010 Pedernal Malbec (San Juan)

Description: Ripe, foresty aromas include sweet maple, woody char, blackberry and jammy black currant. This offers a round, full, chocolaty palate with oaky flavors of raspberry and plum as well as chocolate and pepper. Woody finishing flavors of chocolate and coffee feature a rooty cola note.
Name: Zentas 2010 Grand Reserve Malbec (La Consulta)

Description: Exotic aromas of cardamom, blueberry and spiced currant filter onto a fresh but wide-bodied palate with raspberry, blueberry, herb and spice flavors. The finish is intriguing due to a reprise of notes like anise, mint and herbal berry flavors.
Name: Mendoza Vineyards 2011 1907 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Meaty, gritty aromas of earth, animal hide and horseradish introduce an intense, chewy, saturated but slightly clumsy palate with blackened berry, plum, carob and vanilla flavors. An oaky, medicinal tasting finish is potent but not very complex.
Name: Clos de Chacras 2010 Ereditá Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Scratchy black cherry aromas come with a strong hint of tree bark and cedar resin. This feels snappy at first, then more resiny and oaky upon airing. Woody black-fruit flavors get a boost from juicy acidity, while an oaky finish tastes like mint and licorice.
Name: Torrevieja 2011 Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Char and gritty scents ride heavily on the bouquet, which also shows fresher notes of cassis and raspberry. This excels via a natural feeling, pulpy palate and flavors of raspberry and red plum accented by pepper and herbs. A lightly herbal, minty finish offers length and good texture.
Name: Mendoza Vineyards 2011 Unsung Hero Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Mild aromas of balsam wood and lightly spiced raspberry and plum are subtle and unforced. This deals ample body weight and lively acidity along with savory berry flavors accented by mild herbal and leather notes. Light spice and tomato flavors mark the finish.
Name: Valentín Bianchi 2012 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Warm, earthy, jammy berry aromas are oaky and bring a note of latex into the fold. This chunky Malbec is tannic and grabby, with oaky flavors of black plum and vanilla set against herbal undertones. Spice, chocolate, carob and drawing tannins create a bold but rough finish.
Name: Terrazas de Los Andes 2012 Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Dark, full and very oaky on the nose, this extracted Malbec is ripe and toasty smelling. Tannic, stacked and chewy in the mouth, with flavors of roasted blackberry, raw oak, chocolate and clove, this finishes with a ton of unabsorbed oak and related flavors of clove and mint.
Name: Benvenuto de la Serna 2010 Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: Dark in color and forcefully oaked on the nose, this resiny Malbec will appeal to fans of richly styled reds. Plum, berry, tomato leaf and herbal flavors finish woody but fair, with lasting acidity.
Name: Sur de los Andes 2012 Clásico Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Raw black-cherry aromas are direct and simple but good. This has a juicy feel that thickens over time, with oak character and extract becoming more apparent. A flavor profile driven by dark-berry fruits and smoldering oak finishes meaty but hot.
Name: Gaucho Andino 2011 Winemaker Selection Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Baked plum, molasses, balsamic vinegar and cheesy oak aromas feed into a palate that's braced by a bolt of acidity. A compact set of saucy red-berry and plum flavors features tobacco and peppery accents, while the finish is mildly green in flavor, with respectable weight and balance.
Name: Felix Lavaque 2010 Felix Malbec (Cafayate)

Description: Raisin, prune, mint leaf and extreme ripeness define the nose on this grabby, tannic Malbec that's both jammy in feel but also extracted and heavy. Like the nose and palate, the flavors are jammy and rich, with a strong raisiny element. On the finish, a note of licorice blends with a persistent raisiny quality.
Name: Gubinelli 2010 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Dark in color with a magenta tint, this Malbec is spunky and a touch crude on the nose, with wild berry and animal fur aromas. There's angularity to the palate, which is bland in the middle. Black-fruit, herbal, savory flavors finish short on volume and complexity.
Name: Zuccardi 2012 Serie A Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: Floral raspberry and dusty notes are clean but quiet. This simple Malbec has a fresh, crisp, limited palate, with lightly oaked flavors of vanilla and mint adding character to generic plum notes. A touch of oak is noticeable on the finish.
Name: Fat Gaucho 2012 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Saucy scents of tomato and plum turn perfumed, powdery and floral with airing. A fresh mouthfeel with a hint of oaky resin supports red-berry and modest woody flavors. A spicy, minty finish is where the wine's forced-oak element is most prominent.
Name: Gnarly Head 2012 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Oaky and a bit cheesy at first, this smells of wood grain, vanilla and dill pickle. In the mouth, it's a bit choppy, with firm tannins. Flavors of cranberry, black currant and fresh-cut wood finish similarly, with tannic build up.
Name: Graffigna 2010 Grand Reserve Malbec (San Juan)

Description: Modest black cherry and berry aromas are earthy and a touch flat. This is a full-bodied Malbec with baked blackberry as the lead flavor and oaky, savory, saucy side notes. Residual dark-berry flavors and chewy tannins drive the finish.
Name: Funckenhausen 2010 La Espera Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Bold, gritty, balsamic berry aromas are rubbery and saucy in nature. Edgy and grating on the palate, but also full of spunk, this tastes salty. Modest red-berry flavors finish oaky and rustic, with a lasting note of aged balsamic vinegar.
Name: Fat Gaucho 2011 Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Aromas of cedar, juniper, graphite and blackberry are woody and full but fail to announce fairly the choppy astringency the palate brings. Herbal blueberry, pie cherry and mint flavors end with tangy, tart, borderline sourness on the finish.
Name: Bodega Toneles 2010 Gran Tonel 137 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Gritty, muddled dark-fruit aromas come with burnt overtones. This has a hard, grinding palate along with roasted blackberry and raisin flavors. A minty character and hard tannins drive the finish.
Name: Terrazas de Los Andes 2011 Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Rubbery plum and berry aromas offer notes of leather and metallic minerals. This has an oaky feel, meaning it's sticky and lactic. Herbal, slightly green flavors of plum and berry are sweetened and softened by oak in front of a minty, lightly herbaceous finish.
Name: Domaine Jean Bousquet 2013 Finca Rosa Malbec (Tupungato)

Description: Woodsy, lightly floral raspberry aromas are mild. This wine revolves around a light-framed, dilute body, while flavors of cranberry, raspberry and dusty earth finish woody but shallow, with a preserving shot of acidity.
Name: Bodega El Transito 2011 Pietro Marini Malbec (Salta)

Description: Rubbery, lightly spicy aromas of plum and berry are typical in this wine with a decent mouthfeel and oaky flavors of raspberry and plum. A dry, medicinal, lightly bitter finish reverberates with a forced oak character.
Name: Tupun 2013 Malbec (Tupungato)

Description: Cherry cough-drop aromas are friendly enough. This feels hollow, with quick-hitting plum and cherry flavors. A touch of chocolate dust defines a simple finish.
Name: Bota Box 2013 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: This is stalky, grassy and peppery smelling, with red-berry aromas. Rawness and sharp acidity keep the pulse up as basic flavors of plum and raisin take over. A modest finish keeps the course without evolving.
Name: Black Box 2013 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: This wine recreates the medieval technique used to cook the fermenting must to make it more stable. In this case, it also produces a wine that is almost black in color, dark in appearance and in flavor. There is also some elegance here, with fine tannins that are well integrated into the juicy black fruits and ripe character. It's a wine to age, although it is juicy enough to drink now. Best, though, from 2018.
Designation: Clos Triguedina The New Black Wine
Name: Jean-Luc Baldès 2012 Clos Triguedina The New Black Wine  Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Old vines and low yields have concentrated this wine wonderfully. It is the essence of the stony, chalk and clay soil, powerfully driven by its dark fruits and immense tannins. New wood aging has added spice and has also begun the process of rounding out this impressive wine. It still needs to age and shouldn't be touched before 2018.
Name: Château Haut-Monplaisir 2011 Pur Plaisir Malbec (Cahors)

Description: The highest of the Cahors vineyard's three terraces above the Lot valley has its stony soil with large pebbles. It produces the most structured of the three single-parcel wines from Triguedina. Complex and dark, it is juicy and sumptuous as well as solidly structured. Great acidity cuts through the opulent texture. It's a wine to age; drink from 2019.
Name: Jean-Luc Baldès 2012 Clos Triguedina Les Galets Malbec (Cahors)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Light purple in color, this aromatically appealing, fruit-forward wine has notes of dark plum, dried herbs and peppery spices along with a mocha top note. It's plump and velvety in feel, with concentrated yet lithe fruit flavors that linger effortlessly on the long, fruit-filled finish that kicks it up a notch.
Name: Gorman 2012 The F.O.G Malbec (Red Mountain)

Description: From a parcel of Malbec that is planted at 6,666 plants to the hectare (about 2.5 acres), this is such a concentrated wine. With powerful and brooding tannins, it is structured and richly endowed with black fruits. The natural acidity of the Malbec is enhanced by the mineral character coming from the stony soil. Drink this young wine from 2019.
Name: Georges Vigouroux 2011 Château de Mercuès Cuvée 6666 Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Despite its obvious richness, this is an impressively restrained wine. Powerful dark fruits are kept in check by the firm structure and acidity. It has layers of tannins that will soften and round as the wine develops. From one of the best producers in Cahors, this is a balanced, structured wine. Drink from 2017.
Name: Château Haut-Monplaisir 2011 Prestige Malbec (Cahors)

Description: One of three single-parcel wines, this comes from the terrace closest to the river Lot. It makes for a sumptuous wine, rich in black fruit and rounded tannins. Fresh acidity keeps the wine alive. The structure of Malbec is already well integrated into the juicy fruits.
Designation: Clos Triguedina Au Coin du Bois
Name: Jean-Luc Baldès 2012 Clos Triguedina Au Coin du Bois Malbec (Cahors)

Description: From the middle of three vineyard terraces rising up from the river Lot, this generous wine shows a strong sense of structure. Still young, it has everything for a fine future with dark tannins and juicy black fruit that is still asserting itself. It has high acidity at this stage and this needs to settle down. Drink from 2018.
Name: Jean-Luc Baldès 2012 Clos Triguedina Petites Cailles Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Named after the Roman emperor who allowed vines to be planted in Cahors, this richly perfumed wine has huge tannins that are still controlled by the equally powerful black fruits and acidity. Wood aging is still prominent along with the dry structure. Drink from 2018.
Name: Jean-Luc Baldès 2012 Clos Triguedina Probus Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Meaty, minty scents accent core cassis, jammy blackberry and oaky aromas. In the mouth, this benchmark Argentinean Malbec is tight and structured, with no flab or excess weight. An exotic mix of blueberry, cassis and Middle East spices finish long, with oak-driven lemony snap. Drink through 2020.
Name: Bodega Catena Zapata 2011 Catena Alta Historic Rows Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: This concentrated, midnight-black Malbec delivers the aromatic goods in the form of charcoal, grilled meat and blackberry scents. An extracted palate benefits from core acidity, while black cherry, cassis and blackberry flavors come to rest on a rich but controlled finish. Drink through 2018.
Name: Bodega Cuarto Dominio 2012 Chento Vineyard Selection Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: High-toned anise and lavender mark this estate-grown wine aromatically, followed by balanced layers of blue fruit and leather. A bite of peppery spice on the finish leaves one wanting more.
Name: J. Rickards 2011 Zanzi Curve Vines Malbec (Alexander Valley)

Description: Lightly floral and smoky up front, this features bright red-berry aromas and similar flavors of raspberry and currant resting on a fresh but layered palate. Narrowing tannins are not too fierce, while oaky notes of clove, pepper and toast drive the finish. Drink through 2018.
Name: Lagarde 2012 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Plum, blueberry and graphite aromas along with a mild horsey, grassy element define the nose on this single-vineyard Malbec that's jammy and a touch soft on the palate. Flavors of blackberry, prune and raisin are dull-edged, while the finish is baked and raisiny, with a slight hint of overripeness. Drink through 2016.
Name: Salentein 2011 Plot N°21 Single Vineyard Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: This is a textbook Deep Purple special: huge berry, menthol and violet aromas create a hefty, lusty bouquet. In the mouth, it is more narrow than you might hope for, with staunch tartaric acidity. Jammy berry flavors are big but standard, as is the finish. Drink through 2018.
Name: VinEcol 2009 Los Medanos Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Dark in color, this chunky, ripe Malbec opens with blackberry, earth and rubber aromas. That bold, full quality carries onto the palate, which is staunch and bullish, with pepper and berry flavors that finish dry, yet weighty and lush.
Name: Salentein 2013 Portillo Estate Bottled Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: Black olive, Band-Aid, latex and meaty berry aromas emerge from a reduced nose. Tannic, hard and crimped on the palate, this requires as much air as you can give it. Gamy berry flavors are salty and finish with an herbal note.
Name: Tamarí 2012 AR Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Earthy and soft, this Malbec leans rustic in brambly, wild blackberry and meaty leather, with a mouthful of ripeness on the finish.
Name: J. Rickards 2012 Zanzi Curve Vines Malbec (Alexander Valley)

Description: This chunky Malbec opens with a blast of blackberry aromas and graphite. The palate is jammy and not all that firm, with bold berry and plum flavors that stay solid across a fruity palate that finishes toasty and with an echo of jammy blackberry.
Name: Santa Ana 2012 Reserve Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: This opens hot and heavy, with pounding berry aromas and a touch of animal fur. The palate is full and compact, with jammy, syrupy berry and woodspice flavors. A long finish tastes of licorice and oak.
Name: Valle Las Nencias 2011 Reserve Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: This oaky number offers enough meaty fruit to keep itself on an even keel. Gritty berry and sawdust aromas lead to a full-bodied, resiny palate. Woody, drying flavors rest heavily atop a core of medicinal, herbal berry fruit. It's ripe and resiny on the finish, which is consistent with what came beforehand.
Name: Pascual Toso 2013 Estate Bottled Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Crisp cherry tomato and plum aromas turn more dark and grapy with airing. Jammy yet fresh and easy on the palate, this quaffable Malbec delivers simple berry flavors along with an exotic note or two. A short finish falls off fast.
Name: Valentín Bianchi 2013 Elsa Bianchi Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: This is a heavy, pushy, ultraripe Malbec with lots of oak, toast and heat on the nose. A full, grabby palate is tannic as nails, while baked black fruit flavors come with resiny oak and lemon-peel notes. A minty, herbal tasting finish is hard as granite.
Name: Capataz 2009 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Big, dark, minty aromas include resin, clove and blackberry. The palate is easygoing and plump, with plenty of weight and extraction. Earthy, baked flavors of blackberry become more salty and spicy on the finish.
Name: Mascota 2012 ROD Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Gritty, stalky aromas are leathery and hot. In the mouth, this single-vineyard Malbec is choppy and hard. Flavors of stalky berry fruits are good but unexciting, while the finish is toasty but not complex.
Name: Enrique Foster 2009 Reserva Finca Castro Barros Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

Description: This opens with blueberry and sandalwood aromas that turn murky. Tannic and hard as a rock, this shows rooty, baked, ultraripe flavors of prune and berry in front of a raisiny finish.
Name: Layer Cake 2012 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Hot on the nose, with earthy berry aromas and touch of animal fur, this is a rich wine with a blanket-like mouthfeel. Concentrated, almost stewy flavors of spice and chocolate-infused blackberry finish oaky, chocolaty and medicinal.
Name: Kaiken 2011 Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Primary berry aromas blend earthy blackberry and a hint of minty green. The palate feels jammy and slightly reduced, while flavors of blueberry and boysenberry come with a light hint of green herbs that carry onto the finish.
Name: Septima 2012 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Rubbery berry, leather and animal aromas precede a bright, lean, juicy palate. Wiry plum flavors shows an herbal, peppery side, while the finish is fresh, hot and oaky, with a peppery, lasting flavor.
Name: Tamarí 2013 Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Barrel notes of toast and char are at the fore on this wine, followed by green tea and medicine cabinet. The fruit flavors are lighter in style with firm tannins.
Name: Silvan Ridge 2012 Malbec (Rogue Valley)

Description: Crisp aromas of red-apple skins show a note of paint/rubber cement. This smacks down with firm tannins, while berry flavors are generic and exhibit hints of prune and blueberry. This is mildly raisiny on the finish.
Name: Belasco de Baquedano 2013 Llama Old Vine Estate Bottled Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Lightly roasted, stalky and gamy on the nose, this is a big, rubbery, astringent Malbec with berry and baking-spice flavors. Heavy, hot, and sticky, it blasts at full volume.
Name: Eugenio Bustos 2011 Altivo Vineyard Selection Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: Aromas of plum, berry and Band-Aid come up on the nose. This is wiry, acidic and tannic in feel. Pinched berry flavors ride roughly on a wave of punchy acidity, while the finish is hard and tannic, with loamy berry leftovers.
Name: Red Rock 2012 Reserve Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Horsey, overripe aromas don't convey a sense of balance. As the nose indicates, this comes across heavy and syrupy, with blocky tannins. Stewy flavors of blackberry and prune finish with hard tannins.
Name: Ricardo Santos 2009 El Gran Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Damp, rubbery berry and hickory aromas lack ease. This offers a rubbery, midlevel palate-feel along with roasted, herbal flavors that carry heat. The finish is chunky in feel and tastes herbal as well as salty.
Name: Manos Negras 2013 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Dense berry aromas are a bit flat and medicinal. Expect a juicy, direct palate with hard plum and berry flavors that are also a touch briny/salty. A full finish loses its fruit fast, leaving ringing acidity and a lasting briny flavor.
Name: Santa Julia 2013 [+] Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Rubbery, leathery aromas become stalky and gritty with airing. This is hard, tannic and acidic on the palate, with burnt, gritty flavors of roasted plum and herbal berries. A tannic finish lacks nuance.
Name: Deumayen 2009 Trez Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Jammy berry aromas are medicinal and show a note of animal fur. A rubbery, bouncy palate is lively but lacks finesse, while herbal raspberry and red-plum flavors finish medicinal and herbal, much like the nose and palate.
Name: Chakras 2012 Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Stalky plum and berry aromas are standard, with a blocky feeling palate that's softened by creamy oak. Herbal plum and berry flavors disappear quickly on the finish.
Name: Graffigna 2012 Centenario Reserve Malbec (San Juan)

Description: Lightly floral berry aromas show their best out of the chute. A direct, angular palate is crisp, with mild tartaric scour. Dark plum and berry flavors are short, as is the finish.
Name: Region 1 2013 Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Luján de Cuyo, Mendoza Province, Argentina
Description: Stalky, oaky and rustic on the nose, this is a creamy, woody, resiny Malbec with oak-based flavors of plastic and vanilla along with slightly stewed, baked fruit. Clove and medicinal flavors are prominent on the finish.
Name: Bodega Goulart 2011 Clásico Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

Description: Sulfur, burnt matchstick and powdered sugar aromas make up the bouquet. This Malbec-derived sparkler is round and full, with a light bubble bead. Heavy, sweet-tasting stone-fruit flavors finish melony and sugary sweet.
Name: Reginato 2011 Celestina Método Tradicional Rosé of Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: This opens with off-putting aromas of cinnamon and air freshener. On the palate, this is chewy and creamy, with a ton of oak and jammy, baked berry flavors that finish sticky.
Name: Bodega Carmine Granata 2011 Estate Bottled Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Rough and rugged is the best way to describe this Malbec. Earthy, woody, rubbery berry aromas lead to a sharp, high-acid palate. Wiry, fiery plum-like flavors stay fierce and pick up heat on the finish.
Name: Quara 2013 Estate Bottled Malbec (Cafayate)

Description: Rudimentary cherry and berry aromas are foxy. A rubbery, pinched palate has a tannic, skins-related feel. After a quick shot of jumpy red-fruit flavors, this turns bitter on the finish.
Name: Santa Julia 2013 Made with Organic Grapes Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Earthy, leafy berry aromas are murky in general. This is narrow and acidic in feel, with salty, dry-fruit flavors. It finishes with tomato and hard-spice flavors.
Name: La Puerta 2013 Estate Grown & Bottled Malbec (La Rioja)

Description: Stalky, grassy, burned-out aromas are off-putting. A creamy palate struggles for balance, while the flavor profile is outright weedy and bitter.
Name: Massimo 2013 Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Pure Malbec from the Klipsun vineyard, this is a sappy, concentrated wine with gorgeous raspberry and blackberry fruit supported by a streak of iron and a whiff of dark chocolate. It saw 30% new oak and should drink well over the next decade.
Name: Sparkman 2012 Preposterous Malbec (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Rattlesnake Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Coming in at 12.8% alcohol—nearly unheard of for a Washington red, particularly in a warm vintage—it brings appealing notes of dark plum accented by black pepper and dried herbs. It's silky soft in feel with a dazzling sense of texture and purity with little apparent oak influence.
Name: Savage Grace 2013 Dineen Vineyard Malbec (Rattlesnake Hills)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: A wine club selection, this pure Malbec is fragrant and streaked with well-defined layers of blackberry, dark chocolate and earth. There's a pleasing whiff of sandalwood and baking spice that carries through to the finish.
Name: Kiona 2012 Estate Malbec (Red Mountain)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine gives a clear, clean shot of pure raspberry fruit, lightly dusted with coffee and cocoa. A whiff of smoke drifts across the finish as the wine quickly thins out.
Name: Swiftwater Cellars 2011 Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Broad, ripe berry aromas are dark and full on the nose. The palate is lively, with a shot of bracing acidity. Flavors of dark fruit, grilled meat, herb and salt finish briny, with a final wave of hard tannins. Drink through 2016.
Name: Montes 2011 Alpha Malbec (Colchagua Valley)

Description: Leathery red berry aromas move to dark fruit after sitting in the glass. This Malbec is jammy in feel, but overall it's fresh. Earthy flavors of spiced plum, baked berry and salt finish toasty, woody and briny.
Name: Santa Carolina 2011 Reserva de Familia Malbec (Rapel Valley)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: On first pour this wine seems slightly reduced, after which it shows notes of baking spices and plum. It's medium bodied and plush in feel with silky smooth tannins, but the concentration seems wanting.
Name: McKinley Springs 2010 Malbec (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Though only seeing about a quarter new oak—mostly American—it's this aspect that stands out with notes of vanilla and woodspice which overpower notes of cherry, plum and pepper. Still, it's pleasant enough with quite tart fruit flavors and abundant wood accents.
Name: Waterbrook 2011 Reserve Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Loud berry fruit aromas turn more rustic and barnyard-driven with time. This is big but wiry in feel, with protruding acidity creating a prodding, astringent sensation. Wild berry and plum flavors finish short, toasty and a touch hot.
Designation: Gran Terroir Estate Grown La Huella Vineyard
Name: Agustinos 2013 Gran Terroir Estate Grown La Huella Vineyard Malbec (Bío Bío Valley)

Description: Medicinal cherry aromas are a touch herbal and green, but also floral. This red-tinted Malbec is jammy on the palate, with lightly herbal plum and currant flavors. The zesty finish brings a cool-vintage green character into play.
Name: Anakena 2011 Tama Vineyard Selection Malbec (Cachapoal Valley)

Description: Initial floral and berry aromas turn toward tar and burnt meat upon airing. Flavors of herbal berry, olive and pepper are welcoming to a palate driven by hard tannins. Lively acidity keeps things cranking along.
Designation: Reserva Espiritu de Los Andes Estate Bottled
Name: Santa Alicia 2012 Reserva Espiritu de Los Andes Estate Bottled Malbec (Maipo Valley)

Description: Compact berry aromas veer toward herbal and minty on the nose. The palate is full, hard and rubbery in feel, with pounding tannins. Flavors of blueberry and mint finish with a hint of herbal berry.
Name: Porta 2012 Estate Bottled Gran Reserva Malbec (Bío Bío Valley)

Description: This oaky Malbec is black in color, with charred aromas of asphalt and hickory that overpower blackberry and currant tones. Bracing tannins seem disjointed, while roasted, charred flavors finish with a menthol heat.
Name: Montes 2012 Alpha Malbec (Colchagua Valley)

Description: Dilute aromas of strawberry and cherry feed into a raw palate with a grating mouthfeel. Red fruit flavors seem disconnected, yet candied and grassy in profile.
Name: Agustinos 2013 Reserva Malbec (Bío Bío Valley)

Description: This gorgeous Malbec gets it right. Compact, minerally aromas of blackberry are deep and a bit feral. The palate is juicy and pulses with ribald berry fruit and acidity. Blackberry flavors are beefy, salty and a touch roasted, while the finish is baked, rich and perfectly oaked. Drink through 2020.
Name: SonVida 2012 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Alejandro Vigil's El Enemigo wines are worth jumping on if you like full-bodied, robust Argentinean reds. This is typically smoky and dark up front, with molasses, marzipan and blackberry aromas. The palate clamps down with tannic grip, while flavors of oak, blackberry, tobacco, vanilla and spices end briary and with subtlety, which is what makes this powerful wine so good. Drink through 2019.
Name: El Enemigo 2012 Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: This is the first reserve Malbec from Seven Hills, the winery that first introduced this as a varietal wine in the Walla Walla Valley. Inviting aromas of pepper, coffee, vanilla and cream introduce a dark and sappy wine, with concentrated raspberry and blackberry fruit at its core. Superb ripeness and lift from the juicy acidity mark this as indeed reserve-level in quality.
Name: Seven Hills 2012 McClellan Estate Vineyard Reserve Malbec (Walla Walla Valley (OR))

Description: Inky, black aromas of asphalt, licorice and shoe polish hit hard, and the alcohol is immediately evident. This is gigantic in the mouth and carries some burn, but flavors of coffee, chocolate cake and wild berry are exotic and finish firm and generous, with multiple layers. Drink this ripe Malbec through 2018.
Name: Altocedro 2012 Reserva La Consulta Vineyard Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: Concentrated berry and mossy aromas are inviting and introduce a fresh palate that rolls comfortably along. Black fruit, spice, herb and licorice flavors finish minty, spicy and long. This wine is from the Tupungato region, and it shows: It's balanced and herbal, but also loaded with fruit.
Name: Finca Sophenia 2012 Synthesis Malbec (Tupungato)

Description: Exotic, earthy aromas of loamy blackberry, pencil eraser, brown sugar and violet petals lead to a deep but wiry and clipped-feeling palate. The flavor profile is oaky, with spiced berry and cardamom notes leading the charge. A lasting finish is stern and doesn't waver. Drink through 2020.
Name: Maal 2012 Imposible Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: This is quintessential Argentine Malbec. Aromas of roasted black fruits and smoke transition to a toasty, oaky palate with a spectrum of flavors ranging from herbal to jammy berry. In between are notes of tobacco, spice and molasses. Drink now through 2018.
Name: Bodega Catena Zapata 2012 High Mountain Vines Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Smoky aromas of graphite, road tar and wild berry set up a wiry, full-force palate with a can't-miss beam of tartaric acidity. Blackberry and chocolaty flavors finish forward, with unabashed freshness and drive. Drink through 2019.
Name: Alma de los Andes 2012 Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Supremely fresh plum, berry and cherry aromas announce an equally pure palate with ripe, tasty blackberry and cherry flavors that veer into chocolate, toast and coffee on the finish. This offers an ideal mix of clarity, big flavors and value.
Name: Finca Flichman 2013 Misterio Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Dig into this if you like superripe, rich Malbec. This is loaded with graphite, smoky oak, blackberry and baking spice aromas. Expect maximum ripeness across the palate, meaning bearish flavors of berry fruits, wood and toast. There's not a lot of distance or complexity to the finish, but getting that far is half the fun.
Name: Finca Perdriel 2010 Colección Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Meaty aromas suggest baked berry, prune and other ripe fruits. The palate is almost soupy in its richness, while flavors of molasses, berry and toast are ripe and concentrated. A roasted-tasting finish features notes of cooked brown sugar.
Name: Finca El Origen 2011 Gran Reserva Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: Heavy oak and caramel aromas are dominant, with suggestions of mocha and sawdust. This is tight and drawing on the palate, with wood-dominated flavors of resin, clove and distant berry fruits. This simmers with oak and clove on the finish, but should clean up with another year or so in bottle. Drink through 2017.
Name: Finca El Origen 2012 Gran Reserva Malbec (Uco Valley)

Description: Roasted, leathery berry aromas carry a cheesy, gritty, piercing element. In the mouth, this is solid but slightly syrupy. Flavors of rooty berry, licorice and chocolate finish with plenty of oak, spice notes and heat.
Name: Primus 2011 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Grapy aromas are spicy and woody. This is a full, packed truckload of a Malbec with earthy, baked flavors of blackberry and prune. Licorice and a mild blast of bitterness replace the wine's dark-fruit character on the finish.
Name: Bodega Norton 2013 Colección Varietales Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Interesting notes of cumin and clove accent berry and leather aromas on this well-made red. Roasted, earthy, meaty, spicy berry flavors lead into a mildly burnt, toasty finish with modest oak.
Name: Adoquin 2010 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: This is woodsy, spicy and narrow in its delivery of berry aromas. The palate is lively and shows acidic pick up. Full, generous berry flavors fade quickly then finish with a wave of minty, medicinal wood character.
Name: Finca Flichman 2013 Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Leathery, exotic aromas of blueberry and spice are not too oaky or generic. This is compact and tannic in the mouth, with structure. Flavors of spicy blueberry and pepper darken up on the finish, which is ripe and full but also hot in feel.
Name: Fingerprints 2010 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: This is reduced and cedary up front, with hard black-fruit aromas. The mouthfeel is big but loose, with strong tannins supporting oaky flavors of prune, cocoa, coconut and licorice. It finishes minty and dark, with graphite overtures.
Name: Neu Direction 2010 Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Mossy, foresty aromas are rugged and settle into blackberry. An intense, pushy palate is woody in feel, with hot, minty, oaky black-fruit flavors that improve with airing. Heat and toasty notes rise up on the finish of this bold Mendoza Malbec, a first from San Pedro (Chile).
Name: San Pedro 2013 Epica Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Compact, gritty, stalky aromas are hard and herbal. This feels narrow and short on body, while flavors of generic berry fruits are a bit green and low on richness and depth. Oaky vanilla notes drive the finish.
Name: Ruca Malen 2011 Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Minty, inky, oaky aromas rest on top of basic berry scents. This is juicy but also reduced in feel. The flavor profile is superficial, with hints of cassis and blackberry. The finish is loamy and heavy, with adequate lift and acidity.
Name: Rutini 2011 Encuentro Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Oak, resin, briary fruit and pasty notes characterize the bouquet. The palate is wiry due to pronounced tartaric acidity, but fair overall. Flavors of rooty berry and brown sugar taste sweet, while the finish is low in verve.
Name: Los Haroldos 2011 Reserva de Familia Malbec (Mendoza)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This starts reductive and funky before showing notes of plum, pepper and woodspice. The palate is on the lighter side of medium bodied, with an astringent feel to the tannins and a cinnamon-filled finish.
Name: Reustle 2012 Golgotha Bloc Malbec (Umpqua Valley)

Description: Aromas are leafy and scratchy, also suggesting cement. This feels resiny and creamy in the mouth. Flavors of woody, generic berry fruits finish hot and scratchy.
Name: Finca Flichman 2013 Misterio Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: This heavily oaked wine starts closed; only clove and asphalt aromas escape. In the mouth, it's sinewy in feel, with overly demanding wood-based tannins. The flavor profile is all burnt oak and clove, while showing barely any fruit.
Name: Bodega Carmine Granata 2010 Tradicional Oak Cask Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: The nose conjures feral notes of skunk. A rich, syrupy palate tastes complicated and uneasy. Flavors of brown sugar and herbal black cherry are confusing, while the finish is herbal, earthy and green.
Name: Luminis 2012 Allamand Altamira Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: Stewy, murky aromas suggest muddy fruit and spent coffee. This feels clumsy and grabby, while the flavor profile is baked and herbal, with not much vitality. Prune notes and residual murk show on the finish.
Name: Luminis 2012 Perdriel Malbec (Mendoza)

Description: This dense and dark wine is showing as much tannin as fruit at this stage. It's powerful, the dark fruits ripe and seriously structured. Spice, berries, coffee and a tense, mineral texture are all part of the mix. It needs considerable aging, so don't drink before 2019
Name: Clos Troteligotte 2012 K-2 Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Still very closed up, this is going to be a classic. Its tannins are already balanced to the immense juicy fruits and dark wood flavors that bring out spiciness. It's powerful while not over the top, showing elegance at the same time as an opulent texture. Give this gorgeous wine until 2018.
Name: Château du Cèdre 2011 GC Malbec (Cahors)

Description: One of the finest wines to come out of Cahors, this is so stylish. Of course, it has power, intense fruit and acidity. At the same time, balanced richness allied to solid tannins and ripe black fruits single it out. It needs considerable aging to soften the tannins that are still so exuberant. Drink from 2018.
Name: Château du Cèdre 2011 Le Cèdre Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Hugely rich, this was fermented in egg-shaped cuves that have given an impressively rounded character to a wine still so young. The tannins are opulent, letting the black fruits speak powerfully. It still is a wine to age, so drink after 2019.
Name: Château de Gaudou 2012 Le Sang de la Vigne Malbec (Cahors)

Description: In the range of what Clos Troteligotte calls micro-parcels, this is in the middle. It's full of generous black fruits and attendant acidity. At the same time, it is young and still coming together. The future promises great concentration and depth of flavor. Drink from 2017.
Name: Clos Troteligotte 2012 K Malbec (Cahors)

Description: This is a mineral-driven wine, austere at first then showing great black fruits that are sustained by acidity. It's a wood-aged and complex wine that is likely to develop into something powerful and impressive. Drink from 2019.
Name: Château la Reyne 2011 L'Excellence Malbec (Cahors)

Description: The top of the range from Château Ponzac, this is, as its alcohol suggests, pretty powerful. Almost black in color, it's a solid, chunky wine that still has its youthful tannins. Black fruits, berries and damsons are layered with wood and fruit tannins, giving a dense and concentrated character. It needs to age, so drink from 2018.
Name: Château Ponzac 2012 Eternellement Malbec (Cahors)

Description: A parcel of old vines has yielded this concentrated wine that has great depth of flavor, very ripe berry fruits and juicy acidity. It's smoky with fresh ground coffee flavors, and a touch of licorice. Still young, it's a wine for aging, so don't drink before 2019.
Name: Château de Gaudou 2011 Réserve Caillau Malbec (Cahors)

Description: This full-bodied Malbec out-performs its price. Ripe blackberry and pencil aromas set up a dense, tight, structured palate with focused, drilling flavors of blackberry and licorice. If you like layered, full-fruit reds with balance and harmony, this is it.
Name: Viña Bisquertt 2012 Ecos de Rulo Malbec (Marchigue)

Description: This intense and rich wine has also managed to keep a great sense of balance. The black fruits emerge from the firm tannins, bringing with them juicy acidity and a dusty texture. The wine is still young, but it's developing well to emerge ripe and delicious by 2016.
Name: Clos Troteligotte 2012 K-or Malbec (Cahors)

Description: The top cuvée from Château Famaey is a rich, new-wood-aged wine. With spice, mint and toast flavors, it's opulent, ripe and full of black fruits. Even at five years, it's still young, with tannins that are dense and concentrated. Drink from 2016.
Name: Château Famaey 2009 Cuvée X Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Firmly tannic and closed, this is going to be a serious, solid wine. Its tannins are immense now, but they are sustained by concentrated black fruits and powerful acidity. Give this wine until 2018 when we will be able to revel in its rich fruits and tannins.
Name: Château Saint-Didier-Parnac 2012 Prieuré de Cénac Malbec (Cahors)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: In this pure, focused Malbec, moderately tart acidity underscores a mix of wild berries, with accents of autumn leaves. The definition and soft approachability are exceptional. Malbec is one of the emerging, under-the-radar strengths of Washington State.
Name: Gifford Hirlinger 2010 Estate Malbec (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Description: This big wine has solid tannins, powerful fruits and structure, and a wholehearted embrace of wood and acidity. It needs time to show all its richness, to add complexity to the ripeness, and to develop well. Drink from 2017.
Name: Château Eugénie 2011 Haute Collection Malbec (Cahors)

Description: A powerful, very rich wine with deep tannins and ripe black fruits. It's concentrated, the dark, dry core showing strongly while the fruits act as a plump, generous cushion. It can age for several years, so wait to drink until 2017.
Name: Domaine de Cause 2011 La Lande Cavagnac Malbec (Cahors)

Description: This big, rounded wine has a great sense of power without losing a sense of style. Its black fruits are integrating well with the firm Malbec tannins to give a wine that has a mineral texture and a juicy, fruity aftertaste. Drink from 2018.
Name: Château la Reyne 2011 Vent d'Ange Malbec (Cahors)

Description: An impressive, balanced wine that brings out the ripeness of Malbec and then keeps it in check with judicious wood aging and layers of acidity. It's concentrated while elegant, and will develop delicious black fruits as it ages. Drink from 2017.
Name: Château du Cèdre 2011 Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Very young, this is currently all about juicy black fruits and accompanying tannins. It should develop well to give a richly structured wine that has both fruits and a dark, mineral character, hinting at wood aging. Drink from 2018.
Name: Château Laur 2012 Grande Réserve Malbec (Cahors)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Blended with small amounts of Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc, this has pinpoint focus and is packed with ripe berry fruit. The oak aging (45% new) and crisp tannins layer in veins of espresso and dark chocolate. Drink now through 2022.
Name: Dusted Valley 2011 Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Smooth and spicy, this is a soft style of Malbec. It has tannins, to be sure, but they are suavely integrated into the berry fruits, the touch of mint and the spice from wood aging. The aftertaste brings out refreshing layers of juicy acidity. Drink now.
Name: Château Famaey 2011 Malbec (Cahors)

Description: A smooth, polished wine, with eucalyptus aromas and mint flavors. New wood aging has given a generous feel, balanced with juicy acidity that contrasts to the firm, tannic core. It needs to age at least until 2018. 46 refers to the number of Cahors' Lot departement (county) on the French governmental list.
Name: Château du Cayrou 2011 No 46 Malbec (Cahors)

Description: There is a smooth, polished feel to this balanced wine. Wood and blackberry flavors come together with mint and thyme to make a ready-to-drink wine. The tannins, while firm, are well integrated. Drink now and until 2020.
Name: Clos la Coutale 2012 Malbec (Cahors)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Dark, tart and showing plenty of tang and tenacity, this is a fresh-tasting mix of blueberries and tart acids. Half new and half used French oak is still integrating, but the overall structure and balance are excellent.
Name: Stevens 2011 StevensTimley Malbec (Yakima Valley)

Description: Black fruits dominate this rich wine. While it has tannins, they are soft and dusty, already well integrated into the fruitiness and generous texture. It's full in the mouth, delicious and ripe. Drink from 2015.
Name: Domaine de Cause 2011 Tradition Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Big ripe, fruity aromas promise a powerful wine. It does have weight, but it also offers fruity elegance that's borne up by firm tannins. With this good balance, it will age well, its black fruits bursting with attractive acidity.
Name: Château Armandière 2012 Ancestral Malbec (Cahors)

Description: This opens with exotic aromas of charcuterie along with blue fruits. The palate is heavy and blocky in feel, with grabbing tannins. Roasted berry, spice and herbal notes finish oaky and toasty.
Name: Altamana 2013 Grande Reserve Malbec (Maule Valley)

Description: Even after four years, this wine is showing strong wood flavors. Hopefully this burnt toastiness will calm down, because the fruit has potential. It is rich and packed with blueberry and black currant fruits while still firmly tannic. Drink from 2017.
Name: Château de Hauterive 2010 Chemin de Compostelle Malbec (Cahors)

Description: This is a dense, concentrated and oak-aged wine with delicious, juicy black fruits as well as elegant tannins and acidity. That makes for a wine that's balanced, developing well in its richness. Drink now and until 2020.
Name: Château Famaey 2010 Fût de Chêne Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Black fruits and dry tannins are coming together well in this second wine of Château Saint-Didier Parnac. They make for a ripe wine with a light touch of berry fruits and attractive acidity. It will be ready to drink by 2017.
Name: Château Saint-Didier-Parnac 2012 Prieuré de Cénac Mission Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Varietal Malbec from New Zealand is a rarity. This one is medium to full in body, with supple tannins that end silky and long. The herbal shadings may be a bit much for tasters accustomed to fruity Argentine versions, but black cherry and mocha notes compensate.
Name: Decibel 2011 Malbec (Hawke's Bay)

Appellation: Vin de Liqueur, France Other, France
Description: This is as close as Malbec gets to a Port-style wine. It is rich, lightly nutty and well balanced between sweet black fruits and acidity, with firmer tannins that promise aging. Drink at the end of a meal, like a vintage Port.
Name: Château du Cèdre 2011 Le Cèdre Vintage Malbec (Vin de Liqueur)

Description: Ripe aromas of briary blackberry, licorice and baking spices set up a full, chunky mouthfeel. Big black-fruit flavors are slightly minty and herbal, while the finish is earthy and minty, with bright acidity maintaining freshness.
Name: Montes 2012 Malbec (Colchagua Valley)

Description: Heavily wooded, the wine is essentially toast with a touch of fruit. Of course, it is young, and the rich black fruits behind all this smokiness will come through. Drink after 2019.
Name: Château de Gaudou 2012 Renaissance Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Red fruits and a soft tannic profile give a ready-to-drink feel. It's generous, balanced, the black fruits giving a sweet, jammy feel. Pepper and spice at the end are paired with juicy acidity.
Name: Domaine de Cause 2011 Malbec (Cahors)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Young vines yield a pretty wine with bright fruit flavors focused on raspberries. It's not a big wine, but quite lively with the fruit set against vivid acidity.
Name: Kontos 2011 Summit View Vineyard Malbec (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very juicy aromas of blueberry pie with a buttered crust and vanilla ice cream bring great promise to this Malbec. It carries through with a very round and broad mouthfeel and rich plum flavors with cracked black pepper. The tannins are a tad astringent.
Name: Opaque 2010 Malbec (Paso Robles)

Description: Spiky aromas of brambly, herbal berry fruits introduce a thick yet juicy palate with herbal, spicy flavors of berry and mild green notes. On the finish, this is fresh in feel, with a minty aftertaste.
Name: Concha y Toro 2013 Casillero del Diablo Reserva Malbec (Central Valley)

Appellation: Côtes du Marmandais, Southwest France, France
Description: Malbec from Marmande, between Cahors and Bordeaux, is softer and smoother than Cahors. It has the same ripe, juicy black fruits, with tannins that are already well integrated into the wine. The finish brings out spice and light acidity.
Name: Cave du Marmandais 2011 Château Terrebert Malbec (Côtes du Marmandais)

Description: This rich wine conveys pure fruitiness without any wood aging. That gives a ripe, black currant character, soft tannins and juicy acidity. It's wine to drink young, so start now.
Name: Château du Cayrou 2011 Malbec Valley Malbec (Cahors)

Description: Immense and perhaps too powerful, this is a mouthful of black fruits and dense tannins. It seems the producer tried to hard, with bitter extraction as well as very firm, superripe fruit. Pepper and spice show the alcohol.
Name: Château de Cayx 2010 Cuvée Majesté Malbec (Cahors)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: Produced from Malbec that comes mainly from the Cahors region, this soft, ripe and fruity wine has a light touch of tannins that show beneath the berry fruits, supple texture and tight acidity. It is ready to drink, but will be better in 2015.
Name: Lionel Osmin & Cie 2011 La Réserve Malbec (Vin de France)

Description: This inaugural Malbec from Alta Vista in Argentina is overripe. Reduced, gritty aromas of raisin and prune lead to a heavy, ultraconcentrated palate with baked black-fruit flavors. A hot, raisiny finish is just acidic enough.  Tasted twice with consistencies.
Name: Altamana 2012 Single Vineyard Constanza Vineyard Malbec (Maule Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Grape soda, prune, leather, graphite, dust and black tobacco blend into an intriguing nose on this estate Malbec from Paso's Eastside. It's a little rustic around the edges once sipped, but pleasantly so. The mouthfeel is soft, the flavors are peppery and the tannins and acidity are built to last.
Name: Still Waters 2010 Malbec (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aged in 100% new French oak, this has not (yet) come out from under the strong barrel influence. Butter pecan and vanilla scents dominate. The wine is light and generic, with a bit of heat in the finish.
Name: Barrage Cellars 2010 Obelisco Vineyard Malbec (Red Mountain)
